VB-200046

Update Vectorworks-Libraries deletes files from the Libraries folders

The attached video is showing the problem being reproduced.

1. Install 29.0.1 724920 German Version (installer-31 links below - latest installer that I've created).

https://release.vectorworks.net/temp/77cs5di57pzwx4fj9proc2m4lckn44ct/BuiltInstallers/CW.deu/Vectorworks2024-SP1-724920-SeriesBEG-CW-deu-installer31-osx.dmg

https://release.vectorworks.net/temp/77cs5di57pzwx4fj9proc2m4lckn44ct/BuiltInstallers/CW.deu/Vectorworks2024-SP1-724920-SeriesBEG-CW-deu-installer31-win.zip

2. Open the newly installed Vectorworks.

3. Activate License.

4. Update Vectorworks Libraries and various files will be deleted from the Libraries folders.

Attached is an Excel with the files we have found being deleted. Our Release is next Wednesday and we CANNOT Release with this problem. This needs to be solved asap, please!
Tolu Fapohunda

VB-195307

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 2F.F: Power planning web palette preferences tab not as spec'd

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #Power planning web palette preferences tab not as specified.

The layout direction has been implemented. The rest is missing.
* The Preferences tab of the planning palette is being built by Deersoft within their power planning web palette. UI examples are forthcoming. The preferences tab will contain settings for the following:
** Layout direction of connected systems within graphical displays. See 2F.E:
** Retain sorting of columns as a default. Check box.
*** Column sorts will be preserved during the Generate Report process.
** Retain column positions (left/right) between uses.
*** Column positions will be preserved in generated reports.
** Retain column widths as adjusted between uses. Check box.
** Component tab line display.
Users may turn on, or off, line types based on color via a Check box. (See F2.F.i: )

 

Connections will automatically place cables with assigned colors when users connect devices together. Connections are made using the various cable and patching workflows offered via the patching processes. [Power patching the electrical system help page.|https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/Cables/#h1]

 
* Colors will be chosen via a dropdown selection window/menu. (See F2.F.i: )

This is a list of standard cable colors as specified by the IEC (International Electrotechnical Commission) for the US and the EU. For other countries, please refer to Figure 2F.F.2 below.
* Three Phase default colors as per the IEC, US and EU. See Figure F.2
** L1 (Phase 1) color, Red in the US, Brown in the EU.
** L2 (Phase 2) color, Blue in the US, Black in the EU.
** L3 (Phase 3) color, Black in the US, Grey in the EU.
** N1 (Neutral 1) color, White in the US, Blue in the EU.
** N2 (Neutral 2) color, White in the US, Blue in the EU
**  

* PE (Ground or Earth Bond) color, Green in the US. Green/Yellow in the EU.

Note to Deersoft. This distro is an example of a unit requiring two neutral connections. This can be ignored by the publications dept.
* Single Phase default colors
** Hot is Black in US and Brown in the EU.
** Neutral is White in US and Blue in the EU.
**  

*
PE (Ground or Earth Bond) color, Green in US. Green/Yellow in the EU



 
*
Show or hide phase loads in the Device Graph tab of the web palette preferences tab.
Condensing the Device Graph display layout via hiding phase load information is accomplished by checking the Hide Phase Load Display check box.


* Show/Hide columns via check boxes _(See_ {_}Figure F.4{_}{_}){_} or right-clicking columns.
Power Web Palette columns may be hidden from view via check boxes in the settings tab. All boxes will be checked to show at first use. Settings will be remembered between uses per document. All text is to be sentence case per the UI Guidelines.

 
* Component and Device Graph settings in the web palette preferences tab.
Choose colors of wire lines via the color picker drop down in the Component Graph tab settings shown in Figure F.5
The color picker will contain the range of colors shown in Figure 2F.F.2 IEC Phase color chart.
Options to retain the layouts set by users and their last used zoom levels are also offered via check boxes.
All text is to be sentence case per the UI Guidelines.
Deersoft will build the color picker within the web palette. 		Kevin Linzey

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 5F.C: Vectorworks standard sorting order. Alpha/Numeric.

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #5F.C:  Sort order of device power information pull down windows to adhere to Vectorworks standard sorting order. Alpha/Numeric. Offers no change in function from prior versions for lighting unit power source. OIP does not use VW Alpha/Numeric listing.

 

!image-2023-05-03-15-44-31-203.png! 		Kevin Linzey
VB-195328

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 5F.B: Update the un-patching process to allow repatching. doesn't work

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #Update the un-patching process to allow repatching offers no change in function from prior versions.

When I unpatched via the OIP, the patch remains and the [X] is not removed.

!image-2023-05-03-15-39-08-724.png!
* When a user removes the connection of a distributor to a consumer via the OIP, the dropdown choice will refresh to allow the user to reconnect to the same consumer. The refreshed information will remove the X from the assigned circuit. The assigned circuit will remain in the pull-down without the X awaiting reassignment. Once assigned to either the same or a different circuit, the dropdown will update and display the new connection information, including the requisite X.

** Bug report discussing this:
Currently, In the OIP of a cable object, removing the X from a circuit dropdown menu disconnects the patched items but does not allow them to be reconnected.
** https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-184648. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-195309

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 4F.B: Replacing distributors to allow retention of connections.

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #4F.B: Replacing distributors to allow retention of connections. offers no change in function from prior versions.
* Replacing a distributor with another that contains matching connectors will retain their connections to the extent possible. Figure B.1 Distro Drops any 208V Multicable shows a distro with four each of 120 V and 208 V output connectors on the left and a distro with eight 120 V output connectors on the right. When we replace the 120 V/208 V distributor with a 120 V distributor, any connections made to the 208 V connectors will be dropped. The 120 V connectors will transfer as they have matching connectors contained within the new distributor. The remaining four 120 V connectors, E through H, will be left empty.
* To support the replacement of electrical devices, the name, type, and order of their connectors must be identical. When an unmatched item is encountered, all remaining connections will not be carried forward, and they will need to be reconnected manually. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-195303

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 1F.B new display layout not implemented

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #1F.B offers an incomplete change in function from prior versions.
* The graphic layouts for editing components will use the ConnectCAD methodology to make a schematic view of the internal wiring for the electrical component.
(See Figure B.4 Schematic view of distro made by Conrad and 1F.B.5 Schematic View of a Distributor made by Justin VH using ConnectCAD.)
Though the component graph of the power planning palette attempts to fulfill this need, the ConnectCAD layout is both easier to read and allows for quick editing.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-195302

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 1.F..D moving/dragging connected systems not as spec'd in T0

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #1F.D offers no change in function from prior versions.
* With a modifier key, the user can drag entire parent/child systems to other locations in the layout. Holding down the ALT key will temporarily select an entire system. Figure D.1 Parent/Child example shows two child items, and their parent highlighted. Any component downstream of the parent will be highlighted.
* Dragging connected systems will allow users to move systems to an isolated location in the web palette layout to edit the system independently. Selecting multiple objects for editing or moving will be accomplished by holding down the shift key and clicking on each component or part. See 1F.C: above.
* The modifier key is unnecessary to move items that are already selected and highlighted as a group.
* Connection lines between components will stretch or adjust their paths to maintain connections between components when moved. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-195282

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 erases all internal connections during copy/paste of distributor objects

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #4F.F
* When importing distributor objects from one file, such as a favorite file, into a current drawing, all internal connection naming structures should be maintained. If a Resource Name Conflict dialog is presented during the import process, users must choose the "Do not import this Format; use the existing one" in order to maintain internal connections. This will allow for a consistent user experience.
* For best results, all imports of distributors should be made into drawing files without previous versions of the devices being imported.
* Example workflow: A user starts a new project using a blank file or a template and wishes to import prebuilt systems of connected objects from a favorite file. Importing these connected systems into fresh files poses little risk of overwriting existing items. Importing systems from secondary source pose possible conflicts with internal connection data, thereby overwriting component connections.

To Test, open the attached file.
Open a new file.
In the new file, import the lighting layer from the file with the connected objects.
Once the parts are imported, check the power palette to see if the system maintains connections.

 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-195279

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 does not fully support copy and paste of connected systems between files

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402.
* Users who wish to save connected spotlight power objects within a favorite file containing prebuilt systems will have the ability to copy those systems from their favorite files to their current working drawing. *By extension, connected systems may be copied from one file to another.*
*  

Copy and paste a system does not maintain power connections, as shown in the attached screenshot. To test, start a new file, insert devices and make their connections. Once connected, attempt to copy and paste the system to a new drawing. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-195278

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 does not fully support copy and paste of connected systems

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402.
* Users may copy and paste systems of connected distributors and consumers. This allows users to build a hanging position containing connected distributor and consumer devices and then duplicate their device connections.

Copy and paste a system does not maintain power connections, as shown in the attached screenshot. To test, start a new file, insert devices and make their connections. Once connected, attempt to copy and paste the system in the same drawing and layer. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-195287

Spotlight Power Planning T02402 shift click does not follow item 1F.C

The functional workflow does not match expectations as described in the Power Planning task document, T02402, item #1F.C offers no change in function from prior versions.
* To select a group of connected items in Schematic or any graph view, hold down the Shift key and click on a device to select the device and all connected downstream components/devices. 

Pressing Shift and clicking does not select the connected systems as described in the task doc. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-200201

UK Stair Min./Max. Settings messed up

*1. General Access Stair UK has wrong settings*

The "General Access Stair UK" settings are incorrect:
* Step Length Min. should be = 550 (not 520)
* Max. Tread Depth should be 400 (not 300)
* Max. Riser Height should be 170 (not 220)

*2. UK "Utility stair" configuration missing*

There should be three Saved Sets for UK Stair Min./Max. Settings, as defined by the UK building regs (Approved Document Park K, Table 1.1):
* Private Stair UK
* Utility Stair UK (this one is missing from VW out of the box)
* General Access Stair UK

Approved Document Part K can be downloaded here (see Table 1.1):
[https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/protection-from-falling-collision-and-impact-approved-document-k] 		Chris Baccala

VB-199880

Symbols in 2024 Project Sharing Disappearing

I have a customer I have been in ongoing conversation with for a few days that is struggling with styled walls in symbols disappearing on a continuous basis.

The user says that everyone involved in this project is using 2024 and on the same build.

They are styled walls within symbols (including any doors and windows associated with the walls). At first Unstyled walls did not seem to also have the same issue, but it sounds like they are possibly also not saving and committing.

They have "reset" the project file to a normal file to start from scratch, but the problem does not seem to resolve.

All layers and classes are turned on and they save and commit every 5 minutes or so.

Also, the working file does not always seem to communicate back to the project file (save and commit); the changes made does not show up in the project file.

I had the customer send me over their file and it appears that the wall is deleted completely/the creation and changes of the wall were not saved. I pulled the problem symbol into a clean file just to double check and this seems to be the case.

The customer says that the issue is is not just that one symbol, it happens with all the symbols in the project.

The walls do not disappear while working, only after saving and committing, closing and releasing, and then opening the file.

This has happened in the past then they would convert the walls back to Unstyled walls and it seemed to be ok previously. In this particular project they have intricate walls and a lot of different wall types so styled walls would be preferred if they can get it to save and commit properly.

They have tried copying the layers over to a clean file (revert back to VW 2022). They're disappearing in vw2022 as well.

They have checked the document settings/ preferences and they are all good.

It seems that some line symbols are also disappearing examples 2D fridge, bed and some other furniture. 		Rick Berge

VB-200009

Interactive resizing not working for WinDoor in VW 2024 U2

Because of this change 726063 the interactive resizing of the WinDoor does not work anymore, as it returns -8 for handled event which is casted to false and causes the operation to fail. This was not the case before this change. Christopher Graye

VB-198214

Vectorworks crashes if you interact with OIP immediately after undo

I was able to do this with both the Title Block Border and the new Railing object, though I'd guess you can do it with any parametric object.
# Create a Railing object
# Open its settings dialog and hit Ok. This will pretty much just create an undo event and reset the object.
# Hit undo and immediately click on the settings button

If you do step 3 VERY quickly, VW will crash. If it doesn't, I just hit Enter and repeat step 3 until it does.

To make it easier:
* Hold Ctrl, hover over the settings button, click Z and the left mouse almost at the same time without releasing the Ctrl key at all.
* Slow your PC down. It's easier to reproduce this in Debug mode, than it is in Release. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-194594

When you export the attached document to DWG via the sheet layer (export viewports as 2D drawings), Vectorworks will crash in the export process. Vasil Kitanov
VB-194184

Plant at Poly Vertices Insertion Mode count incorrect

Observe the attached screen recording. 

When a Plant instance is changed from 'single plant placement mode' to 'poly vertex placement mode' the number of plants displayed does not correlate to the count. 

Initially it displays and counts as a single plant, however when the object is edited using the re-shape tool, it will display as two plants but count as three. It will also register on a worksheet as three. The third plant can be 'teased' out and then deleted, however it is not possible to delete the second plant to return the object to a single plant (the way it started). 

Initially a Plant at Poly Vertices mode can be a single plant, but once edited, it counts a miniumum of three plants regardless of how many are displayed. It then can't be returned to the single plant state. 

I have marked this as critical as - in the case of mature trees - it could very easily give rise to an expensive contractual error between the design documents and contractor price.  		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-200086

Cloud: sync error

A customer of ours is having an issue with Vectorworks Cloud Services on a Windows 10 computer. Since Monday they are getting an Error ("Fehler") in the VCS client.

The customer (dennis.heinzle-redfern@suedbau.de) is trying to upload files to a shared folder from a colleague (tanja.rothweiler@suedbau.de). The client of the first shows 0.00 of 100.00 GB. Unfortunately I don't know what the client of the second shows.

If the second one was over quota, which I do not believe to be the case, would the error say that?

Can you please check both accounts, if there is something amiss, that I cannot see from my side?

While their internet connection is quite slow (about 12 Mbit/s up and down), this would make any up or download slow, but not cause such errors, right?

They were running the latest version of the VCS (12.7.2618). I tried uninstalling and reinstalling it, but it didn't change the situation.

They have been working in this setup for half a year now, but only now there is this issue. They require the VCS, because they are working on Project Sharing and sometimes one of them works from home. 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov

VB-199730

Spotlight Equip Summary Key T02059 allows duplicate items to be inserted

In the attached file, it is demonstrated that duplicate items can be inserted into the summary key, exceeding the intended quantity. This issue occurs for both symbols and plugin objects. To test this, follow these steps:

1. Open the Equipment Summary Key dialog.
2. Select multiple items.
3. Click the right-side arrow to move the selected items to the Items and Elements to Display window.
4. Repeat clicking the right-side arrow.

This process results in several copies being inserted, which is not the expected outcome.

This was reported and tested as fixed in 29.0.1 		Kevin Linzey
VB-199696

Corrupt File Recovery

***Edit: The customer wanted to make one more last ditch effort to recover these files by running the original file through a different recovery program. When I opened up these files in 2022-2024 vwx, it gives me the error "This was made with a newer version, minicad, or corrupt..etc." The file size is 267MB so I was hoping that I can send these new versions over to ya'll just to verify one last time whether or not these can be saved. I'd appreciate you giving it another look one last time. The two files are {color:#172b4d}[Test with Disk drill.vwx|https://vectorworks.groupdropbox.com/inbox/download?file_ids[]=51601473] and [test with recoverit.vwx|https://vectorworks.groupdropbox.com/inbox/download?file_ids[]=51601475]***{color}

 

***Original***

A customer called into Tech Support to see if they can get a corrupt file recovered.

Would anyone be able to assist with this as a last ditch effort to save their project?

They are using Windows 11 Pro. The last time they opened the file was in November of 2022 and said they were likely working with Vectorworks 2023 at the time.

Notes from the user:
"We have an issue with a Vectorworks file that can't be opened.
We used to work from a SERVER and when we switched to the DRIVE we replace a project folder with an older version of it, and lost some files.
After using a recovery program (The software we used for the recovery was called WONDERSHARE RECOVERIT) on the Server computer we managed to get those files back, but they can't be opened on Vectorworks, and we get this error message: This is an unrecognized file. It may be a Vectorworks file created by a newer version of the application, it may be a very old MiniCAD file. it may have been created by another application, or it may have been corrupted by a hardware or system error."
 
Troubleshooting that the customer has tried:
- copying the file on the desktop and renaming it
- Trying to import it as DWG or other files types
- Open it with previous versions of Vectorworks 
Nothing helped. 
 
In addition, Tech Support attempted to open the file in newer versions of Vectorworks with no luck, as well as try to import design layers/reference from the corrupt file into a new file with no luck. 		Rick Berge

VB-198092

VB-196525

Change in behavior to offset functionality on polylines results in incorrect results in the Camera Match Mask object (and possibly others). (PR 8685671)

The Camera Match Mask object as a "Line Mode" option that creates a "double polyline" that circles around the plug-in object's path to simulate a line thickness.  It then uses the Offset functionality in Vectorscript to offset the polyline several times and gives each polyline varying levels of opacity to simulate anti-aliasing.  There has been some change in behavior that is causing the plug-in to retain the "hole" geometry created when the offset poly overlaps itself while losing the outer poly.  This causes incorrect results in the plug-in object and there may be other plug-in objects that rely on the current behavior.

Please see video (with audio).

The regression happened somewhere between the following two builds:

VW29.0.0d({*}703865{*}): Good

VW29.0.0d({*}703950{*}): Bad 		Christopher Graye

# Edit the test_a.vwx workgroup reference
# For me results in:

* Referencing layer _A-2-FLOOR_ results in a message asking me to replace the "Stake Record" Format.
* And referencing layer A-1-FLOOR results in Resource Name Conflict, asking me to rename a Group. 		Christopher Graye

VB-194217

Data Tag Object Constraints Incorrect to Left of Origin

I am trying to make two versions of a Data Tag, one to use on the right side of objects and the mirror version to use on the left side.

It appears that for at least some objects the constraints are not processed correctly to the left of the DT origin.

In the attached file the DT on the right of the truss behaves properly. [Hanging Position w/Trim (Left)] Even is you attach it to the left end of the truss and then use the mirror tool on it, it still displays properly.

 

The DT on the left end of the truss [Hanging Positions w/Trim (Right)]. The only two things I have changed in this version are that I edited the DT Layout and Mirrored all the components of the DT using the Mirror tool and a vertical line from the origin, and I changed the Truss Label text from Left Justified to Right Justified.

Note that the polygon with the rounded ends extends to the Right of the triangle, not to the left as it is supposed to. Note that the distance it is moved to the right of the insertion point is the same as the distance it should have been moved to the left.

Edit the Layout of the DT. Note that the constraints show that the rounded poly should be moved to the left of the insertion point.

 

I have tried everything I can think of to get the poly to constrain right with no success.

  		Nikolay Zhelyazkov
VB-197367

VB-193097

MVR export does not use sufficient precision

Transform matrices appear to exported with 6 decimal places. This is insufficient to properly round-trip a 32bit float and this lack of precision is causing significant orientation errors.

The attached MVR was created from a drawing with a single Fixture at (1000, 2000, 4500) oriented (-30.00, 1.00, 45.00)

{{The matrix in the MVR is:}}
{{<Matrix>
{0.706999,0.706999,0.017452}}}
{{{-0.606202,0.618543,-0.499924}}}
{{{-0.364241,0.342866,0.865894}}}
{{{1000.000000,2000.000000,4500.000000}}}
{{</Matrix>}}

All the numbers have six decimal places, instead of sufficient significant figures.

This results in a calculated orientation of (-29.995, 1.15466, 44.4227) for 32bit precision, which is significantly different.

Cast Software also reported this issue in early 2022, I was under the impression it had already been corrected.

I also note that the MVR still doesn't say which version of Vectorworks created the file. Our customer says it was 2023 SP3.

See: [https://randomascii.wordpress.com/2013/02/07/float-precision-revisited-nine-digit-float-portability/]

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-193807

Doing a slight zoom on this file causes an instant crash

Open the attached file. After a small view change, Vectorworks crashes instantly. Justin Hutchison

VB-197146

This is an issue that myself a few others with similar hardware configuration have had in past builds. Essentially after sometime working in the drawing, often after an auto-save, the entire system stops responding for a few seconds. When it does respond again the drawing space appears blank at first, if I attempt to zoom in or out via the scroll wheel the drawing space either begins to shard or turns a solid color (see attached screenshot).

At the time that it happened I was just drawing walls and doors, popping in and out of 3D Shaded View and then back to Top/Plan.

Per [~gmiller] here are my machine specs:
Apple 2019 Mac Pro, 3.3 GHz, 12-Core Intel Xeon W
AMD Radeon Pro Vega II, 32GB running a Asus XG49V Display @ 3840 x 1080
192 GB, 2933 MHz DDR4 RAM

VB-193347

VB-196314

Data Manager: Adding a new record format detaches all other record formats

To replicate (see video):
1) open attached document: record-format-2023.vwx
2) change class for the circle to "extra" > now the circle has one record format attached "Format-1".
3) in the Data Manager add the second record format "Format-2". > OK to attach OK to confirm the Data Manager.
> now the circle has only record format "Format-2" attached and the first was detached.


By changing the class of the object to a different class and back, brings back the wrongly detached record formats, but the entered field values are gone.

--> data loss! 		Mihail Rizov

VB-195545

Spotlight Numbering Not Applying to Lighting Devices

In the New ModeBar build Spotlight Numbering does not apply any data to lighting devices.

 

This is across all parameters. 

 

The Spotlight numbering window appears, and functions as exptected, however when you click ok, and you are taken into the selection mode, the lighting devices still highlight, however the parameters are not shown in the cursor side bar, and no data is applied to the device.  

 

!image-2023-05-11-00-02-42-896.png! 		Payne Chang
VB-195313

CMaterialProvider::GetColor crashing in background threads

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=9113611]

 

Record handler is not threadsafe and this function is calling GetShaderRecord and getting reflectivity properties.

 

The values this function needs should be stored in TextureProperties, so that record is not queried during background tessellation.

 

Note that this case is slightly different than UseOpenGLShaderProxy crash.  That one has been patched with SP5, this one is still open to crashing. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-193854

SBE: Crash in ISDK::GetObjectWallClosureInfo()

We got reports from a customer that Vectorworks was crashing while converting a file from VW 2022 to VW 2023.
Our supporters narrowed it down to either one of our doors or one of our windows.

Debugging revealed that the crash occurred within ISDK->GetObjectWallClosureInfo which is called by the PIO's regeneration code during the conversion.

Please see attached screenshots.

In crash3.png, the reason for the crash is an attempted access to a non-existent array index.

It is easily reproducable by running the simple test routine below in attached testfile.

This is very critical and should be fixed for SP 4.

Thanks!

//-------------------------------------------------------------
void test_get_wall_closure_info()
{

//cwdebug_scope csd("test_get_wall_closure_info",20);

MCObjectHandle wall = gSDK->FirstMemberObj(gSDK->GetCurrentLayer());

MCObjectHandle pio = gSDK->GetNamedObject("test");

//debug_obj(gCBP,wall,"wall");
//debug_obj(gCBP,pio,"pio");

if (wall && pio)

{

WallClosureInfo wi;

gSDK->GetObjectWallClosureInfo(pio,wall,wi);

 

} // wall && pio

 

}
//------------------------------------------------------------- 		Christopher Graye

VB-192657

Spotlight - Unable to Re-Associate Position Name Once Deleted from Lighting Device

It appears that once the Position Name that is assigned to a Lighting Pipe/Truss, that is a Lighting Device is associated with, is deleted from the Lighting Device via the OIP or Lighting Device Edit Window, it is not possible to re-associate the Lighting Device with the name of the Lighting Pipe.

Steps to reproduce...

-Create a Lighting Pipe/Truss and add Position Name

-Insert Lighting Device associated with that Lighting Pipe/Truss

-Removing Lighting Device from Lighting Pipe/Truss and delete Position Name via OIP or Lighting Device Edit Window

-Re associate Lighting Device to Lighting Pipe/Truss.

-Notice that the Position Name no longer generates in the OIP of the Lighting Device. However, the Lighting Device is actively associated with the Lighting Pipe/Truss.

 

This appears to be a regression. Unable to re-produce in VW2022 SP5 Build 669583

Tested on Windows 10 and Mac 12.3 ARM.

Video attached for clarity. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-200255

Tilt/Turn window configuration hinge side and open direction problems

*Tilt/Turn hinge side not working*
# Create a window with Tilt/Turn configuration (or a Custom Configuration with a single sash set to Tilt/Turn)
# Try editing the Hinge Side direction, it's stuck on Right
## Changing it to Left doesn't change anything in the 3D Preview pane nor the window model itself
## It changes correctly if editing a Custom configuration in Custom Configuration Options, but if it's just a single sash the changes aren't made to the 3D Preview pane or the window itself either. It does, however, work if you have multiple Tilt/Turn sashes in a Custom window.
# When using multiple Tilt/Turn sashes in the Custom window settings, the hinge points in the wrong direction. If I put it on Left, it points right and vice versa.

*Tilt/Turn shouldn't have In and Out controls*
* While I was looking into the above problem I noticed that the Tilt/Turn configuration has In and Out controls (both as a window on it's own and in the Custom window settings)
* It shouldn't. Tilt/Turn windows only open inwards.

Could be that these problems have existed since the left and right controls were added:
https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-167477 		Christopher Graye

Activate the Tool Geoimage, click on Preference icon and then on the Select Service button of the dialogo box Geoimage Preferences. 
Now, choose the item "Manage Service or Portal List" in the menu "Server" of  the dialogo box Select Service. When the dialog box Manage Service or Portal List opens, click on "Add URL" button and p'aste the link above inti the text box "Service or Portal URL"
and add a name for the Servie, before clicking OK button. Even if the analysis process is OK, when you come back to the dialog Geoimage Preferences the number of services found is 0.

I then referenced (design layer viewport) the survey into my main work file (originally about 350 MB, but stripped down to a single layer and purged for the purposes of this bug report). The scale bar of the referenced viewport is the correct size, but the other geometry of the survey is off by about 117% (see "example of discrepancy" saved view in "DWG import offscale" Vectorworks file); what should be about a 30' length is impassioned as about 35'. This is quite strange.

When I open a blank Vectorworks file and reference the "survey_import" file, everything is the correct scale (see "DWG_VP_correct_scale"). 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-200281

Detail viewports do not render correctly

See the attached test file.

go to sheet A3.0 There are 3 detail viewports on the right.

They are set to background render hidden line 

Select one of the detail viewports. Select the Advanced Properties tab in the OIP.

Go to attributes. Attributes use original objects but only line drawings appear in the detail viewport.

Change the background render settings to Shaded. Notice layers 2-Floor Plan and 2-Floor Slab render. layer 1-Foundation Plan does not render.

I have a lot of detail viewports in some drawings. I'm afraid or what is going to happen when I upgrade to this version.

The workaround fix is to use the eyedropper tool to transfer Render Properties from a correctly rendering viewport onto the Detail Viewport.  		Justin Hutchison

VB-200304

Windows Get Created as Corner Windows in Update 2 When Placed on a Wall Edge

To reproduce, in each version:
* Activate the Window tool in Interactive Sizing Insertion mode
* Draw a Window as shown, so that its edge aligns with the edge of one of the Walls

VB-200045

Vectorworks activate the "Turn off Unified Views" preference without user input

Client reported a bug.
They tested both on VW2023 and VW2024 - experiencing on several files an unexpected behaviour from Vectorworks. Apparently, performing certain operations on "heavy" files (from our experience mainly with 3d geometry) triggers the "Turn off unified views" preference in the background (under "document preferences - Legacy 2d features"), but leaving the "Enable legacy 2D feature" unflagged.
As a result, a document preference is changed by the software (not by the user), activating legacy features in the background, and has to be manually changed every time by users.
This also seems related to one more unexpected behaviour: after deleting a design layer, a random sheet layer is activated (see attached video). 		Hernán Stamati
VB-200029

Hyperlink to "Open File" Command

Using the Hyperlink tool and telling it to "Open File" does not work when the document is published. 

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199199

SQLite unavailable in Manage Databases

VB-198729

Plant Tool does not regard image resources

In a recent demonstration of library objects, a user pointed out that using the Plant Tool's Create from Image feature for 3D Graphics does not see the images from the default plant image library, or image resources imported into their file.

In testing this, with a plant placed in the file, I select to edit style, and in 3D graphics, I choose Create from Image.

In the resource selector within this operation, it only looks for textures in the Vectorworks provided Attributes>Image Fill folder. It does not even provide an attempt to look in other default image folders (designer would expect to pick from our plant image options). If you do a search for "Acer" in this same resource selector, it still does not find anything.

If you do a similar search for "Acer" in the resource manager, it does find many image resources...most in the default Vectorworks Library>Plants folders. It does provide access to the images designers would like to make their 3D representation from...this was designed to give them these resources for this purpose.

If an image is imported into the file, it also shows in the resource manager for an image resource in this file, but when attempting to choose this from the plant style's 3D graphic's Create from Image resource selector, it still does not see it as an available image resource to use.

I believe this is because the image, though we think it seems like an image resource is actually categorized by Vectorworks as a symbol/plug-in object. Perhaps this is appropriate for a different intended workflow, but for our users they can't use it intuitively in the plant style editing like it should be. Even if the designer attempted to use it from the Copy from Symbol routine, the image is seen as a resource, but when chosen, it says there is no 3D geometry (for obvious reasons).

If a user created their own image, taking the background out, but did not already make an image prop out of this image resource, they should be able to use Create from Image to do this operation, but cannot.

[~slebsack] [~kollikainen] [~bstanchev] [~tkostreski2] [~mhermova]  		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-197727

Title Block Border: opening Project Data dialog causes crash

A Customer Vectorworks crashes when clicking on the Project Data button from the Title Block Border that is in the attached Vectorworks Document. Nikolay Zhelyazkov
VB-193950

Draped hardscape return to Planar when placed on site model in converted 2022 file

Connected to VB-193948

Tamsin reported having issues creating draped hardscape objects in the Landmark sample file 'The Cube Landscape Project'. She created a hardscape style with draped as 'by style', applied it to the site model and then went to check the box for cut into Site model. This made the hardscape revert to Planar pad.

There were also issues with hardscape styles set to Planar Pad/None from the beginning.

This is the same file where we saw the site model skirt disappear when updating the site model in 2023.

If the site model is recreated from source data, the problem disappears.

Link to the file in the University: [https://university.vectorworks.net/mod/page/view.php?id=1442]

[~tslatter2], do you have any more to add? 		Alexandra Beshevlieva

VB-197605

Prioritized IFC Bugs ComputerWorks

Hi there,

We noted that you cleaned up your data base and moved open bugs to the next version. Therefore we were looking into our most important IFC bugs and prioritized (only 2 categories) them. We hope that some of them can be addressed for 2023 SPx or at least in the 2024 cycle.

One thing we noted in general is that we have the "feeling" than there are more objects exported on a wrong position than in prior versions. Mainly nested objects are affected. But it's more a "feeling". We rated them higher because of this feeling and because displaced objects cause always slightly more frustration.

 

Here are the bugs we would be happy to address in 2023 or at least 2024:
|VB-169871: Unclaer Situation with the Data Manager and Project Sharing|
|VB-176274: Wall Component miss in IFC-File|
|VB-187635: Dormer Window is not exported to IFC|
|VB-195562: Export IFC: Multiple Break Opening CW in one Slab create overlapping geometry|
|VB-194237: Wall Closure export 2x3 failed|
|VB-188712: Wrong Export IFC of Symbols with Groups|
|VB-188911: Export IFC4: Some Space objects are exported, some are not|
|VB-193031: Objects receive the wrong coordinates with Export IFC|
|VB-182494: Objects in Groups exported with a wrong position to IFC|
|VB-185761: Wrong Coordinates of Objects when Export to IFC|
|VB-184618: Wrong Export from Custom Modeled Ramp to IFC|
|VB-196314: Data Manager: Adding a new record format detaches all other record formats|
|VB-186948: Nested Symbols still do not export properly via IFC|
|VB-196463: Wrong Export IFC|
|VB-196479: Wrong Export IFC|
|VB-191328: Wall Wrapping: Is not exported to IFC for German Windows|

 

Here are the bugs that have a lower priority:
|VB-181331: IFC Landscape: The right workflow to model gutters in Vectorworks (for IFC exports)|
|VB-177641: IFC Import: takes over an hour in VW, only a few minutes in others|
|VB-195655: Export IFC: Break Openings not exported due to "no fill" (only cylindrical!)|
|VB-194409: Conflict between Project Sharing, BCF Manager & Spaces|
|VB-194529: Wrong Export IFC|
|VB-191491: Export IFC: faulty mapping of component material custom field|
|VB-190958: IFC Mapping of Wall Data doesn't work like expected|
|VB-189720: Export IFC4: Viewport lands at the same position as the original. It does work in IFC2x3 though.|
|VB-186644: IFC-Export: Psets fields with a value of 0 (zero) are not exported into IFC|
|VB-190782: Export IFC: Classification mapping fails for one symbol, but works for another| 		Mihail Rizov
VB-200065

Problems with transferring plant data via PlantPartner API

Below is email communication with the customer (Morgane from RFB) - she has issues with linking data with plants in Vectorworks.
The schedule used is in the VStanev account in PlantPartner - *RFB - 2144 - Woodside Phase 1, and the working file is attached
 
 
Since my call with Adam last Friday, I’ve managed to transfer most of the information I needed; few items of note:
* I’ve previously had great issues trying to import PP info for woodland planting; I was very time-pressured on that one so I gave up on trying to import and ended manually copying info in the plant styles as a workaround - maybe one worth investigating? (affected plants in Planting > Woodland in the Resources)
* I did my Friday’s import in several sections however plants that just got imported were sometimes not appearing as Matched already in the plugin window.
* Few plants had blank PP records that it was impossible to remove as there were not showing as matched in the plugin window; only workaround I found was to import a new plant in to overwrite the one with the record.

 
And yes, Adam, happy for you to copy over the schedules as well; relevant ones should be the ones labelled as '*RFB - 2144 - Woodside Phase 1'. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-196201

T02389 – Objects don’t refresh correctly after DWG import

1. Open the attached file.
2. Go to File > Import > Import Single DXF/DWG.
3. Import the attached DWG file.
4. Click on Advance button in DXF/DWG Import Options dialog.
5. Turn on Classes radio button in Classes/Layers pane.
6. Turn off Preserve Graphic attributes of the existing Vectorworks classes/layers checkbox and select Keep the DXF/DWG ByLayer… radio button.
7. Close the dialogs with OK.
8. Note that the Vectorworks objects don’t refresh correctly after the DWG import. 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-200063

An alert warning that an account has not been created on the SPN server is not displayed on Mac.

An alert warning that an account has not been created on Site Protection Server is not displayed on Mac.
As a result, macOS users are expected to run into trouble where the SPN server suddenly shuts down 10 minutes after installation without realizing that they have not created an account, leading to a flood of inquiries.
*Windows OS notification alerts only appear for a few seconds, so Windows OS users may not notice them.

RLM software version: v15.1

Additionally, our improvement suggestions:
-Automatically display the account creation dialog after starting the SPN server.
-Display a message prompting the user to create an account on the last screen of the installation dialog.
*The above improvement suggestions apply to both WindowsOS and macOS.

Please check the above improvement suggestions as well.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Sasha Wood
VB-195613

PlantMaster Plugin does not map enough data from PlantMaster database to Vectorworks Plant Style

Currently, the PlantMaster Plugin has been developed from the PlantMaster side to give a very limited amount of information from the PlantMaster database to populate the data fields of the Vectorworks Plant Style. This is very problematic as the designer will expect more data such as persistence, tolerances, performance (seasonal attributes), favored planting conditions (including zones), etc. to be mapped as well to be prepared to generate a proper plant material list and for ensuring the data exchanged in BIM file collaboration is sufficient for those receiving the designer's files.

Images attached to this VB include the data tab of a plant style with imported data from PlantMaster, and images of the potential data which PlantMaster already has to report on the same plant. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

The home screen does show it, it's blanc

2,8 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7

Mac OS 13.5.2

VB-200144

Project Sharing - Not able to Commit changes to the Project File "Client Error Other"

I was attempting to commit my changes to the Project File without any luck. A dialog pos up stating to log a bug with the server logs. See "image 34" attached. 
* Zscaler is up to date and running properly
* The attached Working File may not have my most recent changes since I'm not able to commit anything to the PF
* User log is attached. Where can I find the PS server logs?

 

Note:

To fix this issue I did the following:
* Saved the changes in my Working File and closed it. Objects were still checked out and not commited to PF
* Closed VW and relaunched it
* Opened the Working File and did a "Save and Commit" 
* Now the commit operation was successful 		Rick Berge
VB-200113

VB-200040

Various 3D objects render hollow in Clip Cube

This problem was [reported on the Vectorworks Forum back in 2017|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/50873-clipcube-is-this-strange-behaviour/], although it might have existed before then. If this issue has already been reported all I want is a prognosis. I'm sure it will still be worthwhile checking if my attached file offers any new info/value though. 

As the legendary Vectorworks Community liaison [Jim Wilson stated|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/50873-clipcube-is-this-strange-behaviour/&do=findComment&comment=254785], "Users should be able to expect that ANY solid, regardless of what type of solid, will be properly filled by both clip cubes and sections when cut." –Which everyone would of course agree with. Because this is such a fundamental capability of Vectorworks' 3D modelling and viewing technology and because it has persisted for so long, I think it is long overdue to be fixed. 

I spent some hours yesterday establishing the current state of the problem and confirming what conditions currently invoke it. You'll find these labelled in the attached file. I've tested the current Stair Tool as it was of particular concern for members of that Forum discussion. All configurations I tested displayed fine, but that might be because the Stair tool creates {-}Mesh objects which are ostensibly unaffected by this problem{-}. EDIT: I've since established that Mesh objects _are_ affected but in all conditions and physical arrangements, unlike other solids that exhibit this issue under certain circumstances. 

The other file attached is from a user who is unable to produce complete sections due to this problem. 

Please let me know the current prognosis of this bug. Thank you!  		Justin Hutchison

VB-198911

Problems such as script errors occur when using marionette objects from within resources in other files.

When using Marionette Object from within resources in other files, a script error occurs and it cannot be placed correctly. Also, when placed from the Symbol Insertion Tool, changing parameters from the object information palette causes the marionette object to disappear.
*The script error is a problem that occurs only in VW2023, but it has been confirmed in VW2024 that the marionette object disappears due to parameter changes after placing it with the Symbol Insertion Tool.

Steps to reproduce:
-When placing with the Symbol Insertion Tool
1) Open a sample file and a new file and make the new file active.
2) Right-click the symbol "Marionette" of the sample file on the resource manager > left-click "Make Active" and confirm that the Symbol Insertion Tool is automatically selected.
3) When the mouse cursor is moved to the placement destination of the drawing area of the new file and left-clicking to place it, the script error dialog is displayed 3 times and the placement is not correct.
4) When the parameters of Marionette Object are changed from OIP, Marionette Object disappears.
* Recorded in the reproduction video [^13247_1.mov]

-When placed by dragging
1) Open a sample file and a new file and make the new file active.
2) When the sample file symbol "Marionette" is dragged to the location of the drawing area of the new file on the resource manager, a script error dialog is displayed once and the placement is not successful.
3) Even if the parameters of Marionette Object are changed from OIP, the Marionette object will not disappear.
* Recorded in the reproduction video [^13247_2.mov]

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-200130

TK BUG: "Symbol Options" menu is different for symbol and mirrored symbol

Hi VW-Team,

there is a difference in the menu between a symbol and a mirrored symbol!

Mirrored Symbol has “Symbol Options” in “Edit Symbol” menu
non mirrored symbol does not have this option.

Please add also “Symbol Options” to the non-mirrored symbol

+

“Double Click: Displays this dialog”
is only available for the non-mirrored symbol
I think we don't need this option at all!

 

AND please add also “Symbol Options”
to the context menu (right click) for all symbols!

 

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-199975

TK BUG: The Deform tool cannot bend when a Polygon/Polyline is smoothed (PR 10864514)

HI VW-Team,

attached is a user file from the forum.
[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/111599-deform-tool-not-working-vw-2023-sp7/#comment-485561]

The user want's to bend an "Extrude" with the "Deform"-tool,
but the operation can't be executed. 

The base of the Extrude is a Polyline!
It seems that the Polyline is some smoothed, or has some kind
of smoothing.

If you unsmooth the Polyline with:
Modify/ Poly Smoothing / No Smoothing
the bending-operation can be executed.

Please see the attached video!

It seems that some kind of "smoothed" Polygons/Polylines
+ Deform/Bend to not work very well together!

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Hernán Stamati
VB-199888

minimal 40 seconds before shadows in 2D plan show

The top/plan view of designlayer 'indeling B-2' and sheetlayer 'O6' make use of 2d shadows from the class 'Interieur - algemeen'.

When zooming in or out, changing class settings or using any other command it takes minimal 40 seconds before the shadows show again. Sometimes it takes more then a minute before

This interrupts a fast and efficient workflow of editing and checking drawings and settings big time. So much that if prefer not to use them on a next project.

Hernán Stamati
VB-200013

Nomad app: no layout layers error

Measure space with Nomad app vmsr file is created in the cloud > then a vwx file is created > then you can create PDF > here comes the error message “no layout layers”

It worked perfectly until the update on October 6th, 2023.

This was tested with Android. 		Ivaylo Iliev
VB-200096

Shaded rendering- Ground only is incorrect and below the layer plane, also viewport shadow appears cropped even though there isn't one.

Hello,
Enclosed is a v2017 file with an extrude and directional light. OpenGL rendering with Shadows on ground only. Note that the shadow appears to be 'on the ground' or the lowest point in the file and is correct.
Open and convert that same file in v2024 and you'll see that the shadow is lower than the layer plane. This is incorrect.
In both versions in a viewport is created you do not see the extents of the shadow because it appears the viewport is cropped even though one does not exist. The only way to make it visible is to edit the viewport and actually add a crop! Then the extent of the shadow will be seen.

Cheers,
Peter 		Justin Hutchison

VB-199388

Site Model: Top extruded contour doesn't walk around site modifiers

Open 'circular site model 4.vwx'.

It contains a site model with a pad modifier and a retaining edge modifier.

As it can be seen in 'extruded contour closing incorrectly.png', the top extruded contours closes itself incorrectly. It should walk along the blue line, which marks the boundaries of the site modifiers, but instead it breaks at the orange points and because it is treated as a closed contour it finishes with the red line. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-200014

Spotlight Truss being forced into 3D wrongly

In 2023 sp7 if you try to draw a truss line using the truss tool in any 3D view every section after the first will have a roll applied to it despite being inserted lieing flat.
This affects all truss types that I have tested with so far
To recreate the issue follow the steps quoted in the linked forum thread

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/111533-truss-defaulting-to-3d-symbol-in-plan-view-in-spotlight/ 		Kevin Linzey
VB-199926

Cloud rendering

Problem from a Customer:

Good day
Some time ago we sent you a Vectorworks file concerning the problem: extremely slow rendering.
On September 12, Mr. Abt contacted us by phone. We should use the quality levels and other renderers and test how the render time and quality behave in this regard.
We have now done this and found that the cloud renders massively different speeds.

The resolution always remained 8192 x 4096 pixels, thus the highest possible.
The different settings are attached as a pdf as well as our default setting, which we normally always use.

We also noticed that the same renderings on the cloud have different lengths. Could it be that there is extreme variation there? Last week a rendering with all quality levels on MEDIUM without environment took about 15min and today again almost 1.5 hours.
A few weeks ago we had to render the file locally because the cloud stopped rendering after 24 hours. Last week we tried it again with our default settings and panorama and this time it only took about 1hr 15min.
It would be nice if the cloud would become more reliable again, a year ago we had no such fluctuations. Rendering locally is only possible for us in an emergency and also only during the night, since we have to work in Vectorworks every day.
Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-199933

Synchronization loop - Account defect?

Hey guys,

I was in a call with a customer who wanted to use the cloud Services to sync a project file to work on it.

But whatever I tried to do, the files never synced.
Even newly uploaded files within the Home folder wont get synced.

I tried to delete the .ini file in the hidden .config folder but that didn't help.
Also download the latest version of the Cloud Service Application didn't help.

We also weren't able to log off from the Cloud Application, the button didn't respond.

We created a new account and it worked instantaneously. Login, Logoff, Upload, download files, everything synced within seconds.

So our guess here is, that the account, they are using, is somewhat bugged.
I wonder if you can check this account a bit deeper.
The login of this account is "Projektassistent".

Thanks for your help and have a good calm weekend!

Best regards
Alex 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov

VB-199877

Offsetting a window creates a gap between the interior sill and window

Created a standard window with a masonry sill on the external and a sill internally.

If the window is given an offset in the wall, the external sill will reposition along with the offset window position. The internal sill doesn't reposition in the same way, therefore creating a gap or an overlap of the 2 elements, depending on whether the offset is towards the external side or towards internal side.

[^house_modified_v2023.vwx]

It contains a cropped viewport. It is properly visible with  top view, but when you rotate it the content disappears.

The problem is that the viewport crops the content to a rectangle in world space. Then the content is cropped to a rectangle in screen space, so everything disappears.

VB-199871

SBE: Interactive reshape: More weird behavior

SBE: Interactive reshape: More weird behavior

Please watch attached movie. 

In OnGetInteractiveSizingParams, I'm passing 2.3m as default elevation (see log below). 
But the modification points are not at that Z position (for reference, the upper 3D locus is at Z = 2.3m).

Even worse: Even if the window is dragged to the side which should change the width only,
In OnSetInteractiveSizingParams I get a different elevation which of course causes the window to "jump" down.

The difference between the values is the difference between the layer height and the bottom bound of the wall.

 

Attached plug-in is Mac, 29.0.x, debug version.

VB-199103

Update Reference needs more time if referenced file is closed

Attached are two Vectorworks documents.

One being the main file: "6000_RAB..."
The other being the referenced file: "RAB_MASTER..."

First scenario:

1. Open and keep both files open with Vectorworks.

2. Update the reference in the "6000_RAB..." file.

Result: it will update under 5 minutes.

Second scenario:

1. Open ONLY the "6000_RAB..." file.
2. Update the reference in the "6000_RAB..." file.

Result: It will need almost 40 minutes to update (28.0.7) and with 29.0.2b(721584) after 1 hour is still trying to update (showing 0% on the bottom bar).

This problem was also happening with 28.0.5, but then fixed with 28.0.6. Now it is again happening with 28.0.7, hence I am marking this as a Regression.

I have tested this with both Windows 11 and MacOS 13.5 and its important to have in mind that with Windows 11 I am using a 13th Gen i-9 13400K and 64GB RAM, therefore its not because the hardware is not up to par.



Please take a look at this. Thank you in advance. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199801

Grid Line Bubble elbow (Page) value scaling results in critical misalignment

Observe the attached Grid Line Bubble Elbow.vwx file and associated screen shot Grid Line Bubble elbow misalignment.png

Note; When an elbow is associated with a Grid Line bubble, the elbow (and bubble) retain the Page Based scaling and will therefore offset dramatically from it's required position, thereby breaking the visual association with the Grid Line (eg; on VP 1/Sht-2 grid 20 appears to align to grid 21). This could give rise to a critical error on a documentation set as the grids are incorrectly identified. 
[notwithstanding the separate but associated bug report VB-199799 of the Grid Line Bubble not correctly scaling and/or not correctly responding to the Page Symbol scaling factor.] 		Hernán Stamati
VB-199799

Grid Line Bubble do not scale consistently in Sheet Layer Vieport.

Observe the attached Grid Line Bubble scale fail.vwx and associated screen shot Grid Line bubble scaling fail.png

Note; the Grid Line Bubbles do not scale and/or do not scale consistently between VPs. 
Observe (bottom right) Viewports 1/Sht-3 and 1/Sht-5 are identical, however the Grid Line Bubbles appear differently. 

Observe Viewport 1/Sht-2, the Grid Line Bubbles do not respond to Page Symbol Scaling - even although they are Page Scaled Symbols. 
The Bubbles do have a scale factor applied, but it's not clear where that factor is coming from. 

[I have observed that if the Page Symbol Scaling value is applied to a VP of scale (say) 1:1000 and then a duplicate of that VP is created and the VP scale changed to (say) 1:5000, the Grid Line bubbles +will+ scale. But they won't respond and/or update if the Page Symbol Scaling value is applied +after+ the 1:5000 VP is created.]  		Hernán Stamati
VB-199785

The "Select Data Tags?" alert goes missing if I check the "Switch to Plan Projection" don't show again checkbox.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Open the attached file.
2) Select the Living Room Space object and convert it to a symbol.
3) Do not check the "Don't show again" checkbox on the "Select Data Tags?" alert and click the "Yes" button.
4) Check the "Don't show again" checkbox on the "Switch to Plan Projection?" alert and click the "Yes" button.
5) Create the symbol.
6) Select the Parking Space object and convert it to a symbol.

Notice that the "Select Data Tags?" alert does not appear.  I did not check the "Don't show again" checkbox on this alert, yet the alert does not appear again.  Please see the attached video.

VB-196346

VB-198743

Railing: Style with corner supports ON seems to be missing a post when created

Seen in the attached video and file, there are two identical railing styles except for their corner support setting. The style with "support at corners" off does not add posts at the top and bottom angle change of the railing path. This is to be expected (even though it does look strange to have magic cables change direction in mid-air).

What is unexpected however is that creating a railing with "support at corners" turned *on* results in a post missing at the bottom angle change of the path where it appears there should be a post (because there is a post at the top angle change of the path.)

Also, editing the railing to make the seemingly invisible post visible is not successful.

It almost seems like the 2' equal spacing setting for posts is being applied to the _entire_ railing path in a case like this whereas the spacing should perhaps "start over" when it encounters a corner, especially an angle change like this.  

!image-2023-08-19-09-59-49-554.png! 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-198807

Railing: Guardrail top-rails are twisted

In the attached file (The Architect PIO demo file) I have the railings looking good after many attempt... except that the top-rails of the two noted guardrails are twisted. I _feel_ like I have tried everything (adding posts where needed, removing unneeded posts, re-applying gravity many times) but I cannot seem to make these guardrails be perpendicular to theirs supporting posts.

A few things to note:
* The railing style in the file has been newly re-imported from our existing content on Aug 23.
* Support at Corners for this railing style is intentionally off.
* All posts in all railings are located where they should be, so resetting the posts would result in a lot of work to re-place them.

I am hoping you can help solve this. Thank you!

 

!image-2023-08-22-17-38-14-633.png|width=1445,height=813! 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-198795

ConnectCAD - Drop Point "Temp Define Custom Object" undo event

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Create a new document.
# Create a new Drop Point object using the Drop Point tool.
# Undo two times. On the first undo, the object disappears. On the second undo, it shows "Undo: Temp Define Custom Object".

 

_Regression from 29.0.0_ 		Conrad Preen
VB-198630

Light sources still limited to 8 in Shaded render mode

Please see the attached file and screen recording. 

In recent releases Vectorworks, Inc. have promoted that the Shaded render mode was free from the 8-light maximum that was enforced for OpenGL. This appears to be untrue –at least for certain light sources: When I set up 10 Heliodons OR 10 Directional lights each representing a unique time of day, a maximum of 8 shadows can be seen. 

I've considered the possibility that Shaded render mode is limited in the number of shades it can display for each colour but some symptoms suggest that is not the problem here. I've done a pretty thorough job at accounting for overlapping light washing out other shadows and the varying brightnesses the sun delivers at different times of day, etc. Perhaps I've not accounted for everything, but the best evidence is seen in the screen recording where you can see one shadow disappears when an adjacent shadow reappears as I adjust the projection angle of one light source ever so slightly. 

Since making that recording I've added 10 Point Lights to the file and confirmed they too seem to only produce a maximum of 8 shadows. 

This matter came to light because one of our customers is trying to do a solar study, examining what impacts the shadows of their proposed building will have on its surroundings, at different times of day, across different times of year, so it's a really important need.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-198475

BIMObject - Long download time, can't cancel download

Unsure if my internet speed is affecting the download of different objects, but I also cannot cancel the action.

Steps:

Choose a complicated/large object and download from catalog

Before the progress bar disappears (mine shows zero progress), hit the cancel button. 

The cancel button will gray/disable, but the dialog never disappears and I can no longer use Vectorworks.

I waited over an hour yesterday before force closing, but am still encountering today with some objects. I've only been able to successfully download some faucets. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-199716

QA test new Plant Master partner product

The PlantMaster plugin gives Vectorworks users integrated access to the PlantMaster plant database and landscape project management services. Users can sync their landscape projects on both platforms to contain the same amounts and sorts of plants by either exporting plant data to the PlantMaster site to update the plant database in their account, importing plant data to Vectorworks to create new Plant Styles or both. This way PlantMaster users gain a way to visualize their projects with Vectorworks and Vectorworks users gain access to a new plant data database.

Plant master is a new plug-in that is intended to be available from the Install Partner Products Page. It is implemented as a Web Palette and after installation can be found in Window\Palette\Web Pallets\Plant Master.

In order to be able to test, one needs to sign up at the Plant Master site.

  		Walid Remaili

VB-199689

Worksheet ObjectData Function not working with compound criteria

The ObjectData function(s) [at least ObjectData('General Name') and ObjectData('Universal  Value') do not seem to be able to accept compound criteria in a spreadsheet cell. They function properly when used in a Database where the database criteria is compound.

In Worksheet-1 of the attached file there is a Parking Spaces object in the Site-Parking-Bikes class.

Row 6 is a Database with the compound Criteria of ((C='Site-Parking-Cars') & (PON='Parking Spaces')).  The database header row formulas are:

Column A  =OBJECTDATA('General Name')
Column B =OBJECTDATA('Universal Value', 'Parking Spaces', 'No of Spaces')
Column C =Count
Notice that the values returned in the database all appear to be correct.

Rows 11 to 27 are Spreadsheet cells showing variations in criteria.

Rows 11-15 are using ObjectData('General Name')

Rows 16-21 are using ObjectData('Universal Value')

Rows 23-27 are using Count

 

Notice that the first two rows of each group are using single criteria and are returning the expected values.

The 3rd-5th rows are using compound criteria with different arrangement of parentheses.

For the two ObjectData sets, the compound criteria return a value of zero which is not the expected value.

For the Count set, the compound criteria (using any version of the parentheses) returns the proper count.

 

This appears to show a bug in the ObjectData functions that are using criteria.

 

The expected result would be for the compound criteria to function as they do for Count and allow the ObjectData functions to return their expected values of the Name of the Object or the value of the "No. of Spaces" field.

 

I have tried numerous other combinations of compound criteria including using the Criteria Builder and have not found a compound criteria that works. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-193324

Cannot Delete old References

User submitted a file where he cannot delete old references.

He said the references X-ARCH and X-ARCH-NEW freeze up this main file when doing any sort of editing or deleting from the organization palette.

Notes from his email.

When Reference Vectorworks files gets updated, the main file tend to crash/get stuck while updating the file.

Other scenarios the crash would occur when:
1. Opening a file - Gets stuck at "5 of 11 Updating References"
2. Updating Reference file from the Navigation (right click > update)
3. Editing Reference File (right click > edit)
4. Deleting Reference File (right click > delete) One remedy I've done to make the file usable is when the corrupted Reference file is deleted, moved, or relocated (a.k.a. breaking the link).

I found if i created 2 new blank VW files X-ARCH and X-ARCH-NEW I could use them to link in the organization palette and then delete the referenced files.

If deleting the reference files without linking, Vectorworks just becomes unresponsive.

User sent a 2022 file, but i found the issue was the same in 2022 and 2023 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198035

Crash when using Move by Points tool

VW crashes when selecting the Move by Points tool. No crash log is recorded. Payne Chang
VB-197377

It is complicated to make worksheet functions work after changin the call format from "text" to "general"

When you have a cell which has the cell format setting "text", off course, functions are not going to work.
But when you change the cell format to "general" afterwards and recalculate the worksheet, the functions are still not working, as if you didn't change any setting.
This is very confusing.
In stead, you need to do some very specific manipulations in order to make the cell function in a normal way again:
- You need to make the cell empty
- You need to confirm the empty cell, so the cell shows empty in the worksheet as well
- Finally, you need to re- enter the function.

This is problematic because: If the user already realizes the call doesn't work as it should because of a wrong setting, changing the setting doesn't help immediately. Also re- entering the function doesn't help. The average user will not succeed in following the correct steps, so will conclude the worksheet is corrupted. On top of that, in case of a large worksheet, re- entering the functions can be a lot of work. 		Karthick Chilaka

Spotlight Inventory T02059 edit selected does not respect the Toggle Multiple Selection Mode

All items are edited when selecting items via the Spotlight Inventory dialog and then trying to edit just one of the several items selected via toggling the Multiple Selection Mode.

VB-199210

Spotlight Cable tool daisy chain mode doesn't correctly fill in start and end fields in cables

When drawing a DMX cable using the daisy chain mode of the cable tool the cable objects created do not codisplay the correct info in the cables start and end fields.
The first cable in the chain will correctly display the channel ID of the light it starts at but the end field will display the cable run ID of the next cable in the chain.
All the cables in the middle of the chain will display the cable run ID's of the previous or next cable in the chain, and the last cable will display that it starts from the previous cable but finishs in the final light.

The cables should all display the channel ID of the lights that they are connected to not the cable run ID's of the other cables in the chain. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199177

Aligned Hardscape: Convex interpolation with 100% Falloff brings holes to the surface

Open file 'convex interpolation holes.vwx'.

The aligned hardscape is aligned to a path hardscape.

Observe that the aligned hardscape has holes in the vertical wall where the alignment happens. It seems that some of the boundary points are not sent to the adjacent surface definition polygon.

I think this is an epsilon ModifyTIN problem as ModifyTIN is used to insert the surface definition polygons in the aligned surface when *Interpolate surface* is on. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193368

Curved Hardscapes Create Jagged Edges on Site Model, Regardless of Simplification Tolerance

The attached file contains a Site Model and two Site Modifiers with curved edges that share geometry (so that the Site Model forms perfectly-vertical faces between them). The file also contains a Hardscape whose shape matches the upper modifier's shape. Both the modifiers and the Hardscape have a Simplification Tolerance of 0".

Note that the Site Model shows a series of jagged edges in the area where it's cut by the Hardscape (see attached screenshot). This looks like some kind of mismatch in the tolerance between the Hardscape and the modifiers.

This gives the Site Model an awkward look and probably adds to the computation time.

This only seems to be apparent when the Hardscape is cutting the Site Model, so it wasn't really an issue prior to SP4. Based on that I've marked it against the T02357 task, but if it needs to be removed just let me know. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199111

add a dimension using context menu

It is not possible to add or insert a dimension on existing one.

1. Create a new chain dimension object
2. Doing a Right-click anywhere on it, there is not appears the Add Dimension command as expected. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196437

Texture missing from Roof Face object after file translated to Vectorworks 2024

-Open attached test file in Vectorworks 2023 and note the front-most Roof Face object has a texture that matches the main Roof object
-Open test file in Vectorworks 2024 and the texture is missing from the Roof Face object
-See attached image 		Christopher Graye
VB-194956

Hardscape 2D Main Area Class Properties display insconsistency

Observe the attached screen recording and accompanying file Untitled 7.vwx. 

If the Class Attributes (of the assigned Class) +are not set+ to 'use at creation', then the fill of the Hardscape instance will take the Attributes Palette fill. 
If the Class Attributes (of the assigned Class) +are set+ to 'use at creation', then the fill of the Hardscape Instance will take the attributes of that Class. 
However, for Hardscape instances that were previously drawn, the Attributes are NOT refreshed. 
A change of Fill Attribute via the Attributes Palette will trigger the previously drawn Hardscape to render the Fill attribute of the assigned Class. 
So it works for some instances but not others, depending on whether or not the Attributes Fill has been activated. 
This is very confusing and inconsistent. 
The behaviour can be forced to be consistent by making the Attributes Palette Fill 'by Class'. 
Personally I think that if the Main Area Class is set to 'use at creation' then the Attributes Palette fill should display 'by Class'. This seems especially true as the attributes of the Hardscape 2D Main Area Class specifically states that to be the case. 
I have not checked how the Pen attributes respond.  		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-196130

Adjacent Spaces not respecting modifiers

Please see attached screen recording and test file. Michael Wladarz

VB-192592

Roof Face Edges Get Offset Incorrectly in SP3

The attached movie and test file show this in 2023 SP2 compared to SP3. The file contains a Roof Face with a square Eave Cut and an Edge Offset applied to one of its components.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and reset the Roof Face.

In SP2, note that the edge offset gets applied to only one edge.

In SP3, note that the offset gets applied to three of the four edges.

As part of the 679904 change, it looks like square-cut Roof Faces should now be showing the offset on all of their edges, to match the behavior of the other Eave Cut options. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198644

The upSlopePoint member of SlabType gets recalculated every time the user selects/zooms/pans with a Roof Face object selected.

The upSlopePoint member of SlabType appears to pertain to the location of the arrow indicator that appears when a Roof Face object is selected.  It seems a little odd that upSlopePoint is a member of the SlabType object when it seems to be an interactive-only item.  Perhaps this information should live in draw code?

This bug was created from the comments on VB-198572.  I have attached the files on that bug onto this bug as well. 		Christopher Graye

# Start Connect/Combine tool and select "Dual Object Connect Mode"

VB-198603

2D Component Circles Not Clipped by Section Bounds

To reproduce this issue:
# Open '2D Component Circles Not Clipped.vwx'.
# Update the two selected Section Viewports on the Sheet Layer the files open to.
# Notice that the pink and blue circles in the 'Back Cut - Finite' Section Viewport are no longer clipped by the Section Viewport's bounds (i.e., finite length).

This issue is a regression that was introduced between Mainline autobuilds VW26.0.0d(519624) and VW26.0.0d(519746) by changelist 519686 adding a 'DeleteUnecessaryCornerverticesBetweenArcsAndBeziers' function. See attached screenshots for the appearances of the Section Viewports in the two Mainline autobuilds. 		Christopher Graye

The script runs Generate2DFrom3DComp() and succeeds

Select PIO 2 and run the script again.

The script fails.

Symbol 2 contains a NURBS surface pasted from a symbol from another file that was sent to me by a user. I don't know how the curve was created. I've isolated this to be geometry that causes Generate2DFrom3DComp() to fail. Ideally, the command should ignore this surface, which seems to have no area.

VB-198897

Initialization of PolylineVert is incomplete

Creating a PolylineVert leaves fields with undefined values. In particular "unused" and "controlPt". That can for example cause failures in the "DM_PolylineTypeSettersGettersTest" automatic test:

 
-testVertexVector \{ size=4 } std::vector<PolylineVert,std::allocator<PolylineVert>>
- [0] \{p={...} segInfo=\{doDrwLine=true cTan=false sel=false ...} unused=0x000002154ef85722 "9œ... ...} PolylineVert
- p \{...} WorldPt
[0]57 '9'char
[1]-100 'œ'char
- u \{controlPt={y=-nan x=0.0000000000000000 } v1=\{radius=-nan centerM={x=0 y=0} } } PolylineVert::<unnamed-type-u>
+ controlPt \{y=-nan x=0.0000000000000000 } _WorldPt
+ v1 \{radius=-nan centerM={x=0 y=0} } PolylineVert::<unnamed-type-u>::radiusStruct
  		Christopher Graye

VB-197595

Walls: polyline mode doesn't function as designed

When you draw linear walls with the polyline mode and switch the mode to an arc form while drawing, you loose the walls which were already drawn.
This behavior seems to be the oposite of what the design is intending. If you have a polyline mode, you'd expect the behavior to be like a polyline.

Switching from arc to straight also doesn't work, because at any moment you finish an arc segment, the wall finishes. In this ways you are force"d to stop drawing the polyline. 		Christopher Graye
