VB-198276

T02345: Handing Widget Improvements needed

The Door and Window Handing task (T02345) introduced two new widgets for interactively controlling handing related parameters for the Door and Window.  The current implementation needs refinements and the list below contains possible refinements to consider and discuss:
# When relevant parameters are by style making the widget non-functional:
*A.* Hide the handing widget
*B.* Show the Interior Side widget grayed and disabled. This case could possibly use the same translucent icon that shows on the opposite side of wall when hovering over the active Interior Side widget.
# Only show these widgets when they'll be a reasonable size for the current zoom level.
IOW: Don't show when you zoomed out looking at 60 selected doors.
# Possibly have limited scaling of them for reasonable zoom levels.
# Possibly only show them on a selected object while the cursor hovers over the object (rather than always show them).  Note: It may still be desirable to see the Interior side widget for multiple selected insert so we should think more on this one. 		Christopher Graye
VB-194737

SBE: Can't change offset of symbol break of PIO in TXYZRegenSink::OnSetInteractiveSizingParams

In TXYZRegenSink::OnSetInteractiveSizingParams, I need to move the offset of the symbol break the PIO is inserted into.

I do

SWallSymbolBreak  brk;
                    
if (wall.FindBreak(wrp.m_obj,brk))  {
                        
                    
                        
    double new_offset = brk.offset+off_break;
                        

                        
    brk.offset = new_offset;
                        

                        
    gSDK->UpdateBreak(wall,(short)brk.index,new_offset,(short)kSymbolBreak,(void *)(&(brk.symBreak)));
                        

} // **

After the call to UpdateBreak, I checked the wall and its breaks and found the wall break at the correct position (new_offset).

However, in the actual drawing the break still had the old offset.

It seems that Vectorworks undoes my offset change somewhere after OnSetInteractiveSizingParams.

It is vital for our interactive resizing that we can do that. If this isn't the right place to actually move the break, we need to find another solution.

Maybe we can introduce a new EInteractiveSizingType::eISZ variable that we can set in OnSetInteractiveSizingParams.

It could be named like eISZ_NewSymbolBreakOffset, and if the plug-in fills it in OnSetInteractiveSizingParams, Vectorworks will move the break to fInteractiveSizingInfo[eISZ_NewSymbolBreakOffset].fCurrentValue. 		Christopher Graye

-Open test file

-Hover over the frames. Notice the red selection highlighting appears only when hovering over certain frame areas. Seems to work a bit better on the top horizontal frames.  		Christopher Graye
VB-198958

SBE: Interactive creation in 3D: Elevation and window height ignored

Please have a look at attached movie. VW ignores the position of the drawn rectangle by setting  elevation aka sill height to 0 and ignoring the height. If you create the window over a wall, it seems to work correctly. After that, even outside the wall it is working correctly. This looks like a similar initialization problem I reported before.
Delays in the movie are caused by laggings on my old Mac.

VB-194930

SBE: Interactive reshaping: Position shifts if window becomes corner window

Please watch attached movie. After the window becomes a corner window, the left (seen from below) side moved a bit to the right. To make it clearer I have drawn a line perpendicular to the wall at the beginning of the window.

In task T02348 it says:

>>>Because of this, the width reported by the tool (in its floating data bar) 
>>>must be adjusted by the offset amount to insure the correct width is displayed 
>>>to the user and returned back to the insert upon completion.  
>>>This will insure expected results for users and will prevent the opposite side of a corner window from unexpectedly shifting.

But here this unexpected shift happens.

I understand that this is not easy to solve as we have contradictory requirements. 

On the one hand, the users enters a value for the window with and expects that the width he enters will become the corresponding width in the OIP.

On the other hand, users will expect that the opposite side of the window (i.e. the one they did NOT drag) remains in place. But as the actual window width is not calculated from the bisecting line but from like the imaginary window frame or (in case of CW windows) sometimes from an imaginary "finished size" or "unfinished size", we can't do both.

So what is the plan here? 

- Accept the small offset?
- Prevent the transformation from non-corner window to corner window altogether?
- Some sophisticated solution that will need to involve that the PIO calculates some offset so VW can somehow calculate the returned eISZ_BottomCenterPointX (and VW then needs to rename the data bar prompt as the value in the data bar will not represent the actual "Window Width" anymore)? 		Christopher Graye
VB-195489

-Open attached test file created in Vectorworks 2013
-Render with Shaded render mode
-Zoom in to the windows appearing to the left of the front door
-Force Select the center window
-You'll notice the Selection Highlight indicates shutters are associated with the window, except they are not visible
-While the Window is selected, click the, "Flip" button in the Object Info Palette and the shutters will appear
-Video attached 		Christopher Graye

VB-197298

T02345: Some Door and Window configuration issues

Some door and window configurations have issues.  Please see attached VWX file and video (with audio).

{*}Issues ({*}edited on *2023-08-11* using build *717904):*
# {*}Door - Double Acting{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Left Side of Wall":
Arc in Top/Plan appears shifted and does not meet dashed line of leaf.

# {*}Door - Double Egress{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Left Side of Wall":
Swing Directions (In/Out) are reversed.
# {*}Door - Overhead{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Left Side of Wall":
Overhead Path graphics incorrect size.
# {*}Door - Pocket{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Left Side of Wall":
Leaves should be flipped vertically.
# {*}Door - Pocket{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Left Side of Wall":
Active Leaf Open Direction is "Right" but they're opening to the left.
# {*}Door - Sliding OXO{*}: Enable and use the Active Leaf Open Direction to determine which side this opens in the model.
# *Door - Sliding* *XO* and *OX* should be reversed (left to right)
# *Door - Sliding* *XOO* and *OOX* should be reversed (left to right)
# *Door - Sliding* "{*}Multiple{*} {*}Bipart{*}" with odd number of leaves needs *Active Leaf Open Direction* parameter enabled to determine whether the active leave opens to the left or right.
# {color:#00875a}*Door - Swing* *XO* and *OX* should be reversed (left to right) - FIXED{color}
# {color:#00875a}*Door - Swing* *XOO* and *OOX* should be reversed (left to right) - FIXED{color}
# *Door Swing* *OXO* needs *Hinge Side* parameter enabled to determine whether the active leave hinges from the left or right.
# {*}Window - Folding{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Left Side of Wall":
Swing Direction (In/Out) is the opposite of what it should be (still assumes left side of wall is always exterior).
# {*}Window - Hung{*}: Sashes not respecting Interior Side setting (still assumes left side of wall is always exterior)
# *Window Sliding* *XO* and {*}OX{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Right Side of Wall":  Sash geometry should be flipped horizontally.
# *Window Sliding* *XXO* and {*}OXX{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Right Side of Wall":  Sash geometry should be flipped horizontally.
# *Window Sliding* *XOO* and {*}OOX{*}: Geometry issue when Interior Side is "Right Side of Wall":  Sash geometry should be flipped horizontally. 		Christopher Graye
VB-194698

Data Tag Space Change Class failed

Data Tag Space Change Class failed Christopher Graye
VB-197852

T02345 Interior Side doesn't affect all "interior" parameters

Not all door "interior" parameters are reflecting the door's new Interior Side setting. Specifically, the interior kick plate still seems to be using the wall direction's definition of the interior side, not the door setting. See the video showing the difference between the kick plate behavior vs. interior trim.

I haven't done a comprehensive check to see which other settings do what. And I haven't checked the window for similar behavior.

--------------------------------------------

Added by [~mpanzer2]:

Here's a list of exterior/interior (and left/right) elements I'm seeing that are based on the wall direction rather than the insert's Interior Side Setting:

*DOOR:*
* Asymmetric Top shapes (e.g.: Slope from Left/Right) (VB-197655)
* Left/Right Sidelights (VB-197655)
* Interior/Exterior Jamb geometry
* Interior/Exterior Leaf geometry
* Interior/Exterior Sash geometry
* Interior/Exterior Marker (3D Visualization pane)
* 3D Tag (ID Tag pane)
* Kick Plate (Leaf pane)
* Louver geometry (Louvers pane):
Should alway slope down toward the exterior side of the insert.
* Hardware (Hardware pane):
Exterior handle should always face exterior side of insert.
* Interior/Exterior Kick Plates (Kick Plates pane)

*WINDOW:*
* Asymmetric Top shapes (e.g.: Slope from Left/Right) (VB-197655)
* Interior/Exterior Jamb geometry
* Interior/Exterior Sash geometry
* Interior/Exterior Marker (3D Visualization pane)
* 3D Tag (ID Tag pane)
* Louver geometry (Louvers pane):
Should alway slope down toward the exterior side of the insert. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198272

T02345: Handing Related Parameter Behavior on and after Insertion and with Flip Button

Handing related parameters of various Door and Window Configurations and Operations need to be controlled:
# On insertion with the Door/Window tool
# After insertion with the handing widgets
# After insertion with the "Flip" button in the Object Info palette.

All three cases above must have the same handing related parameter behavior to provide a predictable result.  The attached "{*}Handing Parameter Behavior on and after Insertion and with Flip Button.vwx{*}" file has several layers of Door or Window objects set to various Configurations and Operations and the expected behaviors for those three cases listed above.

{*}Edit{*}: I added a Word document that has a table of the behaviors illustrated in the VWX file.

[~jwarshaw] , We should meet to go over this file to clarify what the rules for these behaviors are and we should include [~hpalanivelu] (and [~jfabbiani] if possible). 		Christopher Graye

Justin Hutchison
VB-196901

Structural member top plan 2d representation

To reproduce the issue:
* Model a structural member frame in top plan in poly insertion mode. This is the easiest way to model portal frames
* The above will have the steel profile in the wrong orientation - rotate profile in OIP 90 degrees. With the structural member still 'flat on the ground' the 2d representation is correct.
* Stand the frame upright in 3d. Back in top plan view the the 2d representation is showing the width flipped
* Now rotate the profile to 0 degrees in the OIP - the 2d representation is still incorrect as it flips again. 		Christopher Graye
VB-194501

Structural Member: Resetting Structural Members in one file causes joined behavior problems in all files during that Vectorworks session

# Create a new blank document.
# Place a structural member.
# Place another structural member that joins to the first one.
# Try to move either structural member.
*Notice* they move and stay joined as expected.
# Open the attached "structmtest.vwx" file.
# Select all Structural Member objects.
# Move them by 0, 0 to force them to reset.
# Repeat steps 1 - 4.
*Notice* the Structural Member objects no longer allow you to move them.
# Go back to the original document created in step 1 and try moving the Structural Members again.
*Notice* they can no longer move either.

This problem persists for the remainder of the Vectorworks session forcing the user to restart Vectorworks to correct it. 		Christopher Graye
VB-199043

Braceworks wrongly displays duplicated hoist calculation error message

If one or more bridle legs are linked to the same hanging point as a hoist Braceworks will wrongly fail the calculation and display the critical error message 'Duplicated hoist' (message dispalys once for each bridle leg or hoist on the point)

in the attached file the bridles were all inserted using manual insertion and a specific leg height (15.4m), the hoist was inserted with the same high hook height.

If the hoist is deleted and reinserted as a deadhang bridles down leg then the error message disappears.

I have no idea if this is working as intended or a bug but in real world terms it is wrong as the hanging could be a ibeam which can support multiple baskets and a hoist at the same location

I've attached Martijn's original file 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199062

symbols inside symbols with dimensions a continuing problem

this has been going on forever.

I have created tons of symbols with dimensions inside of other symbols that I use all the time.  Every single version screws up the dimensions, in the way they are displayed and I have to ix every single one of them every new version of VW. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-194278

Attribute Mapping Tool is Very Slow to Activate/Deactivate When Site Model is Selected

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model whose Proposed shape is cut by a bunch of Draped Hardscapes.

To reproduce, select the Site Model and activate the AM tool.

Note that the spinning beach ball shows for about 2 minutes before the tool becomes active.

If you deactivate the AM tool by selecting a different tool, it'll take about 1 minute.

If the Site Model's Hardscape cutouts are disabled, the tool will activate/deactivate in just a few seconds. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

'IFC-MARKET LEASE LINE layer'

VB-198636

Braceworks calculation deadhang drops not being correctly calculated

Braceworks is not calculation drops that are set up as deadhang bridles correctly.
In the attached file the drop supporting one end of the lower truss is a daedhang bridle and when the system is caculated the drop is not included in the caculation overview, the drop itself has no caculation results added to its properties in the OIP (force leg 1 and force downleg fields) and lastly the drop displays as if it has no cross section data (greyed out). Worse since the drop is effectively excluded from the calculation the calculation overview displays that the system has passed until the user looks as the calculation report pdf, which clearly displays that the bridle has failed despite all the relavent data to calculate the bridle being included.

This issues only affects drops when the option to use bridle parts is selected, if the older 'fake' deadhang hoist object is used then the drop caculates correctly.
Individual deadhang bridles also beahve correctly when not used as a drop.

This is a critical fail as the user can't clearly see that the drop has failed until the final report is created and exported.
I've tested this in both 2023 and 2024 the issue is present in both 		Kevin Linzey

VB-193501

GIS - Image import causes unwanted transformation of the geometry in the layer.

This bug happens when the curent layer and the document have diffenrent georeferencing settings. To reproduce:
# Open "GIS Acceptance Test.vwx"
# Go to layer "Medway".  It uses  "US State Plane Coordinate System (NAD83)". Look at the coordinates of the geometry (2D polygons)
# Import "medway1" image with default settings. 
# The coordinates of the geometry are transformed and this is wrong.

Note: This is not the sequence used in the acceptance test. The coordinates of the image are not for this coordinate system and this is expected.  However the geometry in the layer is transformed and the coordinate system of the layer is changed. There is no warning that this would happen and we don't want that. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-198573

Site Model: Contours close themselves in clockwise manner instead of counterclockwise when two Grade Limits intersect

The issue can be seen in 'extruded contours bug.vwx'.

The file contains a site model with two pads and two grade limits.

The extruded contours of the left grade limit are clockwise contours which have fill, but instead they should be added as holes to a boundary extrude.

The extruded contours of the right grade limit have the issue from VB-198566. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-193794

Can't export to IFC

One of our top VWL user is having a nightmare with exporting site models to IFC. VW 2023 SP2 or SP3 won't export to IFC the site model on file untitled 3 nor any other site model I've created from scratch unless you copy and paste the site model and it's modifiers to a new file (our default.sta file which is a file with units in meters an A3 paper size on a design layer and with scale 1/100. With this specific design he had to use VW 2022 since VW 2023 was updating the site model in many minutes and 2022 took a few seconds to update the changes while he worked on them. The problem with the 2022 file saved in 2023 is that VW disregards the crop polygon. As a workaround I copy and pasted the grade limit inside the crop, placed the copied grade limit in the correct place, did a polygon with the paint bucket option, deleted the grade limit and initial crop polygon and it kind of worked except that it created some bad geometry that prevented VW from exporting to iFC - files on Archive.zip. A second try created what seemed to be good geometry in VW, it exports to ifs, but created some additional triangles that shouldn't be there.  This is becoming a real user and if the word spreads we'll pretty soon have these users move to Revió in order to be able to work with the rest of the team Mihail Rizov
VB-195597

Doors moved in ifc export, roof face not exporting to ifc

"2202 D250.vwxp" is referenced into "D250 GEOREF til IFC.vwx," from which "D250 GEOREF til IFC.ifc" is exported. The ifc export has doors that have moved and the main roof object (a Roof Face/IfcSlab) has not exported at all (see "Skjermbilde 2023-05-12 kl. 09.06.39.png"). When the ifc is exported directly from "2202 D250.vwxp," these 2 issues are not present: the doors are fine, and the roof face is present (see "ifc-export-from-vwxp-file.jpg").

Testing in v2023 SP4, the roof face object exports OK, but the doors are still misplaced. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-198398

Site Model: changing selected layers should trigger Update of the proposed model.

In general, changing the Site Model settings doesn't require a recalculation of the proposed model. However, changing the selected layers affects the proposed model and therefore an Update should be triggered in this case

Attached is a test file and a [^site model - changing selected layers should trigger Update.mp4] illustrating the issue 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-195092

Hardscape in Pathway config. with offset fails

Observe the attached file 'Hardscape Pathway Config offset fails.vwx'. 
Observe the unexpected result.

VB-197376

Site Modifiers' TIN is generated twice by each recalculate

When we have recalculate that changes geometry, that is caught by the site model update support that does 1 additional reset. End result is GenerateTIN called once for the site model update support (because it's called first and the flag for it is still true), and once more for the parameter change (here, flag is not read at all).

This behavior can be tracked back to CL 675158, which is fix for VB-190947

  		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-197843

Hardscape Slope Arrow incorrect Class

Please observe the attached files. 

The Hardscape Slope arrow doesn't land on Class: Site-Hardscape Comp-Slope Arrow. It did in 2021. But since then (inc. 2024 b2) it lands on Class: Site-DTM-Modifier. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-198120

Plant Catalog Images doesn't stick

Plant Catalog images don't stick. This has been an intermittent problem throughout 2023. It appears to be resovled with the installation of each new Service Pack, but breaks shortly after. Once again, it worked with Beta releases of SP6, but the current build doesn't work. It works with 2024 Beta4 (714492), but I have no confidence the issue is resolved. 

The issue affects all Plant Form, Detail, Misc, Custom image fields.  		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-194079

Renderworks: Render tab of OIP doesn't always show the mapping pull down

Hello,

I have noticed this on the macOS and a user has just complained to us in support about this on Windows.

As you can see from the movie, when an object has been selected, if you want to change how a texture is mapped you then go to the Render tab of the OIP. Next to the texture in question there should be a pull down allowing users to change the mapping type.

However, most times, it is not visible. The only way to get it is to click face name above the texture name and then back on the texture name and the down arrow then appears. It might seem a small thing but it befuddles users who can't readily understand how to change the mapping.

I enclose a file but this is not file related but it's the one used in the movie. Also a screenshot of his Windows computer showing the pull down being invisible. I'm assuming he's on Windows 11.

Cheers,

Peter 		Payne Chang

So the question is, is it possible to fix the VB-178295 issue without disabling the conversion key?

VB-198458

Both the windows and the doors in this file have a glass material applied, but the texture is set to By Class. VB-197858

T02338 - Added item to Infill type popup

On the General pane, Infill type, we've decided to add an infill type for fabric infill, as the pane is now called Rails and Fabric Infill.

This would be the same as Rails Only (as fabric is a type of rail) but will make more sense for users to make the right choice.

VB-193691

T02356 - NURBS Vertices Disappear When Canceling Reshape Operations

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a simple NURBS Surface.

To reproduce:

- Double-click to activate the Reshape tool
- Draw a marquee around a few vertices
- Begin dragging the vertices, then press the ESC key to cancel

Note that all of the vertices that aren't selected now fail to show. If you change the view, they'll appear again.

I don't see this problem in SP3 using the old Reshape method.

I don't see this with NURBS Curves or 3D Polygons.

I don't see this on Windows 10 so it might be Mac-only. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198763

Site Modifier: vw2022 Contour modifier loses its elevation when converted to Open Edge Line modifier in vw2024.

To reproduce:

* open the test file in vw2022.
Note that the three Contour modifiers there have different elevations.

* open the file in vw2024
Converted to Open Edge Line modifiers they lose elevation (becomes 0 for all three).

Attached is also a screen video. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193969

SBE: ISDK::MoveObject and ISDK::RotateObjectN incorrect in rotated plan

Please see attached screenshots.

The dialog contains a symbol display control with a symbol that was created in the setup phase of the dialog by SDK calls.

The text object is moved after creation so its center matches the center of the circle, then it is rotated by 30 degrees.

It looks fine if the plan is not rotated,

but if the plan is rotated it becomes garbage. Both MoveObject and RotateObjectN do weird stuff depending on the plan rotation angle.

Of course, the symbol must look alike no matter if the plan is rotated or not.

Below is the code that is used to create the sample. Just call function "lm_dialog_testen". This will create and open the dialog.


/*************************************/


#define kItSymDisplayControl 3

#define kHeightSymDisplayControl 600
#define kWidthSymDisplayControl kHeightSymDisplayControl

// -----------------------------


using namespace VWFC;
using namespace VWFC::UI;

class VWLaborDialog : public VWDialog {

public:

  VWLaborDialog();
  
  virtual            ~VWLaborDialog();

public:
  virtual bool    CreateDialogLayout();
  
protected:
    virtual void    OnSetUpEvent();
   
    virtual void        OnInitializeContent();
    virtual void        OnDDXInitialize();
    virtual void        OnUpdateUI();
    virtual void        OnDefaultButtonEvent();
    
    void DrawSymbol();
    MCObjectHandle CreateSymbol(TXString name);
};

 


//-------------------------------------------------------------
VWLaborDialog::VWLaborDialog():VWDialog()
{
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
VWLaborDialog::~VWLaborDialog()
{
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnInitializeContent()
{
    VWDialog::OnInitializeContent();
    
    
    

    
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnDDXInitialize()
{

}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnUpdateUI()
{
    VWDialog::OnUpdateUI();
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnDefaultButtonEvent()
{
    VWDialog::OnDefaultButtonEvent();
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::DrawSymbol()
{
    TXString symbol_name = "sym_test";
    
    MCObjectHandle sym = CreateSymbol(symbol_name);
    
    if (sym) {
        
        gSDK->ResetObject(sym);
    
        SymbolImgInfo imgInfoIn(viewTopPlan, renderWireFrame, EImageViewComponent::NotSet, ELevelsOfDetail::Medium, false);
        gSDK->UpdateSymbolDisplayControl(fControlID,kItSymDisplayControl,symbol_name,imgInfoIn);
        
        
        
        
    }
}
// -----------------------------
MCObjectHandle VWLaborDialog::CreateSymbol(TXString name)
{
    MCObjectHandle sym = nullptr;
    
    MCObjectHandle h = gSDK->GetNamedObject(name);
    
    if (h) {
        gSDK->DeleteObject(h);
    }
    
    
    
    sym = gSDK->CreateSymbolDefinitionForDisplayControl(name);
    
    if (sym) {
        
        const WorldCoord kItemSize  = 5000.0;
        const WorldCoord kRadiusCircle  = 400.0;
        const WorldCoord kLineFactor = 2.0;
        
        VWPolygon2D poly;
        
        poly.AddVertex(WorldPt(-kItemSize/2,-kItemSize/2));
        poly.AddVertex(WorldPt(0,kItemSize/2));
        poly.AddVertex(WorldPt(kItemSize/2,-kItemSize/2));
        
        VWPolygon2DObj triangle(poly);
        
        WorldCoord x_base_text = -kItemSize/4;
        WorldCoord y_base_text = -kItemSize/4;
        
        VWArcObj circle(WorldPt(x_base_text,y_base_text),kRadiusCircle);
        
        VWLine2DObj line1(x_base_text,y_base_text-kRadiusCircle*kLineFactor,x_base_text,y_base_text+kRadiusCircle*kLineFactor);
        VWLine2DObj line2(x_base_text-kRadiusCircle*kLineFactor,y_base_text,x_base_text+kRadiusCircle*kLineFactor,y_base_text);
        
        
        gSDK->AddObjectToContainer(triangle,sym);
        gSDK->AddObjectToContainer(circle,sym);
        gSDK->AddObjectToContainer(line1,sym);
        gSDK->AddObjectToContainer(line2,sym);
        
        
        
        MCObjectHandle text = gSDK->CreateTextBlock("Long Text",WorldPt(x_base_text,y_base_text),false,0);
        
        if (text) {
          // center text around ((x_base_text,y_base_text))

            
            WorldRect bounds;
            
            gSDK->GetObjectBounds(text,bounds);
            
            WorldPt center = bounds.Center();
            
            gSDK->MoveObject(text,x_base_text-center.x,y_base_text-center.y);
            
            gSDK->RotateObjectN(text,WorldPt(x_base_text,y_base_text),30.0);
            
            
            gSDK->AddObjectToContainer(text,sym);
        
        }
        
    } // sym
    
    return sym;
}


/*****************************************************************/
//-------------------------------------------------------------

bool VWLaborDialog::CreateDialogLayout()
{
        
    bool ret = true;
    
    TXString titel("VWTestDialog");
    TXString sok("OK");
    TXString scancel("Cancel");
    
    fControlID = gSDK->CreateLayout(titel,true,sok,scancel);
    
    SymbolImgInfo imgInfoIn(kWidthSymDisplayControl,kHeightSymDisplayControl,0,viewTopPlan, renderWireFrame, EImageViewComponent::NotSet, ELevelsOfDetail::Medium, false);
    gSDK->CreateSymbolDisplayControl(fControlID,kItSymDisplayControl,TXString(""),imgInfoIn);

    gSDK->SetFirstLayoutItem(fControlID,kItSymDisplayControl);
    
    return ret;
}

//-------------------------------------------------------------

void VWLaborDialog::OnSetUpEvent()
{
    VWDialog::OnSetUpEvent();
    
    DrawSymbol();
    
}

/*****************************************************************/

/*****************************************************************/
void lm_dialog_testen(CallBackPtr cbp)
{
  
   
   

  
   

    VWLaborDialog    *der_dialog = new VWLaborDialog;
    
     if (der_dialog->CreateDialogLayout() ) {
         if (der_dialog->RunDialogLayout("XXXXX") == kDialogButton_Ok ) {
             //dlg.GetOptions( *fpOptions );
             ///ok        = true;
         }
     }
     delete der_dialog;
    

}

2. The saved set <Spotlight Defaults> will change to <Customized> but nothing has changed.
3. Clicking a second time will open up the edit dialog.
4. If you wait long enough after the first click, clicking will uncheck.
(Other check box columns in the LB have the same issue.)

The proper behavior can be seen the the classes pane of the org dialog.
Clicking a checkbox column should check/uncheck and select the row. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-197750

Unexpected result with VWPolygonOperation

When performing a boolean subtraction operation for certain polygons, the result deviates from what is expected. Instead of one polygon with the second polygon cut out, the result will be two polygons. One with the outline of the bigger polygon and the second one forming the cut out.

Affected are the functions found in the *VWPolygonOperation* class. Expecially all subtraction operations. _(BooleanPoly_SUB_Clip, etc.)_

When a hole is formed, the algorithm usually connects the holes to the outline of the polygon, leaving only a polygon without holes. It seems that in this case connecting the hole{color:#172b4d}s with the outline fails for some reason. {color}
h3. {color:#172b4d}Steps:{color}
# {color:#172b4d}Insert the code below in Vectorworks to be able to run it.{color}
# {color:#172b4d}Open the attached document.{color}
_{color:#172b4d}(The polygons to be teste are already named +poly1+ and +poly2+ in the file){color}_
# {color:#172b4d}Run the test code from step. 1{color}
{color:#172b4d} *↪ Notice:* The (wrong) result descript above will be shown. i.e. two polygons{color}

h3. {color:#172b4d}Test Code:{color}

 
{code:java}
MCObjectHandle poly1Handle = gSDK->GetNamedObject("poly1");
MCObjectHandle poly2Handle = gSDK->GetNamedObject("poly2");
if (!poly1Handle || !poly2Handle) return;

VWPolygon2D poly1; VWPolygon2DObj(poly1Handle).GetPolygon(poly1);
VWPolygon2D poly2; VWPolygon2DObj(poly2Handle).GetPolygon(poly2);

bool noCommArea;
std::vector<VWPolygon2D> result;
VWPolygonOperation(poly1).BooleanPoly_SUB_Clip(poly2, result, noCommArea);

gSDK->SetUndoMethod(kUndoSwapObjects);
for (VWPolygon2D& p : result)
{
    VWPolygon2DObj o(p);
    VWObjectAttr a(o);
    a.SetFillSolid();
    a.SetFillBackColor(CRGBColor(230, 180, 60));
    a.SetOpacity(50);
    gSDK->AddAfterSwapObject(o);
}
gSDK->EndUndoEvent();
{code}
  		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-194644

Add Leader Line doe not respect angle constraints

They act as if the constraints are suspended w/ the tilde key 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-193464

VB-193408

Export DWG: Referenced DLVPs class visibility not exporting correctly

VB-197533

Spotlight and Braceworks objects even if all their classes are made invisible and they are not drawn on the page, can still be selected!

Hello,
In the enclosed file and movie you will see a rectangle, a Table and Chair PIO and a piece of Braceworks truss and a Spotlight Lighting Device.

You will see that if the PIO Table and Chair and the rectangle primitive are selected you will see that described in the OIP. If their classes are made invisible so that they are no longer drawn on the page, the OIP immediately says 'No Selection'.

However if you do the same for the Truss and the Lighting Device so that they are not seen on the page they are still selected according to the OIP.

If de-selected and a selection marquee drawn they can again be selected even though they are not visible on the page. This is quite dangerous as users might well want to make certain Spotlight and Braceworks objects invisible yet they could easily and unknowingly delete or move things.

Cheers,
Peter
Kevin Linzey

Objects not correctly exported to DWG

The objects marked with a green square in the attached screenshot are not exported correctly to DWG. Vasil Kitanov

VB-193455

File induces warning about large 'Stipple' objects when no Stipple objects exist

The user reported that this file had been fine/normal, but now when it is opened Vectorworks displays the following warning, "Warning: This Stipple will be very large and time-consuming to create. Change the settings (try increasing the max shape size or reducing the density) or make the stipple boundry smaller." - *But:* She has never used the Stipple Tool before and no Stipple objects can be found by looking or when using the 'Custom Selection' command. 

The file exhibits other display and behavioural oddities: 
* The file can take a long time to open - presumably since this problem began.
* The user reported leaving the computer overnight while it was simply opening this file but the process was not complete by the morning. I thought this may have been due to her computer running out of memory as it is very poorly spec'd. - Her Windows laptop only has 6GB of RAM and when I connected via TeamViewer it was using 91% of this with only this file open and only a couple of other programs. 
* Some objects in the drawing were invisible but pre-selection highlighting showed they were there. 
* When I open her file on my well-spec'd PC it memory consumption used a very high proportion of my free memory - about 18GB as I recall - but this went down when the processing had been complete. It's as if there _*is*_ a stipple object present, but it is not visible and cannot found using the Custom Selection command as seen in the attached screenshot. 

I checked this file on my PC but found no 'far out objects' away from the drawing so I'm wondering if corruption is at play or perhaps a rather specific Vectorworks bug. 

What to do from here?  		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-197016

Invalid comparator exception when comparing

While manipulating a datatag, an "invalid comparator" runtime exception was thrown out by this operation in DlgEditDataTag

```

std::sort( fFields.begin(), fFields.end(), [] ( const SField& first, const SField& second ) {

```

The problem is that the comparator is not consistent. That it, it does not always respect that  if A<B and B<C, then A<C

```

            if ( DoublesAreNearlyEqual( firstPt.y, secondPt.y ) )
            {
                result = Double1_LE_Double2( firstPt.x, secondPt.x );
            }
            else
            {
                result = Double1_GT_Double2( firstPt.y, secondPt.y );
            }

```

The correct way to handle relatively equal values is by rounding.  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-192713

A roof in a mirrored symbol exports displaced to IFC

When you export a mirrored symbol without an IFC tag to IFC, the roof object will be displaced in the exported result. Mihail Rizov

VB-193504

Hardscape "Fit to Surface" Command Doesn't Fit Cleanly to Site Model

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model and several modifiers on one layer, and a path-based Hardscape on another layer that has its "Cut the Site Model" option disabled and a Datum that's located at its bottom.

To reproduce:

- Change the Hardscape's layer to Design Layer-1
- Run the "Fit to Surface" command
- Update the Site Model
- Delete the Hardscape so you can see the Site Model geometry underneath

Note that there are several areas of the Site Model where small pieces have been cut away by the Hardscape (see attached screenshots).

In this case it seems like the Hardscape's modifier should be aligning perfectly with the Site Model surface, so that these areas don't get cut away.

The same thing happens going back to 2023 SP0.
Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-197121

Project Sharing: possible issue with OneDrive (and SharePoint) and crash

Setup information:

Computer 1: Windows 10 on Intel iMac with bootcamp
Computer 2: Windows 10 on Dell laptop
both use Vectorworks 2023 SP3
both mount a SharePoint folder through OneDrive (v23.114.0530.0001)

User 1 prepares the project file:
1) opens a vwx document (created in Vectorworks 2023)
2) saves copy on desktop
3) opens copy and create vwxp on desktop without creating a vwxw file
4) moves vwxp to SharePoint folder
5) opens vwxp to get the vwxw file and saves that on the desktop

User 1 can now start working (check out objects, edit, commit changes, release objects...)

User 2 opens vwxp to get a vwxw file and saves that on the desktop and can now work like User 1.

When the first user commits changes, they can see that OneDrive is uploading the changed vwxp file and then the second user can see the changed vwxp file being downloaded. So good so far.

Only when User 2 tries to commit changes, they start getting the following message:

 (screenshot 01)
Do you want to Reset the Project File cloud version?
Vectorworks detected duplicate Project Files. Manually replacing or making copies of Project Files that use Cloud Integration is not supported.

User 2 even had a crash after clicking "Save and commit...". (logs and crash file are attached)

When User 2 now deletes the vwxw file and tries to get a new one, they get the following message. (screenshot 02)
The cloud version of the project file has to be reset. How do you want to continue?
(Mind you: I couldn't find the original English title string for this message)

Also: the customer never saw two files present in the SharePoint folder.

I tested this setup with a colleague, but with DropBox instead of OneDrive and it worked like a charm. No messages about conflicts whatsoever.

The customer will test the Vectorworks Cloud solution for project sharing, but they would prefer not to have to use yet another cloud solution, because they fear their files being too wide spread over different systems. 		Rick Berge

There is no external monitor.

I can not repeat this on my M1 MBP 13.4 but I have 64GB UM. She has resorted to using a fairly underpowered Intel iMac to work. She says that it too sometimes doesn't draw but that it's still better than the new machine.

I have tried the following:
Vectorworks Prefs: Turned off
* Accelerate graphics
* Use Vectorcaching for Faster Redraw

Document Prefs: Turned Off
* Save VGM Graphics Cache

Each time we closed and opened the document. Each time after a few operations the non-draw problem returned.

I note that the files are simple although there are 8 Design Layer viewports in the Area Detail file and 16 in the file that is referenced. Those are not big numbers and is very common with Interior designers. The point of this report is that the M2 is worse than the Intel.

VB-192588

Catch points are not correct

Hi Vectorworks

Once you had turned a .vwx file into a PDF in Vectorworks Cloud, you could open it in the NOMAD app and measure it. You could measure a distance or an angle on the snap points of the geometric objects in the scale of the respective section or view area. Currently, this no longer works. It is shown in NOMAD App that the snap points are loaded, but when you want to measure them, they are either not available or if you find snap points, they are not in the right place or offset to the 2D objects.

Greetings

Fredi 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-193328

"Migration Manager" with Vw2023 does not inherited the changed Marker style in the setting of "Edit Marker List..." with Vw2022 even if "SavedSettings.xml" selected in "Migration Manager" dialog in Vw2023. Is this designed behavior or not ?

Question 1:
"Migration Manager" with Vw2023 does not inherited the changed Marker style in the setting of "Edit Marker List..." with Vw2022 even if "SavedSettings.xml"  selected in "Migration Manager" dialog in Vw2023.
Is this designed behavior or not ?

Question 2:
The edited marker items will be inherited when the "SavedSettings.xml" setting file  move to the specified location in the user folder of Vw2023.
Is it okay to announce to the customer with this operation? 　
Yes I know Vw2022 and Vw2023 have differences in the description of "SavedSettings.xml" file.
If there have no problem, I would like to announce it to the customers.

 

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Steps to reproduce.
Question 1:
1) Vectorworks 2022 : "Tools" menu > "Options" command > "Edit Marker List..." submenu command > "Edit Marker List" dialog > Click "New..." button

2) Create a new marker in the "Edit Marker List" dialog and click the "OK" button.

3) Confirm that the created marker is added in the "Edit Marker List" dialog. Click the "OK" button.

4) Vectorworks 2023 : "Tools" menu > "Migration Manager..." command > "Vectorworks Migration Manager" dialog > Click the "Next" button > Check if the migration source and migration destination match in the "Select User Data" item Confirm and click the "Next" button > Select "All User data" > Preferences > Settings > SavedSettings.xml in the migration option, click the "Next" button > Click the "Migrate" button to save the settings Migration.

5) Vectorworks 2023: Go to "Tools" menu > "Options" command > "Edit Marker List..." submenu command > "Edit Marker List" dialog
Markers created in Vectorworks 2022 are not migrated to the Current Marker Types list.


Question 2:
1) Vectorworks 2022: Create a new marker in the "Edit Marker List" dialog and click the "OK" button.

2) Save SavedSettings.xml of Vectorworks 2022 to the specified location of User Folders of Vectorworks 2023.

Move "Save SavedSettings.xml " setteing file with Vw2022 to Vw2023 from
 ( C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\Nemetschek\Vectorworks\2022\Settings)
to(C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\Nemetschek\Vectorworks\2023\Settings)

3) Vectorworks 2023 : Check "Tools" menu > "Options" command > "Edit Marker List..." submenu command > "Edit Marker List" dialog
Marker Types created with Vectorworks 2022 are displayed.


Please refer to attached "Migration Manager.png" and "SavedSettings.png". 

 

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Payne Chang

VB-195513

VCS: Localization_URL links on VCS portal add/change request

Some URL links on VCS portal related pages need to modify or need localizable string:

#1: When non-VSS customer tries to use VSS-only functions (such as Generate PDF), a warning dialog will display, “Enable this feature with Vectorworks Service Select.”
In this dialog, the “More info” button is linked to [https://www.vectorworks.net/en-US/service-select] page. We’d like to change this link to our Japanese VSS page [https://www.aanda.co.jp/VSS/index.html].
Please add localizable string for this link.

#2: “Legal” link on footer: This links to the Legal Information page [https://www.vectorworks.net/ja-JP/legal/company]. In this page, there are links for EULAs. Since these links opens English EULA pages, please add the words which notify the users these are English version of the EULAs, and change the link names to English.

VB-196111

Unable to change story elevation

See attached test file

Go to Stories in the Organization dialog box

Give the middle story an elevation of 22.8m.

Hit return

Select "move all stories"

All the stories should move.

Go to stories again,

Give the lower story the same elevation of 22.8m.

An error is generated. Invalid story elevation - a story already exists at this elevation.

The lower story should take on the new elevation and all other stories move accordingly.

This seems to happen with metric dimensions. Doing the same thing in imperial units does not generate the error. 		Karthick Chilaka

He then used the modified symbol as a bumper within his speaker array tool. VB-192863

UI focus remains with previous document after switching to another document tab

This issue has persisted for years. It is extremely disruptive when it occurs and inconvenient to remedy so it's time it got fixed. 

Because it contains so much contextual detail, I'll quote here how a user described this problem to me in 28th of March, 2018. 
 
"Often after I've been switching between multiple open drawing tabs, my session will lock onto one of the open drawing tabs, and although I seem to have switched to the other (it becomes visible on the screen), anything I do with my mouse is still operating in the previous drawing. For example I will zoom with a mouse scroll and the seemingly open drawing will no respond but if I switch back to the previous drawing tab it will have zoomed as per my scroll. The only way to fix it is to close vectorworks and open it up again.
 
I discussed it with Bill and we hoped that the new graphics card would fix it, but it didn't. It doesn't happen every session, but at least every two-three days and sometimes several times in one day. If you've got any ideas, it might be an interesting challenge to fix.... No one else here seems to have the same problem and it doesn't happen in any other programs." - Sarah Ledingham. 
Her colleague had the same issue a few months before she did too. I received other reports of this over the years but did not submit because restarting Vectorworks fixes the issue so I thought it was a fleeting glitch, but now I see that it is likely a bug. Another user - Mike Dowsett - contacted me about this last week and another user reported this to me in December too, so it's a good time to look at this. 

As I recall, this issue has been submitted by others before but as I can't see other user's submissions in Jira so I can't be sure. Have a look. 

*Also reported here:* 
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/93985-freezing-on-switching-between-documents/
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/77955-freezing-with-vectorworks-2020-on-windows-computer/

*Please note:* 

Back in 2021 Joseph Block (SENIOR GLOBAL TECHNICAL SUPPORT MANAGER) said this issue had been reproduced by leaving Vectorworks open on a computer for days at a time. But this will not be the [only] cause because as the user quoted above points out, this has happened several times in a day and is fixed by restarting. It is very unlikely to be due to memory consumption because two recently affected users have 32 GB of RAM or more and the computers didn't exhibit any symptoms of insufficient memory. 

All reports I've seen are on Windows computers. 

While assisting user Laura Cotterill (G0VLQ4) and while the issue persisted, we:
* Tried quitting all other apps.
* Tried unplugging all additional monitor/s.
* Noted that the subject file/s had 'Legacy 2D Features' enabled. 
* Noted each new document opened 'stole' the UI focus. (See my screen recording attached). Symptoms include: 
** Rulers no longer visible. 
** Cursor does not change to reflect the selected tool, for some but not all tools. 
** There is a notable delay between selecting a tool and the cursor/UI reflecting that change. 
* Noted that closing subsequently opened documents, returned UI focus to the next-most-recent document opened. 

I appreciate that it is difficult to troubleshoot bugs if they can't be reproduced so I've provided as much contextual info as possible to help isolate the code that might be responsible. There is lots of circumstantial info available about this issue available (read the Forum links I provided too) but I might have more than what is recorded here also, so quiz me if you have something in particular you wish to determine.  		Walid Remaili
VB-194599

ConnectCAD: Browse dialog shows the old location of the shared report after changing it

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on Share Reports
2. In the share reports dialog, click on "..." in order to change the default location of the file
3. Change the location
4. Click again on "..." and see that the old file location is opened in the browse dialog 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-193972

Here it the excerpt from the Customer installog:

[21:13:50] Finished setting Libraries writeable (icaclsGenericWorked = 1).
Could not find registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Nemetschek\Vectorworks 28\General User Folder. Setting variable UserFolderRaw to empty value

[21:13:50] Copying C:\Users\khadmin\Desktop\GM-G0Z78G.ldf to C:\Users\khadmin\AppData\Roaming\Nemetschek\Vectorworks\2023\GM-G0Z78G.ldf.
[21:13:50] About to set errorReportingMode to 0 in default prefs

[21:13:50] Successfully set errorReportingMode to 0 in default prefs
[21:13:50] Writing proxy batch file.
[21:13:50] Installing Windows Updater App from batch file at: C:\Users\khadmin\Desktop\Vectorworks 2023 SP1\resources\installer\resources/UpdaterApp/InstUpdater.bat.
Executing C:\Users\khadmin\Desktop\Vectorworks 2023 SP1\resources\installer\resources/UpdaterApp/InstUpdater.bat
Script exit code: 0

Any ideas what can we do to help this Customer?

As it seems, the Client installs (through Silent Installation) the 28.0.2 with Admin rights and the LDF is installed in the Admin User, other users that are not Admin cannot start Vectorworks because there is no LDF in their User, hence resulting in the License File Error.

Is this known? If this is so, then it should be a general problem with any Client and Computer.

The Customer has used the command that we have in our PDF:

C:\Users\Benutzername\Downloads\Vectorworks 20XX\resources\installer\Install Vectorworks20XX.exe --unattendedmodeui none --Serial XXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXXX --installdir “Ordnerpfad” --modeunattended --LDFChoice licenseID 		Tim Ardoin

VB-192940

Shaded no longer renders textures with bump AND transparency

Reported by Annelien:

In Vectorworks 2023, any textures with a bump-map and a transparency will not be rendered in shaded. Textures with a bump OR transparency will do fine, but the combination prevents shaded from rendering anything. Kind of bothersome when working in a 3D Shaded view. 		Justin Hutchison

You will perceive that in the Shaded rendering appears a wall that doesn't exist in the original OpenGL rendering.

VB-193507

Curved Wall Closure shapes are become faceted

A change between the following builds caused wall closure geometry to become more faceted:
* VW28.0.4(690757): GOOD
* VW28.0.4(690792): BAD

Open the "Wall Closures - Wall Hole Shapes.vwx" file and zoom into now of the curved openings shown in elevation on one of the sheet layers and update the viewport.  Notice the curved geometry is more faceted in build 690792.

Note: the opening highlighted in red on sheet "1.2" is just one example and is also shown in the attached screenshots. 		Christopher Graye
VB-193705

Project Sharing in cloud folder

Hi [~tfapohunda], I tage you through this way because your colleague Inikolova told me via a chat message on Slack (ext-vcs-tech-support) that you might be able to help me with the following.

The client in question set up a Project Sharing with 6 colleagues. And the .vwxp file is stored in the VW Cloud folder. So far this is going well but they run into the following:
All 6 users get a notification at random times during the day when they go into their own .vwxw file that the file needs to be updated. The problem is that they regularly get a notification from VW that the file needs to be updated. While this is not ordered by anyone. See shreenshot, this one is in Dutch. Here is the translation:

 

*The operation could not be completed because the project file in the local Vectorworks Cloud Services folder it updated. Would you like to try again?*

The Vectorworks Cloud Serviceses client did not contribute the local copy of the project file. The last update in the cloud was 20 seconds ago by buck on PERSPEKT_WS14. Wait for synchronization to complete or make sure the Vectorworks Cloud Services client is active.And all drafters participating in the Project Sharing file are affected.

 

The users at that time did not give an order in VW where an update of the model is needed. I understand that you can look in the log files. To see what is happening here, and why this message is coming up out of the blue.
If you tell me what information you need for this and where to find it. I will pass this on. 		Tolu Fapohunda

VB-193636

Spinning beach balls/VW laggy with attached files on M2 Air

VB-193369

vs.PopAttrs does not restore Pen Foreground Color

PushAttrs and PopAttrs are supposed to save and restore the file object attributes when running a script. They work properly in Vectorscript but not in Python. 

I have not tested Python for anything other then pen foreground color, but it should be tested for all the attributes pushed/popped.

In the attached file there are three scripts Vectorscript Push/Pop, Python Push/Pop, Python Workaround.

The two Push/Pop scripts do the same thing. Writes a line of text using the current pen foreground attribute, PUSHes the attributes, changes the pen foreground color, writes a line of text using this new color, POPs back to the original attributes, writes a third line of text.  The Workaround script accomplishes the same thing, but it manually stores and restores the pen color instead of using Push/Pop

Open the file. Make sure the Pen Foreground color is set to black.

Run the Vectorscript Push/Pop Script. You will get three lines of text with the first and last line in black and the middle line in blue.  This is the expected result of all three scripts.

Run the Python Push/Pop script. You will get three lines of text, but the last two lines will be blue. The pen foreground color is not being restored by the vs.PopAttrs command. Notice that the pen color in the Attributes palette is now set to blue. You will need to set the default pen color back to black after running the Python Push/Pop script.

Run the Python Workaround script. You will get three lines of text. Black/Blue/Black as expected. This tells me that the FPenFore command to get the pen color and the PenFore command to set the pen color are working correctly.

The expected result is that PushAttrs and PopAttrs should function identically between Vectorscript and Python.  The Vectorscript behavior is correct. The Python should be corrected. 		Rick Berge

Graphics glitching when panning and zooming during acceptance testing

In the attached video and file, I noticed that the drawing window glitches when panning or zooming.  Does not do this on a new file with multipane turned on. Josh Loy

VB-193100

New reference Dialog: Create Layer link on layer doesn`t link existing layers

Make sure that reference Vectorworks files is set to Layer import

                Go to Tools > organization Dialog > Reference tab > Settings > Use this method to reference Vectorworks files > Layer Reference

 
# Switch the Navigation palette to Reference tab
# Right click > New
# Select the attached file
# Check the Create layer link on layer check box if it isn`t
# In the drop down menu next to the check box the existing layers aren`t listed. 		Rick Berge

VB-192894

VB-192738

Vectorworks 2023 crashes at startup on Windows because of "out-dated" firewall settings

I would like log a crash bug that only is caused indirectly by Vectorworks but it is an issue already for a pretty long time and in the past view days it just shows up more and more in support.

The issue:

Vectorworks can cause a crash during launch because of "out-dated" windows firewall rules. Maybe it shows up more in support because of the new LDF file in Vectorworks 2023 that has to be created but that's just a guess. However, there is a solution to fix that by doing one of the 2 steps:

 
# Delete or reset the Vw user folder. This cause Vw to re-create the firewall rule.
# Delete the Firewall rule in the WindowsFirewall settings manually and re-launch Vw

We are aware that these are actually easy solutions to solve the issue but it anyhow pops up as a support case that takes time.

 

I was asked by our support staff who want's to focus on "real" issues ti report that bug. The hope is that this issue can be fixed on the Vectorworks site during launch. Maybe a check if the firewall settings should be updated or not and avoid a crash.

 

I log a bug for it and maybe we can start the discussion about this here. 		Tim Ardoin

VB-198761

T02350 - Settings Dialog Attributes List Requires Extra Clicks to Open Pop-Up Menus (Windows Only)

This is a continuation of VB-197456.

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:
* Insert a Structural Member and open its settings dialog
* In the 2D Attributes list, expand the Pen Style or Fill Style menu for any part

Note that this requires at least 3 clicks, one to set the focus on the part, the other to set the focus on the column, and another to open the menu.

On Mac, this only takes a single click.

List browsers do sometimes require an extra click on Windows to set the focus, but it seems like it should only take one extra click and not two.

Some of the other controls in the list browser (Class, Pen Color, etc) only require one or two clicks to access. 		Payne Chang
VB-200289

Speaker: “The data Record for the selected Symbol is missing one or more necessary dimensions. Please select a different Symbol.” message displays if you choose to insert an symbol from Speakers Atlas Sound Sound Strategy.vwx file

To reproduce:
Activate a Speaker tool
Select to insert a symbol
Choose the “Audio Speaker Atlas Sound APF-15T” symbol from the Resource Selector
Insert the symbol
Try to change any parameter in the OIP
“The data Record for the selected Symbol is missing one or more necessary dimensions. Please select a different Symbol.” message appears

I was able to reproduce the issue with these symbols:

Audio Speaker Atlas Sound APF-15T

Audio Speaker Atlas Sound APF-15TU

Audio Speaker Atlas Sound APF-15TUC

Audio Speaker Atlas Sound APF-15TU-USA

Audio Speaker Atlas Sound B51-4

Audio Speaker Atlas Sound B161-4

  		Chris Baccala
VB-194546

Styled Space Thumbnail Doesn't Update Initially in the Resource Manager

I've attached a movie that shows this issue

 

-Open test file and go to the RM

-In the RM, select any space style, right click and choose 'Duplicate' from the context menu

-Give the space style a new name then edit it

-In 'Space Style' dialog, go to the "Occupancy" tab and change the Space Name to "Test" then close the dialog

-Notice the thumbnail still has the old space name.

 

You'll have to edit the new space style again and click 'Cancel' in the "Space Style" dialog so that the new name is visible in thumbnail. 

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-193320

Import problem with renamed tile

Original bug VB-193119.

PSh problem was fixed, this is only an import problem.

Not filmed steps:
# Opened the file. Created a project file on the server.
# Exported all resources into a new empty file.
# Note, there is a Tile ("Test tile") and a symbols (Symbol-3, Symbol-5) which use it.

Filmed steps:
# Activated the target document. Renamed the tile to Test tile1. Symbols changed properly.
# Activated the working file and imported Symbol-5 back with the option "Replace".
# Result - Renamed tile is imported, but the imported symbols use the original "Test tile".
# Edited Symbol-3 to make sure.

It seems to me the problem here is nested symbols.

This happens without project sharing as well. 		Rick Berge
VB-193702

Data visualization and record with type number error

Reported by Casper:

Client has attached its own record to an existing tree. And to show the value of the tree in a data visualization, he created a field with type "number." When the value is displayed in the info palette as 13.440,00 the correct color from the data visualization is not shown. When we set the type to Text and enter the value as 13440,00 it is displayed as it should be.
So there is an error in how VW handles (./,) period and comma character in numbers. 		Karthick Chilaka

# Edit the 2D component of the symbol.
# Grab some of the objects (lights and the pipe they hang on)
# Group them
# Exit symbol
# Edit symbol

Expected: The stuff I grouped is still grouped

Actual: It's ungrouped again! On its own! 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-198757

3D viewports : wrong position when updating if view not set in “Top/Plan”

If I update my 3D viewports when my view is not set in Top/Plan, their position after the update is wrong.
I think this is linked to the georeferencing system.

I attached 2024 files, tested on 2023 and 2024 > same result.

SYD-000000-Solander v2024b220 is the file of the viewport,
SYD-000000-GR is the master file.

I think position of the objects should be independent from the view.

See video :
at 0:00, viewport up-to-date > position OK
at 2:12, updated with view in 3D > wrong position
at 4:46, updated in Top/Plan view > position OK 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-200362

ConnectCAD - Using device size handle changes object class

Not sure, if this is a bug or a feature, but when using the sizing handle of a device, the geometry changes the class to the currently active.
In the example below the box turned red, as it is not treated as a NonPlot object.

VB-196662

VB-199968

ConnectCAD: Panel Connector objects and term panels

This bug is 100% my bad. Term panels have more than one connected-to device and socket and at the moment we only see one of those. If only the left-hand side of the term panel is connected the Panel Connector displays the device/socket connected from the left, but the moment another device/socket is connected from the right the Panel Connector switches to show those. See attached file.

Now the problem is that in the case of term panels we don't know which is the "outward-facing" side from looking at the schematic. Any port can be in input or an output and if it's an IO then without understanding the design as a human we cannot decide.

In the old days I handled this by populating the upper text with the left device-socket and the lower text with the right device-socket. Leaving it to the user to edit the result to their needs.This wasn't great because most of the time there wasn't room for all that text.

I think what we need is a by-instance toggle for Panel Connectors that are used in Term Panels to decide which connected-to device/socket is displayed. This can't be part of the style because it concerns the usage of the panel in a given system.

I'm up for discussion about how best to resolve this. 		Conrad Preen
VB-200307

T02498 Railing Texture Mapping one direction

Textures applied to continuous railing paths does not follow longest edge Kostadin Ivanov

that the "Layer options palette" will be reset!
This is a very annoying behavior.

VB-200284

After entering "Edit Finishes..." in the Room Finishes category under "Space Settings" in Space Shapes, the current Room Finishes settings will be reset (initialized). 

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
After entering "Edit Finishes..." in the Room Finishes category under "Space Settings" in Space Shapes, the current Room Finishes settings will be reset (initialized). 

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open the attached file.
2) Go to the Object Infor palette > Settings... > Room Finishes pane
Confirm that "[壁-2]モルタル/45角 磁器タイル張り" is set for each side wall in the North, East, South and West.
3) Click "Edit Finishes..."
Then, when close the dialog box by [OK] or [Cancel] in the dialog box
The setting of each sidewall is switched.

*Remarks*
*We confirmed that it is not reproduced in Vectorworks 2022 or lower.
*We confirmed that it is not reproduced in Vectorworks 2024 (725708).
*I can enter "Edit Finishes..." from the Object Infor palette, we confirmed that the problem is not reproduced here.


Please refer to attached "231027.vwx". 

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Michael Wladarz
VB-200351

Elevator tool bar in Spanish has concatenated strings that impact user experience

The Elevator tool bar has instances of concatenated strings that may not pose a problem in the English version but they cause naming display issues in the Spanish version. See screenshot below for context.

Open the Spanish version of Vectorworks 2024 (SP1 beta 2, for example).

Open a blank file and place an elevator, which appears as Ascensor in the UI. Select the elevator and click Elevator Style. This appears as {color:#4c9aff}*_Estilo Ascensor_*{color}, which is incorrect because the string for this item is a concatenation of Elevator and Style. Thus the Spanish translations are also concatenated as Estilo + Ascensor.

Likewise, in the Elevator tool bar, we see the UI item {color:#4c9aff}*_Personalizado Ascensor_*{color}, which is a Spanish concatenation of the UI string Custom + Elevator. Both instances, 1 and 2 in the screenshot, are incorrect renditions and have a serious impact on localization.

*Recommendation:* please get rid of such concatenated strings and use full strings, such as Elevator style (see 1 as Estilo Ascensor in the screenshot) and Custom Elevator (see 2 as Personalizado Ascensor in the screenshot).

!image-2023-11-01-17-15-15-910.png!

  		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-200357

Window/Door Texture Changes Behave Incorrectly When Editing Multiple Objects

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few identical Windows, that currently use by-Material textures for their Jamb and Sash parts. Those parts also have custom Classes assigned.

To reproduce:
* Select both Windows and open the settings dialog
* Change the Jamb and Sash parts to use a by-Class texture

Note that the change only gets applied to one of the objects.

This seems to fail when going from:
* By-Material to by-Class (the above example)
* By-Material to None
* By-Class to None
* None to by-Class

Other changes, for example when going from by-Class to by-Material or from by-Class to a direct texture, seem to work fine.

The same thing happens going back to 29.0.0. 		Christopher Graye

VB-200334

Windows 11 taskbar in auto-hide mode is not revealed when VW application window is maximized on the primary display

From User:

1) Settings > Personalization > Taskbar > Taskbar behaviors > Check the box for Automatically hide the taskbar
2) Maximize the VW application window (second button from right in the extreme upper right corner, or Windows key + Up arrow)
3) Scroll the mouse to the bottom edge of the screen. Under standard Windows behavior, this should reveal the taskbar but it doesn't.

I tested this on a desktop system with two screens, and this behavior occurred on the primary display but not when I moved the VW window to the secondary display. The behavior also occurred when I tested it on a laptop with only one display.

Note that this issue did not occur in VW 2023 or previous versions. 		Payne Chang

VB-200300

Class overrides not working when data viz is applied

In this file there is a viewport that is looking at the second floor, but several objects from the first floor are also visible. One of those is a structural member. That SM is set to appear above the cut plane (because it is above the first floor cut plane) but when it is in the second floor plan, I want it to appear below the cut plane. I set the "above cut plane" class to have a class override for that viewport. However, there are data visualizations applied to that viewport. One changes the hatches of slabs based on their style, and the other changes the hatches of wall components based on their layer and material. Neither of these data visualizations affect the particular class that is has the override, nor do they affect any objects outside their criteria. Therefore, based on what the help says, the class override should still be visible but it is not. The file is saved in multi view where one pane is looking the structural member in its design layer, and the other is looking at the viewport in question. If you turn off the data visualizations, you can see the class override appear. Karthick Chilaka
VB-200252

Materials vs. By Class Textures

I've recently noticed that when applying materials to components of several different types of objects (walls, hardscapes, fences (2024), railings (2024), that the Material Texture will always override the visual texture applied...even if in the component settings, you select Class Texture.

!image-2023-10-27-12-51-15-783.png|width=668,height=436!

The functionality should be that if Class Texture is selected, regardless of if there is a Material applied to the component or not, that the Classes defined texture should automatically override and be visible. That seems to be why this option is even possible.

That said, it doesn't work that way and the only way to get the class texture to show is to remove the material from the component altogether...therefore eliminating the ability to pull data from the materials if needed.

The goal of our workflow is to still utilize materials and their inherent benefits, but rely on the class to do the 2D/3D visual lifting. This allows for more flexibility with finish/texture varieties without having to create unique styles for every finish/texture variety. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199312

Resource Manager: Thumbnail highlighting uses non-standard colours

If the Resource Manager ist set to list view, I believe the correct highlight colour is shown but the resource name needs to be inverted. It is currently not readable is highlighted. Compare to the resource type, which gets inverted correctly.

!image-2023-09-17-07-20-09-555.png|width=398,height=46!

When in thumbnail views (both), a lighter blue is used, which is not the correct highlight colour, I think. it needs to be the darker blue (accent colour) plus inverted text.

!image-2023-09-17-07-21-13-750.png|width=229,height=128! 		Payne Chang
VB-200272

Documentation Error on VS Dimension Functions

In the Vectorscript Function Reference (Both the HTML version that ships with VW and the version posted on the Developer site) the description for the LinearDim function is incorrect.  The following image is included in both versions.

!image-2023-10-30-08-43-15-469.png!

But the offset that is shown in the image is not the actual offset. The offset value required by the function actually appears to be the horizontal (along the dimension line) offset as a percentage of the line length.  There is no value in the LinearDim function that controls the offset of the text from the Dimension line.

 

ObjectVariableReal with an index of 43 control the offset of the text away from the Dimension Line. And a ResetObject is required after to have the change display.

 

In the attached file, delete the two Dimension objects and run the only Vectorscript in the file.  The top linear dimension has a Text Offset of 0

 

Both the HTML and Developer versions of the Function Reference need to be reviewed for the LinearDim function and corrected to display an image and words that actually explain what the function does.

I have commented the Developer version of the function, but it should be edited so my comments are not required.

 

I also recommend checking the documentation for AngularDim and CircularDim.  They both also have an Offset function and image that shows a text offset. I have not checked these functions, but I would not be surprised if they function the same way as LinearDim. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-200305

ConnectCAD arrow circuits across layers do not respect data visualization

Arrow Type circuits on the same design layer are highlighted by data visualization as expected.

Arrow Type circuits across different design layers show the data visualization only at the source end. 

  		Conrad Preen
VB-200251

Redshift: Optix denoising should be used on NVIDIA cards

We use Altus all the time because we can't detect which platform has Optix, but Optix would probably be faster.  This requires us to detect NVIDIA hardware which I think we have now because of code Tony added last year.

 

We should test Altus vs Optix on NVIDIA RTX to make sure this is faster and better.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-199832

VB-200280

Class visibility in viewports is controlled by class settings on design layers

This is a strange, sporadic bug and I'd sure like to know what causes it to happen.

See the attached test file.

The file is zoomed in to Section A on sheet A2.0

select the section viewport and click on the classes button to bring up this viewport's class properties.

Go to class Detail-Insulation. Notice it is visible. The rigid insulation on either side of the concrete foundation wall are visible.

Close the viewport classes properties.

Go to Classes in the navigation palette.

In the navigation palette make the class Detail-Insulation invisible. 

Now ,on design layers , objects of this class will not be visible.

Select Section A viewport again and update the viewport. Notice even though the class Detail-Insulation is set to visible in the viewport, objects of this class are not visible.

In other words, no matter whether a class is visible in the viewport classes properties, the class visibility is overridden by the class visibility of the document.

We have now lost control of class visibility within viewports.

Quit & reopen vectorworks causes classes to behave correctly  		Hernán Stamati
VB-196452

Line type cell has a wrong preview (List browser)

Problems exist on both platforms. They are just slightly different.
Please, see the videos attached.
1. Windows does not show the name of the Line type, though it has a tooltip.
Mac does not show the tooltip, but it has a name next to the preview.

2. Note, when the Pen does not have a Line style a random style name appears in the Line cell (possibly first available style in the resource selector). Preview shows a straight line if the type is "Solid", and some random preview (dashed in the example) if the type is "None" or "Pattern".

I think the "Line" cell should be empty in all these cases. Or at least for "None" and "Pattern".

3. When the Pen has some Line style the preview is correct on Mac, though the name of the style is not present.
On Windows the name sometimes is correct, sometimes does not update, and the preview is always a straight line. 		Payne Chang

VB-199610

Accpt Test- Symbol Preview Disappears when Toggling between the Alignment Buttons on the Tool Bar

 
- Launch VW, draw an oval and convert it into a symbol ( uncheck 'Leave instance in place' during symbol creation)
- From the Resource Manager, double click the oval symbol then move the cursor onto the document window
- Hit the "O" key  from the tool bar several times to toggle between the alignment buttons
- Notice as you toggle , the oval preview disappears in screen. Moving the mouse (after the toggle) fixes this issue).

 

This problem is specific to macOS 14.  		Payne Chang
VB-200257

Revit import as 'Vectorworks Solid Objects' fails.

Hello,
In the enclosed 16MB Revit file, if it is imported as a mesh it imports fine. The problem is that I was hoping to import as 'Vectorworks Solid Objects'. It stops at item 1120 of 1156.

Handle hObject is too small
   actual: 280 bytes  specified: 1118 bytes, Assertion Failed! 
{code}
Looks like a minor interactive-sizing related ASSERT. Probably not harmful but still worth fixing.

VB-200275

Door Thresholds Extend to Wall Opening When "Threshold Under Leaf" is Disabled

The attached file contains an in-wall Door with a Threshold enabled, using the default settings where "Threshold Under Leaf" is disabled and the Threshold "Extension" is set to 0". The Door also has some Shim Gaps added to illustrate the issue.

To reproduce, open the file in VW 2023 and VW 2024.

In VW 2023, note that the threshold extends only to the inner edge of the door jamb (see first attached screenshot).

In VW 2024, note that the threshold extends past the jamb to the edge of the wall opening. Also note that it fails to trim the jamb geometry (see second screenshot).

If you enable the "Threshold Under Leaf' option in VW 2024 you then get the same result as VW 2023, so it's possible that this was an intentional change. If so, then the only issue is that the jamb geometry isn't getting trimmed (it intersects with the threshold geometry).

The same thing happens going back to 29.0.0. 		Christopher Graye

4. Now select some existing resource. Note, it is updated. Close the Criteria dialog. Note, the criteria string has an empty name. Selection is not saved.
