VB-200178

Using Patterns within Vectorworks.

Reported by Pascal:

Using Patterns within Vectorworks.


At Design Express we have been asking for the removal of the patterns within the graphic features for a very long time because over time they usually cause more problems than benefits.
We often receive the message that these remain in order to be able to open older files that use patterns. In itself, I think that is an outdated argument. At some point, the choice must be made to send this to Legacy. By leaving the options in, the user will always continue to use them.

It is therefore very annoying when we as support employees inform the customer that it is better not to use it. That way you get an endless discussion. If this is available in VW why am I not using it then taking it out?

It is also time-consuming for the customer after we told him he no longer has to use this, to then search for all the patterns and replace them with a line hatching, motif of colour, for example.

By way of argument, I have attached 2 “identical” files here. It is made with patterns, in the other all patterns have been replaced.

What now appears if we publish these documents? When you publish the file with the patterns, you will see a very blurry PDF of the presentation layers where patterns were used.
If you publish the document without the patterns, the PDF will be sharp on all pages.
That's what the customer expected. So let this be an extra argument to finally omit the patterns within Vectorworks.

A customer does not like to invest time and working hours without added value.

Steps to reproduce:

You find here 2 files, one with patterns, and one without it.
Try to publish both and take a look at the PDF files. The file with patterns gives a very blurry PDF and that is not OK.

 

See the files in the folder. It is placed in 2023 bugs, but it is the same in every version of Vectorworks 		Hernán Stamati
VB-200085

Accelerate graphics problem while editing edges

Vectorworks presents a problem in the display during "Edit Edge" of a polygon, which is particularly insidious because it leads one to think - on the user side - that there is a drawing error and in the geometries when instead it seems only a graphic rendering wrong effect.

The edge of a closed polygon, during viewing or editing, doesn't meet with the real edge of the object and the "rendered" area follows the wrong editing edge instead of, as it should, the real edge of the object both in top/plan view (wireframe) and in top view (shaded). 

We have found that:
The problem disappears by breaking the polygon into lines
The problem sometimes disappears by reversing the direction of the polygon
The problem disappears by disabling the “Accelerate graphics” option in the General Settings - that I think is the culpict. 		Justin Hutchison

if you want to convert a Subdivision object with Iteration: 1
to Nurbs. It seems that not all faces can be converted.

Subdivision with higher iteration can be converted.

Can you please take a look into the conversion?

Greetings
Tobi  		Hernán Stamati

VB-196806

Colors may change when exporting files to older versions.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Colors may change when exporting files to older versions.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open the sample file (Color.vwx) in Vectorworks2023.
2)Export the file in the previous version format.
3) Check the difference in color when opened in the version in question.

Compared to Vectorworks2023, when opened in the older version, the color is not brown (RGB value 86,44,5), but rather an earthy color (RGB value 86,72,59) with some gray mixed in.

---
When the data created with v2023 was extracted from the previous version, we confirmed that the colors did not change significantly as in the sample file (Color.vwx), but the overall color tone changed.

Please refer to the following files.
The file in problem was created by selecting all the classic colors available in Vectorworks 2023,
Tools menu > Utilities > Create Color Palette.
 
[File name]
Compare Color3.vwx 
Compare Color3_v2022.vwx 
Compare Color3_v2021.vwx

Compare Color_2023.png 
Compare Color_2022.png 
Compare Color_2021.png
 
In addition, the findings show the following situation.
2023→2022 Colors become slightly lighter (saturation decreases)
2023→2021 Colors become slightly darker (saturation increases)

*Remarks*
* We have confirmed that this problem occurs with all version exports.

*Findings*
This problem clearly changes the color tone.

The color tones seem to be different even for colors other than the color palette I created, and users have told me that they cannot use Vectorworks 2023 when this kind of problem occurs, so we think an improvement is urgently needed in the next SP.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Justin Hutchison

If I then edit accessories en move the base accesories away from center of the lighting device. The insertion point of the 3D component is shifted to the insertion point of the base accessorie. You can see this in the screen recording :"Base accesory Shift 3D".

This is a problem that can result in big errors in a production and requires attention imho.

VB-200197

VS GetTypeN() returns incorrect value for Sketch Styles

GetTypeN() returns a value of 47 for Sketch Style resources, like 'Rough', 'Careful', etc.

GetTypeN() should return -47 for Sketch Style resources.

Object Type 47 belongs to Record Formats.

If you create a Resource Folder by script using BeginFolderN(47) as the folder's resource type, you will get a folder that only accepts Record Formats.

To get a Resource Folder to accept Sketch Styles, you must create it with object type -47, as follows:

NameObject('My Sketch Styles');
BeginFolderN(-47);
EndFolder;

See attached VW file for some simple script examples showing the problem.

Please fix the function GetTypeN() to return -47 for Sketch Styles, but PLEASE don't change the function's name. It was unnecessarily changed from GetType() to GetTypeN() in the past and it did not change basic functionality, nor did it require different inputs, while still returning all the expected values from prior VW versions.

The number of scripts that will be affected if the name changes again is unthinkable. It would be better to not fix the function, than to fix it and change the name.

Thank you 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199882

Beta Undo Alert 4: MFarnan DSTOP Undo Error Imminent crash. Object 0x60001a507720 of tdType 123 is being deleted without the undo tables knowledge.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Open the attached "(2024) Community Library Stand Alone.vwx" file.
2) Change the render mode to "Artistic Renderworks".
3) Make sure the "Undo View Changes" VW Pref is turned ON.
4) Use the "Export to PDF..." menu command from the File menu.
5) Accept all defaults on the "Export PDF" dialog and click the "Export" button.

Wait for the export to finish.  Once the export finishes and the layer rerenders, a Beta Undo Alert 4 appears. 		Rick Berge

VB-200238

String input is broken for plug-in styles created from Marionette objects.

String input is broken for plug-in styles created from Marionette objects. Affects String nodes with similar names but different numeral prefixes.

 

From User:

1. Create a String node and a Point2 node. Attach them both to a Create Text node.
2. Duplicate these three nodes together so that you end up with four sets.
3. Name the String nodes "1 String" "2 String" "3 String" and "4 String"
4. Set the values of each Point2 value to something different so that the text objects won't be created on top of each other at the same location.
5. Connect all the Create Text nodes to a Pass node. This is just to connect them all into one network.
6. Right-click on any node and select "Wrap Marionette Network..." from the context menu. Name the wrapper something like "string input test"
7. Select the resulting wrapper node. In the PIO, enter text into the four input boxes that are all labeled "String." You could simply enter "1" in the first box "2" in the second and so forth.
8. Run the wrapper node to test it. Four text objects should be generated that contain the strings you input.
9. Right-click on the wrapper then "Convert to Object Node..." The wrapper should change into a Marionette object that is the group of four text objects.
10. Select that Marionette object. In the style box of the PIO, select "New Plug-in Style from Unstyled Plug-in..."
11. Confirm the modal that asks where it should be located in the resource manager.
12. Confirm the default name. Enter your text examples in the four boxes labeled "String" again. **It seems like a another bug that the existing string values do not populate these boxes.**
13. Notice that the four text objects now all show the value of the fourth string. **This is a the buggy behaviour.**
14. Try changing the string values in the PIO. Only the fourth value is shown in the text objects. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-199902

T02389: Importing with the setting "Don't preserve Vectorworks graphic attributes" doesn't reset the objects correctly

VB-197307

Choosing plants in ladscape area settings creates an undesired duplicate

When you follow the next steps:
- Manually import a plant from a library
- Edit the plant style
- Create a landscape area object
- Add the same plant to the landscape area, but (accidentally) form the library and not from the active document

A duplicate of the plant style will appear in your active document without any warning. It will be the unedited plant style form the library which will be used for the landscape area.
This is dangerous, because the user doesn't know in this way that an unedited plant style is used. The user should get the usual resource name conflict dialog, which you also get when you import a resource manually.

I report this as a bug, not an enhancement request because:
- This behavior can lead to mistakes in calculations because the user doesn't realize that an unedited version of the plant style is used
- Since importing resources in other ways trigger the name conflict dialog, it seems like the implementation of that dialog is forgotten with the design of the landscape area, and the design as it is now is not like that on purpose.
- If the user check the Resource Manager and sees duplicates he/she didn't make on purpose, it feels buggy to the user. 		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-200203

Fence: Asymmetric scaling of Gate configuration - Symbol parts

Draw Fence

Add Gate using Reshape tool

 

Select the Fence, click on Settings, click on Unstyled

Choose the Gate Configurations pane

Select the Gate Leaf Metal Pipe 12ft 6-Rail....

Below 'Gate'-tab select Asymmetric

Z Scaling Factor: set to 0,5

Click on OK

 

Result: hinge stays at original position (see screenshot)

Expected: hinge should stay at relative position of Gate

 

  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-200180

Project Sharing referenced Design layer viewport bug

Just had Stefan Bahrawy reach out about a potentially major project sharing issue.

He is having issues with referenced design layer viewport scaling in project files losing the viewport scaling in new working files. He has 6 referenced design layer viewports, 2 of which seem to be losing their scaling after the working file they were created in get committed in to the project file

From the conversation I just had with him all the referenced files are DWG based, the 4 files that are working correctly are drawn in mm and the 2 that are causing problems are in meters (both from Capture).
Everything works correctly when he creates the referenced design layer viewports in the working file, the 2 Capture DWG's are correctly scaled.
However once the working files is committed and closed any new working files created from the master file do not have the correct scaling in the 2 of the referenced design layer viewports (the 2 from Capture).

Follow up info from the Stefan, he hasn't tested if the manual update affects the issue as he's using the automatic update option.
But interestingly he changed his approach and instead of directly referencing the problem DWGs into the project he instead referenced the DWGs into shuttle files which were then referenced into the main project file and this seems to addressed whatever is causing the issue.

I've attached copies of the master project folder and reference (Xref) folder from Stefan.
THese files are highly confidential and should not be shared externally 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-199969

Wrong message after using "Edit attribute" tool with a fill tile

message: The Attribute Mapping tool cannot be used on an object participating in the active data visualization unless the override fill style is Retain Original. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-200162

Import Symbol (Batch) Fails to Apply Textures to Imported Sketchup Objects

The attached movie shows this from a blank file. I've also attached a Sketchup file that can be used to duplicate it.

To reproduce:
* Run the File/Import/Import Sketchup command and import the file
* In the import options dialog, enable the two checkboxes in the "Import Materials" section

Note that the textures get applied to the imported objects as expected.
* Now open another blank file
* In the Resource Manager, expand the utility menu and choose "Import Symbol (Batch)"
* Choose the same Sketchup file
* Click the Options button and enable the same two "Import Materials" options

Note that the textures get created, but they fail to get applied to the imported objects.

I don't see this problem with other file formats like OBJ or 3DS.

This feature was broken on Mac prior to 29.0.2, but the same thing happened on Windows in VW 2023. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199878

ConnectCAD: Panel Conn Display Tag overriden

This is a strange one, I'm not sure exactly what is going on.

I have schematic panel devices linked to a layout.

Unstyled Panel
* If I override the display tag of a connector, this will be cancelled and reset to the Linked Socket name if I use 'Update from Schematic'. (ideally these should know they were manually overriden from the socket name and resist this change)
* But if I also change the name of the linked Schematic device at all (doesn't matter what), the display tag is no longer reset and retains the new display tag - even though the Linked To Socket is incorrect and still linked to the previous socket name.

Styled Panel
* This behaviour is similar but a little different. If I change a display tag in the Style, exist the style and Update From Schematic, it will revert to the old label externally, but upon editing the style again, the change has stuck and is shown, but is not shown outside of the panel edit mode whenever the Update From Schematic button is pressed.
* As above, if I also change the name of the linked Schematic device at all (doesn't matter what), the display tag is no longer reset and retains the new display tag - even though the Linked To Socket is incorrect and still linked to the previous socket name.

We've spoken before that the Update From Schematic button could be viewed or expected to update the Linked To Socket when schematic devices are renamed, and we've discussed whether a separate button provides that function instead. But at the moment, it doesn't actually touch the Linked To Socket but does affect the display tag, which can be confusing.

 

Can I just say; despite the tickets and discussion today, I think Update 2 for Panel Layouts is great in general and I think it is going in a good direction. 		Conrad Preen
VB-200165

KLS: Site Modifier different result in existing and proposed site model

A site modifier has different behavior when site model is existing or proposed.
See attached testfile.
When site modifier is applied to proposed site model, then the slope is steep as it should be. But when the site modifier is applied to existing site model, then the slopes are not steep any more.
According to my understanding, the behavior of a site modifier should be the same with existing and proposed site model. So I think this is a bug?
If it is a bug, pleas fix it.
If it is works as designed, then please tell me about the different behavior. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199734

Spotlight Equip Summary Key T02059 opening the build list resets the box size to very wide

Upon opening the summary key, as demonstrated in the video, the column width and name width automatically reset to a significantly larger distance than necessary. This issue may be attributed to the system resizing based on the symbols, which are set not to show in this specific key. Ideally, column and name width should maintain their previously set dimensions while closed when opening the box.

Perhaps the bounding box needs to be checked to see if the "Show Symbols" box is checked or not before resetting the text column widths.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-198639

Empty Selection in Advanced Layer Georeferencing Dialog

1.Open a new file

2. In Navigation palette edit the design layer

3. *_Georeferencing_* should be off – turn it on

4. Choose the activated *_Advanced Georeferencing_* button

5. Choose _*Edit Document Georeferencing*_ button

6. Select _*Use a common coordinate system or enter WKT*_

7. Choose _*Lat/Lon Document Units*_ for Coordinate system

8. Close the dialog by clicking OK, and observe that in the Advanced Layer Georeferencing Dialog, the selection for Coordinate System is empty.

9. Once again, choose the Edit Document Georeferencing button, and take note that Use an EPSG code is selected instead of Use a common coordinate system or enter WKT.

10. Select Use a common coordinate system or enter WKT once more, and observe that the selection for Coordinate System is empty. 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-200051

Project Sharing - Object Checkout is Required When Duplicating Structural Members with Click-Drag

Movie and Project file are attached. The file contains a Structural Member.

To reproduce, click-drag the SM while holding down the Option key (CTL on Win) to duplicate it.

Note that the object checkout dialog appears.

If you duplicate with the Duplicate command or one of the duplication tools, the checkout isn't required.

I don't see this problem with other object types.

This is a regression from VW 2023. The same thing happens going back to 29.0.0. 		Christopher Graye

VB-200066

Specific library document: spots are not automatically on in the visualization palette

When you choose any symbol form the library with a light source in it, normally, this light source immediately emits light. This is because that light source is checked on automatically in the visualization palette.
This is a good thing, because in this way, the user sees immediately the effect of their action.
An exception to this rule are the symbols from the next library:

Site- Landscape- "in-lite landscape.vwx". Whenever you import a light source from this document into the active file, this light source doesn't emit light. The light source is checked off by default in the visualization palette. This is confusing to the user and it is usually not immediately clear to them why the light source is not immediately emitting light.

This issue needs to be fixed in that library file. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199326

In a viewport with a crop it is not possible to change class visibility via the visibility tool

If you have a viewport with an associated crop the visibility tool will affect only the class of the crop. If there is no crop you can change individual classes. Hernán Stamati

VB-200089

When selecting multiple Keynote Legends and editing the Title/Body Text, only the last selected Legend will receive the changes

If you do a bulk selection of Keynote Legends or a Custom Modification, then go to the Format Title Text or Format Body Text buttons in the OIP, it will only edit the last selected Keynote Legend.  We can work around this by doing them individually, but it's a bit of a pain.

I've attached a video going over this and please let me know if there's anything I can do to help.  Have a great day!  :) 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-199947

Unrelated resources defined in file when creating/editing fence style

The following resources are created/defined in any file when creating a fence. In this case I've attached a video when adding a concrete material to the fence footings attributes, these are added to the file unnecessarily.
* Alum RoofingSiding Bold Rib TF (Tile)
* Aluminum/Magnesium HF (Hatch)
* Asphalt Small RT (Texture)
* Brown-Yellow GR (Gradient Definition)
* Extr Asphalt Rought IF (Image Definition)

These are not necessary or used, I eliminated them from my default content files, so I'm not sure how they are being added? It is very annoying though, when trying to keep files "clean" of extraneous/unnecessary content

  		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-198865

Import Point Cloud: Point cloud is imported sliced & Point cloud is always imported offset

Hi Vectorworks,
we received point cloud file from surveyor with 4 reference points in global coordinates.
First misconduct:
Point cloud is imported sliced. Even if the file is geolocated, it will still be imported cut up. The import only works correctly if you import the point cloud on Internal Origin.
Second Misconduct:
Point cloud is always imported offset about 11-12 centimeters, even if the file is geolocated.
As a counter-test, the file was imported into QGIS, the coordinates match.
See video: Movie_Import Point Cloud Object.mp4
Please have a look, our VIP customer works a lot with point clouds

Regards,
Viktor 		Justin Hutchison
VB-200035

TK BUG: Overlapping scaled symbol in Wall cannot be be scaled to entire wall length

Hi VW-Team,

the symbol should be used to edit the wall to make it thinner in a certain
area along the entire length of the wall.

The bug occurs if you have 2D components in the overlapping symbol.

BUG = symbol cannot be scaled to entire wall length.
The symbol overlaps the wall on one side and a gap is
created at the other end of the wall.

If you delete all 2d components except the loci,
you can use the symbol over the entire wall length

 

Information to the symbol = symbol hybrid 1
2D components = only and some lines
3D components = 3D locus
Wall hole component = cube with 1 x 1 x 1 cm

Information to the symbol = symbol hybrid 2
2D components = only loci
3D components = 3D locus
Wall hole component = cube with 1 x 1 x 1 cm

For Top/Plan view, it is necessary to have 2D components in the symbol!

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Christopher Graye
VB-193375

Windows: Text edit paste changes text size

This is a strange bug that I'm surprised I did not notice before.

Pasting during text edit changes the text size of the pasted content on Windows.

To reproduce:
# Set global text to Arial, style plain text, size 11 pt.
# Create a new text object and type the word "test"
# While still editing, select the word 'test' and copy with ctrl-C
# Move the cursor to the end of the text field, and paste with ctrl-V
# Now move the cursor into the text you just pasted and check text attributes in the OIP

EXPECTED: the pasted text has size 11 pt, same as original 

ACTUAL: the pasted text has size 10.4 pt

This is not a regression, it was there in VW2021. Windows only. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197336

Data Manager: renaming a current Pset, while adding a new with the name of the current one causes faulty entries

To replicate (see video):
1) create a new document (Blank: Metric)
2) create a wall (fixed height style) and keep it selected
3) open the data manager
4) add the custom pset "A-G32-ePset-Window-nbl_All"
5) add the fields of that custom pset to the data sheet of "BIM Wall" and confim OK to leave the data manager
--> you see that the fields are in the OIP. ok.
6) go back into the data manager
7) now goto manage custom psets
8) copy the name of the custom pset "A-G32-ePset-Window-nbl_All"
9) rename "A-G32-ePset-Window-nbl_All" to "A-G32-ePset"
10) before leaving this dialog add a new custom pset and name it "A-G32-ePset-Window-nbl_All"
11) add a new field for the new custom pset
--> all fields of the old (renamed) pset "A-G32-ePset" are now empty
--> also: the old pset, that was added, is not being renamed, and also disappears from the list items of "Ifc Psets (Custom)" 		Mihail Rizov
VB-199548

'Site Model Opacity Container' object is not supposed to be seen in the UI

When you right-click the site model snapshot and select the 'Edit 2D components' command, you will enter the editing mode. When you click the site model contained in the snapshot, the OIP will display the 'Site Model Opacity Containter'.
In fact, the opacity of this object doesn't influence the general site model's opacity, which you can now define in the OIP.
This OIP seems to be useless and probably is not supposed to be seen in the UI.
It's also not documented in the user help and it's contained in the one-string file:
Landscape > ExtObjSiteModelOpacityContainer.vwstrings > SiteModelOpacityContainer
Moreover, the T02383 doesn't mention it either.

Does it work as designed?
If so, could you tell me what it is and why it mentions the 'site model opacity'?

!image-2023-09-26-21-09-44-432.png|thumbnail! 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199998

Hardscape Alignment Fails After Realigning

This is a continuation of VB-193174, which was fixed in 29.0.2.

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Planar Pad Hardscapes.

To reproduce:
- Activate the Hardscape tool in Aligned Configuration Mode
- Draw a Hardscape as shown, so that it aligns with the two existing Hardscapes

Note that the Hardscape initially gets aligned correctly, but if you click "Realign", the alignment then fails. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-196232

Door offset insertion mode in rotated top plan missing swing indication

When inserting a door with offset insertion mode, you get the option of choosing which what the door will swing before placement.

When the design layer is rotated using the rotate plan tool you no longer get the visual cue to choose the swing direction. You just get to blindly click a direction then the door appears and the offset dialog box displays as well. 		Christopher Graye

VB-199406

LAND-Stake Object does not display document units

User Joe Hanauer brought to my attention that when Stake Objects are placed on a site mode and its Elevation Units are set to Document Units using the following settings:
* Feet and Inches
* *Rounding style: Fractional*

the stake object does not display as fractional—it displays as decimal inches. Although landscape designers/architects usually use decimal feet for grading, it is important for users who use traditional methods of measurement for grading to be able to display elevations as fractions.  		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-200037

Running the "Replace WIth Stock Symbols" command on a Straight Truss PIO that was created by the Mirror Tool fails with error message "Selected Truss Objects Are Rotated in 3D. They cannot be replaced"

When in fact the trusses are only rotated in the top plan view. There is no hanging angle/3D rotation. Please see the attached file:

[^Replace With Stock Symbols on Truss PIO.vwx]


1.) Draw a straight truss PIO off center, at an angle (top plan) to the left of center.
2.) Mirror this truss across the center line
3.) Run the "Replace With Stock Symbols" command on the mirrored truss.
4.) Observe error message.

VB-198672

*Structural Member Join behavior and display

I am trying to join beams to a continuous, closed perimeter path beam. the video shows the 2D top/plan going "wonky" when performing a joint at an angle. The 3D looks good. When I join to the opposite side of the beam, the 2D top plan view reset itself but with an extension on the other side rather than showing the correct termination of the beam. I am modeling this, I see many roadblocks for the designer to use this tool. At the end of the video, there is, even more, surprise as the smaller beam actually cuts the path beam. AND a beautiful crash for you at the end when trying to reshape the path beam Christopher Graye
VB-200034

TK BUG: (Overlapping) Symbol in Wall will be deleted when moving the wall by mouse

Hi VW-Team,

a bug occurs if you have an overlapping symbol in a wall
and you move the wall with the mouse.

BUG = symbol will be deleted!

If you move the walls with the Move command (Modify / Move)
the symbol will not be deleted!

If the symbol does not overlap the wall and you move the wall
with the mouse, it will not be deleted either.

 

Information to the symbol = hybrid symbol

2D components = loci and some lines
3D components = 3D locus
Wall hole component = cube with 1 x 1 x 1 cm

The symbol is used to edit the wall to make it thinner in a certain
area along the entire length of the wall.

There is a 2nd. Bug with symbols in walls (I make a separate report for this)

Greetings
Tobi 		Christopher Graye
VB-196290

Locking an object still allows the locked object to be inadvertently duplicated in a locked state

1. Draw a rectangle on a layer

2. Lock the rectangle (right click, lock)

3. Select the locked rectangle and hit cmd+d. (It should have a grey selection box, indicated it is indeed locked)

4.  It won't look like anything happened but you'll find if you unlock (right click, unlock) the rectangle,  there are now two rectangles.   The base one,  which is still locked,  and the duplicate that is now unlocked.

I often lock a venue symbol/viewport/group/etc into place when designing,  and it's super easy to still inadvertently select the locked venue object when duplicating (via any of the usual duplicating capable tools) something else entirely.    And eventually ending up with 10+ copies of the base venue plan beneath and all that added geometry slowing the whole file down.   But you don't realize they are even there.

If an object is indeed locked,  by definition you should not be able to interact with it, with any tool,  without first unlocking.

 

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199807

Changing exposure / bloom / depth of field / vignetting / etc/ is not visilble interactivly

When editing exposure / bloom / depth of field / vignetting / etc of a linked camera in a viewport it is not visible in the view when editing. You have to deactivate the camera to see the changes you made to the settings of exposure / bloom / dof/ etc.

See movie for further clarification

Justin Hutchison

I exported the file back to v2022 and it works in perspective. I enclose both files and a movie.

VB-200010

Railing style button help texts not updated when changing the style

# Create an unstyled railing object and open its settings dialog.
# Hover over any of the style buttons and notice the help text. It should state that the parameter is "by instance".
# Select a style from the popup at the top of the dialog.
# Hover over the style button for a parameter that's set to "by style". It's help text will still state that the parameter is "by instance". Closing and reopening the dialog fixes the help text. 		Christopher Graye
VB-200030

Vectorworks crashes on Exit due to not releasing datasmith

The 290x branch is not releasing the datasmith library and this is causing VW to crash on exit, this is a Mac-only issue.
To reproduce follow these steps:
Open the attached file (DataSmith Community Center Test 2022.vwx)
In the Visualization toolbox select "Datasmith Direct Link" (the unreal icon)
Export file to any local folder.
when previous step is done click the Direct Link icon
Optional: open twinmotion and load the scene
Made some changes like moving the statues around or the lights
Disconnect by clicking the Direct Link button again
Close the VW file,
Select Vectorworks -> Quit Vectorworks
This is going to cause VW to crash, complaining about the datasmith library. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-200041

See simple file, simplified from customer file. Sheet G17 for example.
There is a nested flattened DLSVP that does not show on the SLVP unless it is updated while NOT in rotated plan. Editing the SLVP's design layer, or navigating to it, does so in rotated plan; updating the viewport here seems to give it bad bounds, or otherwise make it not image on the SLVP.
If updated while NOT in rotated plan, then it works. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-200017

Too many roofs appear in the worksheet when searching with the criteria "componenent is present"

When you search for object in a worksheet with the criteria "component ... is present", to many roof will be selected in the worksheet. This is becquse both the complete roof as the roof faces will be counted. This might seem logical knowing how a roof is stuctured in the backgroud, but for a user this is not clear. This leads to wrong calculation.
The database should only show 1 object, which is the roof itself. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198844

Simplify Mesh not working as expected for mesh with huge amount of polys

We realized that. the command "Simplify Mesh" do not work as expected for Meshs that have huge amount of polys. Especially in that case the command would be really fantastic. We also realized that the command works reliably for smaller meshes. Therefore we think there is a limitation and the issue only occurs for huge meshes.

However, for one off our developments we depend on this feature in some cases. It would be fantatstic if you can watch the movie and try to optimize simplify mesh command working with big meshes too. (without breaking what you have already :))

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# See attached movie
# Open "Testfile 20230823_02" to reproduce the problem

If you start simplify the mesh you can see that the slider has more or less no influence. The mesh will be reduced in a way that it cannot be used at all no matter how the slider is set.

 

Because of our ongoing development it would be fantastic if you can check if this feature can be optimized for large meshes too.

We hope it's a low hanging fruit and a internal limitation of the tool :) 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193424

DOM: Styled Marionette Scripts are disconnectable too easy

Comment 2023:
After having some more experiences with styled Scripts. I excpected that the style would be something on the level of a symbol or a bulletproof hull wich contains the script and not rewrap new by copy/paste the style as example. Near copy/paste we have many of other functions or workkflows which could go through such a Marionette style and can potentially wreck the script.
My notion was, that style-script is wrappend, cached and attached to the style. And nothing (even deleting some of the graphical representation from outside (with a tool, a bug, a workflow, a simple script, etc.) would be able to destroy it except the exit button of the style itself (the user).

Does the New Style and Script-Instancing Task should address this issue by design?
The Question is very important because of that information we have to inform our customer if Marionette PIOs should be used in big projects or not.












Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-197589

I think the method in which we rearrange nodes needs to be strongly reconsidered. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-193647

DOM: Button of styles PIOs does not work

I have a Marionette PIO with a button "LeitungenAktualisisieren"

1. This Button collects all PIOs on the Active Layer and resets them.
2. A Message Box and an Alert Dialog shows the acitive Layer Name and the List of collected PIOs for debug.
3. The Other Pipes will reset and visually you can see, the pipes get the new diameter or height. In short: It works

1. The same Script as a styled version. The Message and AlertDialog shows also the right Layer and the right collected pio handles.
2. After Reset, the PIO on the layer are not resetted. I think because of the style, somewhere (to fix another issue) they are prevented from resetting.

Also I tried some workarounds as example
vs.SetObjectVariableBoolean(h,1167,False) To set PIO in an unactualised condition.




Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-199820

Editing Linked Renderworks Camera Causes Render Process to Stay Active Indefinitely

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Viewport with a linked RW Camera.

To reproduce:
* Enter the Viewport's Camera edit mode
* Click the Fine Tune Camera button
* Change the render mode to Hidden Line, and make some view changes
* Now change the mode to Shaded

Note that a render process is now active, and will remain stuck in that state.

If you switch to the design layer and then back to the sheet, the render will cancel.

This seems to be related to Hidden Line. You can see the same thing if you set an RW Camera's render mode to Hidden Line and then create a linked Viewport from it. When the sheet becomes active with the new Viewport, a render process will be active.

The same thing happened in VW 2023. 		Justin Hutchison

This is on layer 1-Wall Layout. I deleted the window, and I was prompted to checkout 4 walls. I would think I would only be prompted to checkout the wall containing the window. Christopher Graye

VB-199867

T02477 - UI Review - Group box titles and menu button labels should use title case

VB-199954

Mirrored detail viewport geometry rotates the crop when turned into a detail viewport.

Within a sheet layer view port annotation space, if you mirror an existing detail view port and use the option in the OIP to create a linked detail view port from the new object, VW rotates the resultant crop boundary. On the source page VW does not actually rotate the visible detail viewport geometry so it looks like it should, a mirror of the original detail viewport. However, on the sheet where you place the new detail viewport the crop will be rotated.

This rotation only occurs when using the mirror tool. If you edit the mirrored detail viewport geometry before you turn it into a detail viewport VW will not rotate it.

Obviously the desired result is that VW should not rotate anything. Using any tool to copy a detail viewport should allow the user to turn it into a new detail viewport without any change to the boundary geometry.

See the attached screen view of this in action. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199624

Strings are too long in the Fence

We noticed that some strings are too long or the space is too short in the Fence dialog. Payne Chang

4) select the image
5) try selecting one of the 2d objects on top of the image by clicking on the objects

VB-199741

User's Home Screen is blank

Hello and good evening!  I'm not certain where we should go with this but I was hopeful to send this in as a Jira to get thoughts and advise.  

We have a user who always gets a blank home screen.  So far we've tried and checked the following:
* Reset the User Folder
* Checked if there was any antivirus or firewall on the computer
* Tried another internet connection
* Did a full uninstall/reinstall of Vectorworks
* Did a full uninstall/reinstall of Vectorworks Cloud Services
* Logged out, wiped the User Folder and the "Accounts" folder, then logged back in

We still haven't been able to figure out why this is happening and I've included a screenshot and a system report from the user.

This issue has occurred for them in both 2023 and 2024 and it happened even with a clean install of 2024 (no migration).  Any thoughts are appreciated and have a great day!  :)  		Payne Chang
VB-199945

Sill/Threshold 2D extension geometry offset radially from Arc Wall face.

Both door and window are affected.

I know what the issue is here - the offset amount is exactly equal to a RoundWallOffset value by which the Door/Window shifts all of its geometry after creating it. The problem is that the Sill/Threshold is flush with the wall face prior to this shift.

So it needs to do something like shift the wall envelope, temp hole geometry, and sill geometry in the opposite direction before using it to create the 2D sill/threshold geometry.

But I think Judah's the best one to work out the exact way to fix it. 		Christopher Graye

# Update all viewports on the sheet layer.

VB-199937

Railing Handrails Only Show Highlighting on Path Geometry

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Railings that have a Handrail only.

To reproduce, place the Selection cursor over a Railing.

Note that the Railing can be selected if you click anywhere on its geometry, but it only shows selection highlighting on the linear part of the handrail's path (not including the terminations). In Shaded mode this makes it hard to tell that the Railing is being selected.

If you Ungroup the Railing into a Generic Solid, the highlighting shows fine.

I don't see this problem with Guardrail geometry. 		Kostadin Ivanov

At 9 minutes into this video with me and [~nhilendarov], we observed an incorrect qty being shown in the summary key.

In the attached file, the symbol key should be showing 2/2, or 2/6, depending on the inventories checked off as being used.  		Kevin Linzey

Note that the members get joined, but in the wrong location.

- Now undo the join
- Join the members again, but this time hold down the Shift key to constrain the movement

VB-199853

* Click on the corners of the Extrude as shown

* Now try the same thing in Shaded mode

VB-199546

Cabinet - Wall cabinet with Generic Handles at Bottom

VB-199868

SBE: Reshaping span window returns incorrect eISZ_CornerConfig.currentValue

Please watch attached movie. I'm dragging one edge of the window only, but the other window edge is also moved away from the corner.

This incorrect behavior is caused by eISZ_CornerConfig whose fCurrentValue is 0 (eISZ_ObjCornerCnfgNotCorner) in OnSetIncorrectSizingParams. The correct value should be eISZ_ObjCornerCnfgAtWallStart resp eISZ_ObjCornerCnfgAtWallEnd as only one edge of the window was moved.

I'm attaching the PIO (Mac, debug, 29.0.x). Please don't use this PIO to analyze other interactive reshape bugs and vice versa! 		Christopher Graye

I have noticed this trend before but I thought it had been resolved. 

Sent3VWCrashDump.dmp is the latest one and the one that I recently noticed the Task manager instances.  

  		Payne Chang

To reproduce:

Invoke a DXF/DWG or DWF Import command

Choose to import all files from //depot/Engineering/Documents/Tests/VW29/Acceptance Tests/Interoperability and Support/DXF Import/Points/
Click OK
DXF/DWG Import Options dialog displays
Set Units in the For unitless DXF/DWG file use drop down
Click on Advanced… button
Select Objects
Turn on Loci in the Points group
Click Ok to close the dialogs
There are points that aren’t import as loci

VB-199861

IFC Export Column error

I have gone through the following variations:
1. remove 2D representation, the column is then exported
2. defined a round column with the same 2D representation >> column is exported
3. different settings with the reference heights >> no success
So exactly this combination with the mushroom and the matching 2D representation gives a problem somewhere.
Possible workarounds:
1. duplicate props into another class and delete the 2D representations there.
2. export remove and undo. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-193575

BUG: "Merge with Structural objects in Sections" + Shaded View

Hi,

“Merge with Structural Objects in Sections” won't work as expected
with “Shaded View”-Rendering.

Sometimes 3D-objects merge, sometimes 3D-objects won't merge.

Some 3D-objects never merge: “Extrudes” for example, or Subdivisions!
“Generic Solids” merge if the tool works as expected, but often “Generic Solids”
won't merge.

Please fix this behavior for “Generic Solids” + please enhance VW
that every 3D-object can merge!

VB-198737

Vectorworks appears to have rouge processes after the application crashes

This was found during testing in a dev environment...

 

How I reproduced:
# Open Undo.cpp
# Find second instance of "break here"
# Add the following code (the manually cause a crash)
##
{code:java}
static int count = 0;count++;
if (count == 5) {
    auto crash = [&]() {
        BlankHandle h = nullptr;
        if ((*h)->GetTdType() == kUndoPlaceholderNode) {
            gDC.fpDG->fpmwd->SetDocumentIsDirty(true);
        }
        };    BlankHandle h1 = TUndoSwapPrimitive::NewUndoPlaceholderObject(gDC);
    BlankHandle h2 = h1;
    DeleteObjectWithoutUndo(h2);
    if ((*h1)->GetTdType() == kUndoPlaceholderNode) {
        crash();
    }
    else {
        crash();
    }
} {code}
 

# Build and run from explorer
# Do any action that create an undo entry 5 times
# After the application crashes, open the task manager
# In the background tasks you will see vectorworks is still running some processes each taking up CPU resources. 		Payne Chang

VB-197670

Using auto-hide docked palettes results in a blank palette tray

As seen in the attached video, when you close the default left side palettes (Basic, Tools Sets, and Attributes) then turn on auto-hide docked palettes, then turn on the Tool Sets palette, the left side of the application window only reveals a blank "tray" where the tool sets palette should be. The blank tray is unexpected because at this point the Tool Sets should appear.

Turning on the Attributes palette makes both palettes then appear.

(This was found while testing the resolution of another VB, but this seems to be a different issue so a new VB was created.) 		Payne Chang
VB-197454

T02350 - Structural Member Settings Dialog's Attribute Browser is Very Click-Sensitive When Editing Multiple Items

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

- Place a default Structural Member and open its settings dialog
- In the Attributes pane, highlight multiple items and then try to expand one of the pulldown menus by clicking on the small arrow next to it

Note that this is possible, but only if you click in a very specific place. If you're even a little bit off, it'll treat the click as a new selection and everything else will become un-highlighted.

When only one item is highlighted, the user can click anywhere in the column (on the arrow or the text string) and the pulldown menu will open. Ideally that would also work with multiple items.

This also affects the other browser columns that don't use pulldowns. For example the pen/fill color swatches and the "Show" checkmarks only work if you click exactly in the middle of their graphics.

On Windows 10 I can't get multiple-item editing to work at all (reported separately in VB-197456). 		Payne Chang
VB-199464

Equipment List and Inventory won't recognize certain items

For instance, in the Awards Show file, under Staging>Soft Goods.
Pipe and Drape 17'2.948 x 6'4 reports there are 0 in-use inventories, but upon checking the inventory tab, there are 6.
Pipe and Drape 21' x16', though, reports accurate counts in the symbols and part and inventory tab and can be properly assigned.

Accurate counts seem to track of sub parts like sliders, bases, and uprights. 		Walid Remaili

VB-194757

Hardscape breaks when using material in component/ none fill

Hi, 

One of our users has come across an odd sequence which breaks a hardscape. If you set up a material with a Tile fill and apply this to a component of a hardscape. Then for the 2D fill of the hardscape set this to the same tile. Edit the tile to have no background fill. Then change the 2D fill within the attributes palette to none so it just shows the line work. The 3D of the hardscape breaks. 

If you do this process without the material it all work ok. It also starts working if you change the material to have a different fill and then back to the tile. However this then breaks again a little time after. 

Please find a video of this issue. 

Let me know if you need anymore information 

Best Wishes 

Helen  		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199510

Cabinet Door Stiles Show Wrong Texture Direction on Shaker Frame Doors

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Base Cabinet that uses a Shaker Frame door and has an image-based texture applied to all parts.

Note that the door stiles show the texture horizontally instead of vertically, and that this depends on the height of the door. With some heights the textures show fine (ex: 30" height), and with others either one stile will incorrectly (ex: 40" height) or both stiles will show incorrectly (ex: 36" height). Screenshots are attached.

I don't see this problem with Shaker Frame drawers or with Mitered Frame doors. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-199795

worksheet: cannot report user record format from referenced viewport

Data from user defined record formats are not avaliable in worksheets, when the objects are within/from a referenced viewport.


Attached are 2 documents: _source.vwx_ and _target.vwx._


_+source.vwx:+_
a door, a structural member and a railing have been placed on a design layer.
a user defined record format has been attached to said objects.
(record format name :  "{_}Test-Record Format{_}")
a worksheet has been created to report the data from the user record format.

+_target.vwx:_+
the _source.vwx_ has been referenced into this file with "design layer viewports"-method
a viewport of the objects from _source.vwx_ has been placed on a design layer.
a worksheet has been created to report the data from the user record format aswell as from PIO-record formats.


+_Problem:_+
the user defined record format is not avaliable for worksheets in _target.vwx._
allthough the PIO-record formats, are avaliable for worksheets in _target.vwx._

user defined record formats and their data should be made avaliable when originating from referenced files / viewports of referenced files. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199724

Viewport still large after crop

On sheet layer A1.3 of the file attached, I have viewport 4/A1.3 that is extending off the sheet, but the viewport is cropped so that the viewport should stay within the boundary of that sheet. When I enter the design layer and view the object, it is a symbol which is essentially just an extrusion. The polyline to make the extrusion uses fillet point mode to make the large curved portions, so the control points are way off to the left of the polyline, which essentially makes the viewport larger. Please see attached for images and the file. Karthick Chilaka
VB-198143

T01987 - Cabinets - Openings and doors not flush

* Where openings are placed, the drawer/door faces need to be flush with the opening panels.
* Separators between face items should be fully covered by the door/drawer, and not just halfway overlapped.
* Correct opening height and item height should be calculated. 		Bozhidar Zarev
VB-199715

Duplicated fields in Space record

The Space record contains two fields (Universal Name):
* ='Space'.'Finish Remarks' (read and edit in worksheet/Data Tag)
* ='Space'.'Remarks' (only read in in worksheet/Data Tag)

In the english version they are localized as:
* Room Finish Remarks Edit
* Static Room Finish Remarks

As far as I understand, the user would always want to use the Edit field because it offers more..

We should hide the Static field to make it more easier for the user to pick the correct field. 		Michael Wladarz
VB-198263

T02059 - Stage Deck Symbol "Edit Selected..." Does Nothing

Clicking "Edit Selected..." for a stage deck symbol does nothing except seemingly reset the Inventory and Equipment List window and scrolls to the top of the list

Video and File attached for clarity. Tested on MacOS 12.3.1 ARM 		Kevin Linzey
VB-198119

T02059 - 'Edit Selected' Doesn't work on Truss that is in Hanging Position

# Open attached file (or create Truss and Convert to a single Hanging Position with Geometry)
# Go to Spotlight>Inventory Equipment List...
# Select the Truss in the Symbol/Object List
# Click Edit Selected
# Notice nothing happens 

If there is a truss of the same type in the drawing that is not a Hanging Position, Edit Selected will populate the Properties window. (As seen in video)

If the Hanging Position is created as a symbol, the system shows (not the truss type) and the Edit Selected is not active. (T2 System in Drawing & Video)

I am not complete sure how this is expected to work, just might be confusing for users? 		Kevin Linzey
VB-199800

New UI: Rotate, Offset and Mirror tool all missing vital information that the command/control key can be used to select objects

Hello,
The enclosed snapshot shows what 2023 is like and as you can see in the mode bar the help that "Use the Command Key to Select Objects" is missing.
This piece of information is such an important one as it allows users to remain in that tool(s) and carry one working.
I'm not sure if there are other tools that also use this but please bring this back it's very important!

Cheers,
Peter 		Payne Chang
VB-199728

Also, from time to time, we see Lighting Pipes loose their Style.

So maybe there is something wrong with the Undo behavior, as in this files the complete style is deleted. 		Kevin Linzey

In the Equipment Summary Key, when attempting to sort items within the Items and Elements to Display window, the items fail to maintain their positions after clicking "OK." VB-198751

TK BUG: Pen-Color of a 3D-Polygon with only two vertices (in 3D-VIEW)

HI VW-Team,

if you want to draw a 3D-Polygon and click on the tool-icon,
the view will switch to Top-View.

If you draw now a 3D-Polygon with only two Vertices, the 3D-Polygon use the Fill-setting as Pen-color and not the Pen-setting as Pen-color.

If you switch to Top-Plan-View, the Pen-color will be shown as defined
in the Attribute Palette.

A 3D-Polygon with more than two vertices, will be shown as defined.

/ / / 

It would also be fantastic if we can define Pen-Colors for 3D-VIEWS
with the Attribute Palette. At the moment, this isn't possible.
Hope we get this opportunity in the future.

 

Attached is a VW 2023 SP6 file + screencast.

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Justin Hutchison

VB-198479

BIMObject - Update selected mode displays download objects browser

Currently, if you click that button with an object selected, it brings you to the browser which is confusing. If you choose a different object, then the text information of the selected object may change, but not the drawing representation, which is even more confusing.

 

Is this an issue with the help, or is this an issue with how the mode is working? 

I think this mode should just check for updates and not allow user interaction. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-198932

T02344: Window geometry incorrectly showing between sill and bottom of window jamb

Open the attached "VB 2309-Architect PIO Demo.vwx" file.

Notice the wall geometry showing between the sill and the bottom of the window.

{*}Edit{*}: I took a closer look at this and noticed the main wall hole geometry stops short of the bottom of the jamb by 1/2" (the Top Gap value).  This leaves a gap in the solid addition (used for the wall hole) between the main hole and the hole for the sill. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198746

The worksheet function "=materialvolume" doesn't function for object within groups within PIO's

The worksheet function "=materialvolume" will always return "0" for the objects within groups. Watch the attached video and file with an example with our localized DEWD plugin:
- The aluminium frame does return a volume, the other objects don't. The only difference between both objects is that the latter two objects are placed within a group
- The worksheet function "=materialsurfacearea" is capable of returning a surface area for objects within groups within the PIO, so it is an issue specifically with the "=materialvolume" worksheet function. 		Hugues Tsafak

            // Unrotate vertically aligned text.
            if( fbUsingATFont && pStringFormat) {

VB-199499

Shaded render with 2D background gives very unusable results

Reported by Casper:

When we have an urban plan, there is often a 2D background here. Like Polygons and Polylines, a building can sometimes be a simple extrusion. In this way a client wants to give a quick impression of what the urban area will look like.

Currently, I am not getting good results in VW2024 SP0 either. When no 3D surface is present, the 3D objects seem to float. This is because VW2024 but also VW2023 projects the shadow a meter below the 3D object. This makes it totally unusable and gives a wrong impression.

When we place a 3D extrusion under the GIS info and have it on, the shadows are shown correctly. But this is not always desirable or possible.

I made a video showing this. Also, the file has been added as a VW2024 file. 		Justin Hutchison

Kevin Linzey
VB-199559

Can't do that..Dual-render section perspective VP

In our office, the holy grail of a 3D design phase view is:

-A section viewport, in perspective, shaded background, hidden line foreground, created from Clip Cube.

1- if starting from design layer w/ clip cube and you use "create section VP", the VP is orthogonal to the building (not diagonal). You can set perspective projection in OIP, but NOT rotate the camera to achieve the desired section-perspective view.

2- if starting from design layer in perspective w/ clip cube and you use "create VP", you get the desired view and projection. However, if you want a dual render (shaded background and hidden line foreground) the hidden line renders beyond the limits of the intended view.

Hidden line fails to respect section limits, used in foreground of VP or background render 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199536

ConnectCAD: some tools have trouble detecting objects when only snap-to-grid is on

This bug arose from the review 722666 and was seen in the ReRoute Circuits tool. In schematic drawing it's normal to have only snap-to-grid on as this helps make sure objects are not placed unintentionally off-grid. However, this setting forces the tool point to the nearest grid point and this can make it hard to pick parts of objects that happen to be off-grid.The work-around is to enable snap-to-object also but this can result in objects straying off the grid again. This isn't specific to the ReRoute tool. Conrad Preen
VB-199457

HTML Dialogs: Padding and border needs to be deleted, should come from html, not Vectorworks

Our html palette has padding around the outer edges that comes from Vectorworks. On Windows, it also has a border.

This is interfering with styling that is coming from the html inside the palette. It will get compounded once we enable dark mode for html palettes.

Here is the BCF manager on WIndows, with its contents replaced by a div with a red background. Dark mode shows there is only 1px of padding. This should ideally be reduced to 0:

!image-2023-09-22-06-50-11-541.png|width=380,height=344!

This magfified view shows that there is also an additional 3px frame on Windows, which should also be deleted if possible:

!image-2023-09-22-06-52-52-170.png|width=381,height=344!

On Mac, there is much more padding, but no frame:

!image-2023-09-22-06-54-44-860.png|width=379,height=342!

  		Payne Chang

VB-198323

Model gets "cut away" when a railing or flyover tool (or perhaps any other tool) is activated

I realize this is going to be a somewhat vague one, but it *keeps* happening to me with the attached file so I wanted to get it into JIRA for good measure...

At seemingly random times, when I am in a 3D view and I activate a tool, the model instantly appears "cut away" and continues to "morph" in a cut away state. (In may case, the tools that have been activated as this occurs are the railing tool and, as seen in the video, the flyover tool - invoked by my 3DConnexion Spacemouse.)

Rendering the model in its current mode - Shaded - Does not solve the issue.

Rendering the model in Wireframe and then back to Shaded, does not solve the issue.

I have tried saving the file, closing, and reopening the file, and that has only resolved the issue once or two, maybe.

Typically what I must do is fully quit Vectorworks and relaunch it, then reopen the file. Then the issue usually does not occur again for a few hours, but sometimes it occurs again within a few minutes.

Other info:
* My computer is rebooted daily, at least.
* A system report is also attached in case it's needed.
* When the issue occurs, typically I am not running anything else graphically intensive or requiring lots of RAM.
* This has been occurring randomly during during the beta cycle of 2024. I am entering the build number where I last saw the issue below. I download a new build daily.

Please feel free to get in touch with me if you have any additional questions of want me to try anything in particular to help troubleshoot this issue.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-199593

VB-195903

View Bar Text Styles (B, I, U) don't apply to text along path

Confirmed this is a bug on both Mac and Win.

Likely an issue with how the VWApp.Text API applies text changes to objects, somehow not including text-along path.

To reproduce:
# Create a one-line text object with some text, and a bezier path, then combine them with the Text->Text Along Path command.
# With this object selected, click different style buttons (B, I, U) in the view bar

EXPECTED: the styles are applied to the selected text-along-path object

ACTUAL: the object is not changed, even though the buttons in the view bar toggle

Note that Bold, Italic, Underline work on the object as expected from other controls (OIP, Text->Style menu, dialog).

Also note that other view bar controls like Font and Size work properly on the object.

Marking as not a regression because this is a new UI, but it is a regression in terms of expected behavior of bold/italic/underline controls generally. 		Hernán Stamati

The wall-finish line hatch in the viewport is also omitted in the section view. Also tried this in Vectorworks 2022 and Vectorworks 2024 beta.
 
For the customer it is important to lay out the wall based on tiles.

VB-199564

Spotlight - Editing Aisle Path Displays Ghost Lines

Video and steps to reproduce are below...

1) Draw a Seating Section with an Aisle (Rectangular or Polyline Mode)

2) Double Click on the Aisle Object>Path>OK

3) Resize or change the Aisle boundary.

4) Notice that there is a ghost outline of the previous geometry in the edit window. It is not clickable nor can the user snap to the lines.

This behavior is different from if/when a user edits the path of a poly line in the drawing window. 

This behavior occurs on both macOS 12.3 ARM and Windows 10 		Kevin Linzey
VB-199556

Viewport: Lighting Device not visible if Accelerated Graphics is Off

In the attached Vectorworks document we have a Viewport with a Lighting Device.

If Accelerated Graphics is Off, the Lighting Device is not visible.

If its On, the object is visible. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199583

Spotlight Equip Summary Key T02059 inserting incorrect items after removing PIO items

I've figured out a workflow with the Summary Key that causes the list of PIOs to get confused and insert incorrect items.

In the attached file, create a new Summary Key and add Plugin Objects from the Build List, but leave out the cables.
Close the Summary Key and then open it again.
After reopening it, remove the 50-degree lighting unit so it shows up on the left-side list browser.
Close the Summary Key once more.
Reopen the Summary Key using the Build List button.
Try adding the 50-degree light again.

You should notice something other than the light gets inserted. This issue occurs when you remove and try to reinsert Plugin Objects in a Summary Key.

I have attached a video. FIle tested in both 29.0.1 and 29.0.2 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199469

VB-199475

Structural Member - joining the joint

Reported by Jakub:

It's not easy to join precisely the previously created joint. There's not snap point on the axis line of the main beam that would help me to do it in expected way. 		Christopher Graye
VB-199486

Window objects: exterior trim shown incorrectly sitting atop window sill

Create a window, place it in a wall, and give it a window sill and exterior trim. For sample dimensions please see the attached file.

Note that the window trim extends along the top and sides of the window, as appropriate. However a portion of the trim is also extended between the bottom of the window and the top of the window sill. When viewed from the exterior, there is trim visible beneath the bottom of the window, and above the sill.

This is not correct general practice. The sill should extend in from the exterior toward the window sash, with the sash (or in some cases the window frame) sitting directly on the sill.  This is actually shown correctly in the image used for the window settings dialog diagram.

For another example of correct sill and trim placement please see this article:
[https://www.remodeling.hw.net/products/windows/neat-and-trim-window-trim-design-basics] 		Christopher Graye
VB-199465

GIS Stake: Auto ID Numbering does not work on file

In the attached file when we place a few Stake objects with the Mode "Use as 2D/3D graphic only" and "Auto ID Numbering" active with Initial ID Number: 0, it does not work. Every Stake remains with the ID Number 0. If we do the same in an empty file it does work. Kostadin Ivanov
VB-197891

This issue is present going back to VW28.0.0 when the Home Page was added, also seen in VW29.0.0.  This is a Windows ONLY issue
# Open Vectorworks
# From the Home Page, Click Open
# In the top right corner of the Open window, try click in the Search 
# Notice there is no curser or option to type text
# The Open window seems useable after the first few times of clicking in the Search
# After 3-6 attempts, the Open window will become non responsive.
# Force Quit is required

The Task Manager doesn't show that Vectorworks is Not Responding, but I can't find a way to resolve this other than Force Quit.

I removed my User Folders and continued to see this issue.

This issue doesn't appear on MacOS

This issue doesn't occur when using File>Open.  This is only seen in the Home Page>Open 		Payne Chang

VB-198309

Problem with ramp tool and shading/texture render

Reported by Philippe:

If you create a ramp using a model into the resource selector, it is impossible to get shaded or textured render mode for the object.
If you create the same ramp using the default preferences dialog box THE FIRST TIME, shading or texture can be applied.

But it seems that it is just for the FIRST ramp created using dailog box only, instead resource manager.
If you re-create a new ramp using the preferences dialog box a second time, no shading and no texture are rendered, like with the resource manager mode problem described prevously. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197827

Auto-rotating image props are not sectioned correctly

In 2024 auto-rotating image props are not sectioned.  This is a side effect of the RW section re-engineering.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-197841

Crash at shutdown on material texture properties cleanup

Example Crash Report: [https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=9766618]

Crashes seem to be at shutdown, due to attempting to use the SDK to clean up texture properties after the SDK has been destructed. It is unclear why the texture properties have not been cleaned up beforehand as we would expect. Further investigation is needed to determine what needs to be done to ensure the texture properties are properly cleaned up before the SDK is destructed in all cases. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199478

Spotlight Braceworks duplicated items a not aligning along truss properly

In the attached video, I show adding a single speaker to a truss. Duplicated speakers do not snap to the same chord as the original. This issue also occurs when utilizing the Move by Points tool and specifying the number of duplicates. The first duplicate aligns correctly with the truss chord, but subsequent duplicates are misplaced halfway down the truss height. It appears that they snap to the Braceworks snap line while maintaining their alignment.

When duplicating a speaker, vertical and horizontal alignment should be maintained. Holding the Shift key while moving the duplicate should also preserve this alignment. However, the duplicates are not being positioned correctly.

To verify this issue, follow these testing steps:
# Open a new file and insert a truss line.
2. Add a speaker to the truss and align it with the truss chord.
3. Create a duplicate of the speaker and drag it along the truss chord, observing the results.
4. Repeat this process using the Move by Points tool set for placing duplicates.

Note, my VW preferences have Offset Duplicates turned off.

This problem persists with both our speaker tool and Andy Dunning's new one, as demonstrated in an attached videos. 		Kevin Linzey

-I open the attached file in 3 different versions of Vectorworks.
-In Vectorworks 2022 with no objects selected when I turn on clipped,
the border box surrounds all of the objects, so all drawings are visible.
-In Vectorworks 2023 Sp6 and Vectorworks 2024, when I turn on clip cube with
no objects selected. The boundary only surrounds the object that is on the
active layer. In this particular case 0-slab. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199447

Vectorworks becomes unresponsible when changing light angles

when the lights are modified in either shaded or renderworks it can become unresponsible to the point that needs to be killed. Based on debug data looks like the issue is a deadlock in the multi-threading system
to reproduce open the attached file "Custom Light 2024.vwx"
select the custom light and change the parameters:
change the pitch using the scrollbar if that wont reproduce the bug then change the light angle using the scrollbar.
Vectorworks eventually will become unresponsible
Justin Hutchison
VB-198666

Site Model: Retaining Edge modifier creates a hole in Extruded contours below its modification

The reason is that the extruded contours' definitions are cut in 2D by the polygon of the Retaining Edge and they cannot fully close themselves. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-198619

Site Model: Extruded contours differ from 3D Mesh

The extruded contours don't model the vertical pad very well. That's because no contours are created on vertical sides. Therefore, site model boundary contours are put as placeholders, but they cover the whole area and make a big difference from the 3D mesh representation. Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-199433

VWThumbnailPopupCtrl::SelectItem removes the focus from the dialog

VWThumbnailPopupCtrl::SelectItem removes the focus from the dialog. This is a problem because we use this function in OnUpdateUI. Whenever a user selects a field, UpdateUI is called and SelectItem will remove focus from the dialog.

This disrupts the workflow of the user and is therefore of high priority to us. 		Payne Chang

Note that the surface has no fill and is not textured.

VB-198300

A strange case with a viewport's render modes

Please see attached video. Using the VW29.0.2d(715940)_64 autobuild, I randomly encounter a crash while changing the render modes of a viewport. I can't consistently reproduce the crash with a certain set of steps though. One thing that I notice is the crash usually happens when I accidentally double click on the "Update" button on the OIP.

So I sync 29.0.x to the same build number (715940) and run a Debug build to try to get a call stack for it. I change the render modes, click "Update" on the OIP, then wait until the "Cancel Update" button appears, I click it, let it run for about an hour, and it finally crashes. Please see attached images for call stacks and variables' values. It looks like there's one render job (fRunningJobs size = 1) that never gets removed because fStatus has a weird value (885211360).

I try my best to explain it, but I don't think I completely understand what's going on, so I'm sorry in advance if anything I describe doesn't make any sense at all. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199417

Redshift rendering may not show background textures through transparent objects.

In Redshift rendering, the Renderworks Background may not be displayed through a transparent object that has a texture with the transparency attribute set to "Glass".

Occurrence condition:
If the Renderworks Background of an image, such as "Sunset" from the Vectorworks library, is set as the Renderworks Background.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Open the sample file [^13282.vwx].
2) There are two viewports arranged one above the other on the sheet layer, the upper viewport is set to the Renderworks style "Redshift Exterior Fast_Sunset", and the lower viewport is set to the Renderworks style "Realistic Exterior Fast_Sunset".
3) The upper viewport does not display the Renderworks Background through the Extrude object whose transparency attribute is set to a "Glass" texture.
*Please also refer to the screen dump "13282.png" that captured the scene.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Justin Hutchison
VB-198349

Bold characters may be displayed differently from what they look like on VW when executing "Export PDF" or "Print".

Problem fonts: "MS Mincho", "MS P Mincho"

Also, this Bug is seem to be related to VB-197165.


Steps to reproduce
For "Export PDF"
1) Open an attached file.(Sample.vwx)
2) Click the "File" menu > "Export" command > "Export PDF" submenu command.
3) Click "OK" in the dialog and save it in any location.
4) Comparing the bold characters in the exported PDF "MS Mincho" and "MS P Mincho" with the characters on VW, they look different.

Please refer to attached files.(Sample.vwx Sample2.vwx and 13241.mp4)

For "Print"
1) Open an attached file.(Sample.vwx)
2) Click the "File" menu > "Print" command.
3) Click "OK" and compare the printed result with the text on the VW and it looks different.

"Workaround"
For "Export PDF"
・Turn on [Rasterize text] in the "File" menu > "Export" command > "Export PDF" submenu command > "Export PDF dialog".
・Turn on [Rasterize text] in the "File" menu > "Publish" command > "Publish" dialog options > "Export PDF Settings" dialog.

Please refer to attached files.(Sample test1 Raster OFF.pdf Sample test2 Raster ON.pdf 13241 Workaround PDF.mp4)

For "Print"
・Turn on [Rasterize Print OutPut] in the "File" menu > "Print" > "Print" dialog.
・Disable [Use GDI+ Imaging] in "Tools" menu > "Options" > "Vectorworks Preferences" >"Display" tab.

If you want to avoid rasterization of text or want to operate with Use GDI+ Imaging enabled, the above workaround cannot be used.
Please let me know if there is a workaround by switching options.

 

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198725

Acceptance testing - texture is not repeating on a roof

Christopher Graye
VB-198711

Texture roof "by class": "roof textures" overwrite the component textures

When you want to determine the texture of a roof component "by class", you'd expect that it would be the "component" texture setting within the class which determines the texture of the roof component (if textures are set by "component" in the OIP, of course).
But as you can see in the attached file and video, it is the "roof textures" of this class which determine the attributes of the roof component. Only when there are no "roof textures" set in the class, the component texture will be used. 		Christopher Graye
VB-198698

Vectorworks crashes when deleting geometries

Vectorworks is consistently crashing in the design layer when deleting geometries.
The call to lock the mutex is using an invalid address which is causing the crash
To reproduce follow the next steps:
1. Open the attach model "Dover Dam 2024.vwx"
2 Switch to any visible layer in the design layer
3 change the renderer to shaded and navigate around
4. select all the second floor in the house and delete.
5. most of the time VW crashes immediately but if that does not crashesVW select the rest of the house and delete,
VW will crash 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193793

New Summary Key counting confusion with speakers, PIO vs. Symbols

Two files are attached.
The one without the word correct has four instances of speakers. The Key shows three symbol versions of the speaker and two of the plugin version.
It should show four of each, in theory.

If you start to duplicate the speaker objects, the counts change and still do not add up properly, until you get to the 20 I show in the second file.

In the file with the filename ending in "correct," the key shows 12 symbols and eight PIO versions of the speaker.
The drawing has 20 instances of speakers with various hanging methods assigned. 
The Key should show a count of 20 total of each, in theory.

We want 20 total Adamson Point 12 speakers to be shown.

If we have to treat speakers solely as plug-in objects, we should not show any speaker symbols alone and only show all as PIOs.

The main difference between the two sets of speakers (symbols vs. PIO) is the tilt angle.

[~bmerdzhanova] [~nhilendarov] 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-199248

Hardscapes with an organic shape: is triangulated since version 2023

When you choose a "slab" as 3D type for a hardscape with an organic shape, the resulting geometry will be triangulated. Also when the object is not a site modifier nor it is aligned to any other object.
This causes the result to be more segmented.

This is a regression compared to version 2022 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199329

Visibilty tool does not change class in a viewport with a crop.

In a viewport with an associated crop the visibility tool says the a class is changed but it is not.
