VB-199325

Preset of custom cabinet

Reported by Vicky:

When you select a preset from the method bar, you can place a custom cabinet from the library.
Normaly when you open a new drawing, the default values should be active and not the preset from the previous drawing. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-199287

2D Polygon in Outer Boundary Mode fails in Interior Elevation Viewport

As I have reported before, depth cues are an important part of architectural drawing that are missing in Vectorworks (VB-78525, VB-94422). Without automated depth cueing, users must resort to manually drawing them in Section and Interior Elevation Viewports. This tedious process is rendered a bit more efficient  with the Outer and Inner Boundary Modes of the 2D Polygon tool. Unfortunately, these appear to be broken in 2024 (seemingly a regression of VB-163815). Please see attached video and sample file. Karthick Chilaka
VB-197357

T02344 UI review

Please see attached, for both Windows and Mac builds 710590. Christopher Graye
VB-199310

View Bar Compact mode on Windows has menu buttons at too narrow a width to be useful

On Mac, the menus auto-stretch to a useful size. On Windows, menu buttons are very short, despite enough space for them to expand. Can we make the behaviour the same on Windows as it is on Mac?

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/110721-vw2024-view-bar-sort-order/&do=findComment&comment=482015 		Payne Chang
VB-199314

Spotlight Source 4 70deg draw beam

In 2024, with the ETC Source 4 70deg fixture, when you turn on 'draw beam as 3D solid' it flips your orientation to top view. I tested this back to 2022, where it would cause everything to disappear until you zoomed in and out to cause the screen to refresh. Kevin Linzey
VB-199300

Textures On Objects Not Showing Correctly

When you apply a texture onto an object for the first time. It will show as a solid color and not the actually texture. Do an undo and re-apply the texture then it will show correctly. Please see the video and bug file. Justin Hutchison
VB-194034

Site Model: Extruded contours fail when there are modifiers which share a single vertex

Open file 'Extruded contours fail - two modifiers with shared vertex.vwx'.

It contains a site model and two site modifiers which share a single vertex.

Because the modifiers share a single vertex, this breaks the TIN and when contours reach the shared vertex they begin cycling inside the modifiers' polygons until maximum iterations are reached.

This is the same issue as the one described in VB-191744. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199246

Structural Member pitch cannot be set to 0 in the floating data bar when drawing in Top/Plan with non-zero story bound height

Reported by Ségolène:

when you draw a Strutural Element like a beam, a slope is automatically created, so you need to go to the PIO to load it later.

It cannot be changed when the element is drawn.

On the other hand, it is 0° when 2 poles are connected.

In 2023, the basic slope was 0.

Watch video 		Christopher Graye
VB-195317

Please see the attached file.  When rendering the viewports in this file with Redshift Exterior Final which has been edited to include a specific background (High_res_BG) as a very dark grey instead of showing the RW background.

The RW background works fine when rendered with shaded. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-193897

Spacemouse: switch from 2d to 3d zoom axis is swapped

The 3DConnexion Spacemouse wireless and also enterprise has an issue with Vectorworks, that when switching from 2D to 3D the zoom direction (z / up down) is swapped with the shift axis (x/y back and forth). This can be remedied by selecting the other function (a: forward / backward; b: up/down) under zoom direction in the 3dc driver.

Desired zoom direction would be up and down (a) but the desired behaviour is sometimes under a, sometimes under b, depending on the switching error.

Is this known? Can someone please test this and let us know if it can be solved or whats the diagnosis? Thank you in advance. 		Josh Loy

As example, the benches are not as visible and well defined with 2023 as they are with 2022. Other example is the light on the Truss objects, which is clearly better with 2022. One last example is the floor, that is displayed much cleanly with 2022 than 2023.

VB-199303

VB-193856

Hi there,

it is about worksheet functions.
We do have that new parser file 1914 WS Function Options.vwstrings.
This parser file makes the options of worksheet functions german.
For example Anzahl(Angle) becomes Anzahl(Winkel).
When this function get inserted, the command line shows correctly the german expression. But when edited, then the popups are blank.
See video.

This report is related to VB-193855 - KLS: WSFunction options not German when browsing.

VB-197784

In the border setting of the database cell of the worksheet, the border cannot be set to "bottom".

In the border setting of the database cell of the worksheet, the border cannot be set to "bottom".

Steps to reproduce:
1) Open the sample file [^13213.vwx] and the worksheet "Test-1" will be displayed in the drawing area.
2) Open the worksheet “Test-1” from Resource Manager.
3) Select database rows 2.1-2.3 and execute Format menu > Cells... command.
4) Click the "Bottom" button in the Border tab of the Format Cells dialog.
5) Click the OK button to close the Format Cells dialog.
6) Borders are not displayed under cells in database rows 2.1-2.3.

Please also check the reproduction video [^13213.mov].
*This bug occurs not only on VW2023 but also on older versions.

VB-198086

Worksheets: HEIGHT function does not work correctly when component index is used

When using component index in a formula for walls in HEIGHT function, it always returns the value for the core component (it doesn't matter asking for overall or average height).

Please, note that in the same worksheet other functions, like:
=VOLUME('gross', 'component=1')
=FOOTPRINTAREA('gross', 'component=1')

work properly. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-199250

Gamer Mode of the Walkthrough Tool is unusable when the Vectorworks application window is shown on a secondary display using macOS's Screen Mirroring

1. Open any file or create a new blank file in Vectorworks. It helps to have some objects scattered around for orientation.
2. Enable Screen Mirroring. I usually do this via the Control Center in the top menu bar. And the devices I connect to are Apple TVs or an iPad. Set it to "Use as a separate display."
3. Return to Vectorworks and activate the Walkthrough Tool.
4. Set the Walkthrough Tool to Gamer Mode.
5. Try to look around by moving the mouse.

From user: The view jumps around and may even rotate upside down. Or it may not even respond to the mouse movement. The mouse pointer disappears sometimes. And I have even noticed that the mouse pointer might be "teleported" back to the other screen (the screen that is not not showing the Vectorworks window) and when I move the pointer back to Vectorworks, as soon as the pointer touches the 3D view area, the mouse pointer is teleported back to the other screen. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-199284

DOM: Marionette 3D Modi-Point

1. Open The Attached Example
2. If you move the Modi Point in z-Direction the Point moves also in x or y direction. It is, because there is not geometry drawn which is around the modi point and the modi-point is the most outside object of the PIO.

Movie is with 2023 but same behaviour in 2024

The is related to the post in the Forum:
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/69679-control-point-1-dimension/ 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-198727

Truss Magnets Ignoring Length Field In Truss Properties

When you run the Insert Magnets command for truss the straight truss length field is being ignored. This is resulting in both the left and right magnets being placed together at the (0,0) location in the 3D component. As a result, the auto connect will fail because the right hand magnet is not at the actual right hand location of the truss.  Kevin Linzey
VB-199145

While working on a site model I entered both the edit contours mode and edit surface mode.  When you enter the edit window the smaller tools window appears for the type of editing you are doing.  Upon exiting the edit mode the windows disappear as they should until later down the line when they reappear, often with multiples of the same window.  These windows can not be closed and will remain on screen until Vectorworks is completely closed. Bozhidar Stanchev

- In version 2024: The 2D pen color will determine the fill color in 3D (wrong) 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-199155

Stair CW: 2D Austritt not in the Attributes for Gestemmte Treppe

I have already spoken with [~sbender] about the problem.

In the attached Vectorworks Document is a Stair CW with a Bauweise: Gestemmte Treppe. In the Attributes the 2D Austritt is missing, which makes not possible for the Customer to define a filling colour to this. The workaround was to switch from Gestemmte Treppe to Massivtreppe, then give the wished color and then switch back to Gestemmte Treppe.

Please take a look at this and see if its possible to have 2D Austritt available in the Attribute Settings. Thank you in advance. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198029

All worksheets created by the Equipment and Inventory dialog should report which inventory source each item has or is not assigned.

Several items in the Task Document already have this listed as a needed field. Some worksheet examples missed this detail. Please add the field to all worksheets.

For lines of items with many parameters and some being assigned to different sources, we can add more "assigned source" columns or use the term "Mixed" in the single field just as we do in the Equipment and Inventory dialog box.

# Click OK to run
# Double click on the selected Lighting Devices to open Edit window.

VB-196661

T02059 - Layer chooser dropdown in the Inventory Management Filters dialog should be a layer control

When creating a filter it looks like we're using a regular pulldown and populating the list of layers in the dialog code. We should use the pre-built layer control in this case which is a searchable pulldown control since the list of layers can get very large. This is also inconsistent with the rest of the application.

This is a minor issue and could be unlinked from UI review if we choose, but I'm putting it there for now.
Nikola Hilendarov
VB-193962

When a lighting symbol contains a 2D component for a corresponding schematic view, Vectorworks properly uses the 2D component. However, Vectorworks does not include the 2D component of any nested symbols. (Lighting symbols often are built from other symbols)

See the attached file. The lights in front schematic view do not show the nested symbol. The symbol alone, in a rendered front view, DOES show the nested component. (Though the stacking order is not correct, which is another issue).

VB-196036

The operation when entering a value in "Tilt" of the OIP of the created Lighting Device has changed.

The operation when entering a value in "Tilt" of OIP of created Lighting Device is different between VW2022 and below versions and VW2023.

・VW2022 or lower version
The light source is angled according to the Tilt value.

・VW2023
The light source is not angled according to the Tilt value.
Also, setting the Focus Point does not change the angle.

■ Reproduction procedure
1) Create any symbol.
2) Concatenate the "Light Info Record" records in the resource manager.
3) Double-click the symbol and place it on the drawing as a Lighting Device.
4) Do Shaded rendering.
*At this time, turn off the "Shadows" option in Shaded Options.
5) Check the angle of light by setting the angle to "Tilt" of OIP.

■ Remarks
・Even in v2023, like the standard resource Lighting Device, if the object in the symbol is connected to the "Parts" record format, and the "Body" is set, the light source will rotate together with the Body.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199092

Solid Subtraction causes object to become non-manifold

Open the bugfile. Subtract the block from the complex shape. It will become non-manifold (see screenshot).  Justin Hutchison
VB-199109

Canceling the action of changing the direction of a light does not remove the current drawing

Attached project file LightCheckout.vwxp contains a few different types of Light objects (Directional, Point, Spot, and Custom).

To reproduce, click and drag the blue handles for the Directional, Spot, or Custom Lights, then cancel the operation by pressing the Esc key. Although the light object is reset and its original direction drawn, the direction of the light at the time the operation was cancelled is also still drawn.

This bug was originally found as part of the investigation into VB-198512 and was also found in VW23. At that time, some attempts were made to resolve this using CTS but nothing was found that didn't require major changes to how CTS works. The main issue come from the fact that the actual light object is changed as the light is rotated. This causes CTS to track changes without having a way to remove them in the case where the resize is cancelled, since there is no CTS event currently running.

It appears that all other IResizer instances make changes to a temporary object for the drawing as the user moves the mouse. TLightResizer should be refactored to do that as well. This would prevent CTS from tracking any changes until the user completes the resize. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199216

Generic Solids overlap if Shaded or Renderworks is being used

Generic Solids overlapping while Shaded or Renderworks is being used, which does not happen if Wireframe is being used. In 2D the objects also do not overlap.

Not overlapping is the expected result, making us believe that with Shaded and Renderworks the 3D display is not correct. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-199208

BUG: "Interactive Editing" when switching between modes without prior process completion.

Hi VW-Team,

“Interactive Editing” of a “Window in Wall” can be defected
if you switch the editing-modes without complete the prior
process.

The editing-modes are:

1.
SHIFT + Left-Mouse-Click = Preserve the ratio of the "Window in Wall”

2.
COMMAND + Left-Mouse-Click = stretch "Window in Wall” from the middle

Attached:
VW 2024 file and a screencast.

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Christopher Graye

VB-199200

TetraX GDTF not working correctly in Vision

I patched TetraX in mode 4 (RGBW) and I was changing values on channel 53 which is white color on pixel 1. From DMX readings it was all ok. While pixel 1 started to do what is supposed to do (starting adding white colour), on top of that pixel 2 started to emiting with red color. In this example Vision is overlaying the channels 53 (Pixel 1 white) and the next channel 54 (Pixel 2 Red). Long story short while you changing value of the white channel on any pixel the next pixel starts emiting red.

For further undertanding I took a TetraX GDTF library and deleted all RGB modes which gave me library with only one DMX break and when I used this library in Vision, then it starting to do what it should. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199172

Auto Hide Palettes permanently revealed if you edit a worksheet

Hello,
Fairly obscure this one, but I've been using the Window>Palettes>Auto Hide Docked palettes a lot for video presentations and general work.
If you create a worksheet and have it opened on the screen (not placed on the page yet) if you close it, then all the docked palettes come back onto the screen.
If you go to the command it shows that it is still ticked. So you have to uncheck and re tick to carry on. This can be seen in a blank file, movie enclosed.

Cheers,
Peter 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-193581

Site Model Hardscape Cutting Often Leaves Gaps Between Adjacent Objects

The attached file contains a modified Site Model with several Draped Hardscapes that are adjacent to each other (their edges share the exact same geometry). The Hardscapes are set to cut the Site Model.

Note that the Site Model has a series of small gaps in-between the Hardscapes, where it fails to get cut (see attached screenshot).

This only seems to happen when the shared edge of the Hardscapes is curved.

All of the Hardscapes have their Simplification Tolerance set to 0".

The same problem technically happened in previous versions with Landscape Areas, but it isn't very common to have two adjacent Landscape Areas so it wasn't much of an issue. With Hardscapes, having adjacent objects seems to be pretty common. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

I would like to know about the following two points.
1) Is it possible to install Vectorworks 2023?
2) If Vectorworks 2023 can be installed, will Vectorworks 2023 work properly? (Are there any restrictions on the operation of Vectorworks 2023?)

*From a dealer, there was a user who wanted to purchase Sueface Pro 9 (SQ® 3/5G), and asked if Vectorworks would work.
(As for AutoCAD, it seems that the manufacturer responded that it does not work.)

*Microsoft states in the Tech specs on the following page, "[15] Surface Pro 9 (SQ® 3/5G) comes with Windows 11 Home on ARM. At this time, Surface Pro 9 (SQ® 3/5G) with Windows 11 Home on ARM will not install some games and CAD software, and some third-party drivers or anti-virus software."
https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/d/surface-pro-9/93vkd8np4fvk?activetab=pivot:fulltechspecstab

VB-198691

Path Hardscape has small bumps

Open file 'path hardscape bumps.vwx'.

The selected hardscape is a *boundary* path hardscape which has small bumps at some parts. The bumps can be seen more clearly when the hardscape is zoomed in from the sides.

VB-199168

Windows Only - Sweep Segment Angle using 5.62° Default on first creation.

This looks to be a Windows only issue, not seen on MacOS. 
# Draw a simple polyline (similar to attached video)
# With the Polyline selected, Go to Model>Sweep
# Use any value for the Segment Angle that isn't the Default 5.62° (Suggest 45° or 90°)
# Click OK
# Look at the Sweep object in Iso View & in Shaded (will like Image 1)
# Make ant of the following changes:
** Ctrl+Drag to Copy
** Change Fill Color
** Change Segment Angle
** Add Texture
** Possibly more....
# Notice the Sweep has change to use the Segment Angle Value given instead of Default 5.62° (will look like Image 2)

If the file is saved, closed, and reopened before step 6, the file will reopen with the correct Segment Angle Value (like Image 2).

Found this issue when looking into VB-199165.

Issue also seen in VW 29.0.1 & VW29.0.2 and I don't see this reported already.

Tested VW28.0.6, working as expected 		Hernán Stamati

# Custom Color ='Speaker'.'CustomColor'
# Weight ='Speaker'.'BxWeight'
# Mounting Details ='Speaker'.'MountingDetails'
# Position ='Speaker'.'BxLoc'
# Purpose ='Speaker'.'BXPurpose'

VB-197656

Wall Components don't disappear when turning off Classes if the wall is inside a symbol

Hello!  This is a bit of an odd one and I think it's technically Working As Designed.  If we turn off the Component Classes for a wall, we would expect the component to go away, which it does.  If the wall is in a symbol, the component will go away, but there will also be a white rectangle where it once was.

It's kind of like what it looks like if all the components are off; the wall will just display as a solid rectangle.  

Please let me know if this is intentional or if it could be a bug with using walls inside symbols.  Thank you for your time and have a great evening!  :)  		Christopher Graye

VB-196443

Polyline tool: Unable to create an open circle-shaped polyline with touching ends.

I'm trying to create a circle-shaped polyline that is not Closed (not marked as 'Closed') while its ending vertices are touching each other (i.e. to create a polyline which fully encloses a circle shape which is not marked as 'Closed').

Attached is a screen video [^screen-vid.mp4] showing the ways I tried to achieve this.

1) I use the 'Point on Arc' mode of the Polyline tool:
Initially an open circle-shaped polyline is created.
Using the Reshape tool, I tried adding a new arc segment at the end while keeping the circle-shape so that the start and end points of the polyline match (without marking the polyline Closed!). This doesn't work, it always leaves an open segment at the end.

2) Using the Polyline tool I created a circle-shaped polyline as a sequence of corner and arc vertices (as shown in the video).
Initially a closed circle-shaped polyline is created.
I made it Open (removed the Closed tag) which removes the last segment.
Again using the Reshape tool I tried to add a new arc segment at the end so that the start and end points of the circle-shaped polyline match, but again without success.

(I need this to be able to create a Pathway Hardscape that models a circular pathway with touching endings, (i.e. which mimics a torus-shape).
note that the Pathway Hardscape's object path must always be an open poly, i.e. its center-line must always have a clearly defined starting and ending vertices.) 		Christopher Graye
VB-193499

Roof Face: Profile overlapping clipped edge does not conform to Eave Cut options

This was reported over 5 years ago and is still an issue: VB-141655

To replicate (see video):
1) create a roof face
2) clip a rectangular area on the inside of the roof face profile
--> the Hole Cut setting is applied to the edge of the hole
3) clip a rectangular area that overlaps the outer edge of the roof face profile
--> the Eave Cut setting is not applied to the new edge on the roof face.

The slab's profile is only modified along the original edge of the roof face, not new (and parallel) edges. 		Christopher Graye
VB-197660

SplitPolylineByMultiple2DLoci result depends on current zoom level

The attached file contains a polyline and a locus. The following code should split the polyline at the locus. It succeeds at 30% zoom, but fails at 100%. I ran the code in the CTestStubMenuItem_EventSink::Execute() function (the Debug->Test menu command).

{code:c++}
gSDK->SetUndoMethod(kUndoSwapObjects);
VWLayerObj layer = gSDK->GetActiveLayer();
auto locus = std::find_if(layer.begin(), layer.end(), VWLocus2DObj::IsLocus2DObject);
auto poly = std::find_if(layer.begin(), layer.end(), VWPolygon2DObj::IsPoly2DObject);
if (locus != layer.end() && poly != layer.end())
{
VWPoint2D pt = VWLocus2DObj {*locus}.GetPoint();
VectorWorks::TVWArray_WorldPt pts;
VectorWorks::TVWArray_MCObjectHandle result;
pts.Append(pt);
gSDK->SplitPolylineByMultiple2DLoci(*poly, pts, true, true, result);
}
gSDK->EndUndoEvent();
{code} 		Christopher Graye

VB-196997

Offset Tool - Default Fillet Radius value is invalid

Clear the VW user folder.
Open VW, select the Offset tool.
The Fillet Radius field in the Mode Bar is set to 0 (which is not a valid value).
If you open the Offset settings dialog from the Mode Bar, you cannot press OK because it says that the current radius value is not valid. 		Christopher Graye

VB-195584

When using the the 2D Polygon Tool on a Symbol in Inner Boundary Mode, it doesn't respect the current class visibilities contained within the Symbol when they are off.

I have attached a file containing a nested symbol of a ballroom model.   This model has the ceiling model turned off (1 Venue-Ceiling-XXX)

When I try to fill in a segment of the ballroom with the 2D Polygon Tool in Inner Boundary Mode on the symbol.   (So I can hatch a section of the room to show it's unavailable/unused). 

Though the ceiling classes are turned off, the 2D polygon tool still will fill the currently invisible ceiling parts,  such as the soffit, ceiling tiles, clouds etc as if they were visible,   Rather than only filling using only the currently visible portions of the symbol from the walls to the airwall lines.

[^2D Polygon Tool - Inner Boundary Mode.mp4]

  		Christopher Graye
VB-197237

Split Tool: alt key instead of ctrl key

If with Mac we select the Split Tool and then keep the command-key pressed, it will switch to the Selection Tool while the command-key is pressed.

With Windows it is expected that the same to happen if we keep the control-key pressed, but instead its the alt-key that does this.

Since the Windows control-key is the equivalent of the Mac command-key, we believe that the alt-key is the wrongly set for Windows. Please take a look at this. Thank you in advance. 		Christopher Graye
VB-198429

Offset on polygon with custom record detaches

From user Joe Hanauer:

_"I just ran into an issue. A closed polygon with a record format attached._
_Do an offset line._ _Record format disappears from the data tab."_
 
I confirmed. I know this technically creates a new object which is probably why the newly created object does not have the record attached but it would be expected an offset would maintain the original record.
 
I shared a workaround with using Data Manager to automatically assign records to specific classes but again, this does not follow our mission of being a software that is intuitive. Thank you. 		Christopher Graye

VB-193978

UserDataNode missing after modifying a polygon

In the file attached there is a simple polygon. It has custom data stored in a *UserDataNode* attached to its *AUX* list.

When a user modifies the polygon using common menus and tools such as {_}clip, combine, etc.{_}, the *UserDataNode* is no longer present. 

Known tools and commands with this behavior (probably incomplete)
* Split Tool                                                           {color:#c1c7d0}*L*{color}
* {color:#172b4d}Trim Tool{color}                                                           {color:#c1c7d0}*SHIFT+ALT+L*{color}
* {color:#172b4d}Menu: Modify > Add Surface                           {color}{color:#c1c7d0}*CTRL+SHIFT+ALT+A*{color}
* {color:#172b4d}Menu: Modify > Clip Surface                           {color}{color:#c1c7d0}*CTRL+SHIFT+ALT+A*{color}
* Menu: Modify > Intersect Surface{color:#505f79}                    {color}{color:#c1c7d0}*CTRL+SHIFT+ALT+A*{color}
* {color:#172b4d}Menu: Modify > Combine Into Surface            {color}{color:#c1c7d0}*CTRL+SHIFT+ALT+A*{color}

{color:#172b4d}
*Prerequisites:* The Debug Menu with the _Debug List View Ext_ command must be installed.

*1.* {color}Open the attached file
*2.* Selected the polygon and open the {color:#172b4d}_Debug List View_ in the _Debug_ menu{_}.{_}
*3.* Click on _Find Selected Object_ to jump to the polygon.
    *↪* Notice there are several nodes in the *AUX* list. Among them is a
        *UserDataNode* of Typ {color}{{'CWXT'}}{color:#172b4d} and a {*}RecordNode{*}.
*4.* Close the _Debug List View_ and performe one of the mentioned
    operations to modify the polygon. e.g. Split the polygon in half.
*5.* Open the _Debug List View_ and jump to the polygon again. (see step {*}3.{*})
    *↪* Notice there are still several nodes in the *AUX* list,
        including some UserData nodes and the *RecordNode* from before.
        The *UserDataNode* (Typ {{{}'CWXT'{}}}) from before however is gone.
{color} 		Christopher Graye
VB-195136

T02250 - Split tool should have plane options disabled

The new interface has an updated plane selector directly in the mode bar, which is enabled during relevant tools & interactions, and disabled when not applicable.

The Split tool does not act based on planes; it always works perpendicular to the screen. However, in the preview build the plane selector is enabled for this tool. It should be disabled. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198121

When executing "Flip Horizontal" or "Flip Vertical", the gruop object may move to an unintended position.

Steps to reproduce

1) Open an attached file. (13235.vwx)
*The file contains group objects and non-group objects.

2) Change the current view to "Front".

3) Select the group object and execute "Flip Vertical" to move the group object downward.

*For objects that are not groups, it works correctly.
 Also, in the case of "horizontal flip", it works correctly even with group object.

4) Change the current view to "Right".

5) Select the group object and execute "Flip Horizontal" to move the group shape to the right.

*For objects that are not groups, it works correctly.

6) Select the group object and execute "Flip Vertical" to move the group object downward.

*For objects that are not groups, it works correctly.

 

*There is no problem in the case of Top/Plan view.

*As long as I tried, this doesn't seem to occur in Vectorworks2020,2019.

 

Please refer to attached files. (13235.vwx and 13235.mov) 		Hernán Stamati
VB-194971

Niche calculation for Space not working

In this file, we have 2 space object bounded by a shared wall. This wall has several US Windows. Both Spaces have the correct settings to incluse the windows niches. One Space has a correct path, the other one has an incorrect path.

It seems this is not a Space issue. More likely a ISDK::AssociateBoundedObjectWithWallsAndApplyOffset() issue.

This bug was found with German windows, but I've replaced them by US windows. 		Jürgen Keser

VB-192591

Roof Shows Missing Geometry After Changing Pitch

To reproduce:

- Edit any one of the faces
- Change the Pitch to either 26º or 27º

Note that a portion of one of the Roof's faces disappears (see attached screenshot).

If you change the pitch of the entire Roof instead of just one face, the problem won't happen.

This also worked incorrectly in VW 2022, though the result was different than in 2023. 		Christopher Graye
VB-198131

Create roof truss

Create roof truss draws the rafters above the roof surfaces if you have both roof surfaces active. Only 1 roof surface works. Christopher Graye
VB-193418

Converting polyline vertexes from Radius to Arc

I've not noticed this behavior prior to 28 SP4 Beta, but after tracing a polyline to outline and simplify an existing shape using radius arcs, when altering it by clipping or anything else, many of the radius vertexes used to draw it are being converted to Arc vertext. This is not my preferred way of working with polylines, I assume it is the same for many of our users, it a polyline is drawn using Radius vertex controls, it should remain radius vertexes if it is offset or clipped if at all possible.

The shape shown, the inside line was constructed using circles and fillets, then offset, the vertexes are a mix of radius and arc vertexes. I've seen it in other situations, as well.

!image-2023-02-14-08-18-26-386.png|width=474,height=232! 		Christopher Graye

In the attached file, marqueeing over multiple vertices as shown, then dragging them up or down, displays an incorrect preview as shown in the screengrab. Christopher Graye

VB-196089

Fillet tool: units do not display/ update

In the fillet tool, when you enter in distance, it does not display the units. If you enter in 13, it will keep it as inches, not show 13" or 1'-1" If you are working in ft & inches and enter a value of 50cm it displays the cm until you switch tools and come back, then it will show 50cm converted to inches. This is different from the OIP, where units are shown properly as soon as you enter the value. This does not affect the functionality of the tool, it just shows an inconsistency. This is in v29, but goes back to at least 2022. Christopher Graye

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When using the Connect/Combine Tool on two Roof Face Objects, a gap between those objects and the wall remains and it shouldn't. If we switch the top Roof Face object angle from 0,00 to 0,001 the tool will now connect both Roof Face Objects correctly without the aforementioned gap. 		Christopher Graye

VB-193884

Deleting Segments While Drawing Polylines Causes the Wrong Shape

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few loci that can be used as snap points.

To reproduce:

- Activate the Polyline tool in "Tangent Arc Mode"
- Draw an object using the snap points on the left as shown

Note that the shape of the resulting Polyline is correct.

- Now delete the poly
- Draw another poly using the same snap points, but this time place the last point in the wrong location (as if you accidentally mis-clicked)
- Press the Delete key to undo that last click

Note that the click doesn't get undone on the first Delete, and even if you press Delete a few more times and then try to complete the object you can't get it back to a state where it'll draw the correct shape.

You can see the same thing with the Polyline tool's "Point on Arc Mode", using the snap points on the right. Note that the final shape doesn't get closed, as if the tool is ignoring the final click.

The same thing happens going back to at least VW 2020 so this might be a known issue, but I couldn't find any other reports in JIRA. 		Christopher Graye

VB-192805

Viewer Installer: path / directory changes

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When in the path / directory section we can see that originally is:
/Applications/Vetorworks 2023 Viewer

If we click on the button to choose a path / directory to install the Viewer and then click OK to come back to the Viewer Dialog, we can see that the part "Vectorworks 2023 Viewer" has disappeared.

We would expect that "/Vectorworks 2023 Viewer" would remain in the path. Meaning, when we click on the "Applications" folder then we expect the folder "Vectorworks 2023 Viewer" to be installed in there and not loose files inside of "Applications". 		Tim Ardoin

VB-199098

Splitting a shape assigned a line type of [a complex line type] may result in an incorrect shape.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2024, 2023, 2022, 2021, 2020,2019
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Splitting a shape assigned a line type of [a complex line type] may result in an incorrect shape.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open the sample file (Sample230904_1_v2023.vwx).

2) Split the polygon on the left side of the sample file using the [Line Split Mode] of the Split tool.

3) There is no problem with the bottom polyline.

However, polygons assigned a line type of [a complex line type] containing the letters top and middle are displayed with an incorrect shape.


*Remarks*
* This problem also occurs in [Point Split Mode] and [Line Trim mode] of the Split Tool.

* In the sample file, after splitting, the shape converted to polyline can be displayed in its original shape by converting it to polygon.

* We have confirmed that the shape is also incorrect when a line type of [a complex line type] containing text is assigned to [Polyline], [Circle], or [Oval].

* We have not been able to confirm this problem with general Dashed and complex line types that do not include Text.

* The longer the straight line part of a complex line type that includes Text, the more likely it is to reproduce the problem.

*Findings*
It is possible to display the image in its original shape by converting it to polygon after splitting, but we think it needs to be modified.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198784

SBE: OnSetInteractiveSizingParams returns incorrect value eISZ_CornerConfig

Please watch attached movie. Despite I dragged the mouse to the end of the wall,  eISZ_CornerConfig.currentValue became 1.00000 (CornerAtWallStart) which is obviously wrong.

I assume that VW goes for the insertion point or assumed center of the PIO instead of the actual location of the cursor (actually, the insertion point of this PIO is NOT at its center).

To reproduce, just copy attached plug-in into your plug-ins folder and use attached testfile.

Mac, Debug, 29.0.x, CL 794XXX 		Christopher Graye
VB-196536

VS command vsoGetIntSzingParams() does not compile

VS command vsoGetIntSzingParams() does not compile in VW 2024 beta1 (704629), nor in VW 2023 SP5 (702742).

The compiler generates the error: "Identifier not declared" on Line 70, containing this command.

However, it does compile in VW 2023 SP0 (668937). I did not check the middle versions of VW 2023 to determine when it stopped working. 

See attached file. It is saved in VW 2023 format for your convenience, and contains a script with all of the functions released in VW 2023. It is meant to be compiled only. It does not run (nicely). Remove Line 70 and the rest of the functions compile. 		Christopher Graye

VB-192749

Edit Wall Tool Highlights Curtain Wall Frames/Panels Incorrectly in 2023

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Curtain Wall.

To reproduce:

- Activate the Edit Wall tool in Edit frames and Panels Mode
- Click-select a frame or panel

Note that it works fine at this point.

- Now click in empty space
- Try to click-select a frame/panel again

Note that now it gets treated kind of like a marquee selection, and the wrong frames/panels get selected. This happens even if you deactivate and reactivate the tool, but it goes away once any frame/panel is selected.

In VW 2022, before the new Edit Wall tool was added, clicking in empty space with the Edit Curtain Wall tool did not cause the Wall to get de-selected, so this problem didn't happen.

The same thing happens going back to 2023 SP0. 		Christopher Graye

VB-195799

Import design layers breaks walls and doors

VB-194454

Door Jamb/Wall opening line weight not shown, notch in wall when jamb is zero depth/width

I was speaking to a customer and they were curious about showing a door within a wall with jamb settings set to zero. They set the jamb to depth & width to zero and the line weight around the wall stopped where the jamb was supposed to be, so it looked like there was no line in the wall opening where the door is inserted. I haven't seen this issue in previous versions, and when I tried to replicate the issue I noticed that there is a certain order of steps to receive that result. When doing different orders of operations when changing the settings of the door jamb depth and width, I have noticed a very small notch in the wall where the jamb was and the wall line is broken there as well.

So there are two issues: the wall opening lines that do not show, and the small notch. Both occur when editing the door jamb width and depth settings a certain way.

I have replicated this in their file and in a blank file, and those files are attached and a video of me explaining the process is attached. Also I was speaking to Neil Barman about this and he was able to replicate as well. Please reach out if there are questions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-194164

Barn Door reports wrong size due to overlap

In the attached file, I have a Barn Door plug-in object whose size is selected to be defined "by leaf", and I have set the door to be 3' wide by 8' tall. The door also has a jamb and head overlap defined as 2". As you  can see, this makes the leaf actually 3'-4" wide and 8'-2" tall. In order to be consistent, Barn Doors should default to "by opening", or the leaf size as reported in the Object Info Palette should account for the overlap, since that overlap does in fact increase the leaf size. Otherwise, the size reported on the door schedule and the size dimensioned on the door legend will not be the same. Christopher Graye
VB-194616

Open casement window does not appear in 2D

User submitted a file where he has a custom window configuration of three rows where the middle row has open casement windows

He can see the swing path in top plan but cannot see the actual window is open.

I found that the window will show up if the casement is in the top row, or that it is in the only row (I have attached a screen shot of a new blank file) 		Christopher Graye
VB-196685

Replacing Window Style removes/add columns to the window

* Hello team,

This file seems to have a problem when replacing the user's custom window styles. I tried to Reset All Plugins but this did not help. 

Steps:
* Open the file
* Select one of the Windows inserted into the wall
Replace their style with _DS_W&D/WN: Type02_ style
* The 3D representation of the window will be displayed with 3 columns instead of 2 like the style.
* Replacing the _DS_W&D/WN: Type02_ style with the _DS_W&D/WN: Type05_ will result in the window being displayed in 3D with 1 column only instead of 2.

I have to to manually replace each window in the building with the updated one from resource-pallet. Just to mark a window and use "replace style", or editing plugin-style will not update all properties of the windows already in use in building.

VB-194382

When showing the "operation direction" of "Sliding" in the door tool, the display of "operation direction" may be incorrect depending on the settings.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When showing the "operation direction" of "Sliding" in the door tool, the display of "operation direction" may be incorrect depending on the settings.

The Marker object of "operation direction" has difference with display shape both VW2022 and VW2023. 

Steps to reproduce on VW2023. 
1) Open Vectorworks2023.
2) Select Door tool on tool palette.
Click  'Door Preferences' button on the mode bar >'Door Preferences' dialog >Select 'General' Pane > Configuration: Sliding
Operation: XX
3) Select '2D Visualization' pane > check "Show Openration direction".
4) Place the door on the work screen. Arrow markers also appear to overlap each other.

Steps to reproduce with VW2022.
1) Open Vectorworks2022.
2) Select Door tool on tool palette.
Click  'Door Preferences' button on the mode bar >'Door Preferences' dialog >Select  '2D Visualization' pane > check the box "Show operation direction".
The arrow for the opening direction is displayed correctly for the sliding door.
Place the door on the work screen. 
Arrow markers will appear correctly shape.

Furthermore,
3) Save the file. (Sample13127.vwx)
4) Open the file saved in 4) with Vectorworks2023.

*The shape of arrow for the opening direction will be changing.

Compare with Vectorworks2022 (v2022PDF.pdf).
Overall, the "operation direction" marker (straight line with marker) is short, depending on the width of the door, the markers on both ends will overlap each other.
—
*Remarks*
* Even with the window tool, if I display "operation direction" with "Sliding", it will be in the same state.
(There was no "Show operation direction" option in the window tools in v2022.)

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Christopher Graye

VB-194829

Detail Callout Style; "Use At Creation" not being respected for insertion class attributes

In this file there's a Detail Callout Style: [^DetailCalloutStyle2.vwx]

This style is set to insert on the "2D-Detail Boundary" class which has the desired attributes and is set to "Use At Creation." 

Make sure the Attributes palette is NOT set up to use Class Attributes. Draw a Detail Callout marker using this style.

The object is placed onto "2D-Detail Boundary" class, but the object is not being drawn with Class Attributes despite the object's class dictating that it should be. So the "Use at Creation" checkmark isn't doing its job in this specific context. 		Christopher Graye

VB-197649

T02345 - Door Handing Widgets Show Even When Options are Set By-Style

The attached file contains a few styled Doors that use different by-style/by-instance states for the new handing options.

Note that the new handing widgets display even when the by-style state prohibits it from actually doing anything.

When all three of the new handing options are set to by-style, both of the handing widgets become hidden, so ideally we would hide the widgets individually in cases like this where only some of the options are set to by-style. 		Christopher Graye
VB-197655

T02345: Right/Left parameters should be related to exterior side of insert and reversing sides of a wall should toggle the Interior Side parameter of the wall's inserts when possible.

These problems are all related so I placed them in the same VB.  Please see the attached video (with audio).

*The problems boiled down to:*
# *Reverse Sides* button for wall should toggle the *Interior Side* parameter in that wall's inserts between left and right.
# *Left/Right Sidelights* and *Top Shapes* should always be relative the the inserts interior side as defined by its *Interior Side* parameter. 		Christopher Graye
VB-197673

T02348: Interactive Creation of Corner Windows result in incorrect Width.

# Open the attached VWX file.
# Use the Window tool in Interactive Sizing mode to insert instances of Style "Window A".
# Start drawing the window in Top/Plan by clicking at the intersection of the wall and one of the blue guidelines then move the cursor past the end of the wall at the corner.
{*}BUG{*}: Notice the window's width in the floating data bar is not as expected and should be {*}3'0"{*}.
# Finish creating the window by clicking past the end of the wall at the corner.
{*}BUG{*}: Notice the window's width is incorrect making the side of the window fall short of the first click point.
# Move the resizing handle at the side of the window nearest the guidline and snap to the guideline to correct it.
# Move the resizing handle of the window at the wall end and move it away from the corner to automatically change the window to a regular window.  Note the other side of the window remains in correct position at the guideline.
# Move the same resizing handle past the end of the wall to make it a corner window again.
{*}BUG{*}: Notice the window's width is incorrect making the other side of the window fall short of the guideline. 		Christopher Graye

First, I would assume that Outswing would mean that doors open to the exterior side of the wall, and Inswing to the interior side. Second, if I change the "Interior" from the Right Side to the Left Side, then the door swing should flip from in to out, not left to right. Christopher Graye

VB-198210

T02345 - Door Handing Crank Widget Has No Effect on Multi-Operation Folding Doors

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains two Folding-type Doors with different Operations (one uses "Bi-Fold Single" and one uses "Multiple").

Note that the "Multiple" door has two separate options for Left and Right Swing Direction, and the handing crank widget has no effect on these options.

It seems like the crank widget should either be hidden in this case, or it should toggle the In/Out state of both the Left and Right Swing Direction options. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198221

T02345 - Asymmetrical Top Shape Options Fail to Adjust Left/Right State When Interior Side is Changed

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Windows and Doors that use one of the asymmetrical Top Shapes, which have Left and Right options to control the slope direction.

To reproduce, change the Interior Side for any object.

Note that the slope direction remains the same.

I might be misunderstanding this, but since these options are defined by Left/Right and the object's overall left/right orientation is determined by the Interior Side (always looking inward from the exterior), it seems like changing the Interior Side should always change the visible direction of the slope. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198332

T02346 - Wall Closure Gaps Affect Doors/Windows Even When "Use Wall Provided Gaps" is Disabled

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains two in-wall Doors.

To reproduce:
* Select one of the Doors and enable the "Use wall provided gaps" option
* Now open the Wall Closures dialog and apply gap values as shown

Note that the gaps are applied as expected.
* Now select the other Door and, this time with the "Use wall provided gaps" option disabled, open the Wall Closures dialog
* Again apply gap values

Note that the Door is still affected by these changes, even though "Use wall provided gaps" is disabled. The gaps aren't getting created correctly (they cut inward toward the middle of the Door instead of outward toward the wall) but I don't think they should be showing at all in this case. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198383

T02348 - Window/Door Resize Handles Show on Interior Face of Wall

The attached file contains an in-wall Window and Door in VW 2023 format.

Note that, in VW 2023, the blue resize handles show on the center of the jamb in 3D views (see first attached screenshot).

In VW 2024, note that the handles show on the interior face of the Wall.

The T02348 task doc (F7) shows that we've added plugin support to control the location of the handles along the width of the Wall, but it doesn't say that our Windows and Doors implemented it, and it indicates that it should also happen in 2D (it's currently only happening in 3D). The task doc (in R7) also states that the control points should be on the exterior face of the Wall, and they're currently on the interior face. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198591

Errant 3D Face showing in Hidden Line Render of window with Half Gothic Top Shape

The attached "VB HidLn VP of Half Gothic Window.vwx" file has some sheet layer viewports of three windows inserted in walls.  All three windows have a Top Shape of "Half Gothic".  Notice the geometry looks fine in shaded view but there is an errant 3D face when rendered in Hidden Line.

{*}EDIT{*}: Looking at the 3D geometry of the window shows that the jamb and sash both have self-intersecting geometry.  These top shapes have always had issues but it looks the hidden line render is having more issues with them.  Since the core of the issue is bad geometry, I think we need to fix this by improving the geometry.

[~jwarshaw]:  This really points to geometry issues with the following three Window Top Shapes:
* Half Ellipse:  The top of the sash is incorrectly drawn to the top of the top jamb.
* Half Gothic:  The top of the sash is incorrectly drawn to the top of the top jamb.
* Gothic:  The sash does not follow the shape of the jamb

See "Window Top Shape Geometry Issues.vwx". 		Christopher Graye
VB-198598

T02345: Window - Custom Sash Handing related parameter defaults should be the same as their corresponding parameters in the main Window Settings dialog

# Create a new blank document.
# Select the Window tool and click the tool prefs button in the tool bar to open the Window Preferences dialog.
# Set the Sash to "Custom" and click on the "Custom Configuration Options…" button to open the corresponding dialog.
# Try setting the Selected Sash "Configuration" to all of the possible options and note the new handing parameter default settings.

The results (parameters in {color:#de350b}*red*{color} have the wrong default):
* {*}Awning{*}:
** {color:#de350b}{*}Open Direction{*}: *In*{color} (should be {*}Out{*})
* {*}Casement{*}:
** Hinge Side: *Left* (correct)
** {color:#de350b}{*}Open Direction{*}: *In*{color} (should be {*}Out{*})
* {*}Fixed Glass{*}: N/A
* {*}Hopper{*}:
** Open Direction: *In* (correct)
* {*}Hung{*}: N/A
* {*}Sliding{*}:
** Cative Sash Location: *In* (correct)
* {*}Tilt/Turn{*}:
** {color:#de350b}{*}Open Direction{*}: *In*{color} (should be {*}Out{*})
* {*}Vertical Pivot{*}:
** Opens Out Toward: Left (correct) 		Christopher Graye

VB-192728

Unnecessary material is generated if Pocket-Use exposed pocket recess is checked on doors and Jamb Depth exceeds Wall's Thickness.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023(Occurs from previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Steps to reproduce.
1) Create a wall (example: Thickness 150)
2) Door Tool > Door Tool Preferences >
General pane > Configuration: Pocket
Configuration: Pocket pane > Check "Use exposed pocket recess"
3) Insert the door into the wall.
4) Object Info Palette > Door In Wall > Set the Jamb Depth value to 151.
   Unnecessary material is generated.

Unnecessary material is generat when Jamb Depth is set to Wall's Thickness or more
Jamb Depth does not spawn below Wall's Thickness (Correct)

Please refer to attached "sample13071.vwx","sample13071.pdf",and "sample13071_2.pdf". 

*Remarks
In Japan, this type of Pocket door is used frequently, so I guess that the "Use exposed pocket recess" function was adopted at the request of Japan, but at least in Japan, there is no such unnecessary material.

(It seems to have occurred since the "Use exposed pocket recess" was added. 2021?)

[Priority: Critical]
From support section - This bug significantly reduces the value of the entire standard door tool, so please fix it immediately.

If this material in other countries, please hide it in settings or classes.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-194024

Window/Door Tags in Graphic Legends can have mirrored text

In the attached document and screenshots, we have a window in a Graphic Legend with mirrored text.  We made this window by mirroring an existing window in the file, but it's also possible to see these happen in a document by having windows/doors that have been flipped or using windows/doors on walls on opposite ends of the building.

We can work around this by grouping Windows or by flipping/mirroring them in the Design Layers, but it'd be great if there was a quick and easy solution for users encountering this in their files. 

Any assistance is appreciated and have a great day!  :) 		Christopher Graye
VB-198728

2022 Site modifier "contour" mode and 2023 site modifier "open edge" work differently

The "Open Edge" modifier in 2023 does not modify the site model as it did in previous versions of Vectorworks. It would be expected that if an Open Edge modifier were drawn on a specific elevation representing a specific contour elevation that the result would show a site model with that contour elevation running directly through it unless, of course, the set elevation did not fall into the contour intervals set in the site model settings. For example, if the site model settings has minor contour intervals set to 1-foot, and the Open Edge modifier was set at an elevation of 5 feet, then the resulting contour should align exactly. If set to 5.5 feet, then it would interpolate. 

 

The problem seems to occur more often on "fills" rather than "cuts". In the attached example attached notice how the top contour drawn (Open Edge modifier) does not have the site models contour following it.

!image-2023-08-18-11-33-41-125.png!

Original source:
[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/110079-help-what-has-replaced-the-create-objects-from-shapessite-modifiercontour-feature/] 

 

FYI [~bstanchev] [~kollikainen]  		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-196266

Structural Member Line Types Fail to Get Replaced When Resource is Deleted

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Structural Member that shows Below Plane attributes, where all the attributes use "Line Type 1".

To reproduce:

- In the Resource Manager, delete "Line Type 1"
- Choose to replace it with "Line Type 2"

Note that the SM initially shows the correct Line Type, but if you open the Settings dialog you'll see that it has "None" set as the Line Type. Once you close the Settings dialog, the lines on the SM will all change to solid.

By comparison, Material/Texture/Class resources all seem to get replaced correctly on SMs.

This is a regression from VW 2023. 		Christopher Graye

- Change the Start Bound and End Bound to the Story levels shown

Note that the change fails on both objects.

If you edit each object individually, or if you do the multi-edit from the OIP, this problem won't happen.

This only seems to happen when the edit involves switching _to_ a Story level. If you go the opposite direction (it's currently using a Story level and you switch to "Layer Elevation"), it works fine.

VB-196893

Structural member: Change vertex mode doesn't change vertex from corner to smooth

As seen in the attached video, I am trying to curve a beam that I have initially drawn using Linear Insertion mode. After initial insertion, I have added a vertex to the beam. Subsequently, the change vertex mode doesn't seem to work on that newly added vertex (or at least I can't seem to get it to work in a way I would expect it to.)

If I am doing the process incorrectly, please let me know. I am simply trying to modify the beam using the same logic and techniques that I would modify a polyline.

(I do see that the change vertex mode will work on a structural member initially drawn with Poly Insertion mode, but it is reasonable to expect that users may start with a straight member and then modify it using the provide reshape tools afterwards, especially since we are providing the modes to add, remove, and change a vertex.)  		Christopher Graye
VB-197615

T02350 - Structural Member Settings dialog is not resizable

The Structural Member Settings dialog hosts some list browser controls but the dialog is not resizable. This affects the usability of the dialog because it's not possible to resize the dialog to read all the data in the list browsers.
Our UI guidelines state that all dialogs that contain list browser controls must be resizable.  		Christopher Graye
VB-193847

"Structure Member" in Join state may not be able to be moved with the selection tool.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
I could not move the "Structure Member" in Join state with the selection tool.

Steps to reproduce_1
1) Open the sample file [Sample230303.vwx].
2)  Select both only one Structural Member and all the Structural Members arranged in a square shape (5 in total).
3) Move it to any place with the Selection Tool.
4) It does not move even if I try to move the combined structural members with the selection tool.

Steps to reproduce_2
Please try this steps also.
1)Create new shee and et drawing scale to 1:50 on VW2023SP2.
2) Select 'structural member' tool and confirm a mode  'Linear Member Style',
   'Auto Join Members Mode'.
3) Draw structural member to T shape with join.
4) Select Selection tool and move T shape structural member object.
It does works fine.
5) Adding one structural member that does not join existiong T shape structure menbers.
6) Drag only independent one structures to move after select T shape and independent 
   one structures.
   The dragging independent one structure will be moved however T shape structures does not.
7) After tring move operation, Two structure one and T shape, 
   there relative position will be wrong after execute undo command many times.
*Please refer the [Sample 2.vwx] file.

*Remarks*
- This does not occur in older versions.
- It has been confirmed that it does not reappear when moving with only the connected Structural Members selected.
- We have confirmed that when this problem occurs, the same problem continues until Vectorworks is restarted or the connection of the structural material is released.

VB-194969

Structural Member has no 3D geometry when Major/Minor Breadth/Width are set to certain values

See the attached video for examples, including:

Major Depth < 2*MinorDepth

Minor Depth = 0

This used to cause a crash, but after CL691999 it creates an SM with no 3D geometry.

In cases where the values are valid and it should be possible to create a corresponding SM, we need to do so.

In cases where it is impossible to generate a valid SM with the input values, we should have some code validating the inputs and prompt the user to correct them before we even close the dialog. 		Christopher Graye

VB-193958

Space record: duplicated field "Number of Occu"

The two fields have the same purpose:

+_11_Number of Occu_+

+_SpaceOccupancyRequirements_OccupancyNumber_+

Both can be edited through the additional info pane.

Since the default mapping of the Data Manager only uses the +_SpaceOccupancyRequirements_OccupancyNumber_+ we should make the other field invisible in all dialogs and the OIP. 		Christopher Graye
VB-198904

Spotlight: Restore Instrument Summary coloured border to same functionality as v2023

Hello,
This is purely a graphic regression but it's an important capability for some.
In previous versions if you place an instrument Summary (IS) on the page and have the Bounding Border Style set to Double, then if you change the colour fill only the border changes colour. This is the current functionality and is useful for those using the double border.
In v2024 if you try the same then the entire Instrument Summary's fill changes. This is not desired. Please see attached screenshots of the same IS in both v2023 and v2024.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-198789

Duplicate classes are showing up in Hierarchy view

In Hierarchy view...I have (i think) duplicate Label classes. I have no idea how it happened, and when I switch away from Hierarchy view, then the duplicates go away. I tried deleting one of the duplicate classes (that isn't shown as a sub class under the main prefix) and it deleted both the duplicate class and the real one. I am also having this issue in the latest 2023 build and I've had it with other non-label classes.  Karthick Chilaka
VB-195435

When a color palette is opened in color grid view in certain environments, the color grid portion is not displayed.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Win
v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When the color palette is opened in color grid view, the color grid may not be displayed.
When the mouse cursor is traced over an area where the color grid is not displayed, the color grid in the traced area becomes visible and can be selected.
Once the cursor is traced over an area, it will not disappear and the area will remain selectable.

*Remarks*
* The problem occurs even after restarting Vectorworks.
* The problem does not occur in the color list display.
* We could not confirm the problem in our company environment.
* The problem occurs only on the customer's specific PC.
* We will attach a screenshot of the problem when they occur in the customer's environment.
* We believe it is a graphics problem and have asked the customer to update the graphics (NVIDIA RTX A2000 12GB) to the latest driver and check the settings, but the problems have not improved.

*We have confirmed that the reproducibility is high when specific conditions are met.*
 
Conditions easy to reproduce:
* When the color palette is displayed and the scroll bar is visible

* When the color palette is opened, depending on the blank area, the color palette expansion may be split between the top and the bottom. When this is just near the switching point.

* As a finding, this seems to depend on the screen resolution.
We have confirmed that similar positions on machines with different resolutions are not reproducible.
This may be caused by the maximum range at which the color palette is expanded.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Josh Loy

VB-198632

CW - Spotlight - Hoist/Truss - Hoist adjustment inadvertently moves the truss

Hey guys,

The following situation:
3 layers of PreRig stacked on top of each other - all connected with drops. I have to constantly adjust the height of the PreRigs, so I only move this in height. You could probably say now that my mistake is that I'm not using "adjust system trim height," but manually moving the trusses via the z-coordinate. Okay, but it's happened now. The heights are final now, and I want to adjust the drops without having to redo all of them, and I don't want them to align with the center of the truss but with the bottom/top edge.
Problem: There are now motors that have chains that are too long. They are no longer connected to the lower PreRig layer, but due to the position of the upper hook, they've connected with the PreRig layer above. When I try to manually change this by adjusting the height of the upper hook, it doesn't shorten the chain (definitely a bug), but pulls the upper truss down as well. However, I don't want that (see video). Currently, I have to adjust the height of the upper hook twice in a row - then on the second attempt, it shortens the chain - and then adjust all trusses back to the correct height. This takes time, I'm essentially doing everything twice, and I might forget one. Additionally, Vectorworks always wants to delete the motors/drops of the upper layer of trusses.
Desired outcome: When I manually change the data of a chain hoist/drop, the truss shouldn't automatically move along with it, or I should be able to disable that somewhere. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-192606

Braceworks error with hinge < x°

Hi everybody and happy new year !

When everything is correctly connected with correct hinge angle, Braceworks doesn't calculate and error is : 2 structural elements can't occupy the same space.

I had to put 5° to hinge, without move the trusses, and then ther is no braceworks error. It looks like hinge have to be set at a minimum angle ? 		Kevin Linzey
VB-198649

Spotlight bridle configuration dialogue chain part error

In the bridle configuration dialogue moving a chain part (choke or STAC) in the leg parts list to change where it is in the leg will reset the chain to its maximum length.
Effectively this makes it impossible to correctly configure the leg parts if the leg needs to be edited (which is nearly always required)

in the attached file open the deadhang bridle, hit the bridle cofiguration button, select leg one and try moving the chain part to a different position in the part list. it wil lose the length configuration. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-197571

Spotlight hoist object preferences high hook bug

If you set a hoists high hook height in the hoist insertion tool preferences and then insert the hoist between a hanging point/structural member and truss,
the insertion tool ignores the high hook height set in the preferences and instead automatically extends the high hook of the hoist to its maximum length to reach the hanging point or before adding a deadhang bridle to extend to the hanging point.

The issue is that riggers often recieve truss plots with trusses already placed and trimmed to the required height. This means that they need to make sure the hoist has enough chain to reach the ground or the system will not work.
So the desired workflow would be to set the highhook height in the hoist insertion tool preferences and then insert the hoist to ensure that there is enought chain and that any needed bridle material is correctly caluclated without needing to go back and edit the hoist and or deadhang bridle after insertion. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-196615

Braceworks deletes objects

Hi all, would like to report a bug that I have noticed for the first time but a colleague has noticed many times and so far has not been fixed.

In the attached clip, I copy two trusses lying below each other, including motors, and paste them in a new layer at the same position. Then I move them twice and the second time I get the query: "Do you want to delete the chain hoists that were separated by the last action? Why does this query only appear now? I would understand it if it came with the first move, since the two outer points no longer go into the PreRigg. But what is much worse is that if I press OK now, it deletes one or perhaps even several points in the plan that have nothing at all to do with it. This must not happen under any circumstances. I had this happen several times in the file with the query and was surprised that points where I was 100% sure that I had drawn them were gone.
The colleague told me that his headlights had also been extinguished.

Attention, I have the German version. It should also be possible to select this in Jira under Language. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-197530

Wrong Fixture Rotation from Capture MVR Export

This may be related to VB-194919 but I am submitting it as a separate bug as it doesn't seem quite the same. But my gut tells me it is something with how 

I have attached the file he submitted along with the report

This is the description from what the user submitted: 

Exporting (FIXTURES ONLY) form capture as a MVR file. Import MVR files back into capture everything is fine. How ever when import the MVR file into Vectorworks 2023 I experience the following. The fixtures that have different ROTATION info than what VWX understands ends up being located positionally at 0,0 on the MVR import. A fixture that has ROTATIONAL value of X -0.0º , Y -0.0º , X 0º imports into VWX perfectly. A fixture that has ROTATIONAL value of X 0.0º , Y -0.0º , X 0º imports into VWX wrong and is LOCATED at 0,0 in the drawing. This also happens with fixtures rotated at other degrees. I think it has to do with the Value combination.

Steps: Happens every time I import a MVR file from capture that has values or a format that vectorworks doesn't recognize. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-193398

Reverse Two Leg Bridles will not update the weight on the Hoist or the House Rigging Point

When using Reversed Two Leg Bridle tool with a Hoist, neither the House Rigging Point or the Hoist/Motor will report the correct values.  

This was submitted by a user Charles Arrata (charles@projx.ca) and I've done some testing with it here and would like to report it to see if this is working as designed or a potential bug in Braceworks.  

If we use the Bridle tool using Bridle Parts and with House Rigging Points, everything adds up well.  (This is in the second option from the top in the attached image.)

However, if we place in the Reversed Two Leg Bridle with the Build Down Leg using a Hoist (the top option in the image, or the third option with a House Rigging Point also present), neither the Hoist nor the House Rigging Point will calculate with the correct values.  You can also successfully place in the Bridle but then swap out the Down Leg of the Bridle with a Hoist, which then appears to not count the correct weights again.  

Users can work around this by replacing the Down Leg with a Hoist (the fourth option in the image) but only referring to the initial weight on the House Rigging Point, but it'd be great if it could calculate the weight on the motor and also update the House Rigging Point afterwards.  

Please let me know if there's anything I can help out with and have a great day!  :)

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-198107

Spotlight truss inconsistent snapping guides

The snapping guides for attaching a corner section of truss offer inconsistent snapping guides. In the attached video, I show how three out of the four directions are fairly easy to find when attaching a corner truss to a straight truss. It takes a while and some luck to find the sweet spot for the fourth direction. It's there; it's just frustrating to find. 

The bug is the inconsistent fourth snapping guide being not equal to the other three.

Some users resort to rotating truss which ruins their workflow. This forum discussion is an example. [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/109244-truss-tool-mayhem/#comment-477155]

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-196482

Speaker Array with hoist won't calculate braceworks

VB-192944

Cable tool snaps to wrong point in hoists

Reported by Annelien:

When cabling hoists, the cable tool snaps to the insertion point of the hoist. This works fine if the hoist is in the down position, but not for hoists in the up position.

For hoists in the down position the insertionpoint matches up to the input for power etc. However, hoists in the up position have the hoist (with its input etc.) hanging at the top of the chain. This does not match up with the insertionpoint, and results in visual mistakes and cable-length mistakes.

The drawn cable line always snaps to the bottom of the hoist object. Therefore it calculates the cable-length to the wrong point, resulting in extra length if the cable comes from a support truss (see picture). This also affects cables that connect two hoists, causing wrong visuals.

Explanation picture: see attachment

The client uses UP Hoists, so the cabling for these hoists can all be sorted out at the top "support trusses". However when connecting these hoists with a distro: VW wants the cable to connect at the bottom of the hoist (as if it was a DOWN hoist).
RED CABLE: Distro-Hoist
CYAN CABLE: Hoist-Hoist

I was in contact about this with Jesse Cogdell, he explained:
"currently cables automatically snap to the insertion point of the object they are connecting with, which works fine for hoists in the normal down position but not for hoists in the up position. At the moment there isn't any easy solution for this, you can reshape the cable in a 3D view so that the length is accurate but this is fairly time consuming. On the plus side since the cable edit function is not really working yet the cable will retain the connection information. Can you put in a bug report about this? and add Scott Parker and myself as watchers?" 		Kevin Linzey
VB-194500

Spotlight Cable Tools preferences dialog does not remember Use Cable Set choice between uses.

The Spotlight Cable Tools preferences dialog does not remember Use Cable Set choice between uses.

VB-194508

Set 3D View causes undo warnings if executed multiple times

It seems that if you execute the Set 3D View command, undo and redo it a couple time, and then repeat these steps, eventually the Set 3D View command will break the undo system. It does not seem to be tied to the type of projection you are using (ie; narrow, wide, normal, ortho, current). It seems quite odd to me how inconsistent it is; meaning I would expect it to happen every time not just the third time.

For clarification purposes, when I say "undo warnings" what I mean is a DSTOP. I've attached a screenshot of the DSTOP message.

I didn't try to see how far back this issue goes as I'm not sure how easily this can be tested with an autobuild since they do not show DSTOP messages. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-194098

Document tab freezing. Everything being done applies to the other project tab. Windows only.

Hello! 

Revisiting this age old issue with a breakthrough of being able to replicate it. WINDOWS ONLY.

The problem: A file freezes and at that point even if we make it the active file by clicking on the tab of it, Vectorworks still thinks that the other open file is the active file. Anything we will do on the master file that is frozen will happen on the other file tab. Even when we have the master file active if we will check the resource manager it shows that the file which is not active is considered as the active file.

We managed to find a way to recreate this issue in a very specific setup and using a user folder copied from one of our client machines. 

 

Please replace your user folder with the provided one.
Open the file MS layout 3_1678723675.897978 and update all of the references.
Save the file and close Vectorworks.
Open the file again.

What happens is that an additional Untitled file opens up and stays instead of being closed automatically, which Vectorworks thinks is the active file even tho we have the Master file opened. 

This isolated example only shows us this problem temporarily as if we switch the tab to untitled file and switch back to MS layout it gets unstuck. But this is a perfect example of the file freezing. We were able to replicate it on our side and i will attach a video later on. 

This is a problem that i was finding on windows user machines since 2016 version of Vectorworks. We had multiple companies and a lot of users running into this problem now and then. There are multiple jira's created for this issue and i think this is the first time i have seen this issue happening 100% of time.   		Payne Chang

VB-196955

VB-195005

Win Workspace Editor - multi select + drag only works on visible items

- Expand the "all menus" section to get a lot of menus to choose from
- Now select a whole bunch at the top using shift + click
- now scroll the list down a bit so that some of the selected menus are no longer shown
- now select another menu at the bottom of the list with ctrl + click. This will add another menu to the selection but not deselect the big block at the top.
- Now drag and drop that selection over to the right, you'll notice that only the visible menu items were moved over.

I think the control is ignoring any selected items that aren't visible.

Haven't tested on mac but I would imagine this is windows only.

Payne Chang

VB-193477

- Now change the Border Thickness in the OIP

Note that this causes the border component's Datum to change to "Bottom of component". This will happen every time the thickness is changed.

VB-193511

Aligned Hardscapes/Site Modifiers Ignore Layer Restrictions When First Created

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model and two Site Modifiers that are placed on different layers.

To reproduce:

- Activate the Site Modifier or Hardscape tools in Aligned Mode
- Draw an object as shown

Note that the object initially aligns with both modifiers.

- Now click the "Realign" button in the OIP

Note that now the object loses its alignment with the modifier on Design Layer-2.

It looks like this is happening because the Site Modifier/Hardscape defaults to "Same Layer as Modifier" for its "Align with Objects On:" option, and that option is only taking effect once the object is reset.

It seems like these layer restrictions should take effect as soon as the object is drawn, rather than on the next reset. The current behavior gives the impression that the object is losing a valid alignment which isn't actually the case.

The same thing happened in VW 2022 with Aligned Hardscapes. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-194233

Direct Editing: CGSMenuItemValue.SetEnabledState() not Working on Windows

The SetEnabledState is not working on Windows. On Mac it works fine. If you disable a MenuItem it is not greyed out and is also clickable on Win.

Reproducable Code:
void OnListBrowserDirectEdit(TControlID controlID, VWListBrowserEventArgs& eventArgs)
{
EListBrowserDirectEditType directEditType = eventArgs.GetType();
if (directEditType == EListBrowserDirectEditType::QueryItemListRetrieval)
{
CGSMenuItemCollection& collection = eventArgs.GetCellMenuItemCollection();
Sint64 menuItemId = 1;
CGSMenuItemValue item("Item", menuItemId);
item.SetEnabledState(false);
collection.AddMenuItem(item);
}
}
  		Payne Chang

VB-198460

When using shortcut keys, the screen may enter a state of auto-scrolling.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Win
Vectorworks2023 SP2,4,6
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When executing (starting) a shortcut key that does not use the Alt key or does not immediately display a dialog box, the screen scrolls by itself when the mouse cursor is moved to the screen scrolling area.

Steps to reproduce.
1)Execute (start) the Selection Tool tool with the shortcut X key.
2)Move the mouse cursor to the screen scrolling area on the top, bottom, left and right of the screen.
Then the screen scrolls.

*Remarks*
*We confirmed that this problem is not reproduced in Vectorworks 2022 or lower.

*We confirmed that the problem is not reproduced in the MacOS environment, including older versions.

*We confirmed that the trigger of the phenomenon in question was released when the screen was moved with the mouse wheel clicked (the problem is not reproduced).

*In addition, we confirmed that the phenomenon is not canceled in boomerang mode with the space tool, and that the trigger is met, so the problem occurs.

*Vectoroworks2024 (709930) confirmed that this does not occur.

*Findings*
Some users execute commands directly without using shortcut keys. However, this problem seems to occur frequently for those who use shortcut keys frequently, because they can easily reproduce the same procedure.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Payne Chang
