VB-198535

Crash when opening Open Dialog on Home Screen

I believe this is different than the instances reported in VB-193195 and VB-191674. In both of those cases, the Home Screen was closing. In this report, the crash occurred as the Open Dialog was displaying. It did not load to the point of being usable and the Home Screen remained open.

For what it is worth, Windows was set to Dark Mode. The Open dialog displays in dark while the rest of the app, including Home Screen, has a light theme. It was very noticeable during the crash when the Open dialog began to paint with a dark frame prior to the crash. The issue does not, however, appear to be related to dark mode because subsequent tests were successful.

Logs and .dmp file are attached. 		Payne Chang

VB-196177

In VW2023, when double-byte characters are entered, the behavior after pressing the F10 key differs depending on the location.

Steps to reproduce.
"if you type a character"
1) Enter "あいうえお" with the text tool.
2) Press the F10 key to convert to "aiueo" and the file menu becomes active.
This is the same issue reported in "VB-140195".

"If you enter a character in the record field of the record format"
1) Create a record format.
2) Enter "あいうえお" in the OIP record field.
3) When you press the F10 key, the entered characters disappear. Then the File menu becomes active.
*Until Vectorworks2019, characters could be converted when F10 was pressed.

"If you enter a character in the OIP name"
1) Enter "あいうえお" for the OIP name.
2) When you press F10, the characters are converted. (File menu is not actived.)

  		Payne Chang
VB-196738

VWListBrowserItem Line Type control does not display properly on Windows

The VW List Browser control for Line Types, using kListBrowserItemInteractionEditLineStyle, does not display properly on Windows when using item display type kListBrowserDisplayImageOnly.

See attached screenshots.

On Windows, the Line Type column of the Structural Member Properties dialog and the Line Column of the Org Dialog show only the image, no text.

On Mac, these dialog controls show the image and text.

I believe as with the other control types, we should be able to use kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText for this column. Using this does resolve the issue on Windows, but then the Mac control only shows text and no image, so this is not a suitable fix right now.

I think the best fix for this would be to make the line style control work on Mac and Windows for kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText. 		Payne Chang
VB-196380

List Browser does not display text with image for Hatch/Tile/Gradient as expected

This issue appears to have started with CL 705994.

The Structural Member Dialog (Attributes Pane, Fill Column) and Org Dialog (Classes Pane, Fill Column) do not display the image and text as expected for Hatch, Tile, and Gradient fills.

For some background:

The list browsers in the Structural Member Dialog (Attributes Pane, Fill Column) and Org Dialog (Classes Pane, Fill Column) have individual rows that show different controls depending on what the Fill type is.

For a solid fill, we just show Image Only, no text. For hatch/tile/gradient, we show Image and text.

To accomplish this, we use EListBrowserDisplayType::kListBrowserDisplayImageOnly for that column, and set the appropriate EListBrowserItemInteractionType and EListBrowserOwnerDrawnType for each individual cell depending on the Fill type.

Because EListBrowserDisplayType can (currently) only be set for the whole column, we cannot just change that to kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText for these rows.

Note that Dialog.X and LayoutSDK.X have a version of SetListBrowserEditDisplayType that takes a rowindex as well, but this not appear to be available in VWListBrowserItem or the SDK. So we cannot change the display type for the specific row and column. 		Payne Chang
VB-194092

Hatch "Unilock Brussels E HF" from the VW library gives graphical issues

At every zoomfactor, which is not "zoomed in very much", 2D objects with hatch fill "Unilock Brussels E HF" for the Vectorworks library document "Hardscape Paving Patterns Unilock.vwx" the hatch looks like a grey solid or an extremely fine pattern. Also the PDF export can't handle this hatch correctly. Hernán Stamati
VB-196741

VWListBrowserItem Line Thickness control uses kListBrowserDisplayImageOnly

VWListBrowserItem Line Thickness control, using kListBrowserItemInteractionEditLineThickness, requires the use of kListBrowserDisplayImageOnly, despite showing image and text.

The current behavior is inconsistent with other List Browser controls. For example, the Hatch, Tile, and Gradient controls are required to use kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText in order to show an image and text, as is the Resource picker control. However using this item display type for Line Thickness does not currently work.

I believe as with the other control types, we should be able to use kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText for this column.

This behavior is the same on Mac and Windows. 		Payne Chang

For example "[ĉôôñ_ḄÑĈ]" should be just "[ĉôôñ_]BNC"

VB-198839

Spotlight - Lighting Devices Do Not Insert Properly When Truss Elevation is Changed

Video attached for clarity and step to reproduce are below.

-Insert multiple pieces of truss into a system. Convert that to a Hanging Position.

-Insert a Lighting Device onto one of the truss members/hanging position

-Adjust the "Z" value of that truss.

-In an isometric view, notice that the Lighting Device is still connected to the truss.

-In that isometric view, attempt to insert a Lighting Device.

-Notice that the Lighting device inserts at the same "Z" value in which the truss was inserted (0'0") and not at the new "Z" value of the truss.

 

It is worth noting that the Lighting Device is inserting to the truss. As the truss' "Z" value is changed, the added Lighting Device also changes. Inserting a Lighting Device in an iso view always yields this result. Inserting a Lighting Device in Top/Plan occasionally inserts correctly, but majority of the time not.  		Kevin Linzey
VB-194703

Spotlight Inventory T02059 Manage Inventories dialog box, Symbol/Object window should be blank upon opening

When opening the Equipment and Inventory dialog box, the Symbol/Object window retains what was seen when last used. This can lead to confusion. The window should be blank until a user highlights inventories for browsing.

To test, open the dialog and highlight one or more inventories.
Close the box.
open the dialog again. This time, the window will show what was seen last time, but without any inventories highlighted.

Either, we need to offer a blank window. Or, we need to retain the highlights on the inventories from the last use. 		Payne Chang

Steps to reproduce
1) Click "Tools" menu > "Options" command> "Vectorworks Preferences" sub command.
2) Click the radio button for "General" pane > "Display View Bar in auto-high mode" and close the dialog with "OK".
3) Click "Settings" in the View Bar.
4) With the View Bar settings open, click "Settings" on the Viewbar again.
5) The View Bar settings will not be closed, and will remain open even if tools or commands are executed.

VB-194791

The "BIMobject" tool in the Furn/Fixtures section of the Toolset palette does not allow users to log in with a Google account.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023(Occurs from previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
The "BIMobject" tool in the Furn/Fixtures section of the Toolset palette does not allow users to log in with a Google account.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Click on Furn/Fixtures Tools Set > BIMobject Tools > Browse/Download
2) The Web Browser screen opens.
3) Click on the "Google" button.
4) The login screen will appear. Click the "Next" button.
5) The following message will appear.

"Couldn’t sign you in
This browser or app may not be secure.
Try using a different browser. If you’re already using a supported browser, you can try again to sign in. "

Please refer to attached "13150.png". 

*Remarks*
* We confirmed that the same phenomenon occurs up to v2021.
* In v2020, we confirmed that the Google/Autodesk/Linkedin buttons do not respond in the first place.

*Questions*
We would like to know if there is any information on whether or not we can no longer log in with my Google account, etc.

*Findings*
This is the same in the previous version, but in light of the fact that we have not received any inquiries about similar cases, we expect that there has been some specification change (e.g., security specification change) in the Google account login, and as a result, Vectorworks has been unable to log in to the site.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-193673

Landscape area plants don't react on import of PlantPartner data

When linking PlantPartner data to plant styles, all plants, even plants included in Landscape areas and Hedgerows, should be updated, and you should be able to see the data in reports and data tags.

This should be visible without a reset of all plug-in objects.

The Landscape area plant data is updated today when you go in and change something manually in the plant styles, but not when it's done via the API.

Attached is a Landscape area where you can see this - the PP record is attached - you can't see the result when creating a report of the LA, but if you place the plants individually, you can see that the data is there. After a reset (and update of the report), you can see the PP data. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-198859

Aligned Hardscape: Stake modifiers' labels and Z elevations are inconsistent when the Hardscape is on an elevated layer

Open file 'aligned hardscape on elevated layer.vwx'.

It contains a hardscape on a layer with elevation 2000.

*Edit Surface Modifiers* through right click.

Add a stake somewhere on the hardscape and notice that it gets created with label == 2000 and z == 0.

Increasing the z to 2000 increases the label to 4000.

After exiting the Surface Modifiers edit mode the stake uses the elevation from the label and thus if the label shows 4000, then those are layer coordinates and the stake will have 6000 as global coordinates (ground plane coordinates).

 

In my opinion, the stake should always be created with label == 0 initially, independently of the layer elevation as the stakes show layer coordinates, not ground plane coordinates. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-197638

Move the Grade object.

It leaves the grayed version of itself, which is from the drawing. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

- Open the Main Area Components dialog
- Change the component Thickness and click OK

I don't see this on Windows 10 so it might be Mac-only. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193545

Add/Clip Surface Works Incorrectly on Hardscape When Placed on an Elevated Layer

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Hardscape and a Rectangle that are currently on a 0" layer.

To reproduce:

- Select both objects and run the Clip Surface command

Note that it works fine at this point.

- Now Undo the clip operation
- Edit the "Hardscape" layer and change its elevation to anything other than 0"
- Run Clip Surface again

Note that now the clipped area shifts and rotates randomly.

The same thing happens with Add Surface.

I don't see this problem in all files so it looks like there's something specific about this Hardscape that's triggering it.

This file was created in VW 2023, but if I export to VW 2022 I see the same problem there. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-193910

VB-198806

VB-194728

Set working plane: only snaps to object corners

Reported by Annelien:

The customer wants to define the working plane with 3 points along the sides of an extrusion.
However, when activating the tool in the three-point mode. The cursor snaps to the sides of the extrusion, as expected. But when clicked, the tool doesn not register that point as a refrence point for the working plane. It only registers the click when this click is on an object-corner or "mid" points along the sides. If not one one of these points, and instead on a more random point along the object-side the click is not registered. This limits the possibilities customers have to create "random" working planes.

It can currently be worked around by first placing loci along the object-side to refrence your "random" points. And then going back in with the "set working plane" tool to use these loci as your points. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-193841

Select Similar by "Font" - can't click on a Callout

When you set the Select Similar tool to have only the "Font" attributes checked, then click on a Callout object, you get a pop-up saying "The selected activation options can't be used for this object. Please click on an object which has all the selected options as parameters."

Callouts have a font, so it's confusing to a user why this doesn't work. The font happens to be a very important attribute of that object type since Callouts are essentially just text with a leader.

 

Along these same lines, clicking on a Text object with Select Similar doesn't select any Callout objects that have the matching font.

 

In fact, I don't think any of the Select Similar tool's "Text Attributes" work in regards to Callouts. This should be fixed so that the tool works as expected. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-195599

MVR import issues

Please see the attached files.  The objects representing the organ are not importing into the correct position in VW.  The user is able to open the MVR file in Capture, WYSIWYG, and I am able to open it in Vision without any issues. Kevin Linzey
VB-198690

Outdated Chromium version

From user:  We now are facing an issue with our global security restrictions and the embedded browser of Vectorworks 2022. Starting with version 2022 Vectorworks now requires an account and authentication to use the desktop application. Unfortunatley Vectorworks uses an embedded chomium browser version 84.0.4147.89 (which was released 2020). Our (BNP Paribas Group) internal proxy blocks any request coming from an outdated browser which now prohibits us from updating to a newer version of Vectorworks since our users are not able to authenticate. Would you be able to include an updated version of the embedded chromium browser to comply with our (and probably many large companies) security policy) I also tested with version 2023 SP5 which resulted in the same issue. Payne Chang

VB-194919

MVR from Capture not importing correctly

I'm not sure if this is a bug with our MVR import or the export from Capture. [~klinzey] as we discussed at the R&D meeting here's the file and bug report

When the attached MVR is imported the geometry comes in with different scales.
All the default geometry objects in the file are in a much larger scale than the objects that are named objects in the import dialogue (identified in the Scene description xml as trusses, pipes and lights).
If the MVR is partially imported with only the identified objects everything works as expected, witht he trusses, lights and pipes displaying correctly but is the default geometry is imported (either as a full import of everything or afterwords as a partial import) the default geometry comes in at a completely different scale (unusably large compared to the lights and trusses).

From Talking with Jazz most of the default geometry seems to be from a DWG hat was imported into Capture as the files starting point. In capture this all looks correct with everything having the same scale.

Please note the file is confidential and for internal testing/bug fixing purposes only 		Kevin Linzey
VB-193625

Per Face Texture with Extrude Along Path does not Work Well

I created an extrude along path and used the texture tool to apply different textures on the extrude per face. When I attempted to reshape the extrude with the 3D dragger, the textures on the extrude do not stay. Either whole extrude or part of the extrude turns white, or it changes to one texture. 

This occurs if the profile is fixed. The textures stay applied if the profile of the extrude is not fixed.

In previous version 2023 SP3, the same issue occurs with reshaping the extrude, even if the 3d dragger tool is not available in that version. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196625

T02348 - Golden Rectangle shortcut key creates Perfect square for Doors and Windows

See attached recording

Using Shift+Command/Control keys I can create perfect Door/Window Square. 		Christopher Graye
VB-198665

Site Model: Retaining Edge modifier doesn't modify Extruded contours

As it can be seen in the picture 'extruded contours are not dug until the bottom of the retaining edge.png', the extruded contours are not properly cut by holes until they reach the bottom of the retaining edge modifier.

That happens because one of the extruded contours clogs the other extrudes below it. The contour is filled because it cannot fully contain the hole defined by the retaining edge ('extruded contour not covering hole.png').

This is an example case in which we cannot just add a boundary extrude which would cover the hole, because it would also cover other extrudes from below elevations. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193604

KLS: Layer Colors in SLSVP

Hi there,
it is about layer colors in sheet layer section viewports.
It is more a question than really a bug.
Me personally would rather use data visualization than layer colors.

Now to may question. On design layer the layer colors are working. In a SLSVP there is no fill. I have selected to use the object fill in attributes of viewport.
But layer colors are no object fill, so maybe it is not intended to work in a section viewport. But why is there no fill? I would expect either the original object fill or the layer colors? And why is there no possibility to override the layer in viewport layer overrides dialog windows?

Thanks for the answer and Gruß, Klaus Lüttich.
Karthick Chilaka

VB-198679

Font lists differ between Format Text/OIP and Text Font menu/Viewbar

The "Times" family of fonts exists in the font lists in the OIP and the Format Text dialog but not in the font lists containing submenus in the Text>Font menu and the Viewbar pulldown.

Specifically, the Format Text and OIP lists have:

Times Bold

Times Bold Italic

Times Italic

When compared to other font families such as Arial and Times New Roman, I would expect to see a Times item in the Text>Font and Viewbar font pulldown, with a submenu including Bold, Bold Italic, and Italic. The Times item and its variants do not exist. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198638

Going back to design layer changes view to Top

Reported by Annelien:

A few users have stated that while working, when coming back to a design layer from a sheet layer, the view automatically changes to a top view. They stated they have this problem in a few documents, but it seems to happen pretty randomly. So far it seems document-related.

I received the document from the customer and can recreate the problem in 2022 (version the docuent was created in) and 2023. When trying the same workmethod in an empty document, the issue does not persist. Another customer only experiences the problem in Vectorworks 2023.

Design layer Top/2D - activate any sheet layer - switch back to any design layer: The view of the design layer is now Top/3D 		Karthick Chilaka

# Launch Vectorworks (if opened & used, close & relaunch)
# Open the attached file (or any VW2023 or earlier file with Spotlight/Entertainment Objects in it - Lighting Devices, Truss, Audio, Staging...)
# Select any one of these Spotlight/Entertainment Objects
# Go to the Data Tab of the OIP
# Notice there is no EntEquipUniveral Record Format
# Open the same file AGAIN & do steps 3 & 4
# Notice there is now an EntEquipUniveral Record attached to these Spotlight/Entertainment Objects

This issue will only occurs on the first file opened after launching VW2024.  Even if a New/Blank file is loaded before opening the file, this issue is not seen. 

This issue doesn't occur with VW2024 files, only VW2023 and earlier that do not yet have the EntEquipUniversal Record attached yet. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-195322

Spotlight Inventory Worksheets T02059 Speaker Array worksheet missing spec'd data for Speakers

Spotlight Inventory Worksheets T02059 missing fields for speakers in the speaker array field.

Please double check to include these data fields in the speaker area of the worksheet created when creating a worksheet for the speaker arrays..
# Type =IF('Speaker'.'Source'='Catalog', 'Speaker'.'BxType', 'Speaker'.'TypeSymbol')
# Brand ='Speaker'.'BxBrand'
# Model ='Speaker'.'BxModel'
# Speaker Quantity =COUNT
# Support Type ='Speaker'.'Support'
# Support Qty =IF((('Speaker'.'Support'='Tripod') | ('Speaker'.'Support'='Mic Stand') | ('Speaker'.'Support'='Flown-Crank Lift')), '1', '')
# Tripod/Stand Height =IF((('Speaker'.'Support'='Tripod') | ('Speaker'.'Support'='Mic Stand') | ('Speaker'.'Support'='Flown-Crank Lift')), 'Speaker'.'StndHeight', '') 
# Custom Color ='Speaker'.'CustomColor'
# Weight ='Speaker'.'BxWeight'
# Mounting Details ='Speaker'.'MountingDetails'
# Position ='Speaker'.'BxLoc'
# Purpose ='Speaker'.'BXPurpose'
# Zone ='Speaker'.'Zone'
# Rack ='Speaker'.'BxRack'
# Amplifier ='Speaker'.'BxAmplifier'
# Drive Line ='Speaker'.'BxDrive'
# Cable ='Speaker'.'BxCable'
# Speaker ID ='Speaker'.'SpeakerID'
# Column ID ='Speaker'.'ColumnID'
# Layer =LAYER
# Virtual Parts
# Inventory  		Kevin Linzey
VB-196254

Roof Texture Needs a Reset from the OIP to Appear Properly

This file originate in VW2023 and worked as expected in earlier Mainline builds. When the file opens now, the roof texture doesn't look good in two area.

To fix this issue, you have to set the texture by Class again 

 
* Open test file
* Go to iso view and render in Shaded
* Note the problem. Now go to the OIP's Render tab and select texture "By Class" again. Problem goes away. 		Christopher Graye

VB-194151

VB-193360

SBE: VWParametric_EventSink::OnAttributeQuery( ParametricCanEditAttrMessage& msg) is incomplete

Data type AttributeQuery does not contain flags for opacity and drop shadow and marker link toggle button, but these are actually part of the attribute palette:

struct AttributeQuery {
AttributeQuery(bool inAllDisabled=false,
bool inFillDisabled=false,
bool inPenDisabled=false,
bool inFillMappingDisabled=false) :
penDisabled(inPenDisabled),
fillDisabled(inFillDisabled),
allDisabled(inAllDisabled),
fillMappingDisabled(inFillMappingDisabled){}
bool allDisabled, fillDisabled, penDisabled, fillMappingDisabled;
};

This means that our PIOs can not enable drop shadows in the attribute palette without also enabling opacity which we don't want (and vice versa).


AttributeQuery needs to have flags for all sections/controls of the attribute palette. 		Christopher Graye
VB-198390

Wall Closure Component Wrapping Fails in VW 2024

The attached file was created in VW 2023, and contains a Window placed in a Wall with wrapped components in the Wall Closure.

Note that the component wrapping shows fine in VW 2023, but not in VW 2024 (see attached screenshots). 		Christopher Graye

T02351 - Using "Alt+Shift"/"Option+Shift" to apply Texture on Wall Components Prompts User to Click Several Times in the "Did you know..." Dialog

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 

This is a problem when when you apply a texture on all wall components using the shortcut key "Alt+Shift" (Win)/"Option+Shift"(Mac). 

The dialog pops up several times. It is related to how many components are in the wall. If the wall had 5 components, then you have to click the OK button 5 times to finish applying the texture.  		Christopher Graye

VB-194620

In the attached Vectorworks document are various walls that aren't being correctly displayed. It is not a "Z-fighting" situation and the objects are not far away from Origin. This happens with Normal Perspective, if we switch to Orthogonal the problem does not happen anymore. Christopher Graye
VB-194486

Missing textures when importing design layer objects

Hi!

I have come across a file in which textures seem to disappear when their objects are imported into a design layer.

If the textures are set to be by component then the textures are totally missing.
- Changing the map type from auto alignment to plane and back auto alignment within the render tab of the OIP, seems to bring the textures back.

If the textures are set to be by object then the auto-alignment doesn't seem to work.
- Changing the texture from class to none and back class within the render tab of the OIP, seems to bring the auto-alignment back.

What could be causing this problem?

Please see the video and files attached!

Thanks! 		Christopher Graye
VB-196839

* Open test file . two simple walls, one set to render by Object and the other by Component
* Enable Texture tool (Apply To Object Mode) and with Command+Option keys pressed, click on the wall ( by Component) face to texture all components in it.
* Notice this fails

Pressing the Command+Option keys enables the 'Pick Up Mode'. 

 
* Note that clicking individual components without the shortcuts textures each component as expected.

VB-198290

Open the attached project file. Select the middle slab (the one with 8 edges). Double click on it and select edit boundary on the dialog and click OK. Reshape the polyline, moving an edge. You will be prompted to checkout the polyline and do so. Now click on the button at the top right to exit the slab. You will be prompted to checkout the slab. VB-195152

Work sheet does not calculate Wall Openings if End Cap in Wall present

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

In the attached Vectorworks Document we have two walls.

1. Top Wall has an End Cap in Wall and no Openings (eg. Door).

2. Bottom Wall has an End Cap in Wall and one Opening (eg. Door).


In the Wall 1. we can see that the Worksheet calculates 0m2 of Wall Openings, since there are no Wall Openings.

In the Wall 2. the Worksheet shows N/A and we have one Wall Opening. If we delete the End Cap in Wall and recalculate the Worksheet, then we can see that it calculates the Wall Opening, but it doubled the entry in the Worksheet, which it shouldn't happen. 		Christopher Graye

VB-197824

The texture of a window within a wall can use an override texture instead of the class texture

The attached file has three components: an empty wall, a wall with a window, and a window. There are two design layers, one with a DL viewport into the other layer.

Within the design layer 'Konstruktionseben_00' the two windows should be red using the texture from class 'fensterrahmen'. But the window inside the wall is yellow because it is using the override from the viewport -which is in the Ansich... layer

From the Kons... layer edit the class, change the textures to cyan. The windows will be cyan  But the window in the Ansich.. layer has also changed to cyan even if it should be overridden as yellow.

Switch to the Ansich... layer, edit the class 'fenste... and set the texture to red. The walls and windows  in the viewport become yellow, because they accept the override.

But in the Kons... layer, the window in the wall is yellow, so it is using the texture from the class override, not the texture from the class.

It sounds complicated, because there is no way to follow what is going on: the window in the wall uses the same texture in both layers. And that texture can be taken from the class or the override depending on where you are editing the class.

The problem is present in VW2023 SP6

  		Christopher Graye
VB-195587

Spotlight Equip Summary Key T02059 not showing GDTF next to symbols.

We can see the GDTF mode when inserting plug-in objects into the summary key. We would like to be for the symbols themselves. In the case of the attached file, I have five moving lights. Three of them have a GDTF mode of 33 channels, and the remaining two do not have a mode assigned.

In theory, this would present us with two different examples of fixtures, three with the mode and two without. Therefore, the symbol key would offer them as different fixture types. The user would need both types for accurate counting. Each type would also display its fixture mode.

In the attached file, I have included three summary keys. One uses both symbols and plug-in objects, the second uses the symbols only, and the third shows plug-in objects only. The last one shows an inaccurate count of moving lights overall. The one showing symbols only has an accurate count but is missing the GDTF information. The first one shows symbols and PIOs as an accurate count for the symbols without GDTF and a corresponding inaccurate count for the plug-in objects.

It appears to be showing only objects that have GDTF profiles assigned and is missing the two without the profile.  		Kevin Linzey
VB-192859

Hatch fill in Annotations displays at wrong scale during navigation

The attached file and screen recording demonstrate an issue that occurs with Hatch fills that are applied to objects within Viewport Annotations: while you're inside Annotations Edit mode, these Hatch fills display at an entirely differently scale whenever you're zooming or panning.

The same hatches display correctly when zooming/panning outside of Annotations.

I also noticed that if the hatch doesn't have local mapping (see 00:17) then it displays multiple times LARGER than normal, and if the hatch does have local mapping (see 00:25) then it displays multiple times SMALLER. These are both incorrect, though the latter happens to be more headache-inducing :D

I believe that the 'multiple' happens to be the scale of the viewport (for example, in my file the hatch displays either 16x too large or 16x too small while navigating, since the viewport is set to 3/4" = 1'-0").

[^HatchAnnotationsNavigation.mov]

[^3064_IntCrownChicken_230120_WorkingFile_V05_AEB.vwx] 		Hernán Stamati
VB-197505

Project Sharing folder selector stuck at "Loading"

# File->Open Server-Based Project File
# Move the vertical scrollbar so that you have a collapsed folder at the bottom row of the "view"
# Try expanding the folder
You just get a subfolder named "Loading" that doesn't go away by itself. You have to collapse it back, make sure the folder is not at the bottom of the view and then expand it

VB-197680

VB-198608

All shadows cast below ground plane

In all versions I tested (Vectorworks 2021, 2022 and 2023) all shadows cast onto the ground plane, render below the actual ground plane. 

Method: 
# Draw a square 1m x 1m at 0,0. 
# Extrude it 2m. 
# Place a light source (I tested both a Heliodon and a Directional Light). It seems that Point Lights won't cast a shadow onto the 'ground plane.' 
# Examine the shadow: It starts both below and away from the object in the direction the light shines, as if the surface it is cast upon is below the object's bottom and the ground plane. 

See attached .vwx test file and screen recording. 

EDIT: I've since found a Forum thread of someone _trying_ to explain this very problem from way back in 2012! [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/33732-shadows/] 		Justin Hutchison

Wall tool unstyled has 2 strange wall components, see print screen
Try to delete one > hardcrash 		Christopher Graye
VB-198337

Grass Texture inverting

When applying a grass texture to the individual surfaces of an extrude the grass appears to invert, and goes to the inside of the object rather than the outside of the object. 

Mostly seen on a curved surface, but also appears to happen on vertical surfaces as well 

If the texture is applied to the entire object this behavior doesn.'t seem to happen 

Converting the object in question to a generic solid somewhat resolves the issue, by flipping the grass to "grow" out the correct direction, but the background color of the grass texture doesn't show on the surface of the generic solid. 

Some other object do not display this behavior however, like a directly modeled hemisphere object renders the grass just fine, as well as nurbs surfaces extracted from the objects. 		Justin Hutchison

Justin Hutchison

VB-192786

Group is not preserved within a symbol if one of the objects grouped is a hybrid symbol

Hello,

If you have some objects, 2D or 3D symbols or just objects, select and Modify>Group and Modify>Create Symbol the expectations are that if you edit that symbol the first thing you will encounter is a group.

As soon as just one of those objects is a hybrid symbol, the group is not preserved when editing the symbol. This is especially problematic for users who want to put the group in a container class for visualisation as opposed to another class for the symbol.

I have checked as far back as I can which is v2017 and it seems nested hybrid symbols if part of a group, the group is not preserved within the symbol.

File and movie enclosed. You will see in the movie that there is something not right with the 'Replace Symbol' dialogue but eventually it works.

 

Cheers,

Peter

 

  		Rick Berge
VB-196258

Structural member - 2D view bug when connecting 2 beams

Reported by Grzegorz:

When connecting 2 beams in a way that 1 is straight and second is drawn in polygonal mode and ends in the same beam as started, ending is always extended to the opposite side of the first beam in 2D.
In 3D it works fine.

Files: 		Christopher Graye
VB-197614

2D Loci in Resource Manager are Very Large

I have attached two screenshots as well as a file on this bug. I have a 2019 iMac with a Retina 5K 27" display as my production machine. I have a secondary monitor which is an older Thunderbolt Display running at a resolution of 2560 x 1440.

As you can see in the two screenshots, the 2D loci that are present in the Top/Plan preview of the symbol are different sized depending on what monitor I move VW to when I create the preview. With the program moved to the Thunderbolt the 2D loci are small, but when the preview is generated with VW on the iMac the loci are much larger. This is important because I setup this content to show the loci so that the users know where the insertion and snap points are so it needs to be visible. The loci are the correct size when the symbol is viewed after being placed on the design layer so it appears to be a issue that arises when the preview is generated in the RM 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197839

Localization: Tooltips of Resource Manager use concatenation

It seems the tooltips in the Resource Manager are concatenating strings. They should use replacement instead. Replacement allows translators to change the order if needed, since in other languages some phrases have a different order than in English. Karthick Chilaka

VB-198667

Camera goes out of focus - seen in the animation export

I have done some work with the creative team using animation paths/animations in recent times so [~gbrockbank] shared this issue with me that he discovered...

Using the attached file the animation was created by the selected hellion's Solar Animation command and the option "view (sun to layer plane center)"

The export settings were:

Sunrise to Sunset
1 minute intervals
30 fps
Best quality
1080p and UHDTV (both versions had the focus issue)

Stills from the mov file show the loss of focus at 0:09 and 0:15

The expected behaviour would be that the camera's focus would remain sharp during the entire animation.

VB-193429

The size of the window changes compared to the original window, when making a window a "Corner window".

We have three questions for you with this behavior.
There are end of steps.

Steps to reproduce situation.

0)Set drawing unit=mm, scale 1/50.
1)Creat a wall with thickness 150mm.
2) Select the Window tool and insert a window into the created wall.
3) Select "Sash Opening" from the OIP "Size Reference" dropdown.
4) OIP > Change width value to "1000".
At this time, if you measure the size of the window with the dimension line, it will be "1000".
5) OIP > Turn on the "corner window" check, and select "Corner Post" at the OIP "Corner Condition" dropdown.
6) Measure the size of the window again it will be changed to "1050".
However width value still displayed "1000" on OIP. 

*As long as I tried, I see this problem then Vectorworks 2022. 

*"Sample230207.vwx" was offered by the user who reported this problem.
Here, you can see two types of problems: when the corner window is set, the size of the window increases, and when the size of the window decreases.

・The window on the left page of the sample file is
　The width of the window is set to 4040.
　When applying the "Corner window" setting style and measuring the width with the dimension line, it becomes 4000.
・The window on the right page of the sample file is
　The width of the window is set to 1000.
If you turn on the "Corner window" check and measure the actual width with the dimension line, it will be 1050.

Please refer to attached movie and files. (13094.mov, Untitled 1.vwx and Sample230207.vwx)

 

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Christopher Graye

VB-196302

Rotated text even with 'Adjust Flipped Text' applied, does not export to PDF correctly - it is flipped.

Hello,
Enclosed is a 2023 file and when opened in that version or converted to 2024 the same problem happens.

In the Annotation group of a viewport there are some text blocks that have been mirrored. Thus their rotation in the OIP reads 180º. They look correct on the screen because 'Adjust Flipped Text' is checked in the 'Advanced Properties' of the viewport.

However when exported or published to PDF these text blocks are flipped and thus they do not look how they look on the screen.

Please see the enclosed movie as well.

Cheers,
Peter 		Hernán Stamati

VB-195039

CW STair - thumbnail previews show twice as many treads on Windows.

Thumbnail previews are much finer and show more detail on Windows. Whilst the sharpness is much better on Windows, the somewhat reduced detail makes the thumbnails work much better visually on Mac, despite their relative coarseness.

* Increase the resolution on Mac
* Decrease the detail on Windows

VB-193334

Vectorworks accuracy of the calculations

One of our customers has proposed a procedure that appears to show a calculation inaccuracy in Vectorworks, especially on macOS machines.
We send a short video illustrating the situation. 
First of all, check that in your Vw the 2D Conversion Resolution is put to Very High and Details in Shaded Options to Very High as well.
The test involves creating a curved polyline and another very similar one at a small offset distance. Now select them and call the command Clip Surface or Combine into Surface to get the surface between the two polylines.
It is really important that the offset distance is very small compared to the size of the curves. For example, you can start from circles of 15 m in diameter with an offset distance of 2 cm.
On a macOS machine, as you can see in the attached video, you can perceive an evident imperfection in the curves obtained by zooming in.
The customer reports serious imperfections reported by a cutting plotter.
On the Windows platform this is less noticeable. However if you extrude this annulus and use the Extract Tool to extract the annulus from the 3D Extrude, serious defects reappear, even when you have to click to extract the surface (see at the image attached)
We attach a Vw file so you can try soon.
The same results are obtained with Vw 2023 SP3 and Vw 2022 SP5.
The (long-standing) customer is pressing hard for a quick fix. Please what do you think? 		Hernán Stamati
VB-194565

VB-198316

Data tags not syncing with NBS chorus

From user: Initial setup (working) 1) Vectorworks 2023 (sp6) wall style drawn 2) NBS web pallet opened and Vectorworks model assorted with NBS specification 3) Wall style element is associated with an NBS chorus specification clause (wall type 01) 4) Data tag is added to wall to show this information 5) Data tag is setup to show NBS chorus info such as (#NBS Chorus Properties#.#Code##NBS Chorus Properties#.#Title##NBS Chorus Properties#.#Suffix#) 6) Wall tag show correct info such as suffix – I.e wall type 01 7) MODIFICATION: Within NBS chorus web - wall type 1 (suffix) is changed to new number i.e wall type 02 8) NBS chorus flags this as an issue with associated model – i.e they don’t now match 9) Within NBS chorus I click on update model symbol to match new specification 10) This updates model to match specification – only it doesn’t (see below) 11) NBS chorus shows no further issues Not working 12) No pre drawn existing data tags showing the NBS data updated, even though when I click on the tag its data information is correct (i.e it lists wall type 02) but on screen the tags do not update. This issue remains even if I close and re-open the programme. The only work around is I have to create/drawn a new data tag to that wall type – once drawn all the other existing tags auto Kostadin Ivanov

VB-192990

Publish/Export to PDF issue if viewport is in Top view not Top Plan for transparent symbols

Hello,

In the enclosed file there are some 2D symbols of trees. Their opacity has been overwritten in the Attribute palette. They look very transparent on the screen.

Go to the Sheet layer that has two identical viewports. One is in Top view and the other Top Plan.

If you export to PDF, note that the viewport that is in Top view, all the transparency has gone (see enclosed PDF). Either the WYSIWYG is wrong when in Top view or that there is a bug in the creation of the PDF. 

If the symbols definition is edited to have opacity, then when in Top view the PDF will be correct, it is only when overwritten by the Attributes palette.

 

Cheers,

Peter 		Justin Hutchison

VB-198495

Wall line attributes are not show in sections viewports

As you can see in the attached video:
- In version 2020 an earlier: when you had a wall with components with a line thicknes "0", but the wall itself had a line thickness, the wall as a whole object still had an outline in section viewports, as they do in a top/plan view.
- Since version 2021 and later, the line attributes of the wall object are ignored in section viewports. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-198399

Vectorscript: Incorrect object placement on layer with base height other than zero

Example script "Place PIO" creates a Window plugin on a layer with a base height of 5950mm and places at wrong height. There is a workaround by moving pio in 3D in relation to layer height - check out code. Vectorworks should get it correct in the first place.

Attached file and code below

procedure test;
CONST
k_PIO = 'Window';

VAR
pioH : HANDLE;
baseZ,levelhgt : REAL;

begin
pioH := CreateCustomObject( k_PIO, 0, 0, 0 );
if YNDialog('Move in 3D') then begin
GetLayerElevation( actlayer, baseZ, levelhgt );
if ( baseZ <> 0 ) then Move3DObj( pioH, 0, 0, -baseZ ); {NEW for VW2024}
end;

end;
run(test); 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-197968

RGB and CMYK values differ from external source

Hi, I have a customer reporting their new company brand colours are different in Vectorworks than what their graphic designer gave them. 

I checked on an example of their brand orange colour and I can see inconsistency in how we display the colour codes -  the colour was sent to them described as
R:255 G:74 B:1 HEX: FF4A01
C:0 M:80 Y:94 K:0 Pantone 1655 C

When I input above RGB to VW, CMYK is different. When I input the HEX CMYK is different. When I choose from Pantone, all other are different. When I input the above in Photoshop, all the numbers are exactly the same. 

The colour that visually looks correct (comparing to customer's colour palette) on my screen is when I input using CMYK in VW, while the others are visually the same to me, this is the only one that looks different. The colour from Photoshop also looks to be correct.

Is there a way for customers to correctly input supplied colour codes and get accurate result in Vectorworks?

See attached files and screenshots. 		Josh Loy

VB-193083

Detailing tools like Channel -3D RW texture

I had a customer call in that he cannot just place a Channel - 3D and apply a texture to it in the oip.

You can place the channel in 3D, with it still selected, go to Render in the OIP and choose a texture to apply but it will not show it.

I found the only way to apply a different texture was to create a class using a texture and place that object on that class.

The OIP seems to indicate you should be able to apply a texture to one Channel through the OIP

I have tried on other objects like I-Beam-3D with the same results.

VB-198348

Superscript inappropriately remains checked in OIP after switching to Selection Tool

After typing subscript text, the OIP superscript checkbox can be displayed in a disabled, but checked state if the the Selection Tool is invoked immediately after entering superscript text. See the following steps in the video:

-Go into edit mode in superscript text

-Click off the text object

-Select other existing text objects

--> the OIP font style controls will update appropriately without the superscript checked

-Go into edit mode in superscript text again

-Switch to selection tool

-Select other existing text objects

--> the OIP font style controls will update appropriately EXCEPT the superscript is always checked.

This issue is only in the OIP. The superscript state is correct in the Format Text dialog and View Bar controls.

(For Mac, this was confirmed in build 713132). This also occurs in 2023. 		Payne Chang

VB-197980

T02378 - Menu Commands Are Clickable

Unsure if this behavior is directly related to this task or not. However, the behavior is only seen when interacting with the menus associated with this task.

When clicking out of the Layers, Classes, or Saved Views dropdown, the user is currently able to directly click menu items. This is not the case when a user clicks out view, perspective, render mode, etc. commands in the mode bar. The lack of consistency forces the user to have to click a second time in order to see the available menu options.

Click "View" Mode Bar Dropdown

Click "Vectorworks" (notice it take two clicks to view menu)

Click "Layer" Mode Bar Dropdown

Click "Vectorworks" (Notice it only takes one click, however options are not available until the user click again)

Video attached for clarity. Tested on MacOS 12.3.1 ARM 		Payne Chang

VB-194527

Ventura 13.3 - Warning: NSWindow ordered front from a non-active application

This error started popping up in the log after updating to Ventura 13.3 and Xcode 14.3
{code:java}
[Window] Warning: Window NSWindow 0x336124130 ordered front from a non-active application and may order beneath the active application's windows.{code}
I suspect this is the reason why we've been having issues showing floating palettes after launch on Ventura.
It appears it's no longer acceptable to show windows when the application is not active.
This may happen if the user switches to another app while VW is launching.
We probably need to revise the system so that palettes are shown when the main VW window is first activated.

  		Payne Chang

VB-198196

When toggling the class showing and hiding of grid lines, the grid line length might change due to the location of the section elevation line.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the attached sample file.
2. There are 2 Section-Elevation lines: one is crossing the extrude, and the other is not.
3. Move to the sheet layer (Sht-1). There are 2 section viewports. The left one was created from the section-elevation line that was not crossing the extrude, while the right one was created from the section-elevation line that is crossing it.
4. Select both viewports. Click the "Classes" button on the OIP. Hide the “Grid” class and click OK. Then, go to the Viewport Class Properties again and show the “Grid” class.
5. Click the “Update” button on the OIP. The grid lines on the left viewport will be shortened.

Note: This issue does not seem to occur on Vectorworks 2024.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198208

I think in this case the palette should resize to a fixed height for the current width, since that's how it works when resizing it manually (in icons only mode it always has the right size to fit all buttons). 		Payne Chang

VB-197373

VB-197308

3D Loci appear on image export

When you set the Vectorworks preferences that 3D loci should be always visible:

In version 2023:
- Export a shaded image: the 3D loci will be hidden in the resulting image (as it should)
- Export a renderworks image: the 3D loci will be shown in the resulting image (wrong)

In version 2024:
- Export a shaded image: the 3D loci will be shown in the resulting image (wrong)
- Export a renderworks image: the 3D loci will be shown in the resulting image (wrong)

So this bug already partly existed in version 2023, but got worse in version 2024. 		Justin Hutchison

Select equip item MVIEWER,
in OIP set Rack ID to R1 but don't press Enter,
click directly on the Rack U popup

observe that while the popup is open parts of the rack and the equip item disappear until a U is selected and the popup closes 		Conrad Preen

VB-198129

【question】Is it a specification that I cannot edit Thickness or Elevation in the Add Survey Point Preferences of the "Add Survey Point" tool in the "Edit Geological Survey Points" section of the Site Model? 

【question】Is it a specification that I cannot edit Thickness or Elevation in the Add Survey Point Preferences of the "Add Survey Point" tool in the "Edit Geological Survey Points" section of the Site Model? 
--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Steps to reproduce.
(1) Open the sample file. (03_Landmark.sta)
from
(2) Select Site Model.
3) Click the [Edit Geological Survey Points] button in the OIP.
(4) Select the "Add Survey Point" Tool.
5) Go to "Add Survey Point Tool Preferences.
6）The "Add Survey Point Preferences" dialog appears.
7）Hover the cursor over the "Thickness" or "Elevation" field in the list.
(8) Click on the pencil icon that appears. (*Do not click on any row in the list.)
9) Edit the value and press the Return key.
Some values cannot be changed.

* For example, the topmost [topsoil].


Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-198105

Detail Callout requires shoulder length to display as desired, new callouts have no text

VB-196968

VB-198069

Lights jumping to random z height when moving in top/plan

User is attempting to move his truss system with lights all at once but notices the lights all jump to a random z height after doing so. While testing this file, I noticed they only do this in top/plan and not in top. Select all of his lights, move them to any position, they all jump to completely random positions and heights. Kevin Linzey
VB-198093

Equipment Summary Key Text Distance

The Text Distance functionality of the legacy Instrument Summary tool was logically designed to originate from the center of the associated symbol. If you entered 3/4" the spacing worked well in most instances and the Instrument Type column was correctly left-aligned.

In the new Equipment Summary Key (in beta 5), Text Distance using the Key's border as its origin. While there is some merit to this approach there are a number of pitfalls that could be problematic for users. First, it is unnecessarily inconsistent with the legacy tool and users may initially find it confusing. Second, it requires more trial and error on the part of the user to establish the correct distance from the widest symbol (something the old method avoided).

I personally prefer the old method of using the symbol center as the origin. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-195062

T02384 - Shaded Renders Fail to Immediately Update When RW Camera Settings are Changed

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a 3D model with an RW Camera that uses custom Camera Effects settings.

To reproduce:

- Activate the Camera view
- Render in Shaded mode
- Now change any of the Camera Effects options in the camera's OIP

Note that the change doesn't take effect until the render is "bumped" in some way (zoom, pan, flyover, etc).

With the other Camera settings in the OIP, the render will update as soon as the change is made.

I don't see this problem when rendered in RW instead of Shaded. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-197829

Resource Selector Poistion

When performing operations like replacing Symbols using the Resource Selector the file tree in the left-hand area of the dialog is scrolled all the way to the bottom of the file list instead of a) @ the top or b) @ the file chosen last.

1)  Open the attached file.

2)  Select the Symbol instance in the drawing space.

3)  Click "Replace" in the OIP.

4)  Click on the thumbnail under "Choose Symbol to replace with."

If all 5 of the Library icons are selected, the left-hand file tree area in the left of the dialog will be scrolled to the bottom of the list.

5)  Scroll to the top and choose 1 of the other Symbols in the demo file.

6)  With the new Symbol selected, start the process again @ step #3.

--------------------------

--------------------------

--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Switching Projection changes the angle of view between Perspective and Perspective.

1.Perspective>2.Orthogonal>3.Perspective and just by switching the Projection, the angle of view changes between 1.Perspective and 3.Perspective.

Steps to reproduce:

2) Select the render camera and Activate Camera View.

   If I switch to 2D/Plan, you will see that the camera has moved backward from its initial position.

VB-193261

Steve Johnson: VerifyValidPointer(data) failed!

IsValidAddress(): Pointer is nil. (ptr == nil)
Steve Johnson: VerifyValidPointer(data) failed!
Pointer is NIL, Assertion Failed!

Open a new blank file, then open attached file. STOP pops in "step 10 of 11: generate resource previews". (Won't happen if you don't have a blank doc open first)

Saw this assert, and it just seemed weird enough to merit a little investigation. I attached a snapshot of the stack at the moment the assert popped.

It's essentially opening a new doc, doing RegenerateMissingResourcePreviews, and for some reason VGM ends up looking at the current tool (there isn't one yet) data which it seems like we shouldn't be allowing. (The assert is because there isn't any tool data.)

Justin Hutchison

VB-194768

Graphic artefacts appear while in perspective view.

Hello!

 

We ran into an issue where graphical artefacts appear while navigating through the file in a perspective view. It seems like the walls have intersecting surfaces but moving closer to the design seems to improve the render. We were able to replicate this on our side as well as on users computer. 

We tried to turn off accelerated graphics, but it did not change anything. 

Origins seems to be fine as well. 

We changed Shaded quality to see if we would get any improvements with no luck. 

When user creates more information on the file it seems to be getting worse. 

Please see screenshots and the fille attached. 

I seem to be getting different results with different Mac OS. User is on 12.2.1 and it seems to show more rectangles on the other hand on my machine i get more lines/triangulation. 

User is on M1 Pro 16gb ram mac book pro. 

My computer specs attached as a screenshot. I don't want to raise importance as it does not stop user from working, but it stops user from presenting to clients using the design layer. We found that on sheet layer viewports it seems to be working better.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-197495

Vision Cast Shadows requires an edit to take effect after turned on

This has been a known issue in Vision and Lighting Devices, though I am not sure reported.  Noticed when testing the new projectors for T02414, they have the same issue.  Results are not 100% consistent, but for the most part these are the steps to reproduce:
# Open attached file (or any file)
# Notice with Cast Shadows turned OFF, Lighting Devices and Projectors will travel through mesh objects (WAD)
# Now turn Cast Shadows ON (under Root in Properties or File/Document Preferences/Rendering)
# Notice Lighting Devices and Projectors will travel through mesh objects like before (BUG)
# Making a minor edit tot the scene (nudge position of Lighting Device or Projector) often fixes the issue.

The same seems to happen when going in reverse:  Starting with Cast Shadows ON (and working) and then turning Cast Shadows OFF.

Note: Marked as Sometimes... should really be Most Times.  Just a small part of the time it seems to work correctly.  Slightly inconsistent as seen in the attached 3 videos. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-197106

Vision Preferences Change affects Lighting Devices from turning on when selected

# Open Vision Demo File (any MVR or VSN file should have this issue - not file specific)
# Before doing anything, go to Vision Preferences.
# Make a change (Primarily tested with the Quality/Performance Slider, but individual changes work as well)
# Click OK
# Test turning the Lighting Devices ON by selecting them in the Scene Graph - they should be working as expected
# Go back to Vision Preference
# Make a Change
# Click OK
# Test turning Lighting Devices again and notice most do not turn on when selected.
# Making a change in Properties, while the Lighting Device is selected, seems to correct this issue

Steps 2-5 are not required steps to reproduce the problem, simply showing this issue seems related to turning the Lighting Devices ON first.

Not all Lighting Devices react the same as seen in the video.  Some Moving Lights will work with the DMX recording after this occurs, while conventional will not.

This issue seems to require turning the Lighting Device ON (selecting in Scene Graph) before going into Vision Preferences and making a change.  

If Lighting Devices are selected while going into Vision Preference and making a change, this also seems to keep the issue from happening to that specific selected Lighting Device(s).

Found in Vision 29.0.0, but also seeing in Vision 28.0.4.  I can test farther back if needed.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-196838

Turning ON Display with clip cube makes the viewport blank

Please, see the video attached.

Update. Viewport looks good - all objects are visible.

Now in Advanced properties turn "Display with clip cube" ON. Note, the Alert says all objects will be included.

Update the viewport. It becomes blank.

After you see the bug, if you double click the viewport and Edit Design layer, then immediately exit back to the viewport, then update the VP, the bug gets fixed.

The same in 29 (around 707934) 		Justin Hutchison
VB-195985

bug video: [^2023-05-24 09-08-53.mp4]

The functionality to set which lights are used for a viewport is broken (regression)
* open [^x.vwx]
* select the viewport
* window -> palettes -> lights
* toggle the light on/off
note when you deselect and then reselect the viewport, the light state should be whatever was last set.

ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION

VB-197172

Slab's component fill is not visible in a horizontal section viewport

Reported by Grzegorz:
|In case of a wall and section viewport, if it is rendered as an object beyond view plane it is possible to render wall's component fill (hatch, solid etc).
In case of a slab there is no way to render top component's fill, even in a horizontal section viewport, which Users usually understand as similar like vertical section.
As a slab's top view there is a 'graphical attributes setting', which cannot be connected with slab's top component. This makes it very hard to create a proper BIM floor plan for interior design where top view on a slab reflects the top component of the slab, especially when materials are in use.
 
Files and clip included|

This might be something between a bug or an improvement. In both cases it is kind of serious workflow issue especially for an interior design. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-195570

Mirroring Seating Sections with an Angle of Seating doesn't behave as expected if "Adjust Boundary with Angle" is checked.

I'm not sure when this starting happening (it's not new to the release) but it has been behaving this way for some time.  At least 2022,  if not before.  But it used to work correct.

1.) If you make a seating section,  using the seating section toolset. 

2.) Start off with a simple rectangle shape and a straight ahead seating focus.

3.) Apply an angle of seating to it,   (10° for example).   

4.) Check the "Adjust Boundary with Angle" in the OIP. 

5.) Mirror the seating section.

 

You will end up with something like the below:

!image-2023-05-11-13-33-34-399.png!

 

If "Adjust Boundary with Angle" is unchecked,  and then you mirror,  it behaves as you would expect.

 

!image-2023-05-11-13-36-26-931.png!

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-197850

Click on Stair tool preferences from mode bar

Icons appear dark in class pulldown. Not sure these need to be trasnlated? 		Payne Chang
VB-197961

Compact mode view bar: Deleting cathegories is not helping to make drop down menus bigger

By default, when you put the view bar in compact mode, the width of the drop down menus are very tiny. This makes the active content very difficult to read.
A solution for the user could be here to get rid of categories which are not useful for the user's workflow, so the drop down menus would dynamically get bigger (like it did in version 2023).
In version 2024, this doesn't help, so the drop down menus keep their absurdly tiny width. 		Payne Chang
VB-197423

Custom cabinet texture is lost when subtracting a solid

When you edit a custom cabinet (subtract a solid for example) all the information about the custom cabinet is lost.
So when you change a texture in the settings of the custom cabinet (attributes) and give each element a different texture, all this information is lost if you subtract a solid.

There is a workaround, but it's tedious:

When you try to use the Texture tool, you get an error message saying 'texture cannot be applied to faces of non-history-based object'.
When you convert the solid subtraction to a generic solid, the Texture tool works.

Please see attached video. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-196063

Some WinDoor objects report inflated values for ventilation and glazing areas

Hi folks, 

I've had a customer report that some WinDoor objects return approximately double the actual area values and some report zero, for glazed area and vented area. This is evident in worksheets and graphic legends. I've verified this in the attached Test.vwx. The other file is from the customer which includes three WinDoor varieties affected by this problem. 

EDIT: The WinDoor 'Types' verified so far are: 

*Affected:* 
* Overhead Tilting Door
* Overhead Sectional Door
* Overhead Folder Door
* Combos featuring two 'RS Sliding Right' and a Awning Hung in the fixed window, with 'EX Extend Down' above all. As seen in one of the files included. 

*Not Affected:* 
* Overhead Rolling Door

The user has also since provide a screenshot of sliding doors not being included in 'ventilated area' values/calculations. See attached.  		Christopher Graye
VB-197734

If we change the Design Layer name in a referenced viewport, the Design Layer will go invisible in the main file

When we have a document referenced into another and change the name of a Design Layer, the main file will have that Design Layer invisible after we update the reference.

It seems to happen for all referenced files that we test it with.  I feel this is probably Working As Designed (why would it show a layer that technically doesn't exist anymore with the name change?) but it'd be cool if the Design Layer could remain visible.

Please let me know if there's anything we can do to be of any assistance and have an awesome day!  :)  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197890

Font issue with large font sizes

See the movie, but suffice it to say VW is having big problems with big size fonts. Walid Remaili
VB-197918

Text Along Path produces outlined text

When applying the Text Along Path function, the resulting text appears to have an outlined style on both Windows and Mac. It is not actually the Outline font style being applied. The new shaped text receives the fill color of the text object that was configured before the operation. Similiarly, the Pen color previously configured for the text object is used as the outline color.

This is confusing because some font style commands still behave as expected for text (italics, bold,...) but others, like the Pen color, behave differently. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-197899

Duplicate room, wrong class data stamp

Duplicate room, the data stamp receives the class of the data stamp that is currently selected in the "data stamp tool" - and not your own.

Vectorworks Forum:
https://www.vectorworksforum.eu/topic/26238-r%C3%A4ume-datenstempel-fehler-bug/

I know that's in german, but maybe it helps you... 		Kevin Linzey
VB-193086

Hardscape uses material texture by default

Create a hardscape.

Edit the Main Area Components and set a material to the first component.

Going into 3D, the hardscape has the texture from the material applied, although the texture in the Render pane is set to be By Object, not By Component.

This behavior is not present in SP0 build 665441, so I am not sure if it is correct. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193253

Hardscapes Show Texture Mapping Incorrectly When By-Object Mode is Used

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model and a "Draped" Hardscape with an image texture applied.

To reproduce, in the Render tab of the OIP, toggle back and forth between "By Object" and "By Component" Modes.

Note that "By Component" mode shows the texture with an evenly-repeating pattern and consistent rotation (see first attached screenshot).

Note that "By Object" mode shows the texture with a non-repeating pattern and inconsistent rotation (see second screenshot).

I'm not really sure how the test this with pre-SP4 "Aligned" Hardscapes (it's pretty much impossible to get a similar shape) so I'm not sure if it's specific to the T02357 task. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-196677

Even if you edit the "Weigth" value of the Lighting Device symbol in the "Spotlight" menu > "Report" > "Lighting Symbol Maintenance..."in Vectorworks2023, it will not be reflected.

We have checked with following steps as follows.
We would like to ask you that our way is suitable to check or not.

Please let us know if it's incorrect.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Place the Lighting Device.
(Ex. Light Instr USITT 10BP)

2) Check the OIP>Weight is "0.00kg".

3) Select the "Spotlight" menu > "Report" command > "Lighting Symbol Maintenance..." submenu command.

4) Select the symbol selected in step 1) and click "Edit".

5) Enter "50" in the "Weight" field of the "Edit Instrument Data" dialog and close all dialogs with "OK".

6) Checking OIP>Weight again, it remains "0.00kg".

*After the above procedure, you can change the "Weight" by deleting the symbol in "Lighting Symbol Maintenance..." and re-registering a symbol.
However, this is valid only for Vectorworks2022, and it was not possible to change "Weight" in Vectorworks2023 even if the same procedure was performed.

Please refer to the attached movies.(13195 VW2023.mov and 13195 VW2022.mov)

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Kevin Linzey

VB-196363

New Equipment Summary Object does not work with Data Visualization

It was possible in the old Instrument Summary object to create a data visualization of Lighting Instruments that matched perfectly the Instrument Type in the Drawing area.

VB-197823

2024 Quick Preference icons are inscrutable

One of the things I like least about the new interface are the Quick Preference icons. They are small and their meaning is not immediately obvious.

The worst/least legible are:

—Show Clip Cube. The very worst. If I didn't know there was a Clip Cube Quick Preference in 2023, I'd be hard pressed to guess what the dashed hexagon with a locus in the middle is.

—Project Sharing Options. Looks like data tags

—Show Other Objects While in Edit Modes. Again, I'm having to rely on my pre-2024 knowledge of to interpret this icon. The old icon made sense because it incorporated the orange border that Vectorworks adds when one is inside a group/symbol/viewport annotation. But because all color is verboten now, this icon has lost its meaning.

—Display Light Objects. The triangle over the light bulb obscures it's interpretation. Why have it?

—Use Layer Colors. This one is ironic, as all three of the layers depicted are black, because, well, all the icons are black. At least make one of them grey? And why are there data tags again?

—Show Page Boundary. The old icon with its border was more informative, this icon could just as well be a shortcut to page setup.

This may be flagged as "works as intended" or an "enhancement request", but if an icon doesn't serve its purpose (to give the user a clear and succinct signifier of what the button does) then it has failed and doesn't work. The evidence that the icons are flawed is that 2024 gives you a legend of what the icons mean, which 2023 and before did not need.

This UIX is a large step backward, I regret to say. 		Payne Chang

VB-192610

Georeferencing and VWX refrenced file bug

Reported by Grzegorz:

A VWX file imported as reference into georeferenced file has its geometry scattered and relocated.
VW2022 - it was possible to import a VWX file as viewport reference (without georeferenced layers, e.g. building) into georeferenced file (e.g. DTM) without any rendering issues.

In VW2023 after SP2 the same process is impossible. It does not matter if a base georeferenced file is imported form VW2022 and referenced file is just updated or base georeferenced file is created from scratch in VW2023. In the end there is the same result in a form of scattered geometry of the referenced File.

Att_0 - expected result from VW2022. DTM works fine and reads localisation correctly. Imported file is moved from 0,0,0 to proper location by hand.
Att_1 and Att_2 - File imported from 2022 and updated. DTM works fine, but building geometry is scattered.
Att_3 and Att_4 - File created in VW2023. DTM works fine, but building geometry is scattered.

Files: see included 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-197625

Icon Error: Rectangle Tool, Three Point Rotated Mode Icon

The Rectangle tool's fourth mode icon, the Three Point Rotated mode icon, has a minor graphic error. It only shows two points. In previous versions, the icon shows three points. This visual cue is helpful because it hints at the mode's click-procedure. Payne Chang
VB-196388

Substantial performance hit on initial insertion of curved truss PIO at an angle with the default PIO settings, in a blank file when trying to immediately rotate newly created object with 'opt + ='

This one is hard to explain,   see narrated screen recording attached.   This behavior was not present 2023 SP5.

This one is largely reproduce-able in a blank file on first insertion.   Occasionally it doesn't do it.   After the initial performance hit,  successive inserts generally work,  but occasionally do not,  but I can't seem to pinpoint the cause at this point.   I've also observed similar with the straight truss PIO,  but I haven't nailed down the steps to reproduce it reliably.

But basically:

1. Create a blank file (unsaved)

2.  Insert a curved truss PIO.   Click once to set the insertion point, and then set an arbitrary non squared angle for it. (I think the bug hinges on this) 

3. Hit enter to accept the PIO defaults

4. With the truss still selected, Immediately try to opt+= (or whatever activates the rotate tool in your workspace)

5. You'll notice that the protractor get's stuck and there is no live preview of the rotate,  it's hard to tell if it's even attempting to work.

Updating to add that if you switch applications so something else temporarily takes over your screen,  and then return to Vectorworks.   If you try to insert more curved trusses,  they will be super latent in their insertion and you are unable to preview the rotation. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-197573

ViewBar auto-hide doesn't come back

Sorry to say but randomly when in auto-hide the viewer doesn't come back until changing the setting to regular mode. After putting it back into auto-hide it works fine. Payne Chang
VB-197597

Apply a material to a window component: component doesn't get the material's texture automatically

If you apply a material to a window's component, the texture will still be "by class". Before it can get the material's texture, the user still needs to choose "revert to material texture". This is confusing and not in line with the general Vectorworks behavior. Whenever you choose a material, the texture setting should be initially overwritten to the material's texture. Justin Hutchison

VB-197104

Hardscapes with Holes/Clips function poorly

VB-197297

ALT then "Menu Shortcut Letter" does not work but ALT+"Menu Shortcut Letter" does

Most programs that operate in the Windows environment have the option to Press the ALT key then the shortcut letter will be highlighted for the menus like in this image you can see the underscored letter. 

!image-2023-06-28-15-15-22-984.png!

If you then press the corresponding letter that menu will open.  In this version of Vectorworks this only works if you press the ALT at the same time that you press the corresponding letter.  Not in sequence like most other programs and every version of Vectorworks prior to this one. 

The sequencing is important because you can follow the letters down to actual command you wish to use. But if you have to press the ALT+Letter your shortcut highlighting ends and you can't learn the sequence of the command deaper in the menu because it does not show you the underscored letters again.  		Payne Chang
VB-192693

When creating a landscape area, the values of "Tag Line Angle" and "Tag Text Angle" are not taken

# Create a new document
# Go to Landscape Area Preferences and change:
** Tag Display -> Right
** Tag Line Angle -> 3°
** Tag Text Angle ->3°
# Create a Landscape area and note that changes are not taken from the format
# After recalculating everything looks great 		Bozhidar Stanchev

Note that the contour lines only show during navigation, and fail to show in static views. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-192948

Stake modifiers for hardscapes show different elevations for hardscapes not on the site model layer

In the attached file and video, I have a hardscape on a layer that is above the site model layer by 900'.  When I try to set the elevation of a stake modifier for the hardscape on the site model, the elevation that I type in the OIP for that stake modifier is not what is shown in the drawing window, instead it subtracts the height of the layer.  This makes it abit more confusing to get the right height on the hardscape stake modifier. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193166

Hardscape Stake Modifiers Take-On the Wrong Elevation on Elevated Layers

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few layers, one with a 10'0" elevation.

To reproduce:

- Create an Aligned Hardscape on "Layer 2"
- Enter the Surface Modifiers edit mode and add a Stake object

Note that the Stake takes on a 10'0" elevation. This is relative to the Hardscape, so the point ends up being 10'0" above the Hardscape (a 20'0" world elevation).

Ideally the Stake would pick up the exact elevation of the Hardscape at the point where it was placed, but according to the comments in VB-163789 that's not feasible. If that's not possible though, the Stake should probably just default either to 0", or to the elevation of the Hardscape (as shown in the OIP "Elevation" field).

With Grade objects that are added in Surface Modifiers mode, the elevation always defaults to 0".

The same thing happened in VW 2022. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193552

Hardscape Smoothness Sampling Value of Zero Causes Alignment to Fail

The attached movie and test file show this in 2023 SP3 compared to SP4. The file contains an Aligned Hardscape with a Profile line added.

To reproduce, in each version:

- Enable the "Interpolate Surface" option
- Change the Smoothness Sampling value to zero

In SP4, note that this causes the alignment to fail. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193677

T02394 - Interpolated Hardscape Surface Shows Incorrect Geometry After Realigning

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few round Walls and a few loci to be used as snap points.

To reproduce:

- Create an Aligned Hardscape that connects to the Walls
- Now use the Edit Wall tool to edit the Walls as shown (move the endpoints upward, add a vertex near the center)
- Realign the Hardscape
- Enable the "Interpolate Surface" option

Note that the surface shows a bunch of jagged points (see attached screenshot). The results seems to vary each time, where sometimes the peaks are more noticeable than others.

If you delete the Hardscape and re-create it from scratch, the surface will then be smooth. So it seems like the process of editing the aligning objects and then realigning the Hardscape is messing with the interpolation somehow. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-197216

Offset edge tool dragger arrows should not auto-rotate
