Currently, they auto-rotate:

!image-2023-06-27-07-14-31-794.png|width=282,height=268! 		Hernán Stamati
VB-196619

Site Model: Smoothed contours could go outside modified area in Proposed+Existing display mode

The issue here is with the '2D contours (smoothed)' in 'Proposed+Existing' display mode.
Open the test file and notice that some of the proposed contours go outside the modified area.

A little background:

Due to the presence of 'internal' modifications (that might come from the site model sculpting) we can't guarantee that there are clearly defined outlines of the modified area (sculpting doesn't provide explicitly outlined modified areas). Therefore, a special approach is needed for the 'Proposed+Existing' display mode where all existing contours are displayed, while the proposed contours should only appear in the modified areas.

Since we do not have clearly defined/outlined modified areas, we use the following approach to calculate the proposed contours:
- all existing and proposed contours are calculated.
- the two sets of existing and proposed contours are compared (as geometry) and are found those parts of the proposed contours that are not overlapped by any existing contours.
Thus, by finding the differences, we actually recognize the areas of modification through which each contour passes.

Probably for the 2D smoothed contours, the steps to calculate the proposed (parts of) contours for 'Proposed+Existing' display mode are:
1) - smoothed contours are calculated.
2) - the sets of found existing and proposed smoothed contours are compared.

And it seems that the steps should be:
1) - contours (the non-smoothed ones) are calculated.
2) - the sets of found existing and proposed non-smoothed contours are compared.
3) - only then the resulting proposed (parts of) contours are smoothed. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-197303

'Convert Copy to Lines' command fails with certain Walls

*Note:* One can easily reproduce the issue every time when using the customer's file or even just the Wall objects concerned when copied into a new blank document, but I have not found how to recreate this problem from scratch. All the affected walls may simply be corrupt, but I doubt that in this instance because:
# The usual tricks to fix corrupt objects have not worked. 
#  The command works fine when the file is converted back to Vectorworks 2022. And after opening this v2022 file in 2023 the problem still occurs. 

*Description:* In the users file (supplied), select any of the lower level's outer walls. (Style: Brick 70 Ext). Run command, 'Convert Copy to Lines' and choose 'Hidden Line Rendering.' No object will appear. Walls on the upper level work fine and choosing 'Wireframe Rendering' output with the problem walls works fine too. 

I tested many variables, including: 
* Checked Class visibilities to ensure the resulting object would be visible. 
* Copy-pasted one wall into a new blank document and retested there. 
* Manually change or remove all dependencies, including Wall Style, Object Class, Wall Components Classes, Class-attributed Textures, other OIP settings like height etc. 
* Toggled 'Bel Att Cls' (See: [Attributes Below Cut Plane|https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2017/eng/VW2017_Guide/Walls_edit/Editing_Walls.htm]) to match walls that function correctly. 
* Used the Eyedropper to pick up ALL settings, attributes (everything) from a wall that works with this function and apply them to the misbehaving wall. 
* Ran commands, 'Update Plug-in Objects' and 'Reset All Plug-Ins'

None of them worked. 

I will update this task if any conditional variables are identified. If you find any please @mention me because the user will want a workaround if there is one. 

Thanks! 

Jeremy  		Hernán Stamati

VB-192730

If you crate a roof with:
- a square eave cut
- 2 components
- the bottom component is retracted from the roof's edge
You will see that in Vectorworks, both components will have a square eave cut.
When you export this roof face to IFC, the top component will have a square eave cut, but the bottom one will have a vertical one. 		Mihail Rizov

I consider this a bus, because if these field are available while multiple objects are selected, a user expect this to apply to all selected objects.
- Ideally, this option should function for multiple objects at the same time. Especially when you have a lot of existing trees (which is usually the case in landscaping projects), this functionality is necessary
- In case this it is not designed edit multiple trees at the same time, I'll submit a change request about this. But in that case, there's still a bug. The flields and/or buttons which aren't supposed to work on multiple objects, should be grayed out in case multiple objects are selected. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-196803

KLS: Publish always uses page size of current layer

Hi there,
publish seems not to use the page size of the listed sheet layers, but the page size of the current layer. See video.
In the testfile there are three sheet layers. All do have different page sizes. All three sheet layers should be exported to image file with the proper page size. This does work when you export them using command Export image file. This does not work using Publish. With publish the different page sizes are ignored. Instead the page size of the currently active layer is used. We consider this a bug.
Gruß, Klaus Lüttich 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-196924

Vectorworks 2024 on windows icon size control

Icons in the new interface are significantly harder to see and lack and on windows lack a method of scaling them uop with out having to scale the entire screen!

Scaling the entire screen defeats the purpose of using a higher resolution screen as effectively it gets dropped back to the equivalent of using a lower resolution screen. Which means less available drawing space.

To give an example I currently use 150% scaling on my external 4k monitor that I run Vectorworks on. This is the optimal setting for most applications I use, and used to work fine for vectorworks. Using 2024 Its significantly harder to identify tool icons. The icons do not become easily identifable until the scale is set to 200%, but this then means the display scale has to be changed when i want to use any other application on that monitor, for example Camtaisa when I'm creating video content.
so not only do I lose the benefit of my 4k monitor but I now need to constantly alter the screen scaling depending on what applicatio I'm currently working in!

TO2250 Requirement R2 states

*__* All controls should be easy to read on both small and large screens, as well as high-resolution and low-resolution screens.

This has not been met for windows. 		Payne Chang

VB-194873

Corner Windows do not connect with each other

In the "Testfile 9878.vwx" there are two corner windows in walls that are not displayed correctly if the automatic 2D display for the horizontal section is switched off.

step by step

1. open "Testfile 9878.vwx"

2. You can see immediately that the two corner windows in the 2D plan are not connected.

3. Edit the corner windows

4. In the Settings window dialog, switch to the “Sections/Elevations” tab

5. activate the checkbox for horizontal section "Use automatic 2D representation"

6. Confirm the dialog with OK

RESULT

Now the windows look correct.

must of course be made for both corner windows

Our Windows CW developer has commented: "it looks like Vectorworks can't handle the window not containing 2D objects, so it doesn't push the break in the right place. This must be reported to VWI. They can either fix it or maybe tell how the window can force VW to slide it into place." 		Christopher Graye

VB-196920

Spotlight manage load tool bahaves inconsistantly depending on the choosen mode

The manage load tool allows multiple loads to be attached to a truss or pipe simultaneosly but can only disconnect or move one object at a time.

For a consistant workflow all modes should behave the same and allow multiple loads to be managed at the same time

 

The reason this command is so important is that currently once a load object is attached to a truss or pipe ther is no way to break the link except to delete the supporting truss or move the load objects onto another truss or pipe. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-196753

When inserting a symbol into a wall, the symbol may appear farther away from the wall.

Steps to reproduce.

1) Create a wall.

2) Create an Extrude, then click "Symbol" menu > "Create Symbol".

3) Click "OK" without changing anything.

4) When you insert the created symbol into the wall, the symbol will be displayed at a position away from the wall.

*As long as I tried, this doesn't seem to occur in Vectorworks2023SP4.

*This problem does not occur when inserting a symbol of a window or door into a wall.

Please refer to attached movie. (Sample0613.mp4)

 

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-195020

When creating a viewport using a Clip Cube, the color can be set from the Object Info Pattete's properties, but the color does not appear to change depending on the angle of view even if the setting is actually changed.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023(Occurs from previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When creating a viewport using a Clip Cube, the color can be set from the Object Info Pattete's properties, but the color does not appear to change depending on the angle of view even if the setting is actually changed.

Please refer to attached "Sample0417.vwx". 

Viewports 1,2,3 were created with Arbitrary angle of view.
Viewports 4, 5, and 6 were created with the view "Right Isometric".
Viewports 1 and 4 were created with Advanced Properties set to Default Settings.
For viewports 2, 3, 5, and 6, in the Advanced Properties, the Cap Fill Color for the clip cube is set to light yellow and the Cap Edge Color is set to blue.
Viewports 2 and 5 are set to Shaded in Render.
Viewports 4 and 6 are set to Final Quality Renderworks.

*Remarks*
*　The color of the surface is fine when viewed with the above settings, but the edges are mostly seen as black lines, although some parts of the edges appear to be showing normally depending on the angle of view.

*　We also checked the behavior after changing the Line Thickness, color, etc., and confirmed that there is not much difference.

*　We have also confirmed that the same problem occurs in v2020, which can now display clip cubes.

 ■質問
任意の画角でも問題なくAdvanced Propertiesで設定した色でクリップキューブのCap Edge Colorを出す方法はありますでしょうか。

*Question*
Is there a way to get the Cap Edge Color of the clip cube to be the color set in the Advanced Properties without any problems at any given angle of view?


Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Justin Hutchison
VB-196759

Data Manager: Formula checking does not consider German OS

When Vectorworks is running on a German OS the character used as a function delimiter is a semicolon {color:#de350b}*;*{color} instead of a comma {color:#de350b}*,*{color} as seen in operating systems set to other languages.

To test this you have to change the OS location and language to Germany and German.

Don't set it to Switzerland, since they use commas. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-196791

Structural Member Settings Dialog Shows Texture Info Incorrectly (Windows Only)

This is a continuation of VB-196260.

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Structural Member that uses By-Material textures.

To reproduce:

- Open the settings dialog and go to the Attributes tab
- Change the Member texture to "None", then choose "Revert to Material"

Note that the 3D Attributes list shows the wrong texture name/thumbnail at this point. If you move the cursor over the 3D Attributes list, the problem will fix itself.

I don't see this on Mac so it looks like Windows-only. 		Payne Chang

VB-196770

Data visualisation does not see properties located inside an autohybrid

Reported by Grzegorz:

While using a data visualisation autohybrids seem to be unaffected, when criteria of the data visualisation are connected with parts of the object inside the autohybrid.
Example:
Data visualisation with criteria (texture is XXX) does not see autohybrids that have texture XXX is texture is added to the object inside autohybrid. If texture is added to the whole autohybrid then it works fine.

See the clip with my example: 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-194338

U-stair single wider return issues

Hi,

Seems there are a couple of issues with the U-stair single wider return:

Issue 1 - There is an artifact inside the U-turn that appears to be part of the stringer or structure of the stair. This is only visible in 3d views. On Top/Plan view is fine. To replicate please see the video attached;

Issue 2 - If side 2 is reduced to 1801 mm and side 1 to 1050 mm, one of the step's threads moves back leaving the step without thread. This is only visible in 3d views. On Top/Plan view is fine. I believe this could be related to issue 1. Also, the lower connection to the floor creates an artifact that is only visible in 3d views. To replicate please see the video attached.

Please let me know if there is a workaround for these as the user who reported this is looking to design a stair like the one on issue 2.

Thanks! 		Christopher Graye

VB-194999

Extend Min/Max doesn't work when creating a Site Model

1) Create a pad modifier at -2000 elevation.

2) Create a site model from a rectangle over the pad.

3) When the site model settings pop up, check *Extend Min/Max when Needed* and close the dialog with OK.

The min elevation doesn't get updated.

Creating a new pad afterwards updates the min elevation correctly. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-193576

KLS: Import tree survey misses trunk perimeter in German

Hi there,
in our German version of Vectorworks we do no use parameter DBH.
Instead we use trunk perimeter which is measured at a height of 1 meter.
Well, when performing an import of a tree seurvey file, then the parameter trunk perimeter is missing and only DBH is available.
This is a bug. Instead of DBH there must be trunk perimeter.
And even worse. Customer do select DBH because there is no other option and the result is that all imported treed do have the default value of 0,9 meters for trunk perimeter.
Please make trunk perimeter available on import tree survey file.
See my video to reproduce this in an US version of Vectorworks.
Gruß, Klaus Lüttich 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-196198

Specific document: Clipping hardscape fails

When you try to clip the hardscape with another 2D object indicated in the video, the clipping fails.
More info:
- If you copy the same hardscape to another document, the clipping works as it should
- I tried to isolate the hardscape by deleting everything else in the document except that hardscape (objects, clases, (sheet) layers, resources), but the clipping kept on failing
- Creating a new hardscape with exact the same geometry: for the new hardscape, the clipping works as it should as well. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-194773

Settings Dialog Preview Images Fail to Respond to Class Visibilities in Shaded and Hidden Line Modes

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Window whose Sash geometry is placed in a custom class named "Test".

To reproduce:

- Make the "Test" class invisible
- Open the Window's settings dialog
- Change the render mode for the Preview image

Note that the class visibilities show correctly in Wireframe but not in Shaded or Hidden Line.

This isn't much of an issue with Windows and Doors, but the same thing now happens with Cabinets in VW 2024. In that case, being able to control class visibilities in the preview is much more useful (ex: hiding the door/drawer panels so you can see the shelves). 		Hernán Stamati

VB-192537

Problems undoing Viewport nudge

When you nudge a viewport by holding down Shift+Arrow key, then hit undo, two problems occur:
# The undo command only undoes one pixel at a time. With other objects types, undoing a nudge normally undoes the entire move, not each individual pixel increment.
# The viewport becomes un-rendered (displays as wireframe), which is highly annoying.

Attached is a screen recording showing this. In my example, the background render is Shaded and foreground render is Hidden Line. Also note I'm only nudging once by holding down the keyboard shortcut for a few seconds, I'm not nudging multiple times. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-196394

T02388 - Unexpected Reshape modes on selection

When I have the *Reshape* tool selected, and select a 3D polygon, NURBS curve, or NURBS surface, I usually get the "generic" 3D modes, and not the set of modes that includes *Transform* mode (or the Move modes for surfaces), and the 3D dragger modes.
* If with the object selected, I change to the *Selection* tool, and then back to the *Reshape* tool, I get the correct modes.
* If I do the initial selection with the *Selection* tool, and then select the *Reshape* tool with the object still selected, I get the correct modes.
* If I already have the correct modes for one object and then use the *Reshape* tool to select a different object right away (with no intervening selections or tool changes), I get the correct modes.

See the attached video. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-193475

STL export issues

When exporting tiny objects to .stl we have found that it does not properly export objects under 0.5mm at higher qualities.   This is replicated in both Vectorworks 2022 and 2023.

Medium and low quality exports seems to export everything however high and very high quality exports seem to start ignoring these small objects

The wheel file is the customer's file and the STL export test is my test file.  I can replicate this in both files.

The attached screenshot shows the wheel file exported from very high -> low quality.  We have seen this result in 2 different splicing softwares and when importing back into Vectorworks. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-196269

Help ID for Export USD command needs updating

There is an error in the Help ID for the Export USD dialog box. The current Help ID is listed as d_d_ExportUSDOptions and it should be d_ExportUSDOptions. We need to have the extra d_ removed. This is a separate issue from VB-194606.  Dave Donley

VB-195744

Spotlight - Rope and Stanchion Tool Adds Angle to Last Segment

Issue discovered as a part of my VW2024 (703199) b1 Acceptance Test.

When using the Rope and Stanchion Tool in VW2024, the last segment of rope and last stanchion always appears to insert on an angle. The angle is seemingly arbitrary. The new angle is not reflected in the "Rotation" field OIP.

This appears to be a regression from VW2023 SP5. Unable to reproduce in Build 698306

Video attached for clarity. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-196071

Crash on install

VB-194279

Railing/Fence update OIP Position... button to Position Post...

The "Position..." button should likely read "Position Post..." to match other UI buttons that open dialog boxes.

This will also avoid confusion with other Spotlight items, which use the term "Position" to designate a position upon which spotlight objects (lights, speakers, screens, etc) are hung. 		Christopher Graye

VB-195732

Heliodon 'by class' Colour Bug

The Heliodon object is not using the by class colour (white). It is changing it to red and therefore rendering the SLVP red. See the attached video.

Changing the Helicon fill to 'by object' and 'white' colour fixes the issue. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-195989

Cable object returns TotalWeight when queried by ILoadInfoDataSupport::GetTotalDistWeightParamName when it should be empty, which causes reporting issues

ILoadInfoDataSupport::GetTotalDistWeightParamName() should return the name of a field where weight is stored as a string, with units. In the case of the Cable object, it is returning the name of the field where weight is stored as a real in grams, which is accessed via ILoadInfoDataSupport::GetWeigth() (sic.)

This causes at least two noticeable issues:

The weight is not reported in the total weight of a Hanging Position or other objects and commands that utilize this field, as GetParamString() returns empty.

The weight/length gets calculated from the stored total weight, but never the other way around. This can lead manual entry of weight/length to be ignored, with no feedback for the user, as well as for the weight/length field to reset when the object reshapes. 		Kevin Linzey

# Duplicate the viewports and update them.
Notice:
- Some lines drop out of both viewports
- Some fills are incorrectly stacked on top of lines 		Hernán Stamati

VB-194049

Regression: macOS Ventura custom print presets are not recalled correctly

Hello,

In the movie you will see a custom Print preset being set up.

Notably that in the Paper Handling part of the print dialogue the 'Scale to Fit Paper Size" and "Scale Down only" buttons are not recalled. If they are *on* when the custom preset is saved, if you cancel and then return to the print dialogue and recall that preset these two fields will be {*}off{*}.

In Monterey apparently this works as expected.

Cheers,

Peter 		Hernán Stamati

Installation to this location is not recommended."

Click the "Install" button.

5)The following alert appears.
"Unable to verify the selected installation location, installing to this location is not recommended."
click "OK".

6) The installation starts and the message "COMPLETED!" is displayed.

VB-195630

SyncEngine CreateMaterial doesn't need to be called for RW

VGS is tessellating and during solid mesh access it will call sync material and then create material.  This calls get color image and we don't need this to be done because RW will loop and create its own materials later after tessellation.

 

This is showing as 25% of the sync time for Torre section model for me, in Instruments.

 

Maybe a flag could be made to skip the image retrievals for some clients. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-195554

DOM: Workgroup References slow because of Solid History

Frequently i meet some support-Projects in Relation to that issue (ProjectSharing Referencing). 

One issue are slow Workgroup references and one reason for that can be solids with modell-history behind them. I think it is normal, that history needs some more resources than generic solids but i am not sure if we have a bug here. It seems that some actions regenerate the solids also maybe referencing them. In one Project customer say it takes 15min but I can not reproduce. But what I can reproduce is a difference by 1000% between history-solids or generic solids. 
if I have the following test:

1. Refreshing Document 106 in Document 901 takes 42 Seconds.
2. After converting the solids on 106 to generic solids, it takes 4 Seconds.

Link to a further BIM Object (too big to attach). Here Referencing takes one hour because of the solids.
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/0rtjrpevfkrne8z/AAANlMVyyrsdru1BayElUMV8a?dl=0

It seems, that it is refreshing something in the Referenced Viewports which is should not do, or should it? 		Hernán Stamati

h4. Spotlight Blended Screens and OpenGL rendering

VB-195173

Static Accessories being patched using Spotlight Number

# Open the attached file (or create a file with Lighting Devices and Static Accessories attached)
# Select the Lighting Device(s)
# Go to Spotlight>Spotlight Number
# Set Spotlight Number with fields and values, just be sure to select an option for Accessory Numbering (ex. Next Number)
# Set Primary Direction to anything other than Manual
# Click OK to run
# Looking at DMX Patch (or in OIP), notice Spotlight Number has assigned values to Static Accessories such as the C-Clamps and Barndoors

If Spotlight Number is run in Manual, user can select what accessories get patch information.  However, the Static Accessories still show in the DMX Patch, but as Unpatched.  Unsure if this is WAD, or possible VB/VE. 

Also seems like any accessory that shares the Lighting Device Insertion Point can not be selected in Manual mode.

This is not a new issue, seen back in VW2022. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-194670

SEAT SECTION AND MIRROR TOOL

4. When mirrored, the result is a ghost section and looks rotated 90 degrees. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-195458

Many getter functions in the Graphic Legend plug-in's Utilities.cpp code allows for untracked access to TaggedData

There are many getter function in the Utilities.cpp file of the Graphic Legend plug-in that allows for untracked mutable access to TaggedData without an accessor.  Some of these getter functions include:

- The GetTaggedDataXXXArray() flavor functions (ObjectRef, ColorRef, Byte, Uint32)
- The GetOrCreateTaggedDataXXXArray() flavor functions (ObjectRef, ColorRef, Byte, Uint32)

The above functions return a mutable pointer retrieved from {*}gSDK->TaggedDataGet(){*}.  Ideally, these getter functions should return a const pointer.  If the data should be changed, then it should be changed through a call to {*}gSDK->TaggedDataSet(){*}, so it can be tracked for CTS purposes 		Hernán Stamati
VB-195494

crash in CResourceManagerBreadCrumbControlImpl::PaintControl

broken out from bag of unrelated crashes VB-195446.

https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?build=693289-vectorworks-win&category=108000 		Payne Chang

VB-193645

Vectorworks crash

VB-193683

Heliodon with "physical sun" seems to produce multiple schados under specific conditions.

This bug can be reproduces if the next conditions are fulfilled:
- "physical sun" is checked on in the OIP for the heliodon object
- In the Renderwokrs style used, the background is set to a renderworks background with a physical sky
- "indirect lightning" is enabled in the Renderworks style
- "nvireonment ligntning is NOT set to "current background", but to "none" or to a non- physical backround.

When you render an object with shadow, you will see multiple shadow segments in slightly different colors. As if the heliodon contains multiple light objects.

This seems like a very specific bug, but for us it is quite an important one, for the next reasons:
- Many Renderworks styles in our localized libraries contain indirect lighning and a physical background as a sky, but no environment lighning. Because most of the times, the physical sky gives an evironment lightning which is way too blue.
- The heliodon is placed with "physical sun" enabled by default. Disabling it is something the average user won't try
- this is a new issue since Vectorworks 2023, in version 2022 this problem didn't exist. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-193696

Path Animation Movie Not Created Properly (presence of white frames)

I've attached the file and the path animation movie for review.

I created a path animation movie in Final Quality Renderworks with durations of 10 and 15 seconds. Each time, the movie skips a few frames towards the end.

 

This could be caused when screen saver is enabled while the movie is till being generated. My machine is set to got to SS after 10 mins. 

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-193917

Worksheet functions in Worksheets and Expert Formula fields have to be developed hand in hand

To illustrate this, we can simply take the following formula:

=OBJECTDATA('Component', 'Function', T=INDEX)

This works for the expert formula within the Data Manager, when exporting Walls with the ExportOption _Export Separate Instances_ =TRUE for example.

But when pasted into the cell of the worksheet database header, you get #OPCODE? for both the main object and its subparts.

Yet the [tech video on T02242_DataManager_Expert_Formula|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/86280-0500-t02242_datamanager_expert_formula/] clearly states the following starting at 4:22:
"We get the same result using the same formula"

See the attached screenshot and Vectorworks document. 		Mihail Rizov

pressing a key on Windows

When you open a tab in Vectorworks and you press a key on your keyboard, nothing happens.
When you do it on Mac or in another application other then VW on Windows, a tool or command beginning with the key you pressed is selected.

Please see attached video.

VB-195325

HUGE text cursor seen editing text block, when the last line of text is empty

Older Vectorworks files with text blocks ending with blank lines of text, show huge

-Open test file showing a block of text created in Vectorworks 2018
-You'll notice at the bottom of the text block there is a empty
-Double click the text block to edit
-Zoom out and notice the size of the flashing text cursor
-Zoom to the bottom of the text block and you'll notice there is an empty line of text
-Deleting the empty line(s) of text restores the size of the text cursor 		Payne Chang

VB-195089

String for dialog box name has variables

For editing shaders, user selects the textured objects. Then the user clicks the arrow next to the texture name to open the *Texture* menu (on the *Render* tab of the OIP).

Next, the user selects *Edit* *[shader name] Shader* to directly edit one of the shaders that makes up the applied texture.

The issue at hand is the string for *Edit* {*}[shader name] Shader{*}, which is Edit ^0^1 Shader... This is problematic for localized versions because the resulting dialog box title will appear with an awkward grammar construction.

*Recommendation:* replace the string containing the variables with full strings for the corresponding dialog box titles. I'm informed by our localization engineer that there might be numerous combinations of these ^0 and ^1 variables in the dialog box title.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-195134

Drop down list for Quality pane in Shaded Options dialog box is too short

Select {*}View > Rendering > Shaded Options{*}, then look at the *Quality* pane. While the dropdown lists for Details and Shadows are Low, Medium, High and Very High, the width of this dropdown list is too short for the localized options.

*Recommendation:* please widen the dropdown lists about 200%-250% to accommodate the length of options in other languages, including Spanish. See below screenshots for context.

 

  		Justin Hutchison

VB-192587

Home screen prevents macOS from restarting

Hello,

In previous versions of Vectorworks if the program was open and nothing needed to be saved and you restarted the Mac then Vectorworks would quit and the computer would just restart.

However now if Vectorworks is open with the Home Screen, and you restart the Mac you are not able to. A message comes up saying that you have to quit Vectorworks first.

This might be the price we pay for the Home Screen but it is nonetheless regressive. If the Home screen is not showing but Vectorworks is open the Mac will restart as expected.  It's just that the Home screen stops it.

Expected behaviour would be that Vectorworks should quit irrespective of the Home screen visible or not?

Peter 		Payne Chang

VB-195184

Wall: named inserts lose the name when duplicated out of the wall

To replicate (see video):
1) open file
2) click-drag + ALT the window into the wall
--> The inserted window duplicate still retains the name plus a number.
3) click-drag + ALT the inserted window out of the wall
--> The duplicated window taken out of the wall has no name.

Contrast this behaviour with inserting windows into walls and taking them out:
--> You will see, that the name is retained at all times.

This behaviour applies to all objects, that can be inserted into the wall. 		Christopher Graye

--------------------------

2) Assign different textures to "Holes" and "Left" in the Render tab > Texture of the Object Info palette for the wall.

VB-194759

When you make an extrusion of a circle and make a viewport, the circle is displayed very segmented.

Problem did not exist in SP3 		Justin Hutchison
VB-194727

Light sources "leak" light in renders

Reported by Annelien:

The customer in this case wats to model a type of "projector". This is pretty challenging for the light-rendering it seems.
Light is spilling from the wrong sides of the model and causing an inaccurate rendering.

The customer first used 5 3D-polygons to shape the projector. I suggested they model it with the "shell solid" tool on a simple extrusion. This already aided the rendering quite a bit. The big problem is that the point light sources seem to have a certain "size" which in some cases clips through the "projector"-model's sides. This causes light to "spill" through the solid sides. When zooming in on a light source, the icon and selection gets rescaled, so there is no way of really knowing this "size".

The issue does not persist when using a "spot" lightsource. These render just fine. The issue with the point lightsource can sometimes be solved by centering the source on the model again. But as soon as your "projector" model hits a certain small size, the issue persists again.

This problem might just be caused by limits of the rendering-abilities. But reporting it seemed smart 		Justin Hutchison
VB-194799

VGM acceptance tests, views 9-13 not showing anything

In the pan/zoom test, the views at the beginning and end work but the ones in the middle are not showing any graphics on screen.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-194848

Omniverse Connector wrong mode

[~daved] - The Omniverse Connector tool Preferences mode currently does not comply with the UI Guidelines. I thought we had fixed this for 2023 SP4, but it has come back from the dead.

In order to comply with UI guidelines, please:
* Name the current Settings mode Omniverse Connector Tool Preferences
* Make the tool tip for that mode say "Sets the export preferences and Omniverse View version." (Note: the period should be included in the string.)
* Replace the Settings icon with the Preferences icon
* Rename the dialog box Omniverse Connector Preferences

Your Datasmith Direct Link tool is in compliance with UI guidelines, and should serve as a good model for this.

I'm filing this bug for Windows but assume Mac has the same problems.

!image-2023-04-18-12-23-06-818.png! 		Dave Donley

VB-194860

Some tools are not visible unless the tool set is undocked

When a tool set has a lot of tools, such as the Building Shell or Dims/Notes tool set, some tools may not be visible when the tool set is docked. This is true even when the tool set has a scroll bar; sometimes, the scroll bar doesn't go down far enough. If you undock the tool set, you realize there are more tools available.

See the attached images. Docked_toolsMissing.png shows that the scroll bar is all the way at the bottom of the Building Shell tool set. Undocked_moreTools.png shows that after undocking, the tool set actually contains three more tools. 		Payne Chang

VB-193516

This is particularly nasty bug that just started yesterday, and seems to be occurring in both 684728 as well as the latest beta 690139.

See attached screen grab. When I grab an object and drag it using the selection tool, the objects alternatively disappear, half disappear, or mis-render. Executing a quick zoom in/out with the mouse wheel resolves the issue.

This applies to changes using move, move by points, and changing coordinate info in the object info palette. Weirdly, the regular "move..." command does not seem to be affected.

Any object in the drawing space is affected, regardless of object type.

VB-194801

Data Viz not applying graphic override on 2D components in Hidden Line (Horizontal Section VP)

Hi,

I have a renovation / phasing related conundrum from a customer - these are two demolition plans on a Sheet Layer, one is a Top/Plan Viewport, the other a Horizontal Section. All objects have a phasing record with Existing, Proposed and Demolition, and a Data Viz setup for each view. For some reason, Horizontal Section does not apply the same graphic override via Data Viz (none for all attributes with RF value Proposed) as a Top/Plan Viewport, so you can see some Doors floating around on the HS, but they are not displayed on a regular VP. Also Door pen is changed to red colour on the VP, but not on the HS, but Walls for example are displaying just fine on both. Data Viz does not apply correctly here, but I can’t quite figure out whether the problem is in Top and Bottom Cut for 2D components, or is it Hidden Line maybe?
It feels like a bug, just not sure if it’s a bug of HS or Door or Data Viz or something else.

To see the issue flick between Phasing - Existing, Phasing - Demolition and Phasing - Proposed data viz. Then have a look at Sheets 1001, 1101, 1201 and 1301  

Thanks 		Hernán Stamati

VB-194324

Closed Corner Vertex Polyline Fill Bleed

This issue came up when working in VW2024 in Project Sharing with QA Pod group.  Other members in Project Sharing could also see this result.  However, I don't think this is an issue with Project Sharing or just in VW2024.  Seen and reproduced in VW2023 SP4.

See the following in attached video:
# Open attached file (Export to VW2023 from VW2024 PS Working File)
# Zoom in and out of Top/Plan to see the L shaped Polyline fill bleed appear and disappear
# When in a 3D view, this fill bleed is always present
# Un-Checking Closed in OIP removes this bleed (not what I would expect?)

Reproducible using the line tool to close area and use Modify>Combined into Surface (Corner Vertex)

Not-Reproducible with using Modify>Clip Surface (Arc Vertex)
# The difference between the two polylines produced from these two workflows was the type of Vertex: Corner & Arc
# However, other polylines in this file that are Corner Vertex don't show this issue.
# If Corner Vertex Polyline is changed to Arc Vertex, the bleed issue is resolved, but all the corners have a 1' radius arc.  So they loose the 90° inner corner. 		Josh Loy
VB-194410

Redundant scroll bar shows up in the basic palette

In the first picture you can see how I've made my basic palette snugly have 5 icons per row and there's almost no room bellow the last row.
When I close and reopen VW the palette is now with 4 icons per row + a scroll bar and I have to extend it sideways quite a bit before it fits 5 icons after which I have to shrink it back to 5 icons wide but with no empty space on the side. 		Payne Chang
VB-194236

Hidden line rendering of tags inconsistent results at different Zoom scale OR Window Position.

We are seeing that Hidden line rendering of tags (such as window tags) create inconsistent results at different Zoom scales. See the image and .vwx files attached. No such inconsistencies exist with Shaded Render.

 

There are a couple of variables which seem to affect the inconsistency. Firstly the Zoom scale percentage will make a difference and so also will the position of the window in relation to the centre of the wall thickness. This can be seen in the image which shows the same objects rendered in Hidden line at different Zoom scales. You will also see two separate windows (in two different walls in the image. One has a different Wall Offset value to the other and this can make a difference as to whether the tag appears in front of of buried with the wall face. (You will see that the tags have been made large in relation to the window in order to get a better idea of what is happening. 		Josh Loy
VB-194403

Acc Test - Mac - Color Picker Spectrum crosshair jumps around

Depending on the selected mode, the crosshair can jump around or become stuck after editing the color with certain sliders in the Color Picker Custom tab. Payne Chang

VB-194254

Omniverse connector-related mode shows incomplete product name

The Omniverse Connector tool has a mode called {*}Send to View{*}, but the “View” part is not generic but the shortened product name Omniverse View. Incomplete product names have an unfavorable impact on localization, as in the case of {color:#4c9aff}*GHST-956*{color} ( https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/GHST-956)

*Recommendation:* To avoid equivocal translations, please change Send to View to {*}Send to Omniverse View{*}. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193886

Redshift rendering results are different between Vectorworks2022 and Vectorworks2023.

Steps to reproduce
1) Create a extrude on Vw2023.

2) Click the "Current View" dropdown in the view bar and select "Right Isometric".

3) Click the "Rendering" pulldown in the Create Viewport dialog, select Renderworks Style > Redshift Rendering Exterior Final, and close the dialog with OK.

4) Right-click on the Renderworks style in the resource manager and select "Edit" in the context menu.

5) Select the "Background" tab, change "Apply Renderworks Background" to off, and close the "Edit Renderworks Style" dialog with "OK".

6) Click the "Update" button in OIP.

7) Extrude is displayed almost "Light Gray" color.

VB-194266

Spotlight - Lighting Pipe - Marker Bug

Hi there,

colleague came up with this problem:

He had set the &#x27;End Marker&#x27; to active, drawn some lines.

Later he added / moved Lighting Pipes and all of sudden they had markers everywhere flying around.

Took me a minute to notice the marker setting being still turned on.

The problem is, the Pipe itself has no option to turn the marker off, the marker setting cannot be activated. So there is no option to deactivate them with a simple click.

Complicated workaround: Deactivate the marker, select the pipes, edit a field and edit back. Then the marker disappears.

Attached vwx file and screen recording 		Kevin Linzey
VB-193968

slow document: pan, zoom, drag, etc.

The attached file displays a slow performance while doing pan, zoom, drag objects, etc.

Customer complains that has difficulties working with this file with MacOS, while with Windows this seems to not happen. Can please someone take a look at this and see what is causing the problem? Thank you in advance. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-194264

Worksheet jumbles user criteria when "ALL" is in the mix

When an IF statement is used inside a DATABASE() statement in a Worksheet Database Formula, VW can jumble the terms inside the IF statement to an illegal arrangement. This occurs when "ALL' is one of the criteria.

In the attached file, the 4 database rows contain formulae in the form:
=DATABASE( IF(LogicalTest, TrueResult, FalseResult) )
where the TRUE and FALSE Results are criteria expressions, like ((T=RECT)).

When both criteria expressions are of the form ((C=Demo)) or ((T=RECT)), the DB Row formulae do not get rearranged, and execute as expected.

But, when one of the criteria expressions is "ALL", all hell breaks loose (pun intended.) The presence of "ALL" in the formulae causes the terms of the IF statements to be arranged, and yet, no syntax errors are issued even though the statements are syntactically incorrect.

Terms within an IF statement should never be rearranged.

Oddly, the formulae with "ALL" in the mix work when the <logical test> evaluates as TRUE, but not when it evaluates as FALSE. After the terms get jumbled, it's truly amazing anything works at all. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-192547

Label Legends do not align in Schematic Views

When using the Offset Locus Point function on Lighting  Accessories, principally for offsetting a Lighting Device along a sidearm, all works well apart from Label Legends in Schematic Views. These revert to the old insertion point of the Lighting Device rather than the new insertion point specified by the Point Loci inside the Static Accessory Symbol.

 

Please find the file and a video explaining the problem. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-194196

QRT OMI - Sheet Viewport appearance regression - Shaded render showing darker

We are trying to get this customer to switch to 2023 but they have demonstrated a regression that is happening with their files converted from 2022 to 2023 whereby the Shader rendered part of their viewport is noticeably darker in 2023 than 2022 and they are saying they cannot trust the new version.

This is marked critical and QRT because we are also trying to get this customer to test our Project Sharing 2024 feature.

This is related to  VB-193896 in that it is the same customer, with the same file and the same viewport. Please see the files uploaded at VB-193896  - as they are the same files needed to be looked at.

 

I believe this issue is something to do with the fact that the quality of the light in a file converted between 2022 & 2023 is different. Please see the attached movie part 1 to see the effect that this has on the viewport and then see attached movie part 2 to see a demonstration of how the same issue can also be seen in the Design Layer view that the Sheet Viewport is looking at.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-194249

It is impossible to delete arroheads from structural members

When you draw a structural member while the arrow heads are (accidentally) active in the attributes palette, all 2D object in the structural member's 2D part get arrow heads. Since Structural members are often created in a 3D view, it might last a while until this is noticed by the user. Since there's no way to get rid of these arrow heads, the user is forced to recreate the objects after disabling the arrow heads in the attributes palette. Karthick Chilaka
VB-194246

Worksheet cells formatted as Dimension do not convert their values when document units change

In worksheets, cells can be formatted with several different numeric formats. One format is Dimension. 

I incorrectly assumed that this format would retain the equivalent value of an entry after the document units are switched.

For example, with Document Units set to Inches, I enter 24 into a cell. The cell will display 24" (assuming Show Units is checked.) When I change the Document Units to Feet & Inches, the cell will display 24'0", and not 2'0" as I expected.

Regardless of a cell's format setting, if you type in a number with units (100 mm), it will interpret the entry and convert both the value and the units to the current Document Units setting (3.937", assuming the document is set to Inches), and the cell is automatically converted to a Dimension format setting. Unfortunately, the same courtesy is not afforded to Dimension formatted cells when the Document Units are changed. Only the unit suffix changes and not the numeric value.

Expected behavior: Changing a file's Document Units setting will update the value and units of the numerical data in Dimension formatted cells to reflect the equivalent value in the new Document Units setting. This should apply to all Linear, Area, and Volume entires in Worksheets.

Example file attached.

 

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-193878

Graphical Issues with file

The file is experiencing some major graphical issues, we can not determine the cause on our end. As soon as you go into a right iso in the file and fit to objects the file acts problematic. 

 

I have deleted everything in the file and it still behaves poorly.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-194226

The VectorScriptLanguageGuide has wrong info about identifier lengths

In the VectorScriptLanguageGuide it says: "Identifiers may be any length, but the first 255 characters are significant (i.e., recognized by the VectorScript compiler)." This is not true. If you have 2 constants in a VS file that have the same name for the first 20 characters, you get a VS compile error. If you rename one so they do not have the same name for the first 20 characters, the error disappears. The VS error it gives for two constants with the same name is "Error: Expected BEGIN". It would be more helpful if the error said something about two identifiers having the same name for the first 20 characters. Vladislav Stanev

VB-193293

Task T02386 - USD library requires to manually deleting dlls from output folder

Use Visual studio and load the vectorworks solution. Make sure the output64 and Output folder are clean.

Compile and run, first time VW will generate the usd library correctly.
make any change to any other file, then compile again (dont clean just compile the new changes)
this time the pre/post build events will complain about the USD dll output folder already exists.

if you delete the release/usd/dlls folder you will be able to compile and run

The command "if NOT EXIST C:\dlopez_perfRel\depot\Engineering\VectorWorks\ReleaseBranches\Vectorworks28.0.x\AppSource\Output\Plug-Ins\Release\USD\dlls (mkdir "C:\dlopez_perfRel\depot\Engineering\VectorWorks\ReleaseBranches\Vectorworks28.0.x\AppSource\Output\Plug-Ins\Release\USD\dlls" )

VB-193872

T02359 - Vectorworks does not recognize changes to the omniverse server

After the 1st successful login to the omniverse from Vectorworks, Vectorworks does not seem to detect login failures.  For example, password changes.  And there appears to be no way to update the password from within Vectorworks.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Open Vectorworks, publish something to the omniverse.  Use the nucleus navigator to confirm the file is there.  Login to the omniverse from Vectorworks if needed, this seems to only happen on the very 1st time.

2) In the nucleus navigator, change the password for the omniverse account you used with Vectorworks.

3) Go back to Vectorworks and publish something to the omniverse again.  You won't be prompted for a new password, shown a login failure, or given any other indication that something went wrong.

4) Check the nucleus navigator for the new file from the last publish, it won't be there. 		Dave Donley
VB-194088

Import the USD file exproted by Vectorworks into Cinema4D and export USD format. After that, when the exported file is imported into Vectorworks, the texture applied to the object is displayed as black.

We checked this behavior with the steps below. 
We would like to ask you that our way was suitable to check or not.
Please let us know if it's incorrect.

1) Create an Extrude.
2) Click  the Render tab of OIP.
3) Expand the "expand" list in the OIP's Texture Browser item.
Then click "None" to select it.
4) From the texture list, select "Texture" and select any texture.
(Example.Brick broken joint 01<brick attribute>RT)
5) Select "File" menu > "Export" command > Export USD(3D only) ... submenu command.
6) Click the "OK" with keep the default settings.
7) Open the exported usd format file with Cinema4D.
(Example.test.usd)
8) Select "File" menu > "Export" command > "USD(*.usda/*.usdc)" submenu command.
9) Click the "OK" with keep the default settings.
10) Select the Vectorworks "File" menu > "Import" command > "Import USD (3D only)..." submenu command.
11) Select the exported usdc format file and click "Open".
(Example.cinematest.usda)
12) Click the "OK" with keep the default settings.
13) Select the "View" menu > "Rendering" command > "Shaded" submenu command.
14) I can't see the texture that applying to the object by me.

*About step 7)
When I open the file exported with Vectorworks in Cinema4D, the texture is displayed.
So it seems there is something wrong with my procedure when exporting in Cinema4D or importing in Vectorworks.

Please refer to attached files. (test.vwx, T02386 question2.mov, test.usd, cinematest.usda)

Sanshiro Moriyama

* Occurs peculiar to VW2023. (does not occur on VW2022)
*Even if it does not reproduce, the settings of whether to use each display connected to the two graphics cards as "duplicate" or "extend" are switched, or restarting VW or restarting PC etc. It was reproduced by being given a change.

VB-193357

T02324 - Status message missing when activating a Saved View from drop down

!image-2023-02-17-00-18-16-839.png|width=613,height=333!

Depending on how the Saved Views are changed, there are inconsistencies with when the blue highlight via the Navigation Palette changes, as well as the notification in the Message Bar. Steps on how to re-produce are below.

1)Select a Saved View via the Navigation Palette.

2)Select a Saved View via the View Bar dropdown menu.

3)Use your keyboard shortcut to either move forward or back a Saved View.

4)Notice that the blue highlight and message bar notification change/appear after the transition is complete.

VB-193585

OpenGL Edge Lines not showing at edges of objects in uncropped viewports.

In the attached "SVP From VP and HSVP OpenGL.vwx" file, you will see two uncropped and two cropped viewports.  Notice the edges drawn in OpenGL do not show in the uncropped viewports.  However, when the viewport is given a crop that's larger than the bounds of the geometry shown within, the edge lines do show.

VB-193843

Shadows in Shaded render mode, not appearing when using lesser onboard graphics. Works in Vectorworks 2022.

Posted in the Beta and Public forum and confirmed in house. There appears to be a difference between Vectorworks 2022 and 2023 in regards to supporting shadows with onboard video. These onboard graphics don't meet the 2GB minimum requirements for entry level drawings in Vectorworks. However, the fact Vectorworks 2022 works and 2023 doesn't, figured it was worth a report.

User reported the issue using (Macbook pro 13" 2018, 2,7 GHz Intel Core i7, Intel iris plus graphics 655 GB1539) I also duplicated with a Mac mini Intel HHD Graphics 630 1536 GB.

See attached video where rendering in shaded mode is compared between Vectorworks 2022 and 2023. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-193615

Snap point difficult to maintain in Normal Perspective while zooming

While testing the fix for, "VB-192964 Geometry is sliced in Normal Perspective", I'm finding something odd with the snap point disappearing, while zooming in the, "cube23.vwx" test file.

It's a little tricky to describe...if you lock in on a snap point and zoom in at a constant speed, everything is okay. If you lock in on a snap point, zoom a little, stop, then try to zoom again, you've lost the snap point and the zoom jumps, significantly. Sometimes, you can lock in on a snap point and it stays locked.

In Vectorworks 2022 SP6 for comparison, once you lock in on the snap point and zoom, it stays locked and the snap point doesn't disappear.

See attached video comparing Vectorworks 2022 SP6 to 2023 SP4 (691376). I don't see this issue in 2023 SP0, SP1, SP2 or even SP3 with the near plane clipping problem reported in VB-192964

Justin Hutchison
VB-193977

Textures for image prop persons contain a "glow" reflection.

When you place a person (image prop) from the visualization library, you'd expect the image prop to integrate in the environment of the drawing.
Strangely enough though, this image prop will always display super bright, even in for example a night render.
It seems like this is because the image prop's texture contains a "glow" for reflection. This makes the person "shine" like a moon, which looks very unrealistic in settings with dim light or when the image prop is standing in a shadow. The image prop's textures shouldn't contain a glow. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193938

VW2023 Crashed after bringing it back from the Dock

I came across this =scenario where VW crashed after bringing it back from the Dock on Mac.  I minimized the VW application, by clicking on the yellow icon in the top left of the application window. It sat in that state for a while. When I brought it back, VW crashed. This is the second time I see the crash.

Maybe the crash log has some clues as to why VW crashed? I'll keep adding to this report if I see it again.  		Payne Chang

VB-193911

VB-193764

Seating Section VERY Difficult To Use

The Seating Section tool is a *LOT* more difficult to use than it should be.  For example, in the attached file...
# Note the section counts and chair arrangements.  Select the single chair Symbol in the Resource Manager.  Edit the 2D portion of the Symbol definition - ONLY CHANGING THE FILL COLOR.  When you exit the Symbol editing environment, every section will be rearranged and counts will change - though no chair dimensions changed.
# Select a simple rectangular section, such as "D."  Note its arrangement and count.  Click "Settings" in the OIP and then "Yes" in the dialog that opens.  WITHOUT CHANGING ANYTHING, click "OK" in the "Seating Sections Settings" dialog.  The section's layout will change and the count will change.
# Select an oddly-shaped section, such as "K."  Note its arrangement and count.  Click "Settings" in the OIP and then "Yes" in the dialog that opens.  In the "Seating Sections Settings" dialog, click on "Seating Information" in the List Browser and check the "Number rows" box.  Click "OK."  The section's layout will change and the count will change.

This is beyond infuriating.  The layout in the attached file took several hours to create.  Even simple changes like changing chair colors and displaying row numbers require HOURS of unnecessary work.  Clicking the "Edit Seating" button in the OIP, exiting the editing environment, and clicking "Modify the boundary so that it fits all seats." has no effect on fixing the above issues.

PLEASE make this tool usable!

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-193820

Renderworks texture's reflectivity percentage setting is not changing reflectivity in Shaded render mode

- bug file [^Courtyard 33 tree grates.vwx]

I am currently working with a VWX "signature project" file (that was made prior to the recent shaded render enhancements). I noticed that the tree grates are reflecting the HDRI {*}a lot{*}. They are not modelled grates but rather simulated using a RW texture with metallic reflectivity.

I inspected the Renderworks texture used by the grate's class and saw that its metal reflection is set to 80%. I want the grates to have very low reflectivity In Shaded… so I would expect that setting the texture to 0% Reflectivity would accomplish this, however even after doing so the texture still reflects. It seems that adjusting the reflection percentage has no effect on the reflectivity in Shaded mode.

A link to the file I am referring to is available via the link below. The file should open up already zoomed in on the tree grates.

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11edba1757b55ba1bf4812d7462326d1/]

The texture is used for the class A_EF-Site-Grate

The texture is Metal Iron Mesh RT

!image-2023-03-06-12-00-11-796.png|width=1223,height=694! 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193533

T02386 - UI Review - Some help texts still missing, some ambiguous.

Two issues with help texts.

For the popup menus at the top, the help text still uses placeholders.

!image-2023-02-21-08-40-20-081.png|width=278,height=396!

For the "By Texture" radio button, the help text refers to "Material". 
* This should probably read "texture". (If it was "Material" it should be capitalised.)
* "Texture" should not be capitalised in the radio button label, as it is not a generic Vectorworks entity.

!image-2023-02-21-08-41-40-187.png|width=279,height=393! 		Dave Donley
VB-193532

T02386 - UI Review - Export USD dialog still uses old style group boxes, menus not left-aligned, help text still missing

[~daved]  did we want to include lines instead of group boxes here? 

The two menus at the top should be left-aligned.

VB-193537

Omniverse T02359 - UI Review - Send to View Settings shows empty menu, needs help text, miscellaneous others

I seem to remember that "Send to View" will be renamed to "Send to Omniverse" but it should probably not show an empty menu if nothing is available to select from. If there is nothing to select from, the menu button should be greyed.

"By Texture": Texture should not be capitalised.

!image-2023-02-21-12-41-48-145.png|width=423,height=412!

"By Layer" help text: "Layer" should be capitalised.

!image-2023-02-21-12-45-14-504.png|width=417,height=403!

 

"Include general records" help text:
* "Click to include record data attached to objects. Data includes records assigned with the Data pane and plug-in object parameters."
** I think "Data Pane" is a Vectorworks entity, therefore "Pane" should be capitalised as well. Maybe even call it "Object Info Palette's Data Pane"?
** Is "with" the right preposition? Should it be "through" or "via"?
* "and plug-in object parameters"
** should there be a comma before the "and" (I don't want to call this a dangling participle but the PIO does not assign a record...)?
** I have seen "Plug-In Objects" capitalised in a lot of texts and I think we should here as well, because they are Vectorworks entities. 		Dave Donley
VB-193752

Section viewports still show section planes of elements in hidden classes.

Imagine a PIO object (i.e. a door) that is in a class 'PIOClass' but its contents are in another class 'PartClass'.

If you create a section viewport through the object and hide the PIOClass in that viewport, the section plane for the objects in PartClass will remain visible. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-193526

In the Wall Framer command, the display of the class selection pulldown in the "Wall Class" dialog is misleading in functionality. Mac only

In the Mac version of the Wall Framer command, when selecting a class from the Name: pull-down in the "Wall Class" dialog, only one of them is checked.
Therefore, it is misunderstood that Wall Framer is created only for the wall of that class.
*On the other hand, the Windows version does not have a check mark.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Run the Vectorworks AEC menu > Framing > Wall Framer command on your Mac.
2) Enter an arbitrary name in the "New Framing Model" dialog and click the "Create" button.
3) Click the Options button in the Wall Framing dialog.
4) Add a checkmark to the class displayed in the "Name:" pull-down at the top of the "Wall Class" dialog.
*Windows does not have a check mark on the class.

Please also check the reproduction video [^13046.mov] .

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno

VB-193140

ExtrudeAlongPath rendered wireframe does not appear properly connected

I'm not entirely sure if this is a rendering issue or an issue with ExtrudeAlongPath, but I'd guess it's a wireframe rendering issue, because it seems to look fine in shaded and hidden line modes, but is incorrect in wireframe. Also incorrect are the highlighting, snapping and the temporary render while I'm zooming in and out. I've attached a video showing how I created the extrusion and one where I switch between different rendering modes.

The extrusion I made using a path consisting of two 3D lines and a 3D polygon profile. I have both the fix profile and lock profile plane options enabled. I used this set of options, because I wanted the extrusion to always have a "flat top" (hope that makes sense). I wasn't able to reproduce this issue using any other combination of settings. But all other combinations of settings also yielded an extrusion different from what I'm trying to achieve.

I'm assuming this is not a regression, as I was able to reproduce it in 2020. 		Josh Loy

VB-193567

Spotlight - Seating Section/Aisle Undo Issues

If a user uses the undo command after deleting a Seating Section and Aisle at the same, once the Aisle is deleted again, the Seating Section does not repopulate the seating area.

Steps to re-produce are below and video is attached for clarity.

1) Draw a Seating Section (Does not matter the mode)

2) Draw and Aisle in the Seating Section, but do not fully draw through the Seating Section. (Does not matter the mode). Be sure that "Split Mode" is active.

3) Delete both the Aisle and Seating Section

4) Undo the Delete command

5) Delete only the Aisle and notice that the Seating Section does not repopulate.  		Kevin Linzey

VB-193048

Hi Vectorworks

If I have point cloud with country coordinates at Vectorworks origin and enable the option "always import to Vectorworks origin", it imports to user origin and not to Vectorworks origin.

VB-193225

Spot Light fails to render in shaded at some zoom levels

bug video:[^2023-02-06 15-57-10.mp4] 
* open [^Light Not Showing.vwx]
* fly around
Notice z-fighting-like artifacts.   This can be fixed by turning off Shadows, or by making the extrude at least 20mm.  Putting an object below the extrude to expand the model bounds fixes the problem too.  Seems like maybe artificially expanding the model bounds by a small amount might fix this. 

See attached. Zooming in and out causes the beam of light hitting an extrude at the ground plane to flicker. You can also see the affects in rendered viewports when changing the scale slightly between renders.

Changing graphics acceleration and vector-caching made no difference. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-192794

shortening section-elevation line moves objects in the section viewport layer

VB-193079

DLVP referenced viewport geometry fails to render in SLVP on iMac

It does render on my MacBook pro, however (specs also attached). The Section Viewport on Sheet "View 1.2" (main room section) renders correctly on both machines.

The Section Viewports reference a Design Layer Viewport itself referencing a separate model file. The model's DLVP is ≈10x10^7 feet diagonally; Centering the Drawing on the Internal Origin reduces that by roughly half.

I suspect the issue with this file is the distant internal origin, but I have been unable to track down what geometry is responsible for the vast extents. I am also attaching the source file. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-192868

Marquee graphics for reshape tool not the same as for other marquee selection

Marquee graphics appear quite differently from the marque that we see for the selection tool. The 3D reshape marquee is only 0.5pt thick and has no fill, while the marquee we get with the selection tool is 2pt and has a translucent grey fill.

Also, the extra plane-aligned rectangle that is being drawn is confusing. Can it be suppressed when a marquee is bein drawn?

!https://forum.vectorworks.net/uploads/monthly_2023_01/769751545_standardmarquee.jpg.a1cb5401c06fa704f7e70ee2afa36d4b.jpg|width=558,height=447!

!https://forum.vectorworks.net/uploads/monthly_2023_01/769751545_standardmarquee.jpg.a1cb5401c06fa704f7e70ee2afa36d4b.jpg|width=558,height=447! 		Josh Loy
VB-193123

Worksheet Perim Function Returning millimeters for Space Obejcts

The worksheet Perim function is returning the value of the perimeter of space objects as millimeters regardless of the document unit settings. The function should return the perimeter in the current unit settings like it does for other object types.

 

The attached file has a Rectangle, a Space Object generated via Create Objects From Shapes from that rectangle, and a worksheet showing the objects and their perimeters as well as the Gross Perimeter and Net Perimeter fields from the Space plug-in parameter record.

The file as submitted is set to use units of millimeters.

Open the file and recalculate the worksheet. Notice that the perimeter of both objects are the same and the Perim matches the parameter record fields.

Change the file Units to Meters and recalculate the worksheet. Notice that value in the Perim column does not change, but the values in the Gross Perimeter and Net Perimeter fields change by 1000 to give the proper value for the document units.

Change the file Units to Feet/Inche) and recalculate the worksheet. Notice that the Perim of the space object does not change, but the Gross Perim and Net Perim fields do change and they match the Perim/25.4 column in the worksheet which converts mm to inches.

 

The Perim function in the worksheet should always return the correct value in document units. 		Rick Berge
VB-193138

Objects behind 3D objects may be displayed when "unified view" is turned on.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023(Occurs from previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When the "unified view"  is turned on, if the thickness of the 3D object is thin and the object in the background touches or is close to the thin 3D object, depending on the angle at which the object is viewed and the magnification of the screen, it may be seen through.

Steps to reproduce.
1)Go to  File menu > Setting document preferences > Document Preferences > Legacy 2D tab> Make sure "Turn off unified view" is unchecked.

2) Set "Layer Scale" to 1:50 and place a rectangle on Layer-1.

3) Create layer-2, create and place "extrude" with a height of 5 mm so as to cover the rectangle created in layer-1. (Class Options are "Show/Snap/Modify Others")

4) Set Right Isometric view, and Shaded rendering. 2D objects (rectangles) under 3D objects (Extrude) may be displayed incorrectly.

*In the sample file (Sample230124.vwx), rectangle and Extrude are drawn on separate layers, but they may be reproduced even when drawn on the same layer.


*Remarks*
* The problem was confirmed in Vectorworks2019 or later.

* If I check "Turn off unified view", some objects will be hidden in the background　correctly. Some of the things on other layers and adjacent things such as 3D objects are shown through.

* If the thickness of the "extrude" is extremely small, or depending on the magnification or reduction ratio of the screen, objects behind the screen may be hidden or displayed.

* The state where the thickness of the “extrude” is small is 1 mm at 1/100, but there is no particular threshold.

* When the magnification of the screen of the sample file is 100%, if the extrusion's value of the extrude is set to about 15, it will not be visible.

 
Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-192839

Adding Bitmap crop: when in VP Annotations, can't snap to original image boundary

When adding a crop to a bitmap, you can normally snap to the corners of the original image. However, when the bitmap is inside of Viewport Annotations, the snap points of the original image are often not available. File & recording attached. Josh Loy
VB-193088

NURBS Curves/Surfaces Become Corrupted After Converting Symbol to Group

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a NURBS Surface and a NURBS Curve placed inside a 2D/3D Symbol. The design layer has a 10'0" elevation.

To reproduce, select the Symbol and run the Modify/Convert/Convert to Group command.

Note that the Shaded and RW representations of the NURBS now show at a 20'0" elevation, while Wireframe and Hidden Line still show at 10'0"

It looks like the elevation of the Shaded/RW render will always be twice the elevation of the Wireframe/Hidden Line render.

The only way I could find to fix this was to use Rebuild NURBS to rebuild the objects completely.

This happens with all NURBS Curves/Surfaces in all Symbols.

The same thing happened in VW 2022 but I don't see this in VW 2021. 		Josh Loy

Thank you for the quick confirmation and for adjusting the phone number.  		George Stanev

VB-192992

Spotlight Instrument Summary upon reset causes publication of PDFs to be subsequently rotated if the design layer is rotated.

Hello,

The enclosed file will have the design layers rotated by 90º.

If you Export to PDF Sheet 2 you will see that the drawing produced has also rotated by 90º. In fact it will be rotated about whatever the rotation angle is on the design layers.

If you uncheck 'reset all PIOs that require resetting' the PDF sheet produced is not rotated, as is expected.

The cause of this weird result is the Instrument Summary on the layer 'Tina Lx hung'.

Even if deleted and a new one placed it will produce the same strange result. Note that once exported, if you go back to the Instrument Summary it will be blank and will have to be refreshed.

I have tried rebuilding using layer import into a new file to no avail.

 

Cheers,

Peter

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-192559

VB-192867

T02356 - UI Review - Tooltip help text still mentions peaks.

Walls have their own reshape too now so I guess we need not mention peaks any more in the tool tip.

!image-2023-01-23-09-06-02-747.png|width=571,height=178! 		Josh Loy
VB-192929

Too big default opening size for Windows and Doors

Hi Vectorworks

The default size of the openings from windows and doors is from my point of view too big. Users expect the opening object to be as large as the largest wall thickness in the area of the opening. For corner windows, a separate rule is needed: the opening object should have to completely cut out the adjacent wall.
Why is the size of the opening object important? In coordination processes, the opening object is used from time to time for model comparisons. Now the opening objects intersects for example with columns that are in the space.

Best regards, Marc 		Christopher Graye
VB-192838

Text "Bottom Baseline" doesn't account for line spacing

For a text object, setting the "Vert. Align" parameter to "Bottom Baseline" makes the anchor point of the text object be the baseline of the bottom row of text. This works correctly when "Spacing" is set to "Single Space." However, when "Spacing" is changed to something larger such as  "1 1/2" Space" or "Double Space," the anchor point is not adjusted correctly. It should move down to the new baseline of the bottom row of text.

See attached screen recording showing this. [^BottomBaseline.mov] 		Rick Berge
VB-192684

Long Delay when Switching View of Horizontal DLVP Rendered in Shaded Mode

I've attached a movie that shows this issue.

I deleted the site model and plants hoping to see if the delay goes away with no luck.

 

-Open the test file and update the section viewport then render in Shaded mode. 

-Switch to Top/Plan view. Notice this operation take a while for the new geometry to generate. 

-After the horizontal section is visible (this may take a few minutes), try to movie it to a different location. This will take a while too

-Switch to a 3D view (this should be fast) then rended in Shaded again

-Switch to Top/Plan. Note the delay come back again

Hardware:

HP Z2 G8 tower

32 GB RAM - NVidia RTX A5000 - 24 GB VRAM

  		Justin Hutchison

VB-192820

Wall texture bug in referenced file.

Reported by Grzegorz:

Wall textures are rendered wrongly when a file is referenced in geo-localised file. It does not matter, if walls are set to use components attributes or by object. Turning off "use world origin" does not change anything either.

Att_1 - How referenced file looks in a georeferenced file.
Texture marked as "A" is set to use components attributes with "world origin" ON.
Texture marked as "B" is set to use "by object" with "world origin" OFF.

Att_2 - file used as reference. I marked walls A and B for better recognition.

Files: 		Justin Hutchison
VB-192765

Hidden line render: smoothing angle behaves random in perspective views

The "smoothing angle" in the "hidden line render" settings seems to function very logical in orthogonal views. for example (see test file and video): with a setting of 20°, a line will be drawn at 21° and no line will be drawn at 19°. That is how it should be.
In a perspective view, though, it behaves very unpredictable. As you can see in the customer's document and video, sometimes 90° angles are even not rendered in a perspective. We do recommend customers to use a 20° angle to prevent complex looking and slow renders. 		Josh Loy

What do you need from me other than the file?

VB-192781

Hatch issue: "Skipping Pen Black HF" repeats poorly

I have two objects on a sheet layer using the "Skipping Pen Black HF" hatch from the Vectorworks Libraries. The one on the left has "Local Mapping" checked (though none of the mapping values were altered). The one on the right does not have default mapping checked, it's just the default mapping that you get as soon as the hatch is applied. But this one looks funky and striated.

Test file: [^SkippingPenHatch.vwx]

I think the underlying issue is perhaps that this hatch wasn't designed to infinitely tile, so it starts to look weird the farther away you get from the hatch origin. That being said, we should get better results from default hatches.

The issue was actually discovered when I was creating some elevations from a 3D model, using Surface Hatches. This is what I saw - note how stripey the top elevation looks compared to the bottom one:

!elevation.png|width=411,height=537! 		Rick Berge

VB-192652

GetPointAndParameterOnNurbsCurveAtGivenLength failing for certain NURBS curves

I stumbled across some NURBS curves, for which gSDK->GetPointAndParameterOnNurbsCurveAtGivenLength() fails for some reason.

It seems to happen only when percentOfLength is fairly close to 0.0 or 1.0.

I was able to create a file and a snippet of code that always reproduce the issue. File is attached to the issue. To reproduce it, I added the following code to the Debug->Test menu command:
{code:c++}
using namespace VectorWorks;

gSDK->SetUndoMethod( kUndoSwapObjects );

MCObjectHandle hPoly = nullptr;
for ( auto h : VWLayerObj( gSDK->GetActiveLayer() ) )
{
if ( VWPolygon2DObj::IsPolyline2DObject( h ) )
{
hPoly = h;
break;
}
}
MCObjectHandle hNurbs = hPoly ? gSDK->ConvertToNURBS( hPoly, true ) : nullptr;
if ( hNurbs )
{
WorldPt3 pt;
double param;
Sint32 index;
TVWArray_MCObjectHandle arr;
bool b;

b = gSDK->GetPointAndParameterOnNurbsCurveAtGivenLength( hNurbs, 0.22576425948300805, pt, param, index );
gSDK->SplitNurbsCurveByPoint( hNurbs, pt, false, false, arr );
if ( arr.GetSize() == 2 )
{
MCObjectHandle hh = arr[ 1 ];
b = gSDK->GetPointAndParameterOnNurbsCurveAtGivenLength( hh, 0.13434296560338491, pt, param, index );
arr.Clear();
gSDK->SplitNurbsCurveByPoint( hh, pt, false, false, arr );
if ( arr.GetSize() == 2 )
{
VERIFYN( kPGeorgiev, gSDK->GetPointAndParameterOnNurbsCurveAtGivenLength( arr[ 0 ], 0.99991070875791122, pt, param, index ) );
}
}
}

gSDK->EndUndoEvent();
{code}

It creates a NURBS curve from the polyline in the document, splits it twice and tries to get a point near the end of the middle "segment". The VERIFYN in the end fails.

And to make things even more complicated, moving the polyline to a location other than X=0, Y=0 causes the issue to go away...

Happens in Mainline, haven't tried 28, but I'd guess it also happens there. 		Josh Loy
VB-192541

Cavalier and cabinet views broken in 2022 and 2023

I cannot seem to get the cavalier and cabinet views to do anything. Can someone confirm this works as expected? When I am in a perspective, choosing one of the four oblique views will switch back to orthogonal but not to a cabinet or cavalier view. None of these choices will do anything, really. Justin Hutchison
VB-192584

2D fills are not working in section viewports on design layers

See attached file. There is one symbol (with an instance on the "Object" design layer) with a 3D component, a top component (filled blue), and right component (filled orange). 

When I make a Section Viewport from the right and put it on a sheet layer (see Sheet 1), I see the Right component which is filled orange as expected. Great!

When I make a Horizontal Section Viewport and put it on a sheet layer (see Sheet 2), I see the the Top component which is filled blue as expected. Great!

When I make a Section Viewport from the right and put it on a _*DESIGN*_ layer (see layer
"Section DLVP"), I see the Right component but it is NOT filled orange as expected. Oh no!

When I make a Horizontal Section Viewport and put it on a sheet layer (see layer "Hor Section DLVP"), I see the the Top component  but it is NOT filled blue as expected. Oh no!

Even though I believe all the settings should be showing 2D fills in these DLVPs, they are not showing.  		Josh Loy

On windows, if I tab, the cursor is placed at the front of the contents but nothing is selected, so the contents get prepended.

VB-200012

Railing settings dialog - can't use the attributes horizontal scrollbar when using a style

The railing attributes list browser is disabled when the attributes are set to "by style", but that also prevents the user from seeing the selected attributes. To see them, you'd have to either edit the style or temporarily convert the object to unstyled. Kostadin Ivanov

VB-200159
