VB-200145

Running the Spotlight Numbering command on Seating Section PIOs with a seating angle will change the border/count of the seating.

Attached is a file with a number of seating sections in it. Note that each section in the original file has 168 seats.

If you select the seating sections and run the "Spotlight Numbering" command. Choose to renumber the Section Name. I just used A as my starting point and +1 for the increment.

You can choose manual, or any of the automatic, L-R, T-B etc. It doesn't seem to matter. I used these seatings:

!image-2023-10-24-07-38-19-846.png|thumbnail!

Run the command and you'll notice that all of the seating sections with a "seating angle" value are now missing a seat. Reducing the count to 167. This doesn't seem to affect seating sections without a seating angle.

I don't understand why updating the section name value would force the seating to redraw in such a way. If I manually type in a section name on each PIO it won't do this, everything stays correct.

Kevin Linzey
VB-197635

STEPS:

New file - open Navigation Classes

Select Plant

Place Plant

Open Organization > Classes

delete all Classes containing Plants-

Reassign all objects to class None

The Plant turns all white

looking in the symbol everything is suddenly 'Make all Attributes by Class'

 

This should not the case, right? 		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-198204

Plant Tag Display does not work when set to "Left"

Hello team,

There seems to be a problem when picking the side for the plant tag to be displayed.

After changing the tag to be controlled by instance in the Plant Style, by selecting the Tag Display options between None, Left, Right or Center, the Left option cannot be selected.

 

After some tests on 2023 SP5, I managed to put the tag to the Left, however then the Right option became the one that could not be selected.

 

This issue does not seem to be affecting the last service packs of Vectorworks 2022 and 2021.

This issue is also affecting Vectorworks 2024 Beta4.

The video attached shows the problem.

  		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-198242

Multiple selection: Plant Tag Top popup doesn't update when changing selection

# Create 2 plant objects.
# Select them and from the Tag Top popup, choose "Set Custom Tag...".
# Make some changes and exit with OK.
# Notice that in the popup, the dash is selected and the new entry is missing.

The problem is that the popup is not refreshing with the new values when we have a multi-selection. If we follow the same steps but only select 1 plant, it will work. The bug is caused by the fact that the function _Boolean TParametricControllerHelper::UpdateListWidget(TObjEditWidget* pWidget, const SWidgetDefinition& widgetDef)_ is not being called. 		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-199002

Styled Plants Not Resetting Properly after changing Spread within Test File

I've attached a short The plants in the test file used to show the proper spread, but now some of the plants are not resetting to show the correct spread value.

 
* Open test file
* Notice the group of trees in the parking lot are of the same style.
* Select one tree and edit its style from the OIP Style drop down menu. Make the spread 20' and close "Edit Plant Style" dialog. Note the plants change spread as expected.
* Go back to "Edit Plant Style" dialog and change the spread value to 10' and close the dialog.
* Notice the plants don't revert to their original shape. 

 

If you save the file at this state, close it and reopen it, then you see the changes. 

 

  		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-199144

Moving Grouped Plants causes Multiplying in vectorworks 2023

Any editing to this group of plants in 2023 causes multiplying.

A workaround I was able to give the user was to try the plant path from scratch without intersecting the plants. This kept the multiplying issue from occuring.

The user also tested the file in 2019 and the multiplying issue does not occur there when trying to move a plant object. 		Alexandra Beshevlieva

VB-200093

TK BUG: Differences between Commands: "Ungroup" and "Convert to Group" with various objects

Hi VW-Team

there are some inconsistencies between the commands: “ungroup” and “convert to group”.

I don't know if this is a bug, or maybe it is more a combination of a bug + wish!?
I placed it here as bug!

1. Command: “Ungroup”

If you ungroup a Slab in a 3D-View you get “Generic Solid”
If you ungroup a Wall in a 3D-View you get one “Generic Sold” for each component of the wall, the solids are not grouped together
If you ungroup a Roof-Face in a 3D-View you get nothing, the object can't be ungrouped
If you ungroup a Roof, you get some Roof-Faces

 

2. Command: “Convert to Group”

If you try “Menu: Convert / Convert to Group”, in a 3D-View, you sometimes get different results!

A Slab will be converted to: a “Generic Solid”, as with “ungroup”
A Wall will be converted to: a group of 3D-Polygons.
A Roof-Face will be converted to: a group of 3D-Polygons
A Roof will be converted to: a group of 3D-Polygons

 

I think there are too many mixture results with both commands!
The most flexible options we have, is with “Convert to Group” + Roof.
There we are asked what we want to get, but not what object type (3D-Polygon or Generic Solid) we want.

Please overhaul the procedure to a more unify process!
If possible, always convert to group of "Generic Solids", if child-objects
like "components" exist in the parent-object.

The process of creating solids from 3D polygons is more complicated
when you have a bunch of different 3D polygons than the other way around!

 

Ideal would be to have “Convert to Group options” (as it makes sense)
+ a option to choose what object type you want to get:
- group of 3D-Polygons
- “Generic Solid” OR group of “Generic Solids” if child-objects like “components” exist in the parent-object
- group of Nurbs / Nurbs Faces

Attached you find a VW 2024 file with some examples.

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-200076

Structural Member Custom Symbols Can't Be Used if They Contain PIOs

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Polyline, a Round Tubing plugin, and a Structural Member.

To reproduce:
* Convert the Polyline and the Round Tubing objects to Symbols
* Open the SM's settings dialog and change the Member Type to "Custom"
* Expand the resource selector for the custom shape

Note that only "Symbol-1" can be used, while "Symbol-2" doesn't show.

The Structural Shape symbols from default content use the same types of plugins and those work correctly, so it seems like this should be supported.

The same thing happened in past versions, so this may be more of a with than a bug. 		Christopher Graye

The texture of cabinet in the preview however is not that of the None Class, it is from a random material in the file (I think the first material alphabetically). The texture of the cabinet itself is correct, it matches that of the None class, but the preview within the settings is incorrect. If I set the cabinet box class to None, the preview updates correctly, but as soon as I revert it back to <Cabinet Class> the random material texture shows back up. Justin Hutchison

VB-193349

Silent install with "unattendedmodeui minimalWithDialogs" gives incorrect error and doesn't install an executable software.

When you execute the silent install with the next command line:

start C:\Users\jeroenb\Desktop\A\dist1\resources\installer\"Install Vectorworks2023.exe" --unattendedmodeui minimalWithDialogs --Serial GJXBEZ-ZZ93RC-E8YGZG-4A7D4A --LDFChoice licenseID --installdir "C:\Users\jeroenb\Desktop\B" --mode unattended

- You will get an error telling you that the serial number is incorrect. I tried this with several valid (G and E) serial numbers. So this error is incorrect
- You can ignore the error by clicking "OK", so the installation continues. But after installation is completed, the "Vectorworks2023.exe" file is missing in the program folder.

The user can solve the issue by using "unattendedmodeui minimal" in stead of "unattendedmodeui minimalWithDialogs", but unfortunately is is the latter one with can be found the most easily in documentation/ forums. 		Tim Ardoin
VB-198270

This might be more of an Enhancement Request than a bug. If it needs to be changed just let me know.

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Cabinets that use each of the five Frame types.

Note that the Door/Drawer Reveal options have no effect on "Inset" Cabinets, which makes sense, but having the options available might be a little confusing to users. Ideally we would gray-out these options to show that they don't apply. 		Bozhidar Zarev

VB-199566

TBB: Edit Drawing Stamp Options dialog can hide behind TBB Settings dialog

This can be reliably be replicated with a MacBook Pro M2 Max (Liquid Retina XDR-Display and Philips Brilliance 258B).

To replicate (see video):
1) open a file with a Title Block Border on a layout
2) open the TBB settings dialog (through OIP)
3) Goto Drawing Stamp
4) Under "Stamp Text" click on the dropdown and select "Edit Drawing Stamp Options..."
--> The new dialog is on top of the TBB settings dialog
5) switch to an application that is in full screen mode
6) switch back to Vectorworks
--> Now (usually) the Edit Drawing Stamp Options dialog is behind the TBB Settings dialog. 		Payne Chang

Why Triad size is bigger in Mac when comparing to Win.

Now create a new wall peak. You'll see the missing frames along the top of the curtain wall.

Note this only occurs if you add or move a wall peak *after* the curtain wall door is inserted.

VB-199526

Spotlight straight truss tool doesn't draw 2 chord truss correctly

The straight truss tool has a number of issues when drawing 2 chord ladder style trusses,
# The ladder truss is drawn lying flat on the ground, which means it has to be rolled -90 degrees to be correctly orientated for use
# when the ladder truss is rolled the 2D geometry is no longer correct. instead of appearing as a pipe from above it appears as a squshed ladder truss (see attched image
# When rolled autoconnect doesn't display correctly in 2D top/plan, its offset to the side of the truss
# Once rolled anything connected to the ladder truss doesn't dispaly in the correct position in 2D top/plan, its all offset to the side. It displays correctly in 3D though.

VB-199520

Truss Circle connection highlight issue when using Drag +Ctrl/Option to Copy

This is present in VW2023 along with VW2024
# Start with a New file
# Activate the Truss Tool
# From the Truss Symbol, select a Truss Circle section
# Draw one section in the Design Layer
# Click and Drag that Truss Circle piece to connect to either end - *Use "+Ctrl" or "option" to Copy*
# The first time, the red connection highlight will show correctly displaying which direction the truss circle is being placed.
# Repeat Step 5 to attach a third section of the truss circle
# Notice that no matter how or where you move the curser, the red connection highlight shows the same direction and will not change.
# It seems that either direction can still be made, the highlight just doesn't show correctly.

If the truss circle is copied using Drag +Ctrl/option and placed to the side, when attaching the piece now the highlight will work correctly

Possibly not just an issue with Copying.  I notice this at times when moving existing pieces as well.  However, slight different.  Can be seen at the end of the video.

Truss symbol doesn't seem to be a factor, tested several all with the same issue. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199535

In talking with Tara, educational serial numbers starting with Vectorworks 2023 had ConnectCAD and Braceworks enabled. VB-199448

Slowness when placing windows in walls

Placing windows in walls results in a spinning beachball for several seconds before window is accepted by wall.

Draw a building with multiple walls.

Select the window tool. Double-click on a wall to place the window.

On the Mac, several seconds pass (accompanied by the beachball-of-death) before the wall accepts the window. On my machine the delay is between 3-5 seconds.

This occurs regardless of the number of windows placed. Not the case with doors: if doors are placed in walls, there's a small delay at the first placement but subsequent placements occur almost instantaneously (though still with a very small delay).

This has been the case for a few versions now. Earlier versions of VW allowed instantaneous placement of windows in walls without the need to wait for the window to be accepted by the wall. 		Christopher Graye

VB-199164

VB-199315

Project Sharing: Project File creation dialog (wording)

Communication is important. Precise language facilitates the recognition of and solution to issues.

Currently the dialog you see, when you open the _Project Sharing..._ menu item while a saved Vectorworks document (vwx) is open, contains the following sentence:
{quote}Once a file is shared as a Project File, all changes (such as editing objects, layers, resources, etc...) must happen to the project through Working Files, which are clones of the master Project File.
{quote}
What exactly is a "master Project File" in contrast to other (non-master) "Project File[s]"? In my experience our customers call different files "master" or even "mother" files - yes, both also in the context of Project Sharing, but some in the context of referencing or Workgroup files.

Communicating with customers is hard enough as it is. If there is a way to avoid unnecessary confusion and it is as easy as removing a single word, then I vote for removing "master" from this sentence. 		Rick Berge

Now apply a texture and the object does not seem to be smoothed.

VB-196539

Worksheets - worksheet export not working with versioning

Raised this before on the forum, but it now has become a minor issue on a project:

When exporting a worksheet from Vectorworks (xlsx in my case) and overwriting an existing file it will first delete the file and then create a new one with the same name. that way the version history of the file is lost.

Would expect to behave the same as the regular vwx file and just overwrite the old file while keeping the version history alive.

I am working with xlsx and OneDrive, but the workflow would obviously be the same for other setups (csv and google drive/nextcloud,...) 		Karthick Chilaka

Observe the attached v2023 file. Navigate to Design Layer 'Concept 5' and display in Perspective. 
Note the option to turn off Perspective Crop is not available in the Document Preferences. 
The file is not recognised as a Legacy 2D file. 
When the Legacy 2D file preference is turned on and the Document Preferences cycled, the 'Crop perspective view' option is revealed. [Which in turn can be switched off - to remove the perspective crop.] 

The same behaviour is seen when the file is converted to v2024. 

In this file, it is noted there are screen plane objects, but these objects do not appear to flag the file as a Legacy 2D file type. The presence of a Crop perspective view preference also does not flag the file as a Legacy 2D file type.  		Hernán Stamati

VB-199221

Dialog builder List browser Presentation values doesn't stick

I was creating a list browser, adding a few columns and want to add values to these.

When I close it, the values are not showing after several attempts. Then, suddenly, and without any changes, the values are visible. However, only parts of the input are visible in some instances. For example, I had written in 'Clay brick, 120 x 102 x 65 mm', and only the first part, Clay brick, is left.

Is the list browser sensitive to commas?

Then, the last of the three rows didn't show the input and removing and adding new data became a hit-or-miss regarding whether the data stayed.

VB-196639

macOS 13 - Unable to launch a different version of Vectorworks by drag-n-dropping a file

I feel this is more of a macOS issue vs a Vectorworks issue.

I recently encountered this issue on macOS Ventura only and the next day, a Beta Tester had a similar experience.

If for example Vectorworks 2024 is up and running. Then, you decide to open a file in Vectorworks 2023, by drag-n-dropping the test file on the Vectorworks 2023 application file, it will open the file in Vectorworks 2024 instead of 2023. If Vectorworks 2022 is the application that's currently up and running, it's not possible to launch and open a file in Vectorworks 2023 or 2024, it will open the file in Vectorworks 2022. (see attached video)

-Launch Vectorworks 2024
-Drag an older file on to the 2023 SP5 application file, to open both Vectorworks 2023 SP5 and the file
-Result, file is opened in Vectorworks 2024
-Close Vectorworks 2024

-Launch Vectorworks 2022
-Drag an older file on to the 2024 application file, to open both Vectorworks 2024 and the file
-Result, file is opened in 2022 		Payne Chang

Please see attached video to see the problem.
It works in VW22 but not in VW23 and also not in VW24 		Hernán Stamati
VB-199157

Spotlight fixtures GDTF default fixture

Hi all

I am not sure when this happened, but any inserted fixtures default to a GDTF Fixture Type 1. This causes problems with the MVR into Capture for example. My work around right now is to select all fixtures and set the GDTF fixture typeto NONE.

Florian 		Chris Baccala

VB-199201

Encryption Dialog Text

1)  Make sure you have an unencrypted Tool or Command in the Plug-Ins folder.

2)  Open the Plug-In Manager

3)  Click the "Custom Plug-Ins" tab and scroll to the unencrypted Tool or Command.

4)  Hold down Control/Shirt/Alt and double-click the chosen Tool or Command.

The dialog that appears should ask if you want to encrypt the chosen Tool or Command.  Instead, the dialog says "Are you sure you want to #REFVAL!."  If you click "Yes" the Tool or Command will be encrypted as-ecpected. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-199166

UI: By Style/By Instance help texts are not changed when choosing a style from the preferences

Open the hardscape preferences and choose a style from the style popup.

Notice that the by style/by instance buttons are correctly changed to indicate which parameters are by style, but their help texts are not changed. The help texts for all the buttons remain: "This parameter is set as an instance parameter and may be freely set".

 

If you choose a style from the style popup in the toolbar and then open the preferences, the help texts are changed correctly and the by style buttons read: "This parameter is set as a style parameter and can only be changed by editing the style".

Then if you Convert to Unstyled using the button in the dialog, the help texts are again not updated and some of them still read the by style help text, although all buttons are by instance. 		Payne Chang

VB-199143

Hatch with bigger line thickness not clipping to poly's bounds

VB-198676

T02311 - When two or more railings are selected the reshape tool modes are incorrect

When two or more railings are selected, the reshape tool does not show the modes specific to railings, like add post, delete post, and gravity.   Kostadin Ivanov
VB-193204

Record gets detached when splitting polyline

When you attach a record to a polygon and split the polygon with the "split tool", the record will be attached to both resulting polygons.

When you attach a record to a polyline and split the polyline with the "split tool", the record will be detached from both polylines.

The behavoir of both object types should be the same, so it is predictable for the user. The behavior of the polygon is preferred. 		Christopher Graye
VB-195659

1. Launch Vectorworks.
2. Double click on Arc tool.
3. Note that Circle dialog appears instead of Arc dialog.
Please watch the attached movie.
Christopher Graye

VB-198735

Hanging Position Z Height and Braceworks Change Trim Command Yield Discrepancy in Z values.

In a blank file,   I have a short run of truss drawn with a Z of 20'

!image-2023-08-18-13-57-01-658.png!

Now, If I option drag this truss to make a copy and convert that copy to a single hanging position (object mode). I named this position T1. You'll see that its Z is still 20'. So far so good.

!image-2023-08-18-13-59-17-260.png|thumbnail!

Now we'll duplicate this hanging position one more time (I renamed it to T2). Let's take T2 and change it's Z value to 30'.

!image-2023-08-18-14-00-38-600.png|thumbnail!

In a side view we see that the T2 hanging position is indeed @ 30', 10' higher than the other two.

!image-2023-08-18-14-01-42-068.png|thumbnail!

Now if you again take T2, and THIS TIME, with it selected we "Change Trim Height of System" rather than Z. Let's change the absolute trim value to 10'. After doing so, if you select the T2 position. And notice the Z value is STILL 30'

!image-2023-08-18-14-04-55-437.png|thumbnail!

Even though in a side view, the truss did move to 10' as you can see in a side view:

!image-2023-08-18-14-05-43-376.png|thumbnail!

If you enter the T2 hanging position object, you can see that the Change Trim command changed the Z value off the contained trusses -20' (from the last 30') to get it to 10'.

!image-2023-08-18-14-07-10-256.png|thumbnail!

Clicking a hanging position should have its Z in the OIP reflect the actual trim height of the position. Not have some strange offset applied to the objects inside. Doing quick trim height checks by selecting the object and looking at the Z value would yield an erroneous value to someone on a show site in this case, which isn't good. And if there is an offset applied to the objects inside the hanging position, this should appear seamless to the user. 		Kevin Linzey

as you can see in the video, the Angle changes to 90 or -90° when snapping this truss piece onto a corner.
what means, I only see the 3D-components of this truss.

What to do, to fix this?

Thanks
Alex 		Kevin Linzey

A&A 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198902

The Align Plane tool vs. the Align Plane option in the View Bar should have different names

At the moment, we have two features called in the same way:
- the Align Plane tool in the 3D Modelling tool set;
With this tool, you can align objects precisely in 3D space to the working plane (see: https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/Basic2/Aligning_objects_to_the_working_plane.htm?rhsearch=align%20plane&rhhlterm=aligning%20align%20aligns%20aligned%20plane
versus
- the Align Plane option in the View Bar, which is used to align the working plane to the current view.

Since those two features have different purposes, they should have different names.
I'd keep the Align Plane in the View Bar as is, but adjust the tool name:
from 'Align Plane' to 'Align to Plane' / 'Align Surface to Plane' / 'Align Object to Plane' etc.

!image-2023-08-26-16-45-59-053.png|thumbnail!

Not only those features work in a different way, but they also use various icons. Hence, their names should be unique. 		Ian Lane
VB-198948

When encrypting VS plug-ins, the confirmation/alert dialog that appears twice contains an error. Please see attached image.

VB-196369

Disabled popup values can be selected when the dialog is freshly opened

This can be tested with the Fence.

VB-196446

Vectorworks Preferences and Document Preferences dialogs do not remember their positions when closed

The Vectorworks Preferences dialog and the Document Preferences dialog boxes always open in the top center of the screen. If the user moves them before closing them, the dialogs "forget" their previous positions when they are reopened and jump back to the top center of the screen.

The Units, Organization, and Data Manager dialog boxes, to name a few, DO remember their screen position when closed and will reopen in the same position.

Expected behavior: ALL dialog boxes should remember their screen position when closed and reopen in that position for the remainder of the VW session. 		Payne Chang
VB-196466

When you go to "file- open" (or you open any other explorer- dialog), the next dialog will cast 2 drop shadows.
- The soft and large Windows 11 shadow
- The hard thin pointy Vectorworks 2024 shadow, a bit further.

This looks quite messy, so should be resolved before release. 		Payne Chang

VB-193881

Aligned Hardscapes/Site Modifiers Create Snap Points in All Files, Snaps Remain Even After Object is Deleted

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

- Open a blank file
- Activate the Site Modifier or Hardscape tools in Aligned Mode
- Draw an object
- Now open another blank file

Note that the snap points from the first file show in the second file.

- Now return to the first file and delete the Hardscape
- Create a new blank file

Note that the same snap points show in that file too, and will show in all other files (new ones or existing ones that are opened) until VW is relaunched.

This only seems to happen with "Aligned" Hardscapes and Site Modifiers.

The same thing happened in VW 2022 with Aligned Hardscapes.

This also happens in VW 2024. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-198892

This seems to be because of corrupted print settings, because executing the attached "clear print settings" script solves the issue.
I post this as a bug, because I hope you can find the source of this issue, and as a consequence of that prevent similar issues in future versions. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198921

Missing variable in a 2024 SP1 string

The following string:
{quote}{{has changed.}}
{quote}
Appears in the following files:
Line  20: Plug-Ins/DWG Library.vwr/Strings/11040 General Errors and Warnings.vwstrings 13 (no context provided) *has changed.*  This demo version does not allow documents to be saved. \{{EMPTY}}
Line 373: Vectorworks.vwr/Strings/950 General Errors and Warnings.vwstrings13(no context provided) *has changed.*  This demo version does not allow documents to be saved.\{{EMPTY}}
This string seems truncated and missing one or more variables. It is imperative that strings are 100% complete if they're going to be properly localized for our overseas users.

{color:#4c9aff}*Recommendation:*{color} please identify the missing pieces in the above string and complete accordingly. If this particular string is not meant for localization, please follow standard procedures to mark it. 		Payne Chang

VB-198767

VB-198525

bool variables may have a default value of true on Mac M-chip machines.

bool variables may have a default value of true on Mac M-chip machines.

In investigating an issue that was only occurring on Mac M-chip machines, and only in release, it was discovered that an uninitialized bool variable was defaulted to true on an M-chip machine, but defaulted to false on other Macs.

All other existing uninitialized bools may have the same issue.

See linked issue, VB-193966. 		Payne Chang
VB-195915

T02338 - Not possible to edit a rail after it has been added to a fence

In the attached video and file, I added a few rails to a fence.  In most other areas of Vectorworks when you see data displayed in a table format in a dialog window, you can click on the cell to edit that data.  Here you must delete the cell and then re-add the post.  I think this needs to be changed to mirror how table cells work in other dialog boxes in Vectorworks. Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-194954

Certain Polygons refuse to Publish or Export Image Fills

Hello to you! 

I'm really not sure if this one is worth submitting because it looks like a simple case of certain objects being corrupt, {*}_however_{*}{_}*,*{_} as this is the second case like this I've had this year and I don't recall it happening in all my years prior (though I suppose I may have just remedied them and moved on) I figure it is at least worth running by you to see what you say. 

Two seperate users, from different companies, two months apart, have experienced this problem: Some - not all - polygons with image fills applied, do not render when published to PDF. There were some subtle differences between these cases: 

Genevieve Mcgirr - Her file had various 2D objects with an Image Fill. Some rendered and published fine, but the others displayed very pixelated when zooming in/out (most notable in any 3D view) but not once zooming stopped and the view solidified - but this was notably slow. (I don't know how to define the difference between the rendered appearance while zooming/panning and the final render state, as it relates to Top/Plan or Wireframe or Shaded). 

Peter Dibnah - His file also had various 2D objects with an Image Fill. Some rendered and published fine. One notable difference is that objects with the image fill concerned showed no unusual pixelation or delay in rendering between view/zoom changes. They remained consistent throughout. 

Genevieve's objects were 'fixed' simply by swapping the image fill to another image fill. Peter's were fixed by using the Eyedropper Tool to transplant attributes from 'healthy' objects to the malfunctioning ones. - Note, that all attributes visible to me in the Attributes palette and in the 'Debug List View Ex' window showed they were identical except in shape, so I presume they are corrupt but as there have been two similar cases in short time, wanted to give this to someone more qualified to assess. 

All files attached. 

Please @mention me with your thoughts or questions so I can update my users accordingly. 

Thanks! 

Jeremy  		Hernán Stamati
VB-198618

Generic Solid cannot be scaled asymmetrically in certain circumstances

We realized that there is a limitation when scaling some generic solids asymmetrically. Normally this is a issue with low priority but unfortunately we're working on a project that imports furniture from an online platform. Because of the bug we cannot import these objects correctly. This is why you get a DWG file and not a Vectorworks file. But I guess it is not an import issue. I think it's a Vectorworks limitation.

Steps to reproduce the problem.
# Watch the attached movie first
# Open "Testfile 20230815" to reproduce the problem

 

It is actually a low priority issue as mentioned. But because of our ongoing project we would be happy if you can check if there is an easy way to get rid of this limitation. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-193763

Editing Camera from Viewport with Multiple View active causes ghosting

User submitted a file from Vectorworks 2022 where he said he sees ghosting of his design layer in his sheet layer after editing camera from double clicking on the viewport.

I opened his file in both 2022 and 2023 and experienced the same issue. I found though that since he has multiple view enabled, I first disabled it to just see the sheet layer on its own. If I double click on the viewport to navigate to the camera view, then exit back to the sheet layer. Updating the viewport produces a clean sheet with no ghosting.

I have attached his file and a video from my machine using 2023 demonstrating the issue with multiple view enabled and then the same steps with it disabled. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198496

Button "revert stacking order" viewport layer settings seemingly causes layers to duplicate

When you enter the layer settings of a viewport from the OIP, change the layer's stacking order for that viewport and click on the "revert stacking order" afterwards, layers seems to duplicate itself.
The layers don't really duplicate: if you click on "ok" and enter the same settings dialog again, you will see that it actually did what you ask. But the fact that the layers visually duplicate ant the moment you click the button, is confusing. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-192977

Wall textures have bad UVs in 3DS and glTF exports

Reported here on the forums:

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/105100-texture-mapping-incorrect-when-using-wall-tool-in-vectorworks-and-imported-to-vision/]

 

While it is possible that both the 3DS and glTF plug-ins have identical bugs in their separate projects, I think it is more likely that both plug-ins are being handed bad UVs. For this reason, I think this is an issue that the core/rendering team will need to investigate. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-198489

3D Dragger Causes Drawing Window Failure or System Crash (Mac w/ Radeon Graphics Card)

Movie and test file are attached (I had to record on a remote machine since this problem causes the screen capture to fail locally). 

To reproduce:
* In the attached file, double-click the Subdivision object to activate the Edit Subdivision tool
* Drag one of its edges

Note that this causes a long lag followed by one of three things:
* The entire system will crash (I duplicated this several times on my Radeon Pro Vega 56 machine)
* There will be a long lag, at which point the drawing window will no longer respond. I can still draw objects but they won't show, and every new file I create/open will show a solid gray drawing window)
* There will be a long lag, but VW will recover and you can continue working. Every time I see this, if I try the Subdivision edit a second time, I then get another lag followed by the failed drawing window

So far this has been duplicated on four different Macs that all use Radeon graphics cards. The 102247 remote access machine uses a Radeon card and also shows the problem:

vnc://102247.remote.vectorworks.net/ 

Login: Vectorworks

Password: YamahaR6

I also tested on Windows, on a few ARM Macs, and on a Mac with an Intel Iris Pro graphics card, and I didn't see the problem on any of those. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198517

VB-198471

Scale arrow head is displayed wrong in viewport in document with specific properties

Scale arrow head is displayed wrong (too small) in a viewport if:
- "Ignore layers with different scale" is checked off in the document preferences (This is always checked off in new documents in our localized version, because that's the behavior our customers expect)
- In the viewport, two design layers with a different scale are visible
- The arrow heads are placed on the layer with the smallest scale. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198444

Project sharing-file, Spotlight Preferences, goes back to default/other settings

From user: If i save a .vwx file with custom settings for spotlight preferences - Lighting Devices: - Classes and Colors And assigning custom classes for "Beam/Field/Centerline" this classes is saved and is also assigned correctly next time i open the file. If i save a project file with same settings, the settings only saves in my .vwxw Working file. If i open the VWPX Project file, these classes are back to VW-default " ". I have tried to check "Save as default" down in left corner, but this only affects new files i create. When saving the project file with this new class information i have checked "Aslo commit changes to: Document Preferences and Settings + Navigation and View related document settings" I also experiences the same for Spotlight Preferences - Lighting Devices - Parameters. Default value here for field "Universe/Adress" is "/". If i change this to "." This also goes back to "/" next time i open the project file. Precision the field remains /still shows "." but if i change the lighting devices adresses or refreshes lighting devices they will change to "/" in the labels. If i go into spotlight preferences and just enter "." again, and then refreshes, it comes back to my wish. Is this two expected behavior or is this wrong? (I hope this is wrong.) After some testing this bugs only appears if there are multiple users involved. If i have a file with only my user this looks normal. Step by step: Have a project file. 1. File > Document Settings > Spotlight Preferences 2. Lighting Devices > Classes and Colors 3. Change the three dropdown fields at the bottom to something else. 4. File > Save & Commit > Check all boxes under more 5. File > Close and release 6. Open the VWXP file again (not the working file) 7. File > Document Settings > Spotlight Preferences 8. Lighting Devices > Classes and Colors, now these fields has changed. Have a project file. 1. File > Document Settings > Spotlight Preferences 2. Lighting Devices > Parameters. 2.1 Change the field "Universe/Adress" default value to "." instead of "/" 3. Draw some lighting devices and apply a label legend, and DMX adresses. 4. 4. File > Save & Commit > Check all boxes under more 5. File > Close and release 6. Open the VWXP file again (not the working file) 7. Change one of the lighting devices DMX adress. This one will now show "/" between Universe and Adress. 8. File > Document Settings > Spotlight Preferences>Lighting Devices > Parameters. "Universe/Adress" field default value is still showing ".". Double click and just enter "." again. 9. Spotlight > Refresh Lighting Devices. Now the lighting devices shows "." again as intened. Ian Lane
VB-198269

Symbol with rotated extrude in it: bounding box is too big

When you put a rotated extrude in a symbol, the symbol's selection bouning box might be too big. This also leads to measurements showing incorrect in worksheets and graphic legends.
In some way, I guess this is by design (the extrude remembers the original position of its 2D base), but the effect it has looks very buggy.
I think something goes wrong already after you rotate the extrude before you put it in the symbol. In my opinion, there's no need for the extrude to remember the original ration of the 2D form, or at least not in a way that it causes this issue.
But if this is necessary for some reason, it should be at least possible to extract correct dimensions from the symbol.

PS: To be clear: I'm not talking about rotated symbols, but about symbols which contain rotated geometry.

Watch the video in the link for an example and more info. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198428

Red dot Message Center indicator not removed after deleting all messages

On Windows, in Vectorworks 2024, I opened the Message Center and clicked, "Delete All". All the messages were removed, however the red dot indicator that shows on top of the Message Center envelop icon, was still visible (See WindowsMessages.png).

Then, I decided to open the Message Center on the Mac. The messages were gone as I expected, however the red dot was still appearing on the Message Center envelop icon (see MacMessageCenter.png). I closed the Message Center/Home Screen on the Mac, opened again, thinking it might refresh the red dot on the envelop icon and it was still visible. I closed and restarted Vectorworks, then the red dot was removed from the envelop icon.

I understand Windows is on a timer of sorts, before the status of the envelop icon is updated. However, Kamen wanted to investigate why the Mac required an update, before the envelop icon updated properly. 		Sasha Wood

ConnectCAD: T02355 - The display tag overlaps the top connector

VB-196107

First opened to a blank Home screen

Peter 		Payne Chang
VB-198241

Resizing Zoom & Font Dropdowns Not Consistent - Windows ONLY

When a user resizes the Font dropdown in the mode bar, VW remembers the new size of the dropdown. When a user resizes the Zoom or Font dropdown in the mode bar, VW does not remember the size the user last used, but rather returns to the default size.

Steps to reproduce...

-Open Zoom or Font Dropdown menu

-Resize the dropdown menu

-Close the menu

-Reopen the menu

-Notice that VW has not remembered the size you set previously.

This behavior is isolated to Windows. 		Payne Chang
VB-198239

Mode Bar Tool Tips are Not Close to Tools - Windows ONLY

When hovering over tools in the new mode bar, the tool tips are not relatively close to the actual tool. While working in dark mode on Windows, it is sometimes hard to locate the tool tip as the UI color and tool tip background color are the same. This behavior appears to be isolated to Windows.

Tested on Windows 10 		Payne Chang
VB-198135

Dialog Builder: Changes to capitalizations of presentation values are not saved

1) Import a dialog.

2) Choose a Popup control or a List browser control

3) Open the Presentation values dialog from the OIP

4) Edit one of the values by changing one of the letters to upper/lower case and close with OK.

5) Open the Presentation values dialog again and notice that the change isn't saved.

 

Demonstrating with the Fence settings dialog in the attached video (changes to capitalizations are not saved.mp4). 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-198207

A crash happens when turning off surface hatches

Steps to reproduce:
* Open the attached file
* Click "Update" on the oip to update the section viewport
* Change the render mode to Hidden Line using the view bar (this may take a while)
* Use the flyover tool for a bit,  hit "Render" on the dialog that shows up
* Turn off surface hatches using the View -> Rendering -> Line Render Options... menu command
* Let it run and the crash should happen 		Hernán Stamati

VB-198162

Disappearing stair lines in a Section Viewport due to "Cut Plane" and "Stair Break" settings during updates.

When updating the viewport, the stair lines may disappear, and this appears to be related to the "Cut Plane" and "Stair Break" settings.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a stair object.
2. Choose any option other than "Plain (no break)" from the "Display Stair Break" pulldown on the OIP.
3. Run "Create Horizontal Section Viewport" and place it on a sheet layer.
4. Click "Advanced Properties" on the Section Viewport OIP and ensure that "Merge cross sections" is selected.
Click "Update" on the OIP. The appearance of the stair lines changes with each click of "Update". Some lines may appear and disappear.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Hernán Stamati

VB-192993

Landscape area: problem with preference dialog

If a row is double clicked in the plant information window, it pops up the “Edit Plant Information” or the “Edit Divider” window. After clicking “OK” or “Cancel” and then we try to move an element, it shows the same window three times. On the third window for some reason the plant is changed (for plants) or the text is empty (for dividers). After closing the third window the item moves. 

 *Steps to reproduce:* 
# Open empty project or the project attached to the issue _“LandscapePlantDividerMoveBug.vwx”;_
# Open the “Landscape Area Preferences” window by double clicking the “Landscape Tool” or double clicking the area in the file. 
# Go to “Plant Information” pane. 
# Create plants, dividers, or both (the file has some placed). 
# Double click on any row in the Plant Information table. 
# An edit window appears for the plant or the divider. 
# Press “Ok”, “Cancel”, or the “X” button. 
# After attempting to move an item from the table, the bug appears. 

Test file and a video are attached. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-197352

Smart Options Display retains the wrong Palette after a Tool is selected.

When selecting a Tool from the Smart Options Display, the next task is invariably to select a tool mode. Currently, the Smart Options display keeps the palette you just clicked on active and removes the Tool Mode palette which is where almost every user is likely to go next.

This current functionality is the main reason why I virtually never use this feature of the program. This is a shame as I would really like to!

This feels like an oversight or a bug.

Please find video explanation.

  		Payne Chang
VB-192731

IFC: roof face color assignment is not consistent

When you export a roof face to IFC, it depends on the eave it depends on the eave cut which color will be assigned:
- Vertical eave cut: the roof face's 2D fill color will show for the object in the exported IFC
- Square eave cut: the roof face's components colors will show in the IFC document.

Neither of them is really "wrong" (however I prefer the component's colors), but at this moment it is quite unpredictable what color will be assigned and that's confusing for the user. The eave cut type shouldn't influence the color in an IFC export. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-197077

Suspended snapping moves cursor fields in Status Bar

See attached movie. This looks like some interaction is still going on with the hidden snapping options in the status bar. Mac only. Payne Chang

VB-197288

Some Workspaces do not include new "Manage Wall closure Names…" command

The new "Manage Wall Closure Names…" menu command should be located in the following workspaces and locations:
* {*}Architect{*}:  In the *AEC* menu
* {*}Architect - BIM{*}:  In the *AEC* menu
* {*}Design Suite{*}:  In the *AEC* menu
* {*}Landmark{*}:  In the *Landmark/Architecture* menu
* {*}Spotlight{*}:  In the *Spotlight/Architecture* menu

In all cases, a divider would be added under “Subtract 3D Object From Slab” and the new command under that.

As of change list {*}710254{*}, I only see this command in the *Architect - BIM* workspace. 		Gunther Miller

VB-195129

gridlines do not show minor rotation in the OIP

See the attached test file.
My colleague created gridlines just slightly rotated.
The OIP says the rotations are 0.0000000° or 90.000000°
They are in fact rotated very slightly. Because if this, they do not show up in elevation or section viewports
If you use the rotate tool to correct the gridline rotation, they will show up in elevations and sections however, in the OIP the gridline will now mistakenly be shown to be rotated.

Gridlines should correctly show their rotation value in the OIP. 		Hernán Stamati

On Classification Lookup dialog, the ID field is definitely too small. Pr_20_29_03_05 does not fit, but Pr_20_29_03_10 does because of the narrower "1".

VB-196902

Adding high numbers of universes causes soft crash

In Spotlight Preferences, adding thousands of universes causes application to stop responding. 

It is probably an edge case, but for their use case the user who reported this needs to have upwards of 6000 universes. 

 

In Spotlight
File > Document Settings > Spotlight Preferences

choose the "Universes" tab on the left-hand side

at the bottom of the universes window click "add" 

add something larger than 1000 universes, and vectorworks will hang until force quit. 


As a possible VE, the user who called about this suggested being able to add universes individually, so you don't have to add all 1-5,999 if you just need to start at universe 6000 (or whatever universe number, for organizational reasons)

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-196912

Could the icons be aligned by the center instead ?

Thank you 		Kevin Linzey

VB-193669

VB-196735

Unexpected behavior with Soft Goods when changing type.

-Select the Soft Goods.
-In the Object Info Palette, change the type from cornier to bezier.
-Notice how it stretches very far.
-I have attached a video capture. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-196694

Windows: View bar font menu clips font name descender characters

This is a cosmetic issue but worth fixing to address our overall perceived quality around font and typography support.

The new font menu combo in the view bar shows the active font name in the system font.

However, the size of the control is not sufficient to display font names without clipping if they have descenders (characters like y or g with parts that hang below the baseline).

See attached screenshot - the lowercase 'g' in Georgia is clipped. This happens with any font that has these characters in the font name.

The fix is to adjust the size/position/clipping of the control, and/or the size of the font-name text display, to avoid this clipping. 		Payne Chang
VB-196669

Level types not present in level types dialog box

See the attached image, the default level types are not shown in Windows, but they are in the Mac.  Ceiling, floor, and slab items are missing. Karthick Chilaka
VB-196706

"Switch Saved View" keyboard shortcut doesn't work when SV is activated from View Bar

The new Opt+Arrow hotkey to scroll through Saved Views seems to only work after activating a Saved View in the Navigation Palette. It doesn't work as expected after activating a Saved View via the dropdown in the View Bar.

It also doesn't work when using the Saved Views script palette.

It shouldn't matter where you activate a Saved View from; Vectorworks should remember the last one used, and the Opt+Arrow shortcut should activate the next one. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-195390

Script API breaks solid Revit entities rendering

 

Steps to reproduce:

1) Open the VW document and run the ScriptBug script from the resource manager

(this should be the code of the script 

vs.DoMenuTextByName("RevitImport", 0)
vs.DoMenuTextByName("Save", 0)

)

2) Import the Table.rfa file as a solid object (The rendering will appear normal)

3) Close the document *without saving it* 

4) Open the document again

Now the object will be rendered as a 3D polygon despite the fact it is a Solid object.

Doing the same using the menu commands and not the script does not break the rendering.  

  		Hernán Stamati
VB-196454

Graphic Legend - Hatch Lines Fail to Show in Fill Attribute Swatches

The attached file contains a few objects with different fills and a Graphic Legend that uses the "Fill Attribute Swatch" Display Mode. It also contains a Viewport that shows the same fills at the same scale.

Note that, in the legend's attribute swatches, one of the lines is missing in each Hatch fill (see attached screenshot).

This line is also missing in exported images and PDFs.

The same Hatch lines show fine in Viewports of the same scale, so this looks like a Graphic Legend issue.

The same thing happened in VW 2023. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-196444

Difficult to access the View Bar in auto-hide mode, when also using the Full Screen option

-In Vectorworks, click the gear icon in the upper right, on the application Title Bar and choose, "Display View Bar in auto-hide mode"
-Now go to the Window menu and choose, "Use Full Screen"
-Now try to access the View Bar
-The Menu Bar will appear, obscuring the View Bar
-It is possible to access the View Bar, you just have to quickly touch the top of the screen with the mouse cursor, then move the mouse down just enough to land on the View Bar
-Once you figure this out, it's not too bad, just tricky
-See attached video 		Payne Chang
VB-196641

Tools Become Inaccessible in Tool Sets Palette With Certain Setups

The attached movie shows this from a blank file, following a clean launch. In my Mac system preferences, the display has been scaled-up one level.

To reproduce, expand the utility menu in the Tool Sets palette and choose View Tool Sets As/Icons and Text.

Note that now the Tools section of the palette is inaccessible, as long as the palettes remain docked in their default state.

On Windows it looks like one small area of the Tools section will always remain visible, so this isn't as much of an issue there (but still pretty awkward).

With all the icons we've changed in this version, users are very likely to set their tool sets to show text along with the icons, so this is probably an easy situation to get into.

It seems like the new combined Basic/Tool Sets palette might benefit from some kind of combined scroll bar, where the bottom of the Tool Sets section could scroll out-of-view to make room for a larger Tools section at the top. 		Payne Chang

VB-196546

VB-193534

Data tags doesn't centre on object

Below is an image of some Existing trees; the data tags are applied with the third mode - All Eligible Objects. None of the tags is placed at the centre of the trees, and most of them are placed completely outside the tree geometry.

It seems like the data tag is taking the built-in tree tag into consideration when placing the tags - the longer the ET tag, the bigger offset from the centre. 

As you can't fully turn off the built-in tag, this can be an issue 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-196343

VB-196029

This has lead to many tech support calls were it turns out that is the only issue.

VB-195769

3DConnexion CadMouse Pro Wireless + a SpaceMouse Wireless problematic 2023

From User:  I use a 3DConnexion CadMouse Pro Wireless + a SpaceMouse Wireless. Since upgrading to VW2023 I have had two problems: 1. 'Switch Navigation' no longer works. Instead it performs 'Fit View'. Being able to use Switch Navigation is ESSENTIAL to using my SpaceMouse as it allows me to set the navigation to 'Target Camera Mode'. This is the only mode I can usefully use the SpaceMouse with + not being able to set it to this mode effectively means since VW2023 I have been unable to navigate with my SpaceMouse. 2. 'Fit View' no longer works. Instead it performs 'Top View'. I spoke to 3DC + they suggested I upgraded to the most recent driver but when I did this things were considerably worse with multiple additional things not working to + so I went back to 10.7.0 where I remain. I can use the devices for the remaining shortcuts without issue. 3DC seemed to suggest that the problem was with VW but without access to a 2023 license they were unable to investigate it fully to determine why it was happening. The last communication I had with them was in March when they said they were still struggling to acquire a 2023 license from you. I have posted about this several times on the Forums, tagging Luis M. Ruiz, but haven't had any response from VW so decided to submit a bug. The 3DC SpaceMouse is heavily endorsed/promoted by VW + I have certainly found it a very important part of my workflow so to have it become virtually redundant since VW2023 is a massive blow + I would really appreciate your attention.  Dave Donley

VB-195869

When a file exported in PostScript format is converted to PDF and printed, the result is different from that exported in PDF and printed.

Checking this bug requires Acrobat Distiller.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open the attached file. (Sample.vwx)
2) Click "File" menu > "Print...".
3) Click the pulldown at the bottom left of the "Print" dialog and select "Save as PostScript".
Select an arbitrary save destination and click "Save".(EX.test0515PostScript.pdf)
4) Open the created file with Acrobat Distiller.
5) Open the file converted to PDF and print it.
6) When I check the printed result, the color of some sides is different from the color of the other sides. (See attached PostScript.mov and PostScript.png.)

*We have confirmed that the above bug can be reproduced even in Vectorworks2022SP6 when exportted in PostScript format.
*We have confirmed that a bug occurs even if you print as is.

*There is no problem if you print out the PDF format.
The procedure is as follows.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open the attached file. (Sample.vwx)
2) Click "File" menu > "Print...".
3) Click the pulldown at the bottom left of the "Print" dialog and select "Save as PDF".
Select an arbitrary save destination and click "Save".
4) Open the created PDF and print it.
5) The phenomenon of different colors on some surfaces that occurred when exportting with PostScript format has not occurred. (See attached PDF.mov.)

*Bug does not occur even if the above file is opened with Acrobat, saved in PostScript format, and converted to PDF with Acrobat Distiller.
(See attached PDFPostScriptPDF.mov and PDFPostScriptPDF.Png.)

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A

Peter 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-194295

Spotlight: Dimensions are associated to Schematic views when in Annotation viewport and this can have adverse effects on the model

Hello,

In the two movies you can see a Schematic View being dimensioned in the Annotation group of a viewport. If the dimension is nudged, any associated object will also be nudged. It is common the nudge dimensions in viewport annotations especially for crowded lighting positions like booms.

There is no requirement for dimensions to be associated with the geometry because the dimensions might not be associated with all the parts of the rigging and thus only some parts will be moved.  In any case you can not enter the dimension number like you can with walls, as the rigging geometry is fixed. Vectorworks file enclosed as well.

Cheers,

Peter

  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-195175

VW2024 launch Chromium Safe Storage keychain password request window

I didn't see anything reported about this, possibly known issue already?

When launching VW29.0.0 Mainline on my MacOS 12.6 M1 iMac, there is this message I have never seen before on Windows or VW28 builds on MacOS:

_*Vectorworks2024 wants to use your confidential information stored in "Chromium Safe Storage" in your keychain.*_

Selecting "Deny" will usually bypass this.  However, I have had a few cases where Vectorworks will not launch after Deny, and then I need to re-launch VW29.0.0.  This is most common with User Sign In at First Launch, though I was not able to reproduce for the video attached.

Since I primarily test on Windows, I checked with other QA members, and too have seen this on their Mac machines on a regular bases in VW29.0.0.  		Payne Chang

VB-193248

Windows Only: Double Clicking the Move by Points Tool Does Not Keep the 'Number of Duplicates' Text Edit Field Selected

{+}On Windows only{+}, double clicking the Move by Points tool does +*not*+ keep the 'Number of Duplicates' text edit field, in the tool bar, selected for immediate editing. After double clicking the Move by Points tool, the 'Number of Duplicates' text edit field is briefly selected before being deselected.

For context:
* On Mac, double clicking the Move by Points tool keeps the 'Number of Duplicates' text edit field, in the tool bar, selected for immediate editing.

* On Windows and Mac, using the shortcut equivalent of double clicking the Move by Points tool (i.e., Shift+M+M assuming the default shortcut of Shift+M for the Move by Points tool), keeps the 'Number of Duplicates' text edit field, in the tool bar, selected for immediate editing.

See the attached video for the working shortcut equivalent on Windows followed by the broken double click functionality. 		Payne Chang

VB-195145

Vectorworks Help: Incorrect Help Entry

*Regarding Working Plane Origins…*
In Vectorworks Help > [Application Window|https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/Start/Application_window.htm?rhhlterm=application%20applicable%20window%20windows&rhsearch=Application%20window] > in table under the Rulers heading…{_}"The 0,0 point on the rulers represents the location of the user origin, or of the working plane axes when using a working plane. The{_} *_User Origin_* _command moves the user origin relative to the internal origin, or moves the working plane origin to that of the layer (see_ {_}[Setting the user origin|https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/Setup/Setting_the_user_origin.htm#h]{_}{_})."{_}
 
The not-so-short answer seams to be, whether a working plane is invoked or not, when in Top/Plan the rulers always show the user origin, nothing else. I think it has always been thus ([~pneufeld] checked back to 2017), except that Vectorworks help seems to say otherwise.
 
In my experience Working Plane rulers have never properly displayed the correct origin location. Anyone know of what I might be doing wrong? 		Hernán Stamati

VB-195056

Snap To Tangent may not work.

Snap To Tangent may not work.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Enable Snap To Tangent at the bottom right of the Vectorworks application window.
2) Draw a circle object (Oval/Circle/Arc).
3) Select the Line tool, after clicking the center point "A" of the drawn circle object, move the mouse cursor to the position "B" that is parallel to the X axis and away from the circle and click to draw the Line object.
4) Furthermore, after clicking at position "B", if the mouse cursor is moved over the circumference of the circle object, the tangent snap will not work.

Please also check the reproduction video [^13151.mov].

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Hernán Stamati
VB-194602

Checked out objects that are not saved are still stored in Project Sharing working file data

* Open a new file and create a project file (File > Project Sharing > \{accept all defaults}).
* Once a working file has been opened, save it.
* Add a rectangle to the drawing.
* Close the working file without saving.
* Open the working file, then open File > ProjectSharing > \{Objects Tab}.
* You will see a "<deleted>" object

Initial investigation showed the issue appears to come from how we store WorkingFileData. When an object is added, it also has an ObjectStatus added to keep track of which objects the user has reserved. This gets automatically saved to the working file. When we close without saving, the object no longer exists but the ObjectStatus does. Thus when the file is opened, it has an ObjectStatus of an object that cannot be found, resulting in the <deleted> name. 		Justin Simerly
VB-194970

Export PDF: windows grey is much darker in the PDF

In the attached Vectorworks file we can see various Windows, which have the glass in a transparent grey colour. In the PDF export result the grey colour is now much darker. How can we have the same colour tone in the PDF document? Please take a look at this. Thank you in advance.

Customer message:

"When exporting/ publishing a view plan, a graphic error is displayed when opening the PDF.
After I had created one of the image fills as a solid surface using the viewports, the PDF could be created and opened. However, the light gray windows were now displayed much darker gray than in another (correctly exported) view PDF.
In the next step, I exchanged the affected areas with picture filling for the objects with picture filling on the other view sheet. Even then, the PDF could be created and opened. However, the display of the windows remained incorrect in this case as well.
In the next step I then copied the window symbols of the working view and replaced them in the faulty view. Unfortunately, this did not improve the display.
The same problem occurred on a completely different PC. I have attached the VWX file and the 3 different PDFs of the views." 		Hernán Stamati

VB-194901

Changing the page setup twice causes a small change in the printable area

This is a small variation from the Units acceptance test.

On File/Document settings/Units, select

     Unit:               Feet & Inches
     Show Unit Mark:     (should be locked on)
     Rounding:           Fractional/Decimal Mix
     Fraction Precision: 1/8
     Decimal Precision:  .01 (decimal)
     Angles:             Radians
     Angular Precision:  0.000
     Decimal Formatting: Trailing zeros AND leading zeros

On the layer scale, select 1/4" = 1' (1/48 scale)

Open file/Page setup. Select Printable Area: ASME A

Open file/Page setup again, hit OK (this step causes change in printable area).

Draw a rectangle tracing the outer boundary of the ASME A print area.

On the OIP palette, the rectangle area is 

43'11.99" by 34'0"   instead of 44' 0'' by 34'0"

 

  		Hernán Stamati
VB-194800

Graphic Legend-inadequate progress indication when updating a legend style with multiple instances

Open the attached file. Edit the Legend style "Materiali Muro 2". Enter the cell layout and exit.
Notice the  progress and feedback (or lack thereof) while the legends get updated.

When a Graphic Legend style is updated and there are multiple instances of that style in the document, separate progress dialogs appear one after the other for each instance. Sometimes there are long delays between each progress dialog. 
Users have no clear feedback about what's going on.

Not sure what the solution would be. Could we keep a progress dialog open for the duration of all updates? 		Hernán Stamati

VB-194576

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a NURBS Curve.

To reproduce, go to a Front or Back view and drag the curve.

Note that its blue handles show in the wrong location, as if the object are much larger.

If you move the curve while in a Left or Right view, the problem won't happen.

If you go to Top/Plan view and then return to Front/Back view, the problem will fix itself temporarily.

If you resize the curve in its bad state, the problem will fix itself permanently.

VB-194505

Current View text bubble isn't updated properly when using Multi-View Panes

# Open a blank VW document
# Ensure multiple view panes are enabled and that the active view pane is in Top/Plan
# With the mouse hovering over the active view pane, activate the flyover tool with the Shift+C keyboard shortcut
# Notice that the Ribbon/Banner shows the Current View as Top
# Notice that the text bubble for the Current View in the active pane still says Top/Plan
# Move the mouse out of the active view pane
# Notice that when the mouse is moved back into the active view pane, it updates to Top

This seems like a refresh kind of issue where, for some reason, the text being displayed in the bubble for the view pane is "a frame behind" or something.

VB-194436

Windows View Bar font menu lets you type meaningless string

The Windows view bar font menu drop-down appears to be a combo box that lets you type whatever you want, which can put it into a meaningless state.

To reproduce:
# Click in the view bar font menu title area (don't show the menu, just click in the font title)
# Note the title of the current font becomes selected
# Type the string "notafont"

EXPECTED: typing either does not do anything, or it opens the font menu to select a font that matches (and selects no font if there is no match)

ACTUAL: the string "Notafont" replaces the currently applied font name. If you hit enter, this string stays in the control until you do something that forces a change like select a different text object.

VARIATION: this also happens if instead of clicking on the font drop-down title you click to show the menu, and then type a string that does not match any font. 		Payne Chang

VB-192892

Shaded Render: Transparency bug

There is a bug with shaded render mode in Vectorworks 2022. It previously worked in 2021 with OpenGL render mode.

Shaded render mode does not allow light through a Glass shader with 'Transmission' values below 90%. (The example file was using Transmission values of 75% in Vectorworks 2021). 		Justin Hutchison
VB-193998

Weird artifacts associated with Space Object in Section Viewport

Customer called in to say he has strange lines and the letter V appearing in his viewports but cannot select them anywhere in annotations or design layer

I found it was associated with a space object he has on the house deck.
I assigned the space to a new class and made the class invisible in that viewport and the artifacts vanished.
I have attached a screen shot and the file 		Josh Loy

VB-193868

Graphic Legend Cell Bounding Area Includes Non-Visible Parts of Dynamic Text Objects

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Graphic Legend with a Dynamic Text object that lists Hardscape components. This text object has a lot of lines in its Field Definition in order to cover up to 12 possible components, but it only reports a few lines of text in each legend cell.

Note that the bounding area for the cells is including all of the text from the Field Definition, even though that text isn't actually visible. If you place the cursor over the cell, you can snap to the outline of the text object.

This causes a large empty area to show at the bottom of each cell.

The same thing happens going back to 2023 SP0. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-193391

Vision 2023 Installer goes into temporary "Not Responding" state after Download/Save License Agreement or Read Me PDFs - Windows Only

# Run Vision 2023 Installer (SP2 or later tested with issue)
# Click 'Let's Get Started" in bottom right corner
# No serial number is needed, just click "Next" in bottom right corner
# On License Agreement (or Read Me) page, click Download
# Click Save
# Try to continue with the install process, notice the installer becomes non responsive.
# Takes about a minute for the installer to be useable again, but it should.
# Any additional downloads will not see this problem.

This is only on Windows Installer, I am not seeing this issue on MacOS.

A video has been included.  Not that if the Read Me document is the first to be downloaded, it will have this issue.  I seems to just be the first document, doesn't matter if it is the License Agreement of the Read Me.

Might be hard to notice in the video, but it seems like clicking buttons while in the Not Responding state will load that action once the installer comes back.  I have seen the installer skip ahead a few pages or back because I pressed Next or Back. 		Tim Ardoin

VB-193039

Turning on or off Class which has only lights doesn't refresh view until you navigate

Working on a Design Layer in Shade mode...

In the Navigation Palette, when you turn on or off a Class which only contains Light objects, the view isn't refreshed until you zoom or pan.

If the class has any other sort geometry on it as well, then there is no issue. The bug only occurs when the visibility change has only Lights.

 

Example file attached. [^3045_ExtBridgeLadder_230127_WorkingFile_v1_AEB.vwx] In the view that it opens to, turn the class "*light1" on and notice that nothing changes in the drawing window. Then zoom out and see that the Light object is now affecting the seen.

Then assign some object to that class and try the process again – now it works as expected. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-192902

Unit spelling in Physical tab of the Material

In the Physical tab of Materials are several units behind the value fields. Please have a look at the screenshot. We might have to change the spelling / abbreviation of the units.
* The period isn't very readable in kJ/kg.K. Should be replaced through a * (Asterisk)->{color:#172b4d} kJ/kg*K{color}
* {color:#172b4d}ECO2 isn't an official unit. What is actually meant would probably be -> t/m^3{color}

 

{color:#172b4d}In addition, the ^2 and ^3 should be written with superscript numbers. But the current spelling might be related to a technical limitation. I reported a VE for the superscript numbers. See VE-103929.{color} 		Rick Berge

VB-192916

Scroll bar in Home Screen doesn't adapt to dark mode

VB-192848

Suggested name change for Edit Subdivision tool mode

In the 3D Modeling tool set, the *Edit Subdivision* tool has several modes, such as Transform, Crease, Extrude, Split and Bridge.

One of these modes, {*}Face Hole{*}, evokes a vulgar expression in American English, an involuntary association that we might want to avoid.

The function of this mode is to create a hole in the face of a subdivision object. Some suggestions:
* Hole in face
* Place hole in face

  		Josh Loy

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023(Occurs from previous versions)
--------------------------

*The problem can be confirmed with line types such as ISO-14 Dashed Triplicate-Dotted and ISO-02 Dashed.

* Please compare Workspaces and the image extracted from the PDF.
  Please refer to attached images. (PDF.png and VW.png)

* Even if the resolution is changed from 300 to 600 DPI, there is not much change.
　Please refer to attached PDF. (300DPI.pdf and 600DPI.pdf)

* There was no difference even if the check of "Rasterize PDF" was switched ON/OFF.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura

* In Top Plane, it takes 6 seconds for the Properties window to show after clicking Edit Selected

When using a Tool like Find and Modify to select the same set of Lighting Devices, it takes less than 10 seconds for both Shaded & Tope Plan.  There isn't much of a difference.

VB-193476

Section Viewport Update is Very Slow When Hardscape Surface Hatches are Displayed

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model with several NURBS modifiers, and a Draped Hardscape. The file also contains a Section Viewport that cuts through the Hardscape.

To reproduce, update the SVP.

Note that the update takes over a minute to complete.

If you remove the Draped Hardscape, the SVP updates in less than a second.

If the Hardscape is Ungrouped into Mesh objects, the slowdown still happens in both VW 2022 and 2023, so this is probably not related to the T02353 (Draped Hardscape) task.

If the Meshes are converted to Subdivisions the problem then goes away, so this seems like a Mesh issue. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-193090

Export to MVR Memory Use Increase - Performance Issue

I noticed this issue when testing the file from VB-192963.  Since that file is causing a crash currently in Vectorworks 2023 SP3, I tested several more files to see if it could be reproduced.  So far I have come across one other file, but several other files don't show this issue.  I marked as Always, since using the attached file will always produce these results.  However, this is not occurring in all files when Export MVR is used.  I am not sure what is causing the increase in Memory use, or if it is even something that needs to be fixed?

Using 3ds backing shows the same results, so not a cause of glTF from what I can tell.

I have included videos showing the Export MVR (both glTF & 3ds backing) with the Memory graph for my Windows 10 machine with 32GB.  Tested and seen on my MacOS M1 16GB machine as well.

Another concerning note (which is seen in the videos) is that once the Export to MVR is completed, the Memory doesn't drop until I close the file.  I am not sure if this is expected, but looks like an unwanted behavior.

Let me know if you need more testing or info. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-193989

Different slow cases with Hardscape objects

I've been trying to "stress-test" many different types of objects and profiling them (using VS2022). Hardscape is just one of the object types that have {{TFormatBaseImpl::GetFieldIndex}} and {{GS_FindAuxObject}} in their profiles. I saw them in many performance bugs in the past. This time I kind of dug deep into it, trying to see if those functions are really the culprit of the slowness. I profiled 3 different cases, and their hot paths all point to {{TFormatBaseImpl::GetFieldIndex}} and {{{}GS_FindAuxObject{}}}:
* Delete 16k hardscapes - it took 36' to finish
* Copy and Paste 8k hardscapes - it took >50' and still not done; I had to force quit it
* Move 16k hardscapes - it took >35' and still not done; I had to force quit it

Since they all have similar hot paths and flame graphs, I upload only the last one's here. I wrote a test that measures the time the 2 aforementioned functions take to finish with the same .vwx file that contains 16k hardscapes, and it took only 128.75 milliseconds (please see {_}test_for_the_2_functions_mentioned_above.png{_}). I'm not sure if my test is 100% correct/accurate, but if it's correct, then maybe the improvement that we need to make is in the plug-in code? I don't know. I'm just trying to provide as much data as possible here. For more info:
* {{GS_FindAuxObject}} is called by the bold part of: {*}VWParametricObj(hObject){*}.GetParamBool("A test string");
* {{TFormatBaseImpl::GetFieldIndex}} is called by the bold part of: VWParametricObj(hObject){*}.GetParamBool("A test string"){*}; 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-198628

File Freezing on Sheet Layer

User sent in this file. File goes unresponsive for minutes at a time when navigating to sheet layer "Top View"

Really simple geometry, small file, low DPI, all in wireframe. Was unable to isolate the problem. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-193799

3D walkthrough tool performance very inconsistent between files

I am trying to use the 3D walk-through tool in gamer mode. I want it to work so badly!

But in certain large files, the mouse response when looking around is just really rough. It is choppy and inconsistent, making it almost unusable and certainly embarrassing to use in front of anyone else. I dragging my mouse and even though the pointer disappears, I feel like I can tell when it gets to the edge of the display and then its ability to keep changing the camera slows way down and I have to swipe and swipe and swipe to try to get any noticeable camera movement. 

On a 2-screen setup, it is much much worse and almost every time I try to use this mode, I get stuck in a situation where my VW camera view is just spinning wildly out of control. Like the mouse moves to the other display and messes up all the math VW is using.

Not sure how to capture or reproduce this.

I have attached 3 files:

Open the one called `Gamer Mode View Ref.vwx`. It is a file full of 3D scenery. Looking around using walkthrough game mode works really well. It is smooth and responsive. Great!

Then open `Gamer Mode view Big File.vwx`. It has a lot more going on in the file (positions, lights, lots more 2D stuff. A full light plot. It has a reference to the 3D scenery from the file above in a design layer viewport on the `3D - Scenery` layer. If you go to the 30-3D Walkthrough, and activate the Walkthrough tool in gamer mode and try looking around, you'll find performance is maybe half as good as the other file, but still usable and not too embarrassing. 

Then set `3D - Scenery` as the active layer and switch to Active Only mode. Performance speeds right back up to be comparable to the original file, which makes sense since the only stuff I'm not seeing in this view is the same stuff as the original file, referenced in. 

Then open `HLL Bway Light Plot RevB2a.vwx`. It should be the EXACT SAME file as the `Gamer Mode view Big File.vwx`. I made `Gamer Mode view Big File.vwx` by doing "Save a copy as" from `HLL Bway Light Plot RevB2a.vwx`. But performance is totally different. When you go to that saved view, it is basically unusable. And even when you go to Active Only mode on `3D - Scenery`, it remains almost just as slow and laggy. 

How are these files different? Why is their performance so different?

I have had these issues for several versions now, at least. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-193397

Hardscape Realignment is Very Slow When Using Higher 3D Conversion Resolution

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Aligned Hardscapes with curved geometry.

To reproduce:

- In the VW Prefs, change the 3D Conversion Resolution to "Very High"
- Now reset the Hardscape in any way

Note that the spinning beach ball appears for over 10 minutes before the operation finally completes.

If the 3D Conversion Resolution is set to "High" the operation will take about 40 seconds, and if it's set to "Medium" it'll take about 15 seconds.

I might be wrong, but it seems like the calculations that are done to figure out the alignment would be based on the Simplification Tolerance of the Hardscapes, while the conversion resolution shouldn't have much of an impact. In cases like this, users are unlikely to wait for 10 minutes and will probably assume that VW is frozen. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-194797

Significant document refresh lag - VW2024 regression

Open the DoverDamPSTesting file attached to VB-194467
Try moving the mouse or zooming in the file.
The spinning beachball keeps appearing.
Macbook M1 Pro 32GB

Works just fine in VW2023 		Justin Hutchison
VB-195366

On file open, the main thread is blocked for a long time in total

This bug uses the same file (attached below [^DoverDamPSTesting.vwx]) as the VB-194797 bug.

The main thread shouldn't be blocked for too long if we want to have a responsive UI. By "UI", I mean the buttons, menus, OIP, Nav Pal, etc., not the drawing view (however, allowing users to make modifications to the model while the rendering is being completed might involve some sort of _task cancellation_ mechanism, but I think that's for another discussion).

More info can be found in the comments. 		Rick Berge
VB-194111

In my working file, I am seeing a significant slowdown of graphics performance that I was not seeing in the regular version of the file. When I make a change, it does not show up on the screen until I zoom in or out. I haven't seen this issue with Vectorworks in a few years and it is surprising to see considering that I am using an M1 Mac. The current size of my working file is 249 Mb, I have Save VGM Graphics Cache enabled in my document preferences, and I am seeing this in Top/Plan and sheet layer views. Justin Hutchison
