VB-194889

Spotlight - VW Freeze When Changing Soft Goods Pleat Width

This appears to be a performance issue. When adjusting the "Pleat Width" of a Soft Good to a value under 5" there is a substantial freeze in VW. No rainbow pinwheel appears, VW just looses functionality until the Soft Good is re-rendered. This occurs in iso views, top/plan view and in wireframe/shaded modes.

VB-194159

Parasolid cache: Copy and paste 4096 Spur Gear 3D objects takes a long time

I try to select all 4096 Spur Gear 3D objects in [this file|https://vectorworks-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/dnguyen_vectorworks_net/ERu3kV4aixhNjVJqLhgJSAoBZi3UwZvobnteHeN1bMU_sg?e=VXsVzI] and copy paste them. The _copy and paste_ operation takes only a few seconds (in the hot path, it takes only ~1% of Total CPU), but the whole thing takes ~7'30" to finish due to some VGM processing stuff. Hernán Stamati
VB-193879

Project Sharing: Save and Commit time is affected by the OnIdle processing

This is another case related to what's described [here|https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-193729?focusedCommentId=907531&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-907531] where the Save and Commit (S&C) time is affected by the OnIdle processing that is executed right after S&C is done, which makes S&C seem slow.

I profiled it twice using 2 different files with many symbols in them. I S&C all of the symbols in each file, and the results are similar. 		Tolu Fapohunda
VB-193583

Symbol vs Group performance discrepancy

There is a difference in the performance of a symbol compared with a group of objects.

To test this, I have gone through creating a model of 4 walls with windows and a door, and also included one staircase. Then copied it 20 times. making a total of 100 objects.

Then copied these 100 objects 2 times, converted one of these bunch into a Symbol, and Grouped the other one.

Please see the videos attached.

In video 1, I made a copy of those 100 objects, a copy of the symbol, and a copy of the group using the holding option key.

In terms of time, copying:

- the 100 objects took about 9 sec
- the symbol took less than 1 sec
- the group took about 9 sec

In video 2, I made the same experiment but using the rotation tool:

In terms of time, rotating:

- the 100 objects took about 16 sec
- the symbol took less than 1 sec
- the group took about 16 sec

In video 3, I made the same experiment but trim a line along those objects using the trim tool.

In terms of time, trimming:

- the 100 objects less than 1 sec
- the symbol took about 8 sec
- the group took less than 1 sec

I have also attached the test file and screenshots of the "About this Mac" and "About Vectorworks" tabs for your investigation.

Hernán Stamati

VB-200373

Vectorscript Documentation Difference : BuildResource List

There are two separate versions of the Vectorscript Function Reference. One if on-line at [https://developer.vectorworks.net/index.php/VS:Function_Reference]. The other is installed with Vectorworks in the VWHelp/Script Reference/ScriptFunctionReference.html file in the Application folder.

The documentation for the BuildResourceList and BuildResourceList2 contain a list of FolderIndex numbers.

The list in the Documentation on the Dev Site is much longer than the one in the installed version of the docs.

I have not compared the lists to see if there are items missing from the Dev Site version.

The version of the list on the Dev Site should be checked for completeness and then that list should be used for both versions of the docs. A system should be put in place so that future changes to the list automatically get included in both versions of the docs. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-197797

Problems with Plugin Objects (PIO) in Plugin Objects (PIO)

*We currently try to use full PIOs inside PIOs with following technique:*

1) We change following object properties:
- kObjXPropPreserveContents is set to true
- kObjectSpecialEditPropertyID is set to kObjXPropSpecialEditEditGroup

2) our PIOs that work as a group contain a single group handle (with sub PIOs inside this group)

3) whenever the user enters the group edit mode, we simply take the group from point 2 and set it as profile handle => this removes the group from the parent, sets it as profile handle and this allows us to make the "content" of the PIO visible inside the group edit mode

4) whenever the user leaves the group edit mode, we create a new empty group below the parent PIO, then we move everything from the profile handle to this new group and then we delete the profile handle again => this way, everything below the group PIO is visible outside of the group edit mode again.


This way we get a full group like behaviour but can also make our groups full PIOs with their own parameters, rules and logic.


*We see following problem:*

When we are inside our group PIO we can place new plugin objects as well as "native" objects like e.g. lines... The problem is, that we see a weird behaviour here. The group PIO gets regenerated whenever we place a new plugin object inside it (via kObjectExternalReset), whenever we change a plugin object inside it, add a new plugin object inside it and similar. But as soon as we place a "native" object like e.g. a line inside the group PIO the group PIO stops getting regenerated on every change inside it, even if we repeat changes that did regenerate the group PIO before we placed a line inside it... this is inconsistent and we wonder why this is like this and if this behaviour could be corrected to some consistent behaviour instead... As we do like to make live corrections inside out group PIO (as the user can freely place objects inside the group PIO it would be nice to correct some things here instantly) we would prefer that the group PIO gets regenerated on every change inside it - but currently this is not reliable...



*Bottom note:*

If there is a better way to use PIOs inside PIOs, especially without misusing data changes like we do currently for this purpose, we would be interested as well... 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-200369

DWF Export: Chinese text is exported as “???”

This bug was found in the Chinese version but it can be reproduced in the English version too:
# Insert a Drawing Label object and replace its Drawing Title field with "绘图标题"
# Go to File > Export > Export DWF
# Close the document and open a new one
# Import the exported DWF
# Note that the text is displayed as “???”

It can also be reproduced with a simple Text object, or probably any object that contains text. 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-200366

Space wrong displayed if converted from VW22 to VW24

Attached is a Vectorworks Document that was last saved with VW2022 SP6 and three screenshots showing the different situations described below.

1. If we open the VW-Document with 28.0.7, the Space object selected when opening the file is correctly displayed.

2. If we open the VW-Document with 28.0.7, save it and then open with 29.0.1 the same space object is also correctly displayed.

3. If we open the VW-Document directly with 29.0.1, the Space object is not correctly displayed anymore.

That brings the thought that is something wrong with the Space object when converting the file from 27.x.x to 29.x.x. 		Michael Wladarz
VB-200228

VW forgets to use separate render mode and projection for primary views

I'm finding that VW forgets, across sessions (shutdown, startup), to use separate render mode and projection for primary views.

When I started up and opened a project today I immediately checked the cardinal views (using the keypad shortcuts) and they were showing in narrow perspective instead of orthogonal. And I explicitly remember last night checking if the cardinal views were in orthogonal before I shut down.

I knew this would happen. It's probably going to be very difficult to reproduce. And it's probably going to be an ongoing problem into future versions. Which is why I would have preferred explicit settings rather than relying on VW to remember last choices. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198091

Revit import causes ODA platform error

VB-200185

VW recalculates unedited styled objectes like they were edited

An example:

User chooses "edit style" from OIP on styled object inserted into the wall (e.g. Design Express WinDoor tool). Then presses CANCEL button - let's say a wrong window was selected. VW recalculates all instances in the same way like in a scenario when User presses OK button, but without any changes.

Shouldn't the CANCEL button just end the operation, without updating all instances?

I did a test and compared recalculating/updating time in each case. 8 styled windows, inserted into the wall. Each time I reopened VW in the same conditions.
# Pressed OK without changes - 01:38
# Pressed CANCEL - 01:38
# Pressed OK, after changes in dimensions - 01:39

As you can see the time needed to update model for all 3 cases is the same, but only the last one makes any difference in geometry. It is a problem regarding seeing VW as a slow software.

  		Walid Remaili

VB-200348

Data Tag Automatic insertion options could be expanded

Currently, it is only possible to automatically insert a Data Tag to the insertion point of a Plug-in object. I would like there to be an option to insert to the Center of the bounding box of Sumbols and plug-ins as well.

A good case in point would be Truss objects which always have their insertion points at the Left or the Right of the object in the drawing area. It is often useful to be able to automatically apply a Data Tag to the Centre of the object instead.

Please see this forum thread. [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/111909-data-tag-to-object-center/#comment-487073]

 

Many thanks 		Nikolay Zhelyazkov
VB-200298

The Automatic calculated value for the object is correctly updated, but the Glazing and Frame values are not. 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-200294

The Line Tool and its dimension functionality works differently in Windows/Mac

A Landmark customer who works on both Mac and Windows observed a discrepancy between the platforms. 

One of them is a visibility of functions - the length/angle/etc in a pop-up menu when drawing a line using the Line Tool. On Mac, there is no need to press a Tab key to display the length/etc. but it's rather been used for the activation of the fields to edit them (Screenshots attached). On Windows, there seems to be a need to press a Tab key in order to see the existing dimensions and there is no further chance to activate the edit options. The customer reports that this wasn't the case in VW23.  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-199924

Spotlight FR: Cannot Update previous created inventories

Reported by Adam:

When creating an Inventory, VW app (FR) should create an XML within the User Folder Bibliothèque\Ressources\Inventaires to manage stocks from this inventory to be used by different projects.
If we want to change stock amount we have an option to Update the inventory even if it is not present in the current file. To do this VW app write the changes to the XML file.

In VW2024 Update 1 T2, There is now way to update the inventories. Each time I click on the Update Inventory VW does not find the XML and rebuilds a new default one wiping all the previous changes.
I checked in the User FolderBibliothèque\Ressources\Inventaires folder (where it should stand) and there is no XML file here. so I guess VW writes the xml file in a wrong location.

I checked in the US version and I can find the XML files for all my inventories at the right place (User Folder Libraries\Defaults\Inventories)

Note from Nele: I think this is a localization issue but I don't know where to look for. At my PC I don't have this problem but 2 collegaes do have this problem. So it seems important enough to solve this in our SP1. I need the solution as soon as possible. Could you help me?

I'll include the needed localized vwr's 		Kevin Linzey

VB-198134

ConnectCAD: Equipment Item geometry flattens in T/P when linked to drop point

This seems to be similar to VB-197915

I have an Equipment Item (not using a symbol) that displays as expected in T/P, but then flattens to a single line when linked to a drop point.

!image-2023-07-28-11-15-57-125.png|width=438,height=263!

!image-2023-07-28-11-16-52-838.png|width=403,height=246!

> Notice the red line now drawn towards the left side of the object. Could this be the symbolic spline link but drawn on the wrong plane? 

Still looks OK in 3D though.

!image-2023-07-28-11-17-25-684.png|width=393,height=288!

 

I believe this is because the Equipment Item has been rotated from the orientation it was generated in. It was generated upright, and when linked to a drop point, it functions fine, as below. But the rotated version of it doesn't. In this particular case, the params of this desk need swapping so it lays flat by default. But not everything has a default orientation.

!image-2023-07-28-11-22-22-323.png|width=451,height=326!

VB-200207

Vectorworks 2023 Shared Project, disappearing objects after Save/Commit

From _Tech Support_ (I will refer to us as {_}TS{_}): The user confirmed all who were working on the file are all working on vwx 2023. Title block does not stay the way that it should: in the "date" section, the date will be changed, saved, and we close the program, reopen the program and the change will stay for a little bit of time but will ultimately revert back to the old date from before the change. When TS opened the file, the file was already labeled as CD and not EX as the customer is experiencing. The viewports needed updating so the missing details would show, TS updated and saved the file, closed the program, reopened the program. The updates remained in the viewports for a bit of time before ultimately reverting back to before they were updated. I had the customer try turning on Viewport cache to retain data from the viewports but this did not help with the issue. What I ended up trying for the Annotations issue was clicking on the individual viewports one at a time, selecting Annotations, highlight over all of the text objects that I want to remove the fill from, going to the Attributes Palette and making sure fill is set to None. I saved and exited the program, reopened and the text had not re-filled again, until later.

----------------------------

From the User: There is a line across the screen that appears on sheet A-6.0, in the viewports 1b and 1c. In 1b a large countertop appears in the viewport, which is not there. I have no idea what this even is (it isn’t in the design or annotations). In the viewport 1c the opposite is happening… the countertop is not showing. Even though it is there in the design layer when you go into it. In the left hand viewport there is a countertop running the entire way across the viewport. This isn’t even in the model (if you go into the design layer or the elevation in place). In the right hand viewport the countertop is not showing at all. It’s on the same class as the cabinets. And again, when you go into the model the countertop is there and shown correctly, just not in the viewport. 
On top of that, I have had issues with the windows not actually being in the walls on the elevations, like the siding goes right through them even though they are called out as a “window in wall.” The windows in wall, on the exterior elevation, you can still see the siding, the window is not creating a hole in the wall.
The title block keeps reverting back to an old date and showing the project in “EX” instead of “CD.” Every time I open the file the title block has reverted to say “EX.’
One more problem is that the elevation grades on the sheet A-4.0 keep reverting to an older setting. In these elevation markers I do not want the text to have any fill, so they are easier to read. I have probably changed these at least a dozen times throughout drawing this project and like the title block they just keep reverting. 

Now that I’ve tried it a few times, the box “Save Viewport Cache” in the document preferences won’t even stay checked even when I save and close the file and reopen it. So that is reverting as well.

------------------------------------

The user additionally sent over this forum link mentioning it is a similar issue to his issue with the window in wall. https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/101836-window-door-in-wall-issue/ 		Rick Berge

VB-200193

Creating a Sketch Style Folder also creates the "Rough" sketch style

This only happens the first time a Sketch Style folder is created in a file. No other resource type creates a resource when its folder is created. Regardless of whether the new folder is created manually, by using UI buttons in the Resource Manager, or by running a script to create Sketch Style Folder, the "Rough" sketch style gets created with it.



To reproduce:

1) Open a new blank file.

2) Open the Resource Manager (RM).

3) Click on the New Folder... button at the bottom left of the RM.

4) Select "Sketch Style Folder" from the popup menu in the New Folder dialog, and click OK.

5) The Sketch Style Folder is created, and the sketch style resource "Rough" is also created.

6) No other folder type, when selected in the New fFolder dialog popup, will create a resource in addition to creating the requested folder.

 

The problem also exists if a Sketch Style Folder is created by script. The "Rough" sketch style also gets created.

If the "Rough" sketch style is deleted, creating another Sketch Style Folder DOES NOT create the "Rough" sketch style again. "Rough" only gets created the first time a Sketch Style Folder is created. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-200269

Viewport Annotations: if Accelerated Graphics active then orange border not displayed

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

While Multiple View Panes is active and inside of Viewport Annotations, we can see that the orange border of objects is not being displayed when the Accelerated Graphics are active. Although objects can be selected.

If we deactivate the Accelerated Graphics option, then we can see the orange border when selecting objects. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-200270

Triad Center Circle is hiding by blue grips in Top/Plan view.

Attached image shows difference in top and top/plan view about triad center sphere.  Maye be we can show similar to top view or always show triad on top of such blue highlights.

Use 3D polygon or Nurbs Curve or Nurbs Surface reshape tool. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-200249

Random large geometry appears when trying to export any sheet layer to pdf

I have a user who is trying to export their sheet layer to pdf. After the pdf generates, there is additional giant geometry on the pdf, we close the pdf, and see that all of that additional geometry is reflecting 94 objects of geometry that generate on any of the sheet layers when export to pdf is selected.

  		Hernán Stamati

A client reported that he recently upgraded his licences to the new Cinema 4D v2024.

If he use the "Send to Cinema 4D" command in Vectorworks, the Cinema 4D app reports: "Unknown File Format".

We requested him to use the Export to Cinema 4D command and it works as expected. 		Justin Hutchison

Drawing not invalidated correctly when deleting and replacing symbol

# Open the attached file

The left circle will appear cropped in the drawing until you pan/flyover/change the zoom level

VB-200246

Activating a saved view does not restore render options properly when going from "Renderworks Style White Model" to "Artistic Renderworks"

Steps to reproduce:

1) Open the attached "render-options-test.vwx" file.
2) Switch the render mode to "Artistic Renderworks".
3) Open the "Artistic Renderworks Options" dialog and switch the style to "Hatch".
4) Create a new saved view with all options enabled.
5) Switch the render mode to "Render Style White Model"
6) Click the View > "Set Renderworks Background..." menu command.
7) Switch the type to "Artistic".
8) In the "Artistic Style" pane, switch the style to "Art" and click the OK button to close the dialog.
9) Attempt to activate the saved view.

The extrude on the drawing doesn't render as expected.  I expect that the extrude would render with Artistic Renderworks with the Hatch style.  The "Current Render Mode" in the View bar still says "Render Style White Model".  If I change to Shaded, Wireframe, or other render modes, activating the saved view works as expected.

Please see the attached "Steps reproduced.mov" video for the steps reproduced.  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-200245

New style NFR-based Vectorworks trials should be identified in Vectorworks using the standard license-type LDF field

For VW2024 SP3 we introduced a safe stopgap measure to get trials working exactly how they are supposed to (VB-200244).

For VW2025 we want to unwind that and use the more proper:
{color:#de350b}"license-type": "evaluation"{color}
LDF field to determine is a license is a trial license.  

Vectorworks will have to change to allow 
{color:#de350b}"license-type": "evaluation"{color}
to be specified with the serial number LDF field like:
{color:#de350b}"serial-number": "EKXUSN-RZBKFF-XXXXXX-G1BL03",{color}
rather than the eval-token LDF field that it currently requires like:
{color:#de350b}"eval-token": "VWEval-29-0000-0000-0000"{color}

Note the eval-token approach should still be supported for VW2025. We just want the serial number approach to be supported also. 

----------------------------------------------------

Addendum:

The terms "eval" and "evaluation" are obsolete. The new term we want to use everywhere we can is "trial". I know the SDK has some calls that use the terms eval/evaluation, and I don't think we need to change those. But it would be good if we could change the LDF license-type value from:
{color:#de350b}"license-type": "evaluation"{color}
to
{color:#de350b}"license-type": "trial"{color}
for VW2025. 		Mark Farnan
VB-200237

The PSet "Material" is not exported during the IFC export of a pavement object

The PSet "Material" is not exported during the IFC export of a pavement object (IfcSlab - Belag/Weg-Objekt in Vectorworks Landschaft) in the IFC 4 version. The export under the IFC 2x3 version works. This error exists in VW2022 as well as VW2023. 

IFC 4 workflow for a path surface:
1. creating a pavement object of a path surface
2. definition of a style of the pavement structure with 4 layers
3. assigning a material to each layer
4. creation of a function in the data manager, which enters the material name of each layer into a component of the pset "IfcSlab/Material"
5. ExportOptions either export by components = true or = false - makes no difference
6. setting up the IFC export for IFC version 4
7. open exported object in Solibri
8. in the Information window the tab "Material" is missing

Same workflow as IFC 2x3 results in a file export including the "Material" tab 		Mihail Rizov
VB-200232

Railing not reset after post symbol is replaced in the resource manager

# Create a railing object
# Locate the post symbol in the resource manager
# Delete it and replace it with another symbol
The railing still appears to use the old post profile symbol. Resetting the railing fixes the issue.

The railing object stores a reference to the post symbol in a symdef parameter in its parametric record. When it's a 2D profile it's used as an extrusion profile, and when it's a hybrid symbol, it gets inserted (and maybe scaled).

The issue is that the parameter gets updated, but the railing object doesn't get reset after that. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198195

Laubwerk plants not behaving properly, sometime crashing the program.

Hello,
In 2023 SP6 I placed the default Laubwerk Plant (LP). The only thing I changed in the LW Global Settings in the OIP was the '3D representation' to 'High Detail'.

1. In the movies (no sound) you can see when I go to the Top the rendering disappears as if there's an Internal Origin issue. If I duplicate or just Modify>'Convert to Group' to get a Mesh, it and the existing LP then both render correctly when using the flyover tool!
See movie Laub 1.

2. Undocumented. Eventually after some flying around the 3D part completely disappeared. I could use a selection marquee to select it. So far I haven't repeated.
3. Sometimes the colour goes and I get a white colour.


3. In 2024, similar to above:
I placed the default Laubwerk Plant (LP). The only thing I changed in the LW Global Settings in the OIP was the '3D representation' to 'High Detail'. Material Style was set to colour but it was as if it was set to None. See Laub 2 movie.

4. In the Movie Laub 3 you can see that when the LP is viewed from above it basically disappears. You will also see that when I change the variant the program crashes. This has happened twice.

Cheers,
Peter

VB-200153

TK BUG: Import DXF/DWG: Layerfilter: Classes are created although they are excluded in the Layer-Filter

Hi VW-Team,

at the moment I produce a Webinar for Computerworks Germany.
Topic will be: Import/Export with DXF/DWG 2024.

And I found some various bugs with DXF/DWG, some bugs have already
been reported. I am not sure if this error was reported yet.


BUG:
I do not want to import some layers and objects,
for this I have set various filters (see video).

The objects on the excluded layers are not imported,
but the classes for them will be created.

But the classes are not always created, sometimes yes, sometimes no.
I can't really replicate it, unfortunately.

This erroneous behavior occurs only in combination of layer AND object filter.

The bug is more cosmetic, but should definitely be fixed. 
Because the user has otherwise, the feeling that it is somehow faulty.

Wish:
Please never create classes that are excluded in the layer filter!

Many greetings from Germany
Tobi

Screencast and my DWG-testfile 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-195608

PlantMaster Plugin does not regard disabled "On Plant List" setting

When using the PlantMaster plugin, I would expect that if I have unchecked (disabled) the "On Plant List" setting on Vectorworks' Plant Style and/or settings such as with the OIP, then that plant should not be part of the plant report shared with PlantMaster in its Import Plant Schedule to PlantMaster feature. If a designer is making such a schedule, and if they are including plants not intended for the schedule (i.e. existing plants - especially if they are not using the existing tree tool), then it should not be brought into PlantMaster as if it is part of the proposed plant schedule.

The attached images represent the selected plants (Red Maple) which have their "On Plant List" disabled, and the worksheet produced does not include the Acer Rubrum (Red Maple, yet the image of the imported plant report for PlantMaster does include the Red Maple not intended to be included.

From a recent conversation where Katarina mentioned this would go away, this could be a lower priority to solve, but will leave this up to the development team to know if it is an easy fix or not. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-200170

Libraries Download Manager buttons out of place with Windows

Attached are a few screenshots comparing Windows and Mac Package Manager.

The button "Alle installieren" (Install all) with Mac is correctly placed on the right side, while with Windows its displayed on the left side right after the displaycategory text.

If a category has only one Package, then the button "Alle installieren" will not be displayed with Windows, but it is displayed with Mac.

Of course, when there is only one package in a category, its senseless to have this button present, but I do believe that the button position looks better placed with Mac than with Windows. 		Tim Ardoin

VB-200184

Lighting devices with two accessory clamps do not show either clamp.

The two clamps attached to the COLORado PXL bar 16, included in our shipped content file, are not displayed when inserted into a drawing. They are also not being reported as attached as accessories since the edit accessory dialog in the object info palette is not available for use. Activity in the forum indicates that when users try to use two c-clamps on a lighting device, neither one is displayed, or they are on top of each other.

For counting and reporting purposes, we need both see clamps to remain as accessories rather than the workaround of converting them to geometry versus symbols.

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/110113-accessories-not-showing-in-section-viewports/#comment-486369]

VB-193890

KLS: WinDoor not working in german version because of EPVSCheck

Hi there,
plug-in WinDoor from Install Partner Products is not working in German version any more.
I strongly assume it is the EPVSCheck inside that VectorScript.
This function has changed from Vectorworks 2022 to 2023.
Some of our VectorScripts had the same behavior, so I assume the EPVSCheck.
As I know, the number of parameters have changed from 6 to 5.
Please have a look at the code of WinDoor and check if EPVSCheck is correct.

This bug is easy to reproduce. Simply download WinDoor into a German version of Vectorworks using a german serial number. You cannot test it with an us-version, because here it will work.
So this bug report only affects the german version of Vectorworks. And I assume it affects all versions except the us-version, at least the european versions.
Gruß, Klaus Lüttich 		Nikolay Zhelyazkov

VB-200166

KLS: Help text in worksheet function not reacting on settings in Language and Region

Worksheet Functions do react on settings of number format in Language & Region in OS Settings.
In Germany we do have colon as decimal separator while in US and Swiss it is a dot.
This affects the worksheet functions.

For example average function. In US and Swiss it is AVERAGE(a,b,c). You see a colon is used. In German it is AVERAGE(a;b;c). You see a semicolon is used,

In Select Function dialog window the function reacts on the settings in Language & Region. It shows a colon or a semicolon depending on the settings in Language & Region.
This is great for us, because our german Vectorworks is for Germany, Switzerland and Austria. In Germany and Switzerland we do have different settings in Language & Region. See screenshot Select Function.png.

Unfortunately there is one left, where the function does not react on settings in Language and Region and this is the help text when typing a function.
See Screenshot Function Help Text.png.
This help text is static. I can write the functions in those help text either with semicolon or colon. This forces me to always write the function two times. One time in german with semicolon and one time in swiss with colon.
This is annoying and could confuse the customers. A help text should help and not confuse.

So please make the help text reacting too on settings in Language and Region.
I created quite a long video to explain my issue.




Karthick Chilaka
VB-200160

Clip cube don't show correctly when opening attached file

See attached recording.

When opening the file clip cube show small and np objects show up in the drawing

Just Toggle the clip cube on View/mode bar to see the drawing correctly.

This happens every time when file is opened. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-200148

Data Manager: Custom Pset with prefix Qto_ is not exported (IFC4 only)

Due to a report from a customer I found out, that there is an issue, when a Custom Pset's name starts with 'Qto_'. That Pset is not exported to IFC4. It isn't an issue though, when such a Custom Pset is exported to IFC2x3.

To make sure the issue is only Qto_ and not any random Xyz_ combination, I also setup a custom pset Abc_CustomPset, which is exported correctly. Mind you, that Abc_ pset only exists in the IFC4 document. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-198687

Import georeferenced image: WorldFile Units > US Survey Foot

Hi,
I got the feedback from our tech writer, that this drop-down option is obsolete, according to this source: https://www.nist.gov/pml/us-surveyfoot/frequently-asked-questions-faqs

_Beginning on January 1, 2023, the U.S. survey foot should be avoided, except for historic and legacy applications and has been superseded by the international foot definition (i.e., 1 foot = 0.3048 meter exactly) in all applications. _

(Source: https://www.nist.gov/pml/us-surveyfoot)

Vectorworks > 716 Image Import Options.vwstrings > kGISUnitValue_Feet> US Survey Feet

Other drop-down options include:
- Document Unit: (variable)
- Meters

Should this US Survey Foot be still on the list or should it be updated? 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-200099

Shaded Rendering projects shadows in incorrect positions

--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023(Occurs from previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Shaded Rendering projects shadows in incorrect positions

If shaded rendering (formerly OpenGL Rendering) is performed with the options "Shadows" and "On ground only" enabled in Shaded Options, shadows will be projected below the ground (Z:0).


Steps to reproduce.
1) Place a simple 3D shape and a light source.
2) Enable the options "Shadow" and "On ground only" in the Shaded Options.
3) Execute Shade Rendering, and the shadow will be projected below the ground (Z:0).


Please refer to attached "Sample231012.vwx". 


*Remarks*
In v2019 and below, OpenGL rendering with similar settings will project the shadow at a height of Z:0.


Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199995

Memory Leak in TaggedDataSet

I think I've found a potential memory leak in TaggedDataSet. For a task I am working on, I needed to store a few MBs of file data from the hard drive in the VW document. I was initially going to use UserDataNodes for this. But, it was suggested that I use TaggedData instead.

So, I started looking for examples in our code. I found this example which I based my code on:

{code:c}
for (size_t i=0; i < inNumUniChars; i++) {
  *pDst = inStr.GetAt(i);
  if ( ! VERIFYN(kEJKerr, gSDK->TaggedDataSet(inhOwner, inContainerTag, kTaggedDataByteArrayTypeID, inDataTag, dataIndex++, &dst[0])))}}
    outbSuccess = false;
  if ( ! VERIFYN(kEJKerr, gSDK->TaggedDataSet(inhOwner, inContainerTag, kTaggedDataByteArrayTypeID, inDataTag, dataIndex++, &dst[1])))
    outbSuccess = false;
}
{code}
My test code is writing ~1.7MB of data. So, my for loop is a much bigger one and I am calling TaggedDataSet many times; 1770425 times to be exact. So, my code looks like:
{code:c}
for (int i = 0; i < bufferLength; ++i, ++bufferIter)
gSDK->TaggedDataSet(fParentHandle, kDataContainer, kTaggedDataByteArrayTypeID, kRecordingDataTag, i, bufferIter);
{code}
When I ran my test code, VW allocated around 130GB of data before MacOS spawned a dialog saying I ran out of memory and needed for force quit an application to free up memory.

I ran this test code again with the MacOS Leaks Instruments tool running to try to narrow things down. I included screenshots and hope they help. 		Rick Berge
VB-200018

Lighting Device object doesn't get deleted when deleting it from the Visualization palette

# Open the Visualization palette with the Lights page selected
# Place a Lighting Device
# Delete it from the Lights page of the Visualization palette

Notice the item is deleted from the list browser in the Lights page but the object is not deleted. If we place a Light object instead, the object can be deleted correctly from the Lights page.

VB-196979

Renderworks Background: Lit fog isn't very controllable in Shaded render.

Hello,
In the enclosed file and screenshots you can see that the beams of light that appear in the lit fog are quite strong at 1%.

Also, the difference between say 50% and 100% isn't that great. It seems that in the past there was a linear curve from 1-100 but now it is not so controllable and thus subtleties aren't possible.

In the file I was trying to just 'hint' very slightly a beam but at 1% it's a bit like a rock concert! It seems the fine control has gone.

Peter 		Justin Hutchison
VB-200087

Stack overflow with deeply nested worksheet formulas

Open attached file [^worksheetcrash.vwx]

^On the worksheet copy the cell B63 It has a formula =TEXTJOIN('-', B62)^

^Paste the formula to B62, B61, B60,... Around B60 it will crash. There is a stack overflow calculating formulas.^

^It is a pathological case that has been around forever.^

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-200083

Problems importing IFC files and Revit from VW into Revit - Hardscapes + DTM

It's of critical importance that our Landmark users are able to export DTM and hardscape correctly into Revit and that Revit is also able to to edit the DTM and hardscape with their tools. This happens with the wall tool, not only the geometry and metadata has to be able to be read by revit, but it's also important that Revit can edit it like it does with walls that originated in VW.

DTMs and Hardscapes arrive into Revit as none editable and as a wireframe mesh. DTMs also arrive as generic solids, not as a terrain. Can someone get in touch with me regarding these topics ? we absolutely need these two object to be read correctly in Revit. Thanks, Jorge 		Katarina Ollikainen
VB-200052

VB-200011

Ref DLVP: referenced cropped design layer viewport doesn't look the same as non referenced cropped DLVP

To replicate (see video "ref-DLVP-buggy.mp4"):
1) open "target-file v2024.vwx"
2) you see a referenced cropped DLVP
3) change into 3D perspective and orbit around the object
--> the crop rectangle is fixed to the screen plane, and only the content of the crop looks correct. The surrounding part looks buggy.
4) open the referenced file: "source-file v2024.vwx"
--> there you will find the same situation as in 3)
5) open and delete the crop rectangle
--> now the DLVP looks correct
6) open "non-ref-DLVP.vwx"
--> this DLVP is also cropped, but not referenced, yet it looks correct

So, the issue seems to be referenced vs. non-referenced.

Strangely this issue looks very different for our customer in Vectorworks 2023:
"Customer-video.mov" 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-200057

View Change Undo Grouping Fails When Navigating with RW Camera Active

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains an RW Camera.

To reproduce:
* Make sure "Undo View Changes: Group similar view changes" is enabled in VW Prefs
* Activate the RW Camera
* Zoom a few times
* Now Undo

Note that each zoom registers as an Undo operation, which can easily eat-up your entire Undo history.

This also happens when editing RW Cameras in camera-linked Viewports.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-200016

ConnectCAD Cable route profile editing issue

Its not possible to edit the cable route profile of a group of selected cable route object.
Only the cable that was used to access the context menu command 'edit profile' will be edited despite having multiple cable route objects selected when running the command.

This is a major hinderence if the user wishes to accurately depect the cable routes in their 3D model, as there is no way to define the profile while drawing, and if the user is adding links to drop points and other object the cable routes rapidly splits into a large number of seprate sections each of which has to be individually edited. 		Conrad Preen

VB-200005

ConnectCAD: Circuit numbers and connector flipped in Top viewport view

See the attached files. The customer reported that the circuit number and connector type text on some circuits was upside down. Once they'd clarified that this was in a viewport not on the design layer it became obvious. The viewport was set to Top view instead of Top/Plan and 3D text doesn't flip. The circuits in question were drawn destination to source and thus had to be flipped in order to look right.

Logging this as a bug because although we know why it happens from the customer's point of view there is no reason for them to expect Top to look different from Top/Plan. 		Conrad Preen

VB-199695

OnUpdateUI is not called when pressing TAB in the last edit control

Steps to reproduce:
- Selecting field 1 and pressing tab will move focus to field 2 and call OnUpdateUI on win and mac
- Selecting field 2 and pressing tab will move focus to the OK button and has different behaviour on win and mac:

*
** on windows , OnUpdateUI is called and gSDK>GetActiveItemID() returns -1
** on mac, OnUpdateUI is not called
*
{code:c++}
class TestDialog : public VWDialog
{
Sint32 m_previousActiveEditItem = -1;

VWEditRealCtrl* edit1;
VWEditRealCtrl* edit2;

public:
TestDialog()
{
edit1 = new VWEditRealCtrl( 100 );
edit2 = new VWEditRealCtrl( 101 );
}

bool CreateDialogLayout() override
{
this->CreateDialog( "Test Dialog", "OK", "Cancel" );
edit1->CreateControl( this, 0, 20, VWEditRealCtrl::kEditControlReal );
edit2->CreateControl( this, 0, 20, VWEditRealCtrl::kEditControlReal );

this->AddFirstGroupControl( edit1 );
this->AddBelowControl( edit1, edit2 );

return true;
}

void OnUpdateUI() override
{
Sint32 activeEditItem = gSDK->GetActiveEditItem( GetDialogID() );

std::cout << m_previousActiveEditItem << " -> " << activeEditItem << std::endl;

m_previousActiveEditItem = activeEditItem;
}

void OnInitializeContent() override {}
void OnDDXInitialize() override {}
};
{code} 		Payne Chang

VB-198637

Error editing Marionette script mentions "referenced file"

When you try to edit a Marionette script from our library without deleting the first line, you'll get an unclear error that mentions "referenced file", even though there's no referenced file involved. Also, the following sentence doesn't give any clue about what a user should do to proceed. But the mentioning suggests that a referenced file is involved (without a "maybe" or "possibly"). This is wrong and misleading and puts the user further away from the solution compared to when there wouldn't be an error at all (which also won't be optimal, to be clear).

The error text should be changed. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-199268

Railing - slab shape construction

Reported by Jakub:

I hope it's visible in attached screenshot (see googledrive link) - I've made two idetical in form sets of slabs and ramp.
The first one - on the left - has an upper slab which shape was made by cutting of 3D geometry from from rectangle slab.
The second one - on the right - has an upper slab which shape was made by hand by converting polygon into slab.

As you may see (I hope), the red line on the edge of the slab, that presents the railing lenght, is propper only in the second case. In the first example tool seems not to 'see' cuted geometry and treats the slab as if it was a rectangle not a polygon.
I'm not sure if that's a more problem of the Railing tool or the Slab tool, but something is not right here, I think. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-199757

Hardscape surface is being covered up by site model

The attached file in 2023 will show the hardscape surface after updating the site model.  The same file in 2024 will not.  It appears there was a regression in early 2024(before build 717409) where the hardscape surface is no longer shown if the "cut site model" checkbox is no checked.  

The hardscape surface should remain visible even if the cut site model checkbox is not checked, because people may choose to leave it unchecked for performance reasons. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-199745

Importing IES files to Custom Light doesn't work

Attempting to import an IES file to a Custom Light object will not successfully import, and the Kind will swap to Spot. Nikola Hilendarov
VB-199777

Point cloud import doesn't consider all file points before culling to limit

Instead of reading in the whole file and then culling to fit within our performance limits (35 million points), any points in the file after the limit are ignored.  This is terrible design because interest may be in something that is further down in the file sequence.

 

Instead, point cloud import should read in all file points then cull the set to our limits.  If a portion of the set is later in the file sequence it will still be represented not skipped. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199771

3) There is no response when selecting a line on the sheet layer.

Takaaki Mizuno

VB-199746

There is a setting in Define Legend preview where the Vertical Dimension shows the window but not the door.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023, v2024
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
There is a setting in Define Legend preview where the Vertical Dimension shows the window but not the door.(Please refer to attached "Define Legend Image.vwx")


1) Define Legend of OIP > Click the "Define Legend Image" button。
2) This occurs when the "Define Legend Image" dialog > Annotations Tab > Check Vertical Dimension is "Frame + Still to Floor".


*Remarks*
*Since the door is in contact with the floor, there is no need to display the height dimension from the bottom frame of the door to the floor.
The problem is that the dimensions of the frame/frame are not displayed.

With this, when you try to display the height dimension from the floor of the window, the Vertical Dimension of the door frame will not be displayed.
Doors and windows cannot be written together in the same Define Legend. I think this is a specification bug.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198334

The text was created and copied in TextEdit. When the text is pasted into Vectorworks with "Paste with Bitmap", the text is pasted as normal text instead of a bitmap. This also occurred in 2023.

This was found on the Sonoma Beta acceptance test machine (103201) but it is also seen in MacOS 12.6. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199717

Text Alignment issue with certain fonts

Insert a text object and type some characters.
You can already notice that the text is misaligned vertically.
Becomes more visible if you use capital letters and change the colors.

This also causes weird graphical glitches while changing Bold/Italic and other text options because the document is not redrawn outside of the text object's bounding box but the text extends beyond it.

Note: I later discovered that this seems to be related to the Al Tarikh Regular font. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199620

Publish command fails on Windows but ok on Mac and Cloud

Hello,
The enclosed Vectorworks file is from a Windows user. He says that when publishing locally after several hours he has to crash out. On my suggestion he used the Vectorworks Cloud Services and received the enclosed screenshot that Vectorworks had crashed on the cloud!

Yet...I can publish in 5 minutes on my MBP and it took the VCS 25 minutes to publish for me. I realise that the VCS is all Windows, so why did I have such a difference experience than the user?

I'm not sure about his OS if he's 10 or 11 but I would expect 11 from him.
Cheers,
Peter 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-193327

Gremlin characters sent to Lightwright via Data Exchange

I recently had a Lightwright customer who couldn't get Data Exchange to work, he did everything right in Vectorworks, but when Lightwright tried to read the .xml file, it said the file was damaged and couldn't be opened.

I've seen this happen before, some kind of illegal character(s) get into the Vectorworks data fields, and so they go into the .xml file. Illegal characters are typically non-printing ASCII characters that can accidentally get into a VW text field.

To solve the problem for the customer, I used Bbedit's "Zap Gremlins" feature on the .xml file, which let Lightwright read it and then send the repaired data back to Vectorworks.

To fix this, Vectorworks should do a similar gremlins zap of the .xml data either before it writes it to disk or after it is in the .xml file.

This is not a new problem, it has existed for years (and I've been fixing user's data), but preventing it on the VW side is the only real solution. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-199697

Bounding box on Symbols wiith light objects are inconsistent/incorrect

Symbols with "Light" defined within them have inconsistent bounding boxes depending on current zoom level. Ideally the bounding box shown in the software could ignore light objects entirely? I've verified that the sizes exported by the sizer script used to generate dimensions for .ifc data are effected by light objects and view zoom, and have a probability of being inaccurate due to the presence of light objects within the symbols.

If I zoom the view of the file in far enough that the representations of the lights are within the geometry of the symbol I'm able to get accurate results from the sizer script, and assume that the light objects are not effecting the numbers.

Light objects don't have a physical volume, so ideally they could be ignored when determining dimensions of bounding boxes. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-199277

Site Model Incorrect Texture

I went to change the texture of the site model in this file and when I updated it, the texture did not cover the entire site model. It seems to be laid diagonally over part of the site model - the rest is white. I can't seem to revert it back to what it was. Any texture I select now does this, and no edits of the texture settings in the OIP appear to change it. Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-199281

Web Browser: OnBeforeUnload event missing when closing the dialog

Attached is a test file. The instructions to reproduce are:
* Open a web-browser dialog via script (change the file path to your local path):

ShowWebDlg('Title', 'file:///Users/vstanev/Downloads/test.html', 'Close', '');
* Open the Dev Tools in the browser
* Type in something in the edit box
* Close the dialog
* Note that the event (break point) is not triggered, and the browser doesn’t confirm the exit, allowing you to cancel it.

 

The root of the problem is that we haven’t implemented the browser life-cycle correctly:

[https://cef-builds.spotifycdn.com/docs/111.2/classCefLifeSpanHandler.html#a4867b3d97d879d9996dec2cf1daa483d]

 

How to get JS browser callbacks on close:

[https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/how-to-detect-browser-or-tab-closing-in-javascript/]

  		Vladislav Stanev

VB-197426

VB-199666

point cloud rotate over angle

Rotate point cloud via Angle in Info palette always adds the entered angle to the existing one. So you can't correct the displayed angle of 10° with 5°, because then it takes the 10° + 5° and results in 15°. So if you now have 15° and really only want 5° you have to enter the angle 350° instead of 15° so it rotates almost 360° around.
my colleague who reported this bug is on vacation, so i only have the video at the moment. if you need the vwx file we can deliver it in 2-3 weeks. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193452

Duplicates when grouping in Vectorworks

This is a bug that was reported by a Lightwright user, on the Lightwright Jira it is LWB-3074, so I put both of the user's .zipped files into a folder named "LWB-3074". The .zip is attached.

I watched the video, and see that reproducing the problem requires two successive data exchanges with Lightwright.

First, here is the user's report to us (he is using the current stable release of Lightwright 6.0.47):

--------------------------------------------------

Hi John,

me again, found a more critical problem. Don’t know yet, if it is caused by VWX or LW. But it happens in VWX 2022 SP6 and VWX 2023 SP3. Newest LW Version

Happens to me and my colleagues. Some are working with windows
# Blank LW File (not my template), blank default vwx file, both in same same folder

2. inserting instruments from VWX online library.

3. setting up LW exchange

4. instruments appear correct in LW

5. grouping instruments in VWX

6. in LW duplicates appear

7. Duplicates don’t show up in VWX

8. Refresh LD in VWX

9. Duplicates still in LW

10. “complete export on exit” in VWX

11. in LW duplicates are identified

I attached a video

Best, Rob

--------------------------------------------------

Reproducing it was complicated because video doesn't have any audio, is tiny, and moves very quickly. The version the user attached is from 2022 .vwx, while I'm running 2023 here. So for testing, I opened his 2022 .vwx using 2023 SP3 and re-saved it. I was eventually able to reproduce the problem on 2023, but it might be easier for you to make it happen in 2022.

Here's what I did to successfully reproduce it, using the 2023 version of VW on 2023 .vwx files:
* Did a Complete Export on Exit from VW
* Looked at the .xml file using BBEdit, in it were 6 Forte and 6 T2 Profiles
* Launched Lightwright, chose the .xml file
* Got 6 Forte and 6 T2 Profiles
* Clicked on VW, there are still 6 Forte and 6 T2 Profiles
* Ungrouped the group of T2 Profiles
* Clicked on LW, there are still 6 Forte and 6 T2 Profiles
* Clicked on VW, did a full export on exit
* The .xml is still correct with 6 of each
* Clicked on LW, nothing changed, correct with 6 of each
* Clicked on VW, nothing changed. Grouped the 6 T2 Profiles
* Clicked on LW, there are now 6 Forte and *12* T2 Profiles.

I have no idea why it took so many back and forths before the VW Group command added 6 new lights.

Good luck with bug hunting on this one, it's clearly reproducible, but I tried a variety of different steps and only the sequence shown above was bad. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-199513

Spotlight Inventory Worksheets T02059 deletes worksheet when clicking on X to close dialog

From [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/110994-equipment-lists-worksheets-vw24/#comment-483025]

When a user creates a worksheet, but then clicks on the X instead of OK to close the worksheet dialog, the worksheet is deleted from the drawing.

closing the 'Inventory and Equipmentlist' dialog window and the worksheet window before pressing the 'ok' Button seems to lead to not saving the worksheet...

-open dialogue

-create worksheet

- close dialogue window via X

=> worksheet is not saved

 

-open dialogue

-create worksheet

-close worksheet window via X

-close dialogue window via 'ok'

=> worksheet is saved

 

-open dialogue

-create worksheet

-close worksheet window via X

-close dialogue window via X

=> worksheet is not saved

This has been tested and confirmed by [~gmatas] using Win 11.  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-199423

Structural Member - improper joint in 3D

Reported by Jakub:

While the 2D joint representation works quite well (see other reports in that case), there's a big mistake made in 3D model. When two beams are joined together, not only the top and bottom parts (flangs) should fit properly, but also the middle one (web). There should definitely be no gap between webs. Otherwise such a join doesn't work from structural poit of view - I mean the most situations, exluding some exceptions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-199431

Create Report: Criteria Field Value not found if referenced file

If we open the file RefVN v2024.vwx and create a Report, select Advanced Criteria, open Edit Criteria, select Field Value and finally search for the Record Field "test" it will be found (screenshot attached).

If we do this in a new empty file where we create a reference of the RefVN v2024.vwx, the Record Field "test" will not be found (also screenshot attached). 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-199211

Spotlight cable tool daisy chain mode wrong connector error message not displaying

If the daisy chain mode of the cable tools is used to draw cables connecting lights with more than a single possible input (for example consumer and input component) the tool will only connect to the consumer (known issue) but will not trigger the normal error message saying that the wrong connector has been used (for example 5-XLR cable style to a schuko on the consumer). Kevin Linzey

VB-199349

KLS: WSFunction Fixed does not consider country specific decimal separator in result

Worksheet function Fixed does convert any number to text.
In Germany we do use a comma for decimal separation and not a dot.
The worksheet itself works fine with country specific format of a number; for example when I type in 7.8 as a number it automatically turns to 7,8 which is correct.
But when I perform the function FesteDezimalstellen(10,123;3) which in English is Fixed(10.123,3) then the result is 10.123. This is not correct. In our german version the result should be 10,123. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197921

Project Sharing: commit change time varies wildly (5-40 minutes)

With this customer we have the situation that the process of committing changes can sometimes be a quick as 5 minutes, but sometimes it takes for ever. There is no apparent pattern.

All 5 users
* are in the office
* use Windows 10
* use Vectorworks 2023 SP5
* use PSS (up-to-date: 23 May 2023) on Windows Server 2019 (virtualized with VMware) on RAID6 with 6 SATA-SSDs
* network uses VLANs
* switches have up-to-date firmware installed
* Trend Micro is installed, but Vectorworks application and user folders are whitelisted

Sometimes the lag occurs with one user, sometimes with another.

When I tried the following steps on their computer through TeamViewer everything worked fine and quick:
* get a new working file
* save and commit changes of current objects
* save and commit with new objects
We tried the same with a local project file and it worked a bit better.
Manually transferring files (Windows Explorer) from the local PC to the server and back never took more than 5 seconds in each direction with the project file (about 570MB).

Which files and other information do you need to help us trouble-shoot this further? 		Rick Berge

VB-199125

Hardscape with specific properties is displayed trangulated in Lumion

As you can see in the attached video:
If a hardscape has a organic shape, has a border but the border is deleted at one or more edges, the display of that hardscape object will be very triangulated in Lumion.

I report this for Vectorworks 2023 SP6, since that's our latest localized version. The customer works on that version and since we don'ty have Lumion at the office, I could only test this on the customer's computer.

I suppose this is a regression compared to version 2022, because in version 2022 herdscapes weren't triangulated yet. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-194202

Objects linked to a story level that doesn't exist reset their z-value to zero when copied

Most interior symbols in our libraries have a link with a story. Since most interior architects don't work with stories (at least in our region) there objects are linked to a story that doesn't exist.
When a symbol is linked to a story that doesn't exist, copying a symbol with a modified Z- value doesn't function as desired. The copy of the original object will have its Z- value reset to "0". This causes unnecessary hassle and confusion to the user. The copy should retain the originals Z- value like it does with symbols which are not linked to a story. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196959

Worksheet TXT function does not handle complex criteria properly

The Worksheet TXT function is supposed to allow the conversion of a value to a specified unit.  It works for simple cases, but does not work for a function containing a complex criteria.

In the attached file, there are 4 lines. One in None Class, the other three in Dimension. Two in the Dimension class have a Pen Fore of red. The two red and the one in None have a record.field  (PTS.MKS) with a value of 'private'. The document units are set to Feet.

The worksheet in the file in column A is the "case" number, column B shows a text version (same formula but without the = so it does not evaluate) of the formula in column C.  Column D shows which returns I believe are correct or wrong. Column E is notes.

The top 4 rows (cases 1-4) show various versions of a Length function using different simple (single criteria) and complex (two criteria ANDed together). For the Length function all of the options behave as expected.

The bottom 10 (cases 5-14) rows show different versions of the TXT function.

For cases 5 & 6 rows (TXT of a manually entered value and TXT of a simple criteria Length function), the results appear correct.

Case 7 used the Criteria Builder to generate the criteria for the Length function and it produced a wrong result. The only difference between the second and third functions is the extra parentheses generated by the Criteria Builder. It does not even return the correct value of the Length function and it returns a numeric value instead of the expected text string.

Case 8 uses the same criteria as Case 6 plus adds the conversion to 'Meters' and works correctly.

The rest of the cases all generate wrong results.

Case 9 uses the Criteria Builder version of a simple criteria (extra parentheses) and returns the text 'Meters'

Case 10 uses the same criteria as Case 2 (parentheses around each of the sub-criteria only) and try to convert to meters. It returns the value of 'Meters'

Case 11 uses the same criteria as Case 4. Rather than returning a text string, it return the numeric value of the Length function/criteria.

Case 12 uses the equivalent criteria to Case 11 and tries to convert the return to Inches. The return value is "Inches"

Case 13 uses the equivalent criteria to Case 10, but using the record.field value instead of PenFore color and tries to convert to inches. The return value is "Inches"

Case 14 uses the equivalent criteria to Case 13, but added the extra option parameters for Rounding Style and Rounding Accuracy.  It returns "1/16", the last parameter.

There appear to be several problems.
# The Length formula inside a TXT is not evaluating properly. 
# In some cases the TXT function appears to be returning a number instead of the expected text string of the value.
# The use of Criteria Builder constructed criteria (simple or complex) do not work when nested inside a TXT function.
# When the TXT function gets a value it can not process properly it returns the last parameter in the function.

The expected result is the TXT function should accept any other properly formatted worksheet function to generate the input number either using a manually created or Criteria Builder version of the function criteria.

The return from the function should be the text string version of the input value. It there is an error, the function should return something indicating the error, probably an N/A or ERROR message. Returning the last parameter is not an acceptable error message.

Originally found in VW2023SP5. Test file converted to VW2024B2 and same behavior noted.

Only VW2023 file attached. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197160

Worksheet Column Width Adjust does not reliably show cursor Icon

When you hover over the Column or Row Header separators the cursor should change to the double arrow cursor showing that you can adjust the width or height of the column. These are not working reliably. Sometimes you get the correct cursor, but most of the time I just get a flicker of the icon an then get the standard pointer icon back. Even with the pointer icon I can click and drag to change the width, but it does not feel fluid.

The attached movie shows what I am seeing.

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197523

BUG: Worksheets and functions results for 2D-Polygons, 3D-Polygons and Nurbs-Curve

Hi VW-Team,

attached you find a VW 2024 Beta 3 file.

I tested the Worksheet functions:

=Length
=Perim
=SurfaceArea
=Area

with: 2D-Polygon, 3D-Polygon and Nurbs-Curve

The objects can have a fill or not,
are closed or not. The combination leading to
different results. 

… and some results are not really logical to me.

Maybe W-A-D, but why?

Greetings from Germany

VB-199093

TK BUG: Slab and Modifiers with touching corners! No Rendering in 3D

Hi VW-Team,

VW has problems with 3D Rendering of Slabs + Modifiers with "touching corners".

If you have a Slab with Modifiers of this situation,
you won't get any Rendering in 3D.
The 2D representation is not affected.

I tried to upconvert from 2023 to 2024 AND
complete rebuild the situation in 2024 = both no success!

Attached you find a VW 2023 SP7 file and a screencast.

Hope you can fix this bug soon!

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Christopher Graye

"Kenchikubuzai" (a third party product) has a lot (189) additional plug-ins and this number can be an additional cause.

VB-199209

WS: Scintilla doesn't work for absolute cell referencing

Since the introduction of syntax highlighting using Scintilla our customers are growing accustomed to seeing colors as a way to determine, if there is an error in a worksheet formula.

VB-197713

Curtain walls: Impossible to control fill stiles in top/plan view.

See in the attached video how I compare version 2022 with 2024.
In version 2022, it was easy to control the 2D fill color of horizontal stiles in top/plan view. The big problem in v2022 though, was that the 2D fill for the Horizon stiles in top/plan view and in 3D/ section were synced. This is luckily resolved in v2023 en 2024.
In the last two versions, the horizontal stiles always show in top/plan view with a white fill, while the fill you set in the stiles settings will only be applied in 3D/ section.
If you want to choose another fill color than white though, it seems impossible.
There should be a way to control the top/plan fill color. 		Christopher Graye

VB-199059

TK BUG: Data Tag: Only predefined Syntax (with capital letters) gives you result

Hi VW-Team,

I don't know if this is a BUG or a limitation of Data Tags.

The syntax for Data Tags works only, if you use the predefined one,
with only capital/uppercase letters!

1.
#AREA# = gives you a result

2.
#Area# / #area# = gives you no result

In Reports/Worksheets, the functions/formulas you write,
will always be converted to the correct working syntax.

It doesn't matter if you write: AreA, aREa, area, areA, …
(or any other creative way of writing) 

With Data Tags the converting-option is not working.

Maybe this could be useful.
Lesser problems, lesser time for support!

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-199120

If I option-drag a viewport to create new one, the name seems wrong

As part of the Section Viewport acceptance test, there's a point where you're instructed to make copies of an existing viewport. If the viewport's name is "1/Sht-1", the copies get named "1/Sht-2", "1/Sht-3", etc., rather than <DrawingNumber>/Sht-1 as seems the more logical name given our naming standards. Karthick Chilaka

VB-197486

Door changed from opening back to operating loses trim

In the attached file I have three instances of the same styled door. The first is a sliding door, and it shows trim per the style. The second is a duplicate of the first door, but now changed to a 'sliding' unit to an 'opening'. Note the trim is gone, as expected: 'cased openings' have trim, 'openings' do not. The third door is a duplicate of the second, but changed back from 'opening' to 'sliding'. Note the continued absence of trim, and more importantly the trim option is now greyed. Not only is the trim lost, but it cannot be reactivated, even though trim is user-defined for this particular door style. Christopher Graye

In the screenshot, the windows should show their swing opening out since the stile is a custom window with one sash set to swing outward. VB-199033

Dialog: SVG cannot be displayed as disabled

When using SVG files in the dialog builder, Mac can display them both as enabled and disabled.

Solution: support disabled for SVG in Windows dialogs.

VB-199042

Low performance with Sheet Layers

In the attached file we have various Sheet Layers, for this report we will use the Sheet Layer number 650 as example.

Select the Sheet Layer 650, zoom and pan around the Sheet Layer several times. The Customer and I both experience temporary freezes and lag while navigating in the sheet layers. Double click one of the Viewports and enter the edit mode. Here also pan, edit zoom around several times and the same performance problems will happen.

There is a visible lag between the mouse actions and when the action happens in Vectorworks. With the Windows 11 the problem is not as much visible, because of the hardware I am using, but with the Macbook the lag and freezing is very visible.

The RAM used remains stable during the full process.

Computers used for the tests:
Windows 11 - 13th Gen i9-13900K 5.8GHz 24-Core, 64GB RAM and Radeon Pro WX 8200.
MacOS 13.5 - 2.6GHz 6-Core i7, 16GB RAM DDR4 and Radeon Pro 560X 4GB. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-199050

Proxy object does not import when importing design layers to use for a Viewport

Steps to reproduce:

1) In a blank Vectorworks file, use the "Create Viewport..." menu command from the View menu.
2) Choose to create a new design layer for the Viewport, then import the design layers from the attached "Stair.vwx" file.
3) Check the box to import the layer objects.
4) Press OK for the remaining dialogs, accepting all other default values.

Notice how only one half of the stair (the proxy parent) is imported onto layer A, only one half of the stair appears in the Viewport, and there are no stair objects on layer B.  If you click and move the stair object on layer A, the proxy object that is supposed to be on layer B is created and now appears in the Viewport.

See the attached video. 		Karthick Chilaka

Export to VGX does not maintain current view in VW

customer is frustrated because he cannot share a link with his clients who have very little computer skills to navigate into the file after it opens way outside of his preferred view. 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-198950

Two tools with different functionality are both called "align plane"

- There's the "align plane" button in the view bar, which places the working plane parallel to you current view
- There's the "align plane" tool in in the "3D modelling" tool set, which aligns an object to an existing working plane based on the surface you indicate.

It is confusing that both functionalities have the same name. One of them should be renamed.
I propose the 3D modeling tool to f.e. "align surface to plane" 		Hernán Stamati
VB-198972

T02352 - Detail Viewport Renders Slightly different when Created from Viewport vs. Section Viewport

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue.

 
* Open test file
* The detail viewport on the right has ViewportStyle-1 which wa screated from a section viewport 

{*}Background Render{*}: Hidden Line

*Foreground Render* : Wireframe

{*}Projection{*}: Perspective (Type> Normal)
* The detail viewport on the left has ViewportStyle-2 which was created from a regular viewport

{*}Background Render{*}: Hidden Line

*Foreground Render* : Wireframe

{*}Projection{*}: Perspective (Type> Normal)

 
* Notice the DV on the left renders even though the projection is in perspective but the DV on the right doesn't.

Maybe this is a different flavor of the Detail Viewport in perspective or it was fixed in VB-198929.  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-198890

"Scale" for image size in a worksheet doesn't work for paper units obejcts

If you show a paper unit symbol in an image in a worksheet, you'd want show it at the same size as it is shown in the drawings. I'd imagine that the "scale' setting would do the trick. I'd also expect the image to show the true size of the symbol at any scale settings, just like it does with viewport and/or layer scales.
But in stead, this setting doesn't have any effect on the image size at all. This functionality doesn't seem to be working as it should.
So you'd have to manually set the size (after manually measuring the size of the symbol, because usually you don't know/remember). 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198748

Custom pSet not assigned to the object during IFC import

We realized that some custom pSets are not assigned correctly to the object during IFC import. In that case it is a re-import from a Vectorworks IFC file. The custom pSet hat the data type "popUp". And in that case it fails. If the data type is a text it works as expected. Our guess is that not all data types (popup in that case) are supported correctly in Vectorworks.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Watch attached movie first
# Open "Testfile Testfile 20230821_1" to reproduce the problem 		Mihail Rizov
VB-193546

Vectorworks looks like it freezes when selecting a lot of doors at once

I don't think this is a critical bug, but I figure I should report it here so that we have a record of it.

Recipe:
* Open the attached [^16k_doors_v2024.vwx] file
* Select all the doors in the file. It takes a very long time for the selection to finish

(Selecting 16k rectangles ([^16k_rects_v2024.vwx]) is not that slow)

If you see the attached hot path (that was taken from the profiler using VS2022), looks like the slowness comes from the data initialization of the OIP's Data pane, even if it's not visible. We might want to do it only when the Data pane is visible and only for the visible UI elements on the pane. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-194960

Space: causes errors in IfcCheckerTool Lite (for every story)

Attached are two different vwx documents, IFC files and screenshots.

When a single wall is exported to IFC, no errors occur.

When a single space is exported to IFC, two errors occur. Several space objects don't cause more errors, but for every additional story with spaces another error is added.

These are the errors:

 
||Heading 1||Heading 2||
|Message Type |ERROR |
|Rule Type |SCHEMADEFINITION|
|Message Code |Undefined|
|Instance |#98=IFCRELCONTAINEDINSPATIALSTRUCTURE('2g44APGIrFvxXB4YLI5oWM',#11,'BuildingStoreyContainer','BuildingStoreyContainer for Building Elements',(),#62)|
|Specification Link |https://standards.buildingsmart.org/IFC/RELEASE/IFC2x3/TC1/HTML/ifcproductextension/lexical/ifcrelcontainedinspatialstructure.htm|
|Message String |number of elements (0) violates aggregate bounds|

 

 

 
||Heading 1||Heading 2||
|Ecco Error Code |49|
|Ecco Error Message |integrity constraint violation: number of elements (0) violates aggregate bounds Instance: OID: #98 Instance Type: IfcRelContainedInSpatialStructure Attribute Type: SET, BAG in file ..\ifc_schemata\ifc2x3_tc1.exp at line 6643 |

 

The customer tells us, that according to Graphisoft, the owner of DDS CAD, the missing IFCRELCONTAINEDINSPATIALSTRUCTURE.WR31 structure is the issue.

Is there a possible workaround for the customer? They say, that the receiver of their IFC files cannot use them in their current state.

  		Mihail Rizov

VB-197272

Some objects are not exporting to IFC in the correct position

Please see the attached VW, file, IFC file, and screenshots.

VB-194812

FS: IFC Wall Data like External and LoadBearing - undefined when turned off

Please look at the test file:

As you can see the in the settings of the Wall Style the CheckBoxes: "LoadBearing" and "IsExternal" are turned of.

If you look at the info palette, you can see that the status is set to "-" (undefined) and ByStyle.

It should clearly show a empty checkbox  ("off")

This only way this can be achieved is if you set this manually "By Instance" and turn the checkbox to "off".

 

(I only tested the two to mentioned checkboxes, but the other two settings "Combustible" and "Compartmentation" likely behave the same) 		Mihail Rizov

VB-198818

Hang after launch - IFC related

Right when VW is just about ready after launch, just prior to showing the document, it usually hangs for ten seconds or so. The progress bar says “Miscellaneous Updating”.
This has been happening for a while.
I paused with the debugger today and this is what the call stack I see. Unexpected.
Looks like several XMLFileNodeImpl instances are getting Released and most of the time is spent in CFBundleGetFunctionPointerForName (accessing the Support library).
Weird.
I’m used to seeing this function call while plug-ins are being loaded but I thought it shouldn't spend any time in there after launch. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-198435

VB-193459

The red "dirty" rectagles behave differently for hardscapes in version 2023 compared to 2022

One of our customers has an issue with his usual workflow he had in version 2022 in version 2023.

In version 2022, when you click on "Edit- reset all plug ins", the alignment of the hardscapes is not updated (which is what the customer wanted, because he doesn't want alignment to update when he's satified with the current geometry), but dispite that, the red "dirty" indication rectangles disappear. The customer used that in a way to "accept" a current state of alignments.

In version 2023, clicking on "Edit- reset all plug ins" also doesn't update the hardscape alignments, but the "dirty" rectangle stays. So it is more difficult for the customer to differentiate between alignments he already "accepted" and alignments which still might need an update.

There's clearly a difference in behavior between version 2022 and 2023. But I'm not sure which behavior is the designed behavior. Maybe the 2023 behavior as a regression, as the customers supposes, or was the customers using a bug in 2022 in his advantage? Or is there actually a bug in both? (maybe "reset all plug ins" should actually update alignments?).

I tried to discuss this with Tech support, but they didn't answer. I don't know anywhere else to go with this user's question then here. Thanks in advance for clarifying whether this is a bug or WAD. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-198587

Bad Variable when Locking Script

When Locking/Obfuscating a script in script Manager, you get a popup that says something along the lines of "are you sure you want to lock #REFVAL" 

It still obfuscates as far as I can tell, so it seems to be a bad variable reference, but I have yet to have my team test the obfuscated scripts. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-194322

Radial dimension tool unable to dimension a curved wall

As seen in attached video, the radial dimension tool is unable to dimension and show the radius of a curved wall, while it can do so with a basic 2D arc. In fact, when trying to dimension the curved wall, the radial dimension "connects" to origin every time. And while I have demonstrated the issue in the video using only one mode of the radial dimension too, all modes of the tool produce similar (incorrect) results.

When creating construction documentation, it would be necessary to show the radius of the curved wall in order for a builder to construct the wall as accurately as possible. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198816

Selecting fence symbol from an external file does not import the required fence symbol

If you create a fence/railing object and want to use a symbol from another file, you have to import that symbol into your current file before activating.

When you change the settings on the fence railing object, do you have the ability to select a symbol from an external file. I believe this should import the symbol into your current file and then apply it to the fence railing object.

This only works if the symbols that you choose is inside the current file. This means that you have to import the symbol into your current file before activating the fence railing settings dialogue box and then choosing the fence symbol you want to apply. 		Christopher Graye
