VB-192679

CDR: Pasting from a "document" to another "georeferenced document" problem.

Hello!

Pasting from a "document" or "georeferenced document" to another "georeferenced document" problems:

a. The resulting objects in the target georeferenced document are scaled when pasting or pasting in place.

b. The resulting objects in the target georeferenced document are rotated when pasting or pasting in place.

c. The resulting objects in the target georeferenced document are displaced when pasting or pasting in place.

Thanks 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-196742

Using Advanced Properties dialog to change Attributes of multiple Section VPs also changes all Extents

On a sheet with multiple Section Viewports, each viewport tends to have different "Extents" settings under Advanced Section Properties. For example, one viewport might need to display 4' beyond the cut plane, another might need to display 8' beyond the cut plane, and another might have this setting set to Infinite.

In addition to the Extents tab, the Advanced Section Properties window ALSO has tabs for Attributes and Display.

There are times when I need to change something on the Attributes or Display tabs and I want it to apply to all selected Section Viewport at once; for example, I might want to universally change the Attributes Class for sectioned objects, or to change all the viewports to display Black & White, or to change the 3D Conversion resolution.

To do this, I select all the viewports and open the Advanced Properties window via the OIP. However, doing this unknowingly makes ALL viewports have ALL the same parameters across all three tabs, not solely the parameters that you've changed. Essentially it wipes out all of the Extents settings for all the Section Viewports, making them all match, even though the only thing you meant to change is some other parameter on another tab. This is very bad. (And I don't think Viewport Styles in 2024 addresses this problem.)

Either it needs to be fixed so that _only_ the settings that are actively changed get pushed to all selected viewports, OR the Advanced Properties window needs to get separated into two windows: one for Extents, and one for Attributes & Display. The latter would actually make Section Viewports match Horizontal Section Viewports which already have one button for "Cut Plane & Extents" and another button for "Advanced Properties." Consistency with how different viewports work would be very helpful.

I think this is both a VB and a VE, but I'm filing it as a VB for now. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198697

SDK Deprecation Warnings

These warnings always come up when building with the SDK:

Precompile DebugPrefix.h (arm64)

(1881, 17) 'vsprintf' is deprecated: This function is provided for compatibility reasons only.  Due to security concerns inherent in the design of sprintf(3), it is highly recommended that you use vsnprintf(3) instead.
(1893, 17) 'vsprintf' is deprecated: This function is provided for compatibility reasons only.  Due to security concerns inherent in the design of sprintf(3), it is highly recommended that you use vsnprintf(3) instead. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-197567

boundary with 3 virtuals walls: Creating slab from walls is not possible

When you have a closed boundary of walls:
one of them is a wall with components
three of them are virtual walls

Creating a slab based on that boundary will not be possible. You'll get the alert telling that the boundary is not closed. 		Christopher Graye

VB-198545

The view panes are not initialized after a TEST_OpenDocument is created

Run the EnterTimingTest. After opening the file the tessellation cache nodes should be regenerated but it does not happen.

The cache is created during FlatScene::Sync:
void FlatScene::Sync() {
if (gCacheDirty[ftd] || IsTempScene())
{
ForEachViewPaneMakeFocus(SyncPane); ... ForEachViewPaneMakeFocus() invokes SyncPane that, among other things, regenerates the tessellation cache.

The method TMultiViewController::GetFocusPane() fails (returns a null pointer). So the cache is not generated. We can see that the multiview controller does not have any view panes for the window, which causes GetFocusPane() to fail:
-mtlCtl 0x0000014600ed62d0 \{fFocusWindowID=0 fActiveWindowID=0 fSelectedWindowID=0 ...} TMultiViewController *
fViewWindows \{ size=1 } std::vector<TViewWindow *,std::allocator<TViewWindow *>>
[capacity] 1 unsigned __int64 [allocator] allocator std::_Compressed_pair<std::allocator<TViewWindow *>,std::_Vector_val<std::_Simple_types<TViewWindow *>>,1>

[0] 0x0000014607553090 \{fPanes={ size=0 } fFrameRect=\{left=0 top=0 right=0 bottom=0} fRectMain=\{left=0 top=0 right=1701 bottom=1278} ...} TViewWindow *
+ fPanes \{ size=0 } s
+ fFrameRect \{left=0 top=0 right=0 bottom=0} ViewRect
+ fRectMain \{left=0 top=0 right=1701 bottom=1278} ViewRect
fFocusPaneID -1 int fActivePaneID -1 int fSelectedPaneID -1 int fbIsUIStateDirty false bool fMaximizePaneID -1 int

The issue was discovered with the Partner Product Plugin PlantPARTNER that creates and attaches a new a record format to pre-existing Plant Styles in the Active Document and updates data in the standard Plant Record. The data in Plant Style instances doesn't get automatically updated and the new record format doesn't appear in their OIP. Vladislav Stanev

VB-198537

Worksheet: the issue with pasting formulas from other applications into Vectorworks

We are talking about the apostrophe characters being changed by other applications like Word, Excel, Slack, PDF, and so on. Often apostrophe characters are changed to different styles of quotation marks or even grave accents, which of course will not work within formulas pasted into worksheets, data manager mapping, or data tag fields.

The issue is so old, it has a long beard by now, and the issue is global - meaning: it affects many applications, where code needs the correct format to work properly.

And even though it's not the fault of Vectorworks for this (external) issue to happen, similarly to a different issue I reported previously (VB-169809), I think that it's in the hand of Vectorworks to fix the (internal) issue.

Our customers usually are not knowledgable about coding, formulas or syntax highlighting. And because of that, they might not spot errors caused by this issue or in the worst case conclude that there is an issue with Vectorworks.

This (external) issue is not going away, and with more and more customers starting to apply the BIM workflow, and therefore use formulas more often, more and more people will eventually run into this issue.

For a simple demonstration I attached a short video to illustrate the issue with the following formula:

{{ =MATPROPERTYBYNAME(COMPONENTMATERIAL(T=index), 'Bauteil-ID.KG - 3.Ebene')}}

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198497

Custom Selection menu - Select Only mode does not deselect objects on invisible layers.

From the documented behavior of VS:DeSelectAll it is clear that this is the current designed behavior. BUT... it does not do what it says on box! Hence this bug report.

Regarding VS maybe we need a new function ReallyDeSelectAll? And for the Custom Selection menu an extra mode that actually de-selects everything including selected objects on invisible layers and inside containers etc. 		Karthick Chilaka

They only appear if you click the 'Fine Tune View" but note the background image reappears on itself at the top right. This obscures the perspective widgets and makes editing them impossible.

Cheers,
Peter 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193939

!image-2023-03-10-12-38-45-829.png|width=1567,height=907!

I tried quitting and restarting Vectorworks but that did not solve it. I tried restarting my computer but that did not solve it.

With Vectorworks not running I removed my user folder, then restarted Vectorworks. A new user folder was created and then the Create Report command would generate the expected dialog window.

I'm not sure what happened within my User folder to cause the blank report window to appear, but I have kept the "broken" user folder if you would like to inspect it. (I tried to attach it to this submission but it is 1.63GB and the system would not allow it to be attached.)

While it is quite unlikely that a customer would swap serial numbers as I have been doing, I thought I should report this bug in case it reveals a weakness we should address.

VB-194383

Some subparts definitions does not work in the worksheet. Related:TOV-2307.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
Vectorworks2023SP4
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Some subparts definitions are not calculated in the worksheet.
Related:TOV-2307

Steps to reproduce.
1)Open VW2023SP4.
2)Create three types of Railing with "No Post", "Post" and "Wall Bracket" by the Railing/Fence tool.
3)Create a worksheet.  Go to Resource Manager>New Resource... > Create "Worksheet".

4)Select any cell(Ex.A1) and select "Database" menu > Database command.

5)Select "Find objects that meet the following criteria" as "Type," "is," and "Railing/Fence" and click OK.
6) Click the lower triangle in Database Header call(Ex.A1) .

7)Select "Function" "Specialized for Railing/Fence" "Height(profile)" and click OK.
8)In the input field of Database Header call(Ex.A1), enter "=HEIGHT('PROFILE', 'subpart=toprail')" and click the check button to display the correct values.
However, the parameter of the following subparts is not calculated and comes out as N/A.

Panel
Wall Bracket Top Rail
Fascia Mount Post

Please refer to the attached "sample13128.vwx" movie. 

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-194106

"Display extents beyond cut plane" option doesn't stay unchecked when making a detail viewport

As seen in the attached video, when making a detail viewport and unchecking the "Display extents beyond cut plane" option it doesn't *stay* unchecked. The resulting detail section viewport has the option checked on.

I discovered this in a working file while doing project sharing based work, but this issue can be recreated in a new, regular blank file.

 

  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-194307

KLS: Scaled symbols losing text in SLVP

Hi there,
a customer uses symbols to specify where specific population of animals were living.
Those symbols contain a circle and a text which is the abbrevation for a specific animal family.
He is scaling the symbols by 2.5. And exactly that seem to cause a problem.
The map and symbols are on design layer 1:1000 and are displayed in a sheet layer viewport scale 1:5000.
If the drawing is saved while sheet layer is active and is reopened then the text of the symbol is missing.
If the drawing is saved while design layer is active then everything is fine.

It is windows only. I have tested with windows 10 and 2023 SP4.

On Mac the text is still visible but the width of the text field got smaller , so only a small part of the text is missing. Not nice, but the text is still visible.

You can repair the symbols by editing them in resource browser. But the moment you save while sheet layer is active the symbols are corrupted again.

See Video, my testfiles and original testfile customer.

!image-2023-08-08-15-03-18-780.png!

!image-2023-08-08-15-04-25-788.png|width=603,height=148!

!image-2023-08-08-15-06-01-005.png!

!image-2023-08-08-15-07-02-031.png|width=564,height=103!

VB-197995

Remote Install: Vectorworks Updaters not Working

Since 2022, there has been an issue with remote installs of Vectorworks updaters. From a Mac IT specialist based in Sydney and servicing many of our largest customers…

 

_Hi team,_
 
_I can't get the updater to work if I run it as root. please check my script_
 
_*#!/bin/bash*

*ver="2023"*
*lic="<a-licence-serial>"*

*# check for vw root lib folder*
*if [[ ! -d "/var/root/Library/Application Support/Vectorworks/${ver}" ]]; then*
    *echo "vw${ver} root lib folder not found"*
    *exit 1*
*fi*

*# update vectorworks*
*"/Applications/Vectorworks ${ver}/Vectorworks ${ver} Updater.app/Contents/Resources/cli.sh" -S $lic -I "/Applications/Vectorworks ${ver}" -L "userFolder:/var/root/Library/Application Support/Vectorworks/${ver}" update*_
 
_I got this error:_
 
_*Serial Number          <dbj-serial-lic>*_    
_*Installation Directory /Applications/Vectorworks 2023*_
_*Version                28.0.4*_                        
_*Update                 SP4*_                            
_*Channel                main*_                          

_*The following update is available: SP5*_
_*Updating*_
_*Preparing to run update*_


_*An error has occurred during the operation*_
_*An unknown error has occurred. Please contact technical support.*_
_*Exiting due to error*_
 
 
_Regards_
_Kevin_
 
*Another response in the chain…*
 
_Hi Troy,_
 
_Tim here. Kevin’s in a meeting until lunch so answering in his absence..._
 
_Silent installation: We’ve previously used the 2023 Silent Installation method to roll out and install the full version without problems._
 
_Previous use: I believe we have used the CLI update method before (briefly, and not with vw2023)._
 
_As an aside, since VW started using its separate updater app we have struggled to script the VW updates. Even when using the GUI, updates failed. To apply a service pack, we resorted to deleting the VW installation and installing a fresh full version._ 
 
_Is there a recent how-to for updates as opposed to full installation? I used [this article|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/articles.html/articles/how-to/installation/vectorworks-updater-command-line-guide-r844/] yesterday, but it is for VW2020._ 
 
_Anyway, yesterday I used this command to create a generic offline updater:_
_/Applications/Vectorworks\ 2023/Vectorworks\ 2023\ Updater.app/Contents/Resources/cli.sh download-generic-update --platform m /Users/Shared SP5_  
 
_Notes are:_ 
* _The {{--platform m}} option is undocumented_
* _The updater file was as large as the full installer_ 
* _The resultant generic update file failed when I double-clicked it in a GUI session. (It failed at around the 98% complete mark.)_
_{color:#222222}That’s my two cents. Kevin might add more once he’s back.{color}_


_Kind regards,_

_Tim_

 

*And another response…*

 

_Troy,_
 
_Thanks for your reply._
 
_Yes both script and GUI do not currently work, as the official VW base installer seems to not create the proper permissions to start with._
 
_From memory this started happening when VW introduced the new updater mechanism._
 
_Please note for obvious reasons we do not allow local users admin privileges, which is best practice and works for all other apps except VW._
 
_We trust the above provides enough feedback to get your devs to sort this out - btw. it seems they eventually managed to get things working for VW2022._
 
_Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any queries or require any additional information._


_Kind regards,_

_Daniel Schagemann_
 
 
*And another response…*
 
 
_Hi Troy,_
 
_Tim here. We’ll agree to differ on that point._
 
_To clarify, the update methods we have tried:_
* _Using CLI : failed_
* _Using Vectorworks 2023 Updater app as non-admin user : failed_
* _Using Vectorworks 2023 Updater app as admin user : failed_

 
_I just tried the GUI updater as admin this afternoon. It was upgrading from SP4 to SP5. It got to approx 85% complete then failed. It displayed this note: “An unknown error has occurred. Please contact technical support.” The VW updater helper log is attached for your reference._
 
_Please let us know what the best approach is to get VW2023 updated._

_Kind regards,_

_Tim_ 		Tim Ardoin

VB-198243

Linear plugin objects leave ghost object when reversing the direction in the OIP

# Insert a gutter (3D).
# Select it and click the 'Reverse direction' button in the OIP.
# You will see a 'ghost' duplicate of a part of it.
# Zoom in/out or click in the drawing and this 'ghost' object will disappear. Only the proper object will stay, as expected from the beginning. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-198077

Styles: Issue when creating instances of plug-in style that has an additional record attached.

Having a record attached to a plug-in style, it turns out that the instances of this style gets that record depending on how the instance (i.e. the styled plug-in object) is created:
- Dragging directly from the resource manager and dropping into a document creates an instance that has the record.
- Using the plug-in tool creates instances that don't have the record.

This can be seen with many styled plug-ins, such as Plant, Cable, Cabinet, Hardscape, etc., while others such as Window and Door work differently - i.e. the record always follows the creation of an instance (which seems to be the correct behavior).

Not sure whether it is a bug or a WAD.
Maybe something just needs to be changed in some plug-in tools, or maybe a more general change is needed.

Attached are two videos demonstrating this behavior - [^Hidden Records for plants.mp4]from [~kollikainen] and another [^records attached to plug-in styles.mp4] from me. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-197787

Question: Redshift rendering with a CPU that lacks integrated graphics.

Our sales team has recently tested multiple PCs with various specifications.
One of the PCs encountered an error while running the Redshift final render.
The error message stated, "Failed to allocate necessary GPU recyclable memory. Aborting the render."
This PC's GPU has 4GB VRAM, which falls short of the minimum requirement for Redshift when using GPU rendering alone. However, it does have 16GB of RAM.
As per the system requirements for VW2023, if the GPU doesn't meet the requirement, the CPU will be used for Redshift rendering.
However, it doesn't seem to be going well with it.

Could the absence of integrated graphics on the CPU be causing the problem?

PC Specs:
Manufacturer: Mouse Computer
CPU: Intel Core i5-13400F
RAM: 16GB
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 GDDR6

Attached a file for testing and a movie that shot the scene of the problem. The problem only occurs on a design layer.

VB-197779

The dictionary does not work for Check Spelling

Open the attached file, Select one of the text objects, and do the Check Spelling command. The first word in misspelled, and there are no suggested words in the listbox. If you type in the correct spelling and click on learn, it goes to the next word, and it thinks "is" is misspelled. It seems to not have access to the English dictionary file. Perhaps in the application folder, the Plus-ins/Dictionaries folder should not be localized. Kristin Bailey
VB-197705

Migration Manager converts Favorites aliases to non-aliases (duplicate files)

Adding a file from a User Library to Favorites will create an alias.

However, when running Migration Manager, it converts those aliases to non-alias files. For clarification, that means that there are now duplicate files in both Favorites and nested folders in the User Library. So if a user edits a resources in one file, the other file's resources are not updated. Now the user has two sets of resources (some are up to date; some aren't).

*Fix: when migrating Favorites aliases, they should continue to be aliases.* Thinking this through, I'm guessing that's tricky because the original file would have to be migrated / converted first, and then VW would create an alias of that file. Therefore, it wouldn't be migrating the alias itself. That sounds like some futuristic AI. Regardless, however this issue is fixed, the user's original files should never be duplicated / forked into two sets of non-alias files. At the very least, alias files should not migrate at all (if that's the only way to to prevent duplication). *In fact,* this would be a fantastic opportunity for the *MigrationManagerDetailedReport.txt* to report what *wasn't* migrated (the aliases in Favorites). 		Payne Chang
VB-197707

Favorites files are not visible in the Resource Manager after Migration Manager finishes

Although Favorites files successfully migrate in the user's file browser (Finder on Mac), they're not visible in the Resource Manager until the user runs the Refresh Libraries command. This leads to confusion, causing the user to incorrectly assume those files didn't migrate (although they did; they're just not visible).

Running the Refresh Libraries command will reveal them. However, running that command is not necessary to reveal the other files that were migrated; only Favorites files. Hence, this issue is a VB not a VE.

*Fix: when Migration Manager finishes, all migrated files, including Favorites, should be visible in the Resource Manager.* If that's not possible for some reason, worst case scenario: Migration Manager should prompt the user to Refresh Libraries after finishing. 		Payne Chang

VB-197436

VB-197732

"Fit to Objects" Command Fits to Un-Selected Objects in Some Cases

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains two objects (an EAP and an Extrude) on different layers, with the Layer Options currently set to "Show Others".

To reproduce:
- Select the EAP and run the "Fit to Objects" command

Note that the command unexpectedly fits to the bounds of the Extrude, even though it's not selected.
- Now change the Layer Options to Show/Snap/Modify Others
- Change the projection to Orthogonal
- Select the EAP and run "Fit to Objects"

Note that now if you change back to the original setup (Show Others and Perspective) the "Fit to Objects" command works as expected.

I'm not sure how the file got into this state, but it was being worked on by Luis using the 3DConnexion Space Navigator (so he's always working in Perspective). I haven't been able to get it back into the bad state but I'm hoping the code will give more clues. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-197690

Texture Can't be Applied to Site Model in VW 2023

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2022 compared to 2023. The file contains a Site Model and a texture.

To reproduce, in each version, try to apply the texture using the Render tab in the OIP.

Note that this works fine in VW 2022 but fails in VW 2023. It also fails in VW 2024. 

This doesn't happen with all Site Models, so it looks like there's something specific about this one that's causing it. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-193740

KLS: Export DWG using option Export Viewports as 2D Graphic in Model Space misses hatch

Hej there,
customer switched from Vectorworks 2021 to 2022.

In the dwg-file (me I have opened it in AutoCAD) a hatch which comes from a referenced file is missing.

Performing export in Vectorworks 2022 or 2023 SP4, the hatch is missing.

VB-193498

Specific Revit import as "entities": Walls dissapear

But if you import the attached Revit document as "Revit entities", you see that several walls are not imported. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-197085

3d poly's within symbols containing are misplaced in a DWG Export

Hi,

I encountered an issue with symbols being rotated and misplaced in a DWG Export.

In this project I had to deal with a lot of imported geometry. A DWG from the project was required. When examining the DWG that was generated from VW I found that various symbols had been misplaced and rotated in a seemingly random way.

The thing that al these symbols have in common is that they contain 3D Poly's. Some symbols are only 3d Poly's and som symbols have a combination of both 3D poly's and other geometry.

After the export to DWG the 3D Polys inside the symbol are misplaced and rotated within the symbol. The symbols that contain both 3d poly's and other geometry only the 3D poly's are misplaced, the other geometry remains in it's correct location.

After a lot of trial and error I noticed first that if only one layer containing some of the symbols in question is exported from an ISO or custom view. The problem does not occur. If the other layers are turned on for export the problem occurs again.

Then I found that if all the layers are exported together and the export is made from a top 3D view then the problem does not occur anymore.

So there is a workaround, but this seems to me an issue that needs to be addressed as is can confuse and delay users that are not aware of the workaround.

Please see the screenshots and example files attached
Vasil Kitanov
VB-197313

Volume stair is counted double

When you try to calculate the volume of a concrete stair structure in a worksheet, You'll notice that the volume is counted double.
In the attached file and video you can find an example as proof for this claim.
This issue exists both in version 2023 and 2024, preferably it would be resolved for version 2023 as well. 		Christopher Graye
VB-197337

Stair with specific geomeotry: Volume is "0"

If you calculate the volume of a stair with the geometry as show in the attached document, you will mistakenly get "0" as a result. Christopher Graye
VB-197413

Wrong message dialog when using attribute mapping tool on Subdivision primitives solids.

In the the following video, I'm doing the following.
-Created a Torus.
-Applied a texture on it.
-I tried to use attribute mapping tool. As expected the command will
not work with these tops of solids (all primitives.).
-The first dialog "_Textures for this object cannot be edited with attribute mapping tool_".
-Then the second second dialog will appear, "_Attribute mapping will only work with object
that has textures."_ which is a confusing/conflicting message.
-But the issue is, the first dialog will only appear once throughout the session of vectorworks,
the user could use some other tool and inadvertently use the attribute tool again. And the
first message dialog will never again, only the second conflicting message dialog will
appear.

This is minor but worth noting.

Hernán Stamati
VB-193627

'Reset All Plug-Ins' command hangs VW when used in Sheet Layers

While helping two different customers with different issues, the solution I found in both cases was to run the 'Reset All Plug-Ins' menu command. However, I discovered that this command didn't work if run while in any Sheet Layer. The process begins, but it never stops, consuming somewhere between 15 and 30% CPU activity. 

If the 'Reset All Plug-Ins' command is run (while in a Design Layer) and then the file is saved, the file will reopen with the benefit of having run that command still in effect. If the command is run while in a Design Layer, but the file is saved while in a Sheet Layer, when that file is reopened the benefit of having run Reset All Plug-Ins is lost. - The problem is reinstated. 

This relates to my other recent submission VB-193455 and the objects in the SLVP are invisible when the file in question is opened. It also relates to my more recent submission VB-193041. 

If you need more insight into the above cases, let me know.  		Konstantin Lalkovski

All of them seem to have the option to show the threads in 3D, Except the "Carriage Bolt 3D" tool. However, when I look up this type of screw, I can clearly see that it does have treads in reality. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-196440

Export IFC: IfcOpening geometry (unneccessarily complex?)

An engineer using Revit to make energy calculations, who works with a customer of ours, is having trouble with the geometry of IfcOpeningElements created during the IFC export from Vectorworks.

They claim, that normal extrudes (IfcExtrudedAreaSolid) are much easier to handle for calculations compared to BREPs (IfcFacetedBrep). And the issue is, that for some reason during export for the German window with rolling shutters two opening elements, that are part of a Wall Hole Group, are merged into a BREP rather than into a solid made of several solids, an IfcCsgSolid. VB-194081

Data Manager: Material mapping for Column fails (this file only)

Recently we received this file from a customer where you see columns with one material: "Holz" (wood)

This material is correctly mapped in the Data Manager mapping, but only one column arrives in IFC with the correct material - for all others it says "Default".

Please watch the attached video on this.

Using the eyedropper tool you can transfer the IFC Data (which doesn't differ from what I saw) to other column, these other columns will now also be exported with the material set in the mapping. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-194917

Data Manager: missing functionality to get the story name

Currently there is either no way of getting the story name or it is not documented.

Story names are given in the IFC export dialog when setting up the design layer to story mapping.

This name then magically appears in the name field of the IfcBuildingStorey property set. I say "magically", because the default formula "=CONCAT(NAME; 'IfcBuildingStorey')" only outputs 0IfcBuildingStorey.

If the name was correctly mapped to the name field this wouldn't even be such a big issue, but our customers want and need to attach information that is of course contingent on the current story that is being processed and thus any formula with IF or IFS will fail, because the name field does not really contain the story name.

We would prefer having worksheet functions to get all non-object field information. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-196761

DT: Selected Eligible Objects Mode doesn't work for empty IFC Pset fields

Attached Record Formats are not affected by this.

The user wants to fill out the Pset Tag field for all hardscapes with incrementing numbers.

The data tag with its incrementing value feature should be best suited, but it doesn't work, if the Pset field is empty.

To replicate (see video):
1) open file numbering-not-working.vwx
--> You see 8 hardscape objects, one is tagged with a data tag.
2) try attaching this data tag with 6 selected hardscape objects with the fourth mode (Selected Eligible Objects Mode)
--> Error message: No eligible object is selected.
3) try attaching this data tag with one hardscape object with the second mode (Single Eligible Object Mode)
--> this works
4) try pre-filling the Tag field and then do step 2)
--> this works, too 		Mihail Rizov
VB-192605

Data Visualization: undefined is read as 1

In the attached file we have a few doors as example for this problem.

Data Manager "undefined" reads as 1 which is "True" and that is incorrect.

Boolean as we all known works with only 1/0 = True/False, hence "undefined" should be neither 1 or 0.

Below is a message we got from a Customer about the subject (translated from the german language) and also a screenshot attached.

"The data manager is incorrectly programmed. We wanted to do a data visualization with the database field "SelfClosing" - we noticed that the visualization was wrong. During research, I noticed that the assignment in the data manager is programmed using a boolean. But in the door via the IFCPset_DoorCommon there is a choice of 3 possibilities: true, false, undefined. It means it colors all undefined doors as well, since it reads it as 1 in the boolean. But Boolean can only be true or false." 		Mihail Rizov
VB-195686

To replicate please watch the video. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-196872

Edit 2D Component: unexpected result

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

This is shown with Stair Objects as an example, but can also be reproduced with the US Windows objects.

When clicking on the object, like shown in the video, and selecting "Edit 2D Component" we get two different Pop-Ups:

- "Other objects will not be shown because this is a flipped plug-in object."

- "The active component is currently plug-in-generated. Any edits will convert it to a user-provided component that will no longer be updated by the plug-in object."

Afterwards (Screenshot 3) we can see that the object is not being shown like warned in the first pop-up.

When doing the exact same thing on the second Stair Object, like its also shown in the video, this does not happen anymore and the Stair is displayed. All stairs have the same settings and we do not believe this problem is from the Stair Plug-In, but a Vectorworks general problem, since the same can be reproduced with the US Windows objects as another example.

------------

Original Customer message (translated to english):

I want my stairs to have a custom 2D representation on the top floor (not on the floor where the 3D stairs sit, but on the next floor).

Custom renderings are done by right-clicking on the stair and clicking "Edit 2D Rendering". This brings up an option where whatever my stair looked like I can edit it. I created an icon for the 2D representation, which I then grouped and gave the correct level of detail (set like the original elements). Those representations worked for a while, and now they're gone. It can't be that I can change a display and then, at the whim of the program, it's gone again. The Stairs sometimes show that they have Custom Appearances but are not visible.

Attached is the file with these errors and marked which stair is correct and which is wrong. You see 2 parts of the building: On the left is the representation as it should be (I have just adjusted it again, and on the right is how it looked this morning, with the representations completely deleted! This problem is repeated on all floors, if you want to see that, except in UG where the Custom Appearance is still visible.

The references are not relevant to the problem, they are set correctly. Nevertheless, in this version are gone.

------------

it seems that it is currently not possible to create a custom 2D representation of the stairs. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-197086

SBE: Interactive reshape uses incorrect elevation if parent wall of PIO is not on z=0

Please have a look at attached movie. Our PIO has a sill height of 0.9m (above layer) and passes this value as elevation in  OnGetInteractiveSizingParams. But the modification points as well as the data bar use 0.78m instead (0.12m is just the difference between layer Z and bottom of wall). 

Even if we reshape the width only and leave  height / elevation unchanged, the sill height goes down to 0.78m.

The weird thing is that from now on the modification points seem to be correct.

I suspect an initialization problem like the one we had before.

I'm attaching the PIO and the testfile (Mac, debug). 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-196914

OI displays wrong object angle if plan is rotated 0.08 degrees or less

When drawing, the specified angle applies to the current face rotation. If we rotate the plan again, the angle shown in the OI will also update depending on the rotation that is now applied to the plan visualization.

However, there is a calculation limitation when the plan has a 0.08 degree rotation or less. For example, if we draw a -90 degree line on a plan that has a 0.08 degree rotation, the OI will automatically show the value as if the plan was not rotated. This means that the OI shows -90.08 degrees instead of -90 degrees, while the plan shows a rotation of 0.08 degrees. While the plan is rotated, as example still 0.08 degrees, the object OI should show -90 degrees and only switch to -90.08 degrees when we remove the plan rotation by 0.08. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-197036

Dimension: some values are lost after converting file

In the attached Vectorworks Document in the Sheet Layer #22 G0007596-0-02-AFU_300_G_EG_GP_WP0-00_102 we have a few Dimension objects as example for the reported problem.

In one of the two screenshots we can see Vectorworks being compared with Bluebeam Revu between 26.0.5 and 28.0.5 versions. We can see that with 26.0.5 (on the left) all values in the Dimensions are being displayed. While with 28.0.5 (on the right) some vlaues have disappeared. Please take a look at this. Thank you in advance. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-196916

The name of the dialogue and the related tooltips need to be changed to make it understandable to a non engineer. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-193558

[Question] I want to know Vectorworks 2022 and 2023 does supported or not whether Kerberos authentication for network authentication.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2022, v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
I want to know Vectorworks 2022 and 2023 does supported or not whether Kerberos authentication for network authentication.

* The user who asked this question was originally using Vectorworks 2021, but suddenly it appeared that the license was about to expire, and it seems that he noticed that the activation could not be performed.
 I heard that you found out that there was a change in the network specifications after confirming with the person.

* The content that the user was told by the person in charge of the network is as follows.
Changed the specification so that communication with "authentication headers that do not support Kerberos authentication" is not processed due to Kerberos authentication settings.

* I thought it would be quicker if the user actually checked it on the actual machine, so I emailed the serial number of the evaluation version (2022 and 2023) held by support and the download destination of the installer. We received a reply that due to the circumstances of the parent company, it is not possible to install the currently approved application.


Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Sasha Wood

VB-196729

Subtract Solid: object retains texture from subtracted solid

In the attached test file we have two cubes, each cube has a different texture.

When using Subtract solids, the cube that stays in the drawing retains the texture from the cube that was removed (on the sides that they were touching). 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196751

Question- About when selecting "Save as PDF..." in the print command, the default file name is set to "Untitled 1" instead of the vwx file name.

I have a question.
Would you please give us some information to solve the following problem?

When selecting "Save as PDF..." in the print command, the default file name is set to "Untitled 1" instead of the vwx file name.

■ Customer's reproduction machine
Mac mini
Model ID: ID 14,3
Chip: Apple M2
Memory: 16GB
macOS: Ventura 13.4

■ Information provided by the customer regarding this issue
- The Export PDF command defaults to the vwx file name and does not occur.
- Reproduced under the following conditions.
1) New file. *Reproduced with the file name "123.vwx".
2) Initialize the user folder.
3) Start macOS in safe mode.

- Does not reproduce in Apple genuine apps (Safari, Preview, Mail, Notes).
- Just in case, we have obtained a reproduction file [^test0425.vwx] from the customer. And even if we used the reproduction file, we were unable to confirm the reproduction.
- As a trial, with a newly created account on macOS, the problem did not occur for a few days, but after that the problem started to occur.
- The customer tried it on another machine (MacBookPro (intel Corei7)), but it did not reproduce on that machine.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Hernán Stamati
VB-196781

SBE: Symbol not displayed correctly in listbrowser

 
Please have a look at attached movie. The symbols that were selected in the resource browser were not 
 clipped correctly in the LB cell. 
The interaction type of the cell is kListBrowserItemInteractionEditResource. For more details please have a look at the code snippet below.
Just call function "lm_dialog_testen"() to create the dialog.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
/*************************************/
 
 
#define kItListBrowser 3
 
#define kHeightLB 20
#define kWidthLB 85
 
#define kWidthColumn0 150
#define kWidthColumn1 320
 
enum ETestLBLines {
kLinePullDown=0,
    kLineImages,
kLineCheck,
    kLineResourceBrowser,
kNumLinesTestLB
};
 
enum ETestLBColumns {
kColDummy = 0,
kColContent
};
 
// -----------------------------
 
 
using namespace VWFC;
using namespace VWFC::UI;
 
class VWLaborDialog : public VWDialog {
 
public:
 
  VWLaborDialog(EListBrowserDisplayType val);
  
  virtual ~VWLaborDialog();
 
public:
  virtual bool CreateDialogLayout();
  
protected:
virtual voidOnSetUpEvent();
   
virtual voidOnInitializeContent();
virtual voidOnDDXInitialize();
virtual voidOnUpdateUI();
virtual voidOnDefaultButtonEvent();
 
void FillList();
 
public:
 
short fIconVisible, fIconInvisible;
 
bool fIsChecked, fIsVisible;
 
EListBrowserDisplayType fDisplayTypeContentColumn;
 
VectorWorks::Extension::IResourceManagerContentPtr fpResourceContent;
 
public:
 
 
 
 
protected:
DEFINE_EVENT_DISPATH_MAP;
 
voidOnListBrowser(Sint32 controlID, VWDialogEventArgs& eventArgs);
    voidOnDirectEdit( Sint32 controlID, VWListBrowserEventArgs& eventArgs );
 
 
};
//-------------------------------------------------------------
EVENT_DISPATCH_MAP_BEGIN( VWLaborDialog );
ADD_DISPATCH_EVENT( kItListBrowser, OnListBrowser );
ADD_LB_DIRECT_EDIT( kItListBrowser, OnDirectEdit );
EVENT_DISPATCH_MAP_END;
 
 
//-------------------------------------------------------------
VWLaborDialog::VWLaborDialog(EListBrowserDisplayType val):VWDialog(),
fIconVisible(-1),
fIconInvisible(-1),
fIsChecked(true),
fIsVisible(true),
fDisplayTypeContentColumn(val),
fpResourceContent(VectorWorks::Extension::IID_ResourceManagerContent)
  
{
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
VWLaborDialog::~VWLaborDialog()
{
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnInitializeContent()
{
VWDialog::OnInitializeContent();
 
 
 
 
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnSetUpEvent()
{
 
fpResourceContent->InitByTDType(kSymDefNode);
 
int dlg = GetDialogID();
 
// Set up list
 
VWListBrowserCtrl* c = GetListBrowserCtrlByID( kItListBrowser );
 
c->EnableDirectEdit(true);
 
fIconVisible = gSDK->AddListBrowserImage(
dlg,
kItListBrowser,
"Vectorworks/Images/Standard Images/Visible.png"
);
 
fIconInvisible = gSDK->AddListBrowserImage(
dlg,
kItListBrowser,
"Vectorworks/Images/Standard Images/Invisible.png"
);
 
c->AddColumn("col_0","col_0",kWidthColumn0);
c->AddColumn("col_1","col_1",kWidthColumn1);
 
 
 
gSDK->SetListBrowserItemDisplayType(dlg,kItListBrowser,kColDummy,kListBrowserDisplayTextOnly);
 
 
 
 
 
 
gSDK->SetListBrowserItemDisplayType(dlg,kItListBrowser,kColContent,fDisplayTypeContentColumn);
 
 
gSDK->EnableListBrowserSingleLineSelection(dlg,kItListBrowser,true);
gSDK->EnableListBrowserSorting(dlg,kItListBrowser,false);
gSDK->EnableListBrowserColumnLines(dlg,kItListBrowser,false);
 
c->EnableDirectEdit(true);
 
VWListBrowserColumn ccol = c->GetColumn(kColContent);
 
ccol.SetColumnType(EListBrowserControlType::kListBrowserControlMultiState);
 
 
FillList();
 
c->EnableDirectEdit(true);
 
VWDialog::OnSetUpEvent();
 
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::FillList()
{
VWListBrowserCtrl* c = GetListBrowserCtrlByID( kItListBrowser );
 
int i;
 
int dlg = GetDialogID();
 
TXString s;
 
for (i=0;i<kNumLines;i++)  {
gSDK->InsertListBrowserItem(dlg,kItListBrowser,0,s);
}
 
c->EnableDirectEdit(true);
 
/*
enum {
kLinePullDown=0
kLineCheck,
kLineResourceBrowser,
kNumLines
};
*/
 
 
size_t image_index = (size_t)(-1);
 
bool b_test_colors = true;
 
// ---- Line with pulldown menu
 
int val_large = 254;
 
VWListBrowserItem vwi = c->GetItem(kLinePullDown, kColContent);
vwi.EnableItemDirectEdit(true);
vwi.SetItemInteractionType(kListBrowserItemInteractionEditGenericList);
vwi.EnableItemDirectEdit(true);
 
gSDK->SetListBrowserItemReadOnly(dlg, kLinePullDown, kColContent, false);
 
vwi.SetItemTextJustification(kItemTextJustificationCenter);
    vwi.SetItemText("Menu value");
vwi.SetItemTextJustification(kItemTextJustificationCenter);
 
if (b_test_colors) {
vwi.SetItemTextColor(val_large,0,0);
 
vwi.SetItemFillForeColor(val_large,val_large,0);
vwi.SetItemFillBackColor(0,val_large,val_large);
 
vwi.SetItemPenForeColor(0,0,val_large);
vwi.SetItemPenBackColor(0,val_large,0);
}
 
 
// ----- Line with Images
 
vwi = c->GetItem(kLineImages, kColContent);
vwi.EnableItemDirectEdit(false);
vwi.SetItemInteractionType(kListBrowserItemInteractionNone);
gSDK->SetListBrowserItemReadOnly(dlg, kLineImages, kColContent, true);
 
vwi.SetItemTextJustification(kItemTextJustificationCenter);
vwi.SetItemImage(fIsVisible?fIconVisible:fIconInvisible);
vwi.SetItemTextJustification(kItemTextJustificationCenter);
 
 
if (b_test_colors) {
vwi.SetItemTextColor(val_large,0,0);
 
vwi.SetItemFillForeColor(val_large,val_large,0);
vwi.SetItemFillBackColor(0,val_large,val_large);
 
vwi.SetItemPenForeColor(0,0,val_large);
vwi.SetItemPenBackColor(0,val_large,0);
}
 
// ---- Line with ResourceBrowser
 
vwi = c->GetItem(kLineResourceBrowser, kColContent);
vwi.EnableItemDirectEdit(true);
vwi.SetItemInteractionType(kListBrowserItemInteractionEditResource);
vwi.SetOwnerDrawnType(EListBrowserOwnerDrawnType::kListBrowserResource);
fpResourceContent->SetEmptyMessage("We are empty");
fpResourceContent->SetSelectedItemText("Some Resource");
fpResourceContent->AddResourceControl(SResourceControl(SResourceControl::DefaultID::None));
vwi.SetItemResourceContent(fpResourceContent);
gSDK->SetListBrowserItemReadOnly(dlg, kLineResourceBrowser, kColContent, false);
 
vwi.EnableItemDirectEdit(true);
 
if (b_test_colors) {
vwi.SetItemTextColor(val_large,0,0);
 
vwi.SetItemFillForeColor(val_large,val_large,0);
vwi.SetItemFillBackColor(0,val_large,val_large);
 
vwi.SetItemPenForeColor(0,0,val_large);
vwi.SetItemPenBackColor(0,val_large,0);
}
 
// ---- Line with check
 
vwi = c->GetItem(kLineCheck, kColContent);
vwi.EnableItemDirectEdit(true);
vwi.SetItemInteractionType(kListBrowserItemInteractionEditCheckState);
gSDK->SetListBrowserItemReadOnly(dlg, kLineCheck, kColContent, false);
 
 
Boolean set_ok = gSDK->SetListBrowserItemCheckState(dlg, kItListBrowser, kLineCheck, kColContent, (fIsChecked) ? CGSMultiStateValueChange::eStateValueOn : CGSMultiStateValueChange::eStateValueOff);
 
vwi.EnableItemDirectEdit(true);
 
if (b_test_colors) {
vwi.SetItemTextColor(val_large,0,0);
 
vwi.SetItemFillForeColor(val_large,val_large,0);
vwi.SetItemFillBackColor(0,val_large,val_large);
 
vwi.SetItemPenForeColor(0,0,val_large);
vwi.SetItemPenBackColor(0,val_large,0);
}
 
// ---  Fill first column
 
vwi = c->GetItem(kLinePullDown, kColDummy);
vwi.SetItemText("Menu");
 
vwi = c->GetItem(kLineCheck, kColDummy);
vwi.SetItemText("Check");
 
vwi = c->GetItem(kLineImages, kColDummy);
vwi.SetItemText("Images");
 
vwi = c->GetItem(kLineResourceBrowser, kColDummy);
vwi.SetItemText("ResourceBrowser");
 
c->EnableDirectEdit(true);
 
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnListBrowser(Sint32 controlID, VWDialogEventArgs& eventArgs)
{
    size_t row;
size_t col;
EListBrowserEventType eventType = eventArgs.GetListBrowserEvent( row, col );
 
 
auto lb = GetListBrowserCtrlByID(controlID);
 
if (col == kColContent) switch (row) {
case kLineImages:
{
 
VWListBrowserItem vwi = lb->GetItem(row, col);
fIsVisible = !fIsVisible;
vwi.SetItemImage(fIsVisible?fIconVisible:fIconInvisible);
}
break;
default:
break;
}
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnDirectEdit( Sint32 controlID, VWListBrowserEventArgs& eventArgs )
{
size_t row = eventArgs.GetRowIndex();
size_t col = eventArgs.GetColumnIndex();
 
auto lb = GetListBrowserCtrlByID(controlID);
auto cell = lb->GetItem(row, col);
 
//cwdebug_scope csd("VWLaborDialog::OnDirectEdit",20);
//cwdebug("OnDirectEdit: controlID = %d, row = %d, col = %d, Eventtyp = %d\n",(int)controlID,(int)row,(int)col,(int)eventArgs.GetType());
 
if (col == kColContent) switch ( eventArgs.GetType() ) {
 
case EListBrowserDirectEditType::QueryItemValue:
{
 
 
switch (row) {
case kLinePullDown:
eventArgs.SetValidEditCompletionData();// sets fReturnCode to 1
break;
 
case kLineCheck:
    {
auto& sc = eventArgs.GetCellCheckbox();
cwdebug("OnDirectEdit: fIsChecked = %d\n",fIsChecked);
sc.fStateValue = (fIsChecked)?(CGSMultiStateValueChange::eStateValueOn):(CGSMultiStateValueChange::eStateValueOff );
}
break;
 
case kLineResourceBrowser:
eventArgs.SetValidEditCompletionData();// sets fReturnCode to 1
break;
 
default:
break;
} // switch
}
break;
 
case EListBrowserDirectEditType::QueryItemListRetrieval:
{
switch (row) {
case kLinePullDown:
{
auto& coll = eventArgs.GetCellMenuItemCollection();
 
CGSMenuItemValue item1( "Localized1", "Universal1" );
item1.SetCheckedState(false);
 
CGSMenuItemValue item2( "Localized2", "Universal2" );
item2.SetCheckedState(true);
 
CGSMenuItemValue item3( "Localized3", "Universal3" );
item3.SetCheckedState(false);
 
coll.AddMenuItem(item1);
coll.AddMenuItem(item2);
coll.AddMenuItem(item3);
 
eventArgs.SetValidEditCompletionData();// sets fReturnCode to 1
 
}
break;
 
case kLineResourceBrowser:
eventArgs.SetValidEditCompletionData();// sets fReturnCode to 1
break;
 
default:
break;
} // switch
 
}
 
break;
 
case EListBrowserDirectEditType::ItemEditCompletionData:
{
switch (row) {
case kLinePullDown:
{
CGSStringValueChange& val = eventArgs.GetCellString();
    // Do nothing ..
}
break;
 
case kLineCheck:
{
CGSMultiStateValueChange& val = eventArgs.GetCellCheckbox();
fIsChecked = (val.fStateValue == CGSMultiStateValueChange::eStateValueOn);
}
break;
 
default:
break;
} // switch
}
 
break;
 
default:
 
break;
} // *** switch **
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnDDXInitialize()
{
 
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnUpdateUI()
{
VWDialog::OnUpdateUI();
}
//-------------------------------------------------------------
void VWLaborDialog::OnDefaultButtonEvent()
{
VWDialog::OnDefaultButtonEvent();
}
 
 
 
/*****************************************************************/
//-------------------------------------------------------------
 
bool VWLaborDialog::CreateDialogLayout()
{
 
bool ret = true;
 
TXString titel("VWTestDialog");
TXString sok("OK");
TXString scancel("Cancel");
 
switch (fDisplayTypeContentColumn)  {
case kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText:
titel += " DisplayType: kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText";
break;
case kListBrowserDisplayImageOnly:
titel += " DisplayType: kListBrowserDisplayImageOnly";
break;
case kListBrowserDisplayTextOnly:
titel += " DisplayType: kListBrowserDisplayTextOnly";
break;
 
default:
titel += " ???";
break;
}
 
fControlID = gSDK->CreateLayout(titel,true,sok,scancel);
 
gSDK->CreateListBrowser(fControlID,kItListBrowser,kWidthLB,kHeightLB);
 
 
gSDK->SetFirstLayoutItem(fControlID,kItListBrowser);
 
return ret;
}
 
 
/*****************************************************************/
void test_dialog_with_display_type(EListBrowserDisplayType typ)
{
VWLaborDialog*der_dialog = new VWLaborDialog(typ);
 
if (der_dialog->CreateDialogLayout() ) {
if (der_dialog->RunDialogLayout("XXXXX") == kDialogButton_Ok ) {
}
}
delete der_dialog;
 
}
/*****************************************************************/
void lm_dialog_testen(CallBackPtr cbp)
{
  
 
test_dialog_with_display_type(kListBrowserDisplayImageAndText);
 
   
 
 
}
 
 
 
/*****************************************************************/ 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196760

Data Set not added if symbol inside of group

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

Like its shown in the video, if we add a Data Set and the symbols are part of a group, the data set will not be added to the grouped symbols. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-195426

When stair stringer is offset, riser does not extend full width of stair

In the attached file, the riser should extend the full width of the stair, but it does not due to the stringer offset. Christopher Graye
VB-196758

Delete a Dimension Standard does not regenerate the list of Dimension Standards

Hi Vectorworks

When you delete a dimension standard and then edit another standard, you will be edit in fact anther dimension standard.

Best regards, Marc 		Karthick Chilaka

Hi there,
customer has a section of a rounded wall. The wall opening is displayed not correct. Instaed of linear line the wall seems to be inclined.
Gruß, Klaus Lüttich 		Hernán Stamati
VB-196642

Wall textures not showing in SLVP of a section DLVP

Take a section VP of some Walls + place the VP on a design layer. 2. Change to 3D view + make VP of the DLVP + place the second VP on a sheet layer. 3. The SLVP does not display the Wall textures.

From user: I was replicating a technique I'd seen on the Forum in posts from 2018 where you could create a Clip Cube-style SLVP but which instead of having a solid colour on the cut plane would display the 2D representation of the components. So essentially the same as a normal section VP but in a 3D view. This worked in 2018 but is no longer working in 2023. I have not tried it in the earlier versions I have loaded (2021 + 2022). This would be a useful technique to be able to use + just interested to know why it doesn't work anymore. Thanks. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-196747

Data Visualization Not Working Properly within Design Layer in 2024

I've attached a movie that shows this issue
* Open test file
* On the design layer, the DV is enabled with two options: 

(1) Objects assigned to None...

(2) Space size by range

 

The DV works when these options are enable separately but when both options are enabled, one space objects doesn't get assigned option (2). It seems like an odd behavior.

 

Also, sometimes when I cycle through the DV options, I get some random results where all objects work with option (1), when at the same time both options (1) and (2) are enabled.  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196667

UI draw: green constraint indicator doesn't always go away

Simple ancient file from the core parametric constraints acceptance test. Open it, and go to the constraints DL instead of the dims DL. 

I constrain two lines to be parallel at at about 30 degrees, green constraints show, I undo, they go away.

I constrain them to be parallel at 0 degrees, green constraints show, I undo, and only one goes away. Zoom or something, and final frame becomes correct.  		Hernán Stamati
VB-196673

VB-194875

Not possible to change drawing scale if Window on Wall and Multiple View Panes active

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

This only happens with the German Version but seems to be a problem for VWI and not for CWD.

In the attached file we have walls and a window with multiple view panes active.

Not possible to change drawing scale:
- If Window is in the Wall and Multiple View Panes is active.

Possible to change drawing scale:
- If Window is removed from the Wall, even if Multiple View Panes is active.
- If Window is on the Wall, but Multiple View Panes is not active. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-196564

Graphic Legend Classes Dialog Shows Incorrectly After Changing Active Image

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Graphic Legend with two Images that display objects with by-class attributes.

To reproduce:

- Open the Define Legend Image dialog
- Apply a class override for Image-1
- Now switch to Image-2

Note that the class list still shows the icon indicating that "Class A" is in an overridden state for Image-2, when the override is really only applied to Image-1.

This is a regression from VW 2023, where the class lists updated correctly when the active Image was changed.

Karthick Chilaka
VB-196517

Legacy 2D document preference doesn't work as expected

On the Legacy 2D tab, you select one of 3 options for which plane the planar tools will work on:
* {*}Screen plane only{*}: Planar objects can be drawn only on the screen plane (only the screen plane can be selected as an option)
* {*}Working plane only{*}: Planar objects can be drawn only on a 3D working plane (the screen plane cannot be selected as an option)
* *Screen plane or working plane:* Planar objects can be drawn on the screen plane or any 3D working plane (any plane can be selected as an option)

Currently, all 3 settings let you create planar objects on any plane.

Also, the help text for these options should be updated, as it still refers to the "Active Plane" dropdown (now defunct). 		Hernán Stamati
VB-196476

Objects flickering

Please see the attached video.  A user is experiencing objects flickering.  To me it looks like it's constantly doing the screen redraw however the user is not panning or zooming to trigger this.

Turning off accelerated graphics fixes this however the user is not happy with the delay in the redraw when zooming/panning. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-196657

VB-196630

VW Crashes When Running "Update all Viewports" Command

Movie and test file are attached. The file's in an older-version format and contains several Shaded and RW viewports on different sheets.

To reproduce, run the Update All Viewports command and note that VW crashes. Crash log is attached (I attached two logs since they look different).

This doesn't happen every time. If you don't see it at first, you may need to do a clean launch, make this the only open file, and/or run the Update All Viewports command immediately after opening the file.

If I update the viewports sheet-by-sheet, I don't see a crash.

I don't see this on Windows 10 so it might be Mac-only.

Karthick Chilaka
VB-196609

Edit Fill and Texture Problem

If you click on a hatched object with the Edit Fill and Texture tool that has an assignment of "not manual", and then do nothing but click on a next object that has an assignment of Manual, the assignment of the first object (which is now set to manual) is incorrectly transferred to this newly selected object. Karthick Chilaka
VB-196534

Fence: Problem with embedded symbols in posts

I think it's likely this has something to do with embedded symbols in post symbols. The caps added to these posts are "floating" Karthick Chilaka
VB-195995

Low Performance while PIO Copy

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

In the attached test file we have 500 stair objects as an example of an Intelligent Object, the problem can be reproduce with any other Intelligent Object that is linked to Layer Elevation.

After selecting all objects and selecting Copy (Ctrl+C) and the Layer Elevation is zero, the operation is instant.

If we set the Layer Elevation to, as example, 5 meters then it will need 36 seconds for the operation to conclude. Note that opening the Edit menu and clicking on Fit to Objects also takes several extra seconds (also shown in the video).

The more objects added, the longer it will take.

Computer Specs:

Windows 11 Pro
13th Gen Intel Core i9-13900K 3.00 GHz
64 GB RAM
Radeon Pro WX 8200 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196544

Asymmetric scaling of symbols containing other symbols is incorrect

# Create a symbol containing a single extrude object. Name it Symbol-1
# Create a symbol containing Symbol-1 stacked on top of an extrude. Name it Symbol-2

If you try setting a asymmetric Z scaling factor to Symbol-2, the symbol inside of it will be scaled, but its insertion point will remain the same. When scaling symmetrically, the insertion point of the inner symbol is moved to the correct position (sett attached screenshot and video) 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196520

Crash while Batch Converting. Files open individually without crashing.

-Download and unzip, "BatchConvertTest.zip" where you'll find only two files inside the folder
-Create a new empty folder on your computer's Desktop
-In Vectorworks, go to File > Batch Convert, selecting the folder you unzipped earlier as the 'Source' and the folder you created for the 'Destination'
-Click OK to start the conversion process
-Before the first file finishes converting, it will crash in the, "Updating Plug-ins" phase
-Only crashes on Windows and no crash dump file is created
-The same two files Batch Convert in Vectorworks 2023 SP5 with no issue
-These two files will open individually in Vectorworks 2024 without crashing, however they will produce the following message while opening, "Some of the objects could not be regenerated". Not sure if it's related and thought it was worth mentioning. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-196358

Inconsistent behaviour when Option-Drag a locked object

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/108317-jira-vb-196290-locking-an-object-still-allows-the-locked-object-to-be-inadvertently-duplicated-in-a-locked-state-wesley-burrows/#comment-471665]

When Option-dragging a locked object, a copy of the object is created in the same place as the original. 

When copying and pasting a locked object, a new, unlocked object is created.

The same result ought to be expected - a new unlocked object 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196350

Linework in PDF only visible in zoom and with accelerate graphics off

Customer submitted a file with a PDF on the design layer. Most of the objects on the PDF are not visible unless you pan or zoom but that is also not always the case. The small PDF in this file is part of a much larger PDF. When that full PDF is imported into Vectorworks all the linework appears without much issue. As soon as that massive PDF is cropped most if not all the linework vanishes again.

I have attached his file as well as the PDF that was originally used.

I found in his Vectorworks file, turning accelerate graphics off will allow all the linework to appear but the file becomes extremely slow. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-196332

Object Info Palette - Render Tab: Texture controls are disabled for multiple selected wall (slab, or roof) components is a texture group is selected before the components.

Texture controls are disabled for multiple selected wall (slab, or roof) components is a texture group is selected before the components.
# Open the attached VWX file
# Select the wall
# In the Render tab of the Object Info palette, select multiple components making sure that the first item clicked on is a component.
Notice the texture controls below are all enabled as expected.
# Deselect all items and and select multiple components again making sure that the first item clicked on is a texture group.
*Notice* all texture controls are disabled.  This feels very broken since users would expect to be able to edit the settings of the selected components either way. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-196305

Laubwerk Plant: Texture color missing

The Textures downloaded from Laubwerk Plant have no color information. VB-196262

'Display out-of-date border' should be unified in the Quick and Document Preferences

Hi!

It caught my attention that there's a small difference between those two commands:

- 'Display out-of-date border' available in the Document Preferences/ Display tab
versus
- 'Display Viewport Out-of-date borders' available in the Quick Preferences.

!image-2023-05-31-16-01-07-745.png|thumbnail!

According to the corresponding help texts in the UI and user help, they should be the same option, applicable to both viewports AND site models.

Could you please unify them, so that they are unambiguous and cover both: viewports and site models? Unless, the option in the Quick Preferences is limited only to viewports.

Strings in question:
- Vectorworks > 260 QuickPref Strings.vwstrings > 38 > Display Viewport Out-of-date Borders
- Vectorworks > 260 QuickPref Strings.vwstrings > 39 > Display Viewport Out-of-date Borders\n\nToggle on/off the out-of-date indicators of viewports.
- Vectorworks > 5053 Doc Prefs Pane Help.vwstrings > 81 > &Display out-of-date border

See:
!image-2023-05-31-16-00-55-003.png|thumbnail!
- https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/Preferences/Setting_quick_preferences.htm?rhhlterm=out%20date%20borders%20border
- https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/Preferences/Setting_document_preferences.htm?rhhlterm=out%20date%20border%20borders 		Hernán Stamati

VB-196228

Resource Conflict at Import from Resource Manager

I am getting a resource conflict when I try to import from two different files into a blank document. The two files contain lighting devices from the same manufacturer but are different models. Each light has a C-clamp within the 3D geometry that needs to live with the symbol. The C-Clamp is a 3D only symbol that lives in the Symbol Parts folder of each file and is the same exact symbol. As there are 1,000s of lights that use this same clamp we decided to include the clamp in each file so that we are sure the clamp will be consistent across all files and not clutter the user's file with different versions of the same clamp. 

When importing from the ETC Source 4 file into a blank file there is no issue at all. When trying to import a light from the ETC Selador D60 file a resource conflict appears stating that the Light Acc C Clamp already exists and what do you want to do. From my understanding, this should not appear as the symbols should be identical. Is there a way to see if there is a difference between the symbol in each file?

Files attached 		Karthick Chilaka

To reproduce, edit the Annotations and move the Symbols.

Note that the page-based symbol shows incorrectly (it only shows some of its geometry in the new location), until another redraw is done. This doesn't happen with the world-based symbol.

This only happens when the "Accelerate Graphics" preference is enabled.

This may be related to VB-196019, which also involves symbol redraw inside GL annotations.

This also happened in VW 2023. 		Hernán Stamati

This happens with both world-based and page-based symbols.

This only happens when the "Accelerate Graphics" preference is enabled.

VB-195908

Windows: Unshaded Resource Manager title bar makes collapsed window hard to find/notice

In my resource manager acceptance test for VW2024 I initially thought ctr-R was broken because I did not see the resource manager window appear when I invoked it.

After resizing the main window etc. I realized the resource manager was there, but its style change with total lack of shading made it blend in to the view bar so I did not notice it.

I think the resource manager appearance is too easy to lose when collapsed with this change. A highlight-color shading would make it easier. I do not think the thin accent-color border is enough (and it does not always appear, it reverts to gray in depending on where current focus is).

Attaching screenshots comparing collapsed RM window in front of mode bar in VW2021 vs. VW2024.

 

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-195902

Windows: No Edit-Mode Redo of Text Style Dialog Alignment Changes etc.

The undo/redo logic while a text object is in edit mode has a few quirks - often changes are coalesced into a single undo/redo event, which seems by design.

However in this case, we get an undo event but after undo there is no redo available.

To reproduce:
# Create a wrapping multi-line text object with some text.
# Enter edit mode in the text object with cursor active somewhere in the middle.
# Open the Text->Text Style dialog and change horizontal alignment*; hit okay
# Note the change has been applied
# Still in edit mode, select Edit->Undo; note the horizontal alignment* reverts to earlier setting
# Still in edit mode, select Edit->Redo

EXPECTED: the change applied at step 3. is re-applied

ACTUAL: the redo has no effect

*this also occurs to changes of line spacing from the dialog during edit mode. Note that the issue does *not* occur with font style changes like bold, italic, font etc. - there, redo works properly in the same scenario.

(I think this is probably not a regression, and may also happen on Mac, will update bug when I find out). 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-195904

Usability issue: Text Tool Rotated Mode seems broken if you forget to drag

In normal mode for the text tool, you can activate the tool, click once in the drawing to get an insertion point, and start typing.

If you put the tool in rotated mode to create a rotated text object, you are expected to drag an angle/endpoint - although, somewhat paradoxically, on Windows at least it doesn't actually honor this width, it snaps back to minimum width when you start typing (and will type past the point you dragged to). Note that this click-drag requirement is very different from most tools like rotated rects and lines which use a two-click approach with visual feedback as you move the cursor after the first click.

The usability issue happens if a little time passes between using the tool and you forget you've put it in rotated mode. If you single-click with the tool in this mode, you get what looks like a single selected-object handle but typing into it actually does nothing. It seems like the text object is broken.

A better option would be to make rotated-text object creation a two-click operation like a line, with visual feedback as you move the cursor. So the first click will not create an unusable, abandoned object - instead it will start the two-click process of creating your rotated text object, just like rotated rectangle, line, etc.

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-195748

Geolocate tool: Select service for Satellite mode

I found three problems.

 1. First problem
* Select Geolocate tool
* Go to Preferences and Select Service for Satellite mode
* Set _Download content from:_  to be _ArcGIS Online_ and select _Terrain 3D_ form the listed names
* Close all open dialogs with OK
* Notice that the satellite map disappears

 2. Second problem
* Go to Select Service for Satellite mode dialog again and notice that _Download content from:_ is set to _ArcGIS Living Atlas_ instead of _ArcGIS Online_

3. Third problem
* Set again _Download content from:_ to be _ArcGIS Online_ and select _Sentinel-2 Views._
* A dialog for logging into ArcGIS appears. Close it with X.
* Notice that the data to the side of the listed names disappears.
* Close Select Service for Satellite mode dialog
* The dialog for logging into ArcGIS appears again. Close it with X.
* Notice that VW freezes.

See attached screen recording for more information.

The missing photos issue has already been reported - VB-194966 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-195642

Back Reference values occasionally disappear during Save & Commit

Hi folks, 

I've not been able to verify this yet but I'm submitting it now because the particulars of this problem strongly suggest this is a software bug and is not simply a function of data corruption or a condition in the file. 

*We have had two seperate customers report that:* 

Occasionally, when performing a 'Save & Commit' with a project sharing file, *_all_* the Back Reference values (only) inside the Drawing Labels disappear. They all have to be added back in one by one. 

*Associated Info:* 
* This problem does not happen every time. User Craig Greig at Andrew Sexton Architecture Ltd gave a rough indication of frequency: He uses 'Save & Commit' about 5 times a day and has restored lost Back References 3 times across 2 weeks. 
* He also said, "As a test while writing this email I tried setting the back reference on one detail to ‘all objects linked to viewport’. During save and commit this message came up; "This file is damaged. It will open with it as much detail as possible." The file still works ok. Just have this ongoing fault. We have cleared meta-data, created new share file but the fault keeps reoccurring." 
* Rhiannon Gray of Bourke Architects Ltd said, "We have noticed the back-references tend to disappear more often when more than one person is working on the file and has made changes and then saved and committed. It occurs less frequently if only one person is working on the project share file." 

I've uploaded files from Rhiannon/Bourke Architects: 
* A video showing an occurrence. ([Here's a link to the original|https://www.dropbox.com/s/pg886m6c8t8l8zb/230502%20-%20Back%20references%20disappearing.mp4?dl=0]). 
* Their .vwxp (project) file and
* A 'Save a Copy As' .vwx file saved to the SLVP seen in the video. 

*If this is a known bug, please let me know.* 

If you need more info from these customers just let me know.  		Karthick Chilaka

* Always show the labels (preferred)
* Show the label for the available option, not the option that's already enabled
* Change the Auto-Plane text tip to "Automatically highlights the working plane as the cursor moves over planar surfaces." (So that when we say in the help, "Select the Auto-Plane option" it's more obvious which one we mean.)

VB-195547

Database Worksheet adding phantom quantities

Hello,
In the enclosed files and movie you will see the following:

* Parasolid files imported into Vectorworks.
* Each one turned into a symbol.
* 'Waterups' record attached to each when editing a symbol and with the geometry not selected. Name then entered for each symbol.
* Then these symbols are placed as they are in real life as components of the library object. This is then saved as a Blue Symbol so users can change the layout if need be.


If a database worksheet is created and you search for things which have the 'WaterUps' record attached it shows the name and the COUNT. This works fine. The preview of the 'Objects' count at the bottom of the Edit Criteria dialogue says the correct number.

If you edit the criteria and you add a second line of criteria no matter what it is, the count increases by two.

If you click on the 'Symbols' button the number goes to the thousands! This is the reason for the report.

Although not in this report sometimes I have had empty rows with a count. If I right click to select the item sometimes it selects the groups that is the collection of symbols (even though no record is attached to the group, and several times as witnessed by others here it has selected the worksheet on the drawing! I have had to delete the second line of criteria to get back to just the counts.

The screenshots are from another similar file but I send a more simple vwx file as it is easier to understand.


Cheers,
Peter


Karthick Chilaka

VB-194055

Constrained Linear Dimension in Constrained Line mode or Constrained Chain mode  may not be able to be edited for the Dimension text with the Selection Tool.

Steps to reproduce
1) Select the “Constrained Linear Dimension” tool and click “Constrained Chain mode” on the toolbar.

2) Create a Constrained Chain dimension that has 2 measuring ponts at leaset.

3) Select the "Selection Tool" and double-click the text on the left (or right) side of the dimension.
You are getting the text editing state with highlight.

4) Double-click the other side text of the dimension.
You are getting the text editing state with highlight text again.

5) Double-click the text on first selected of the dimension when you are in the text editing state.

6) It will not be in the text editing state.

*you can get the same result with simple steps. You do double-click twice on the 'Constrained Linear Dimension'.

* You can edit the text by deselecting the dimension and double-clicking it.

* This problem does not occur when using the "Text Tool" and double-clicking the dimension to enter the text editing state.

*As long as I tried, I see this problem also Vectorworks 2022 and Vectorworks 2021.

* Another matter,  although the reproduction procedure is unknown,　I saw that the blue dimension line that is displayed when entering the editing state is displayed even if the dimension line is not selected.
If the blue dimension line appears, we have two restoration patterns.
1: one that does not disappear until the file is reopened or Vectorworks is closed.
2: the other that disappears immediately after being displayed.

  (Check out the attached videos "13126 Blue Dimension remain.mov and 13126 Blue Dimension disappear.mov".)


Please refer to attached movie and files.(13126.vwx, 13126.mov) 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-194093

Vectorworks hangs when selecting a lot (8k) of dimensions at once

Recipe:
* Open the attached [^8k_dimensions_v2024.vwx] file.
* Select all the dimensions in the file. The selection takes more than 20' and still not done.

There seems to be two things that happen here: the selection (attached images with the prefix {*}select{*}) and something else that happens right after the selection (attached images with the prefix {*}right_after_select{*}). In the VS2022 profile, the selection starts at 1:00 and actually finishes at 6:11; the OIP shows "8192 Dimensions" at this point. However, as soon as I move the mouse at around 6:21, something else runs, and it keeps running forever. All the flame graphs and hot paths point to TObjectRuntimeCacheAccess, but I'm not sure if it's actually the culprit or the fact that it's being called too many times... 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-195466

Spotlight power planning palette creating duplicate devices

If a consumer electrical component is added to a lighting device the light will have a duplicate entry in the patch table, the power overview and device graph of the power planning palette.
This is not a visual error and affects both the total needed power and power per phase calculation of the palette.

Previously adding a consumer component to a light would override the lights default and only the consumer would be used for power calculation purposes 		Kevin Linzey

VB-195434

Vectorworks Cloud animation creation much longer than local

I'm on a 14-inch 2021 MacBook Pro M1 Max with 32 GB of RAM; producing an orbital animation (720 frames) from the attached file takes my local machine about 24 minutes. The same file is estimated to take over two hours to render using Vectorworks Cloud Services. Seems like VCS should be faster than my laptop, not slower.

[I could not attach files due to a "missing token" error. Will try later.] 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-195433

Vectorworks gets into a state where all text objects have vertical size 0

I have not yet been able to reproduce this, but this occurred in VW2023 SP5 fc.

After running text acceptance tests - specifically, after testing creation of custom styles (and also after using the text tool in rotated mode) - Vectorworks got in a state where all new text objects would be created with vertical size zero.

You could type into the object but barely see a section of the text. Then on enter and activation of the selection tool, the object shows three handles (instead of six) - and using them to resize vertically does not work, so the object is not really usable.

I was able to then quit SP5 and run an installed release of VW2023 SP4, and the issue was there as well, indicating something in application settings or preferences.

Running a 28.0.x build in the debugger showed that the InitTextNode() function was assigning a vertical spacing of 0 from dc.fpDG->gVerticalSpacingDefault. The debug build did assert downstream that this was an illegal value.

After renaming the 2023 application support folder the issue went away, so it's definitely related to some corrupt saved application data.

Attaching screenshots including stack traces from the debug problem, and a zip of the bad application data folder.

I doubt this is a regression but won't know until it can be reproduced reliably. 		Karthick Chilaka
