VB-194548

[Question] Is it possible to make any chance of the following communication settings during Vectorworks activation when the server system could not chenge in corporate order that network authentification with Kerberos.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2022, v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
[Question] Is it possible to make any chance of the following communication settings during Vectorworks activation when the server system could not chenge by corporate internal control code with Kerberos authentication.

* Disable proxy authentication (Proxy-Authorization: no header is given)
* Support Kerberos authentication (with Proxy-Authorization: Negotiate header added)

*Remarks*
The details of network situation of customer are not clear for us.
However it have possible to make any chance to following customer's authentication system.

* The network situation of customer, the proxy server does not support Basic authentication.
So server returns a 407 (Proxy Authentication Required) to Vectorworks and requests Kerberos authentication.
However Vectorworks send back the headers on subsequent requests are the same "Proxy-authentication: Basic" header to proxy server.
The proxy server returns error as a result.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura

VB-195170

T02250 - New Text Vertical Alignment icons are incorrect

The new View Bar interface adds a Text section with new buttons that control the Vertical Alignment of the Text object.

In addition to these icons being a bit too detailed and difficult to decipher, the imagery in some of them is inherently {_}incorrect{_}. The two horizontal lines are meaningless to most of the actual settings, and they are incorrectly used for some of the arrow positions.

For example, when it comes to the "Top Baseline" and "Bottom Baseline" options, the word "baseline" in +both+ cases refers to the line upon which most letters sit ({*}meaning the current "Top Baseline" icon is particularly erroneous because it points to the mean line instead of a baseline{*}). The distinction between the "Top Baseline" and "Bottom Baseline" options only matters in regards to multi-line text objects, wherein the anchor gets placed either on the baseline of the first line, or the baseline of the last line. It has nothing to do with the x-height, mean line, or ascender line. For single-line text, "Top Baseline" and "Bottom Baseline" are functionally identical (see below).

It's also important to remember that the Vertical Alignment setting determines the anchor point for the {+}overall text object{+}, i.e. "Top," "Middle," and "Bottom" refer to the bounding box of the Text Object, not individual characters in a line. This is another reason why including the baseline and mean line in all of the icons is misleading.

For clarity, here's a visual breakdown which indicates where the anchor gets placed for each of the 5 various Vertical Alignments: 

!TextAnchors.png|width=464,height=320!

Hopefully this helps illustrate why the icons aren't quite right. Here are two new proposals which attempt to balance clarity vs functionality:

!VerticalAlignment_AEB_opt1.png|width=472,height=116!

or

!VerticalAlignment_AEB_opt2.png|width=472,height=116!

Compared to the current:

!VerticalAlignment0.png|width=472,height=116!

At then of the day, the second and third icons are the most egregious, and _none_ of them should include the mean line. But the main point is that ideally the icons would be reconsidered holistically, and would make sense in both single-line and multi-line contexts.

Thanks! 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-194735

SBE: VWWallObj::SetBreak creates duplicate of PIO instead of moving the break

While trying to implement interactive resizing for our windows and doors, I needed to modify (in OnSetInteractiveSizingParams) the offset of the symbol break that holds our window.

This simple piece of code

 

SWallSymbolBreak  brk;
 if (wall.FindBreak(pio_in_wall,brk))  {    
                        brk.offset+=off_break;                           
                        wall.SetBreak(brk);
  } // **

 

should obviously do the trick, but in reality the break was not moved and the OIP said "2 windows in wall" (before that, it was just one, but now there were two windows at the same position).

 

I did not change anything in the SWallSymbolBreak variable except for the offset so the offset should be the only thing that changes in the drawing. There's absolutely no reason to create a new window.

 

  		Christopher Graye

The file "AEC-UK-Uniclass2015-ARCHITECT-Ss-System.vwx" is not in

VB-194538

Dragging to select over a mesh breaks Previous Selection

Start with a model that has a mesh and some other object. With the selection tool, select the other object. Then drag to select over part of the mesh. The drag to select can be released with either all vertices selected, only some vertices selected, or none of them. Then run the Edit > Previous Selection command. The other object is selected as expected but the mesh object is also still selected.

This was found while looking into a different Previous Selection issue. Some investigation showed that it is happening because dragging over the mesh enables its selection flag (and dragging back off the mesh so that the drag does not contain the mesh does not disable it). The selection state of each object is stored for Previous Selection only when the drag is released and thus it includes the mesh object. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-194643

Select similar tool's saved settings don't allow changes to name's capitalization state

As seen in the attached video, if a saved setting for the Select Similar tool has accidentally been named with the wrong capitalization of a text character, one cannot simply rename the setting and change the capitalization state. When one tries to do this, the edit is ignored and the original caps state is reinstated.

It's a relatively minor annoyance but it should be fixed at some point. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-194001

Marquee selection often works incorrectly in Perspective projection

I've noticed the last few years that using a marquee selection in 3D while in Perspective projection does not always work as intended.

Without holding any modifier keys, the default rectangular marquee selection should select ONLY objects that are completely encompassed within the marquee. If the marquee only partially goes over an object, that object should not be selected.

What often happens is that these rules aren't followed in Perspective projection: objects that are only partially marqueed over become selected. 

I'm attaching a file where this bug happens reliably. See the attached recording in which the first marquee works correctly, then the second and third attempts are incorrect. The 3D figure should not have become selected since only a portion of that Symbol was marqueed. 		Josh Loy
VB-194126

VB-193708

File locking fails with cloud storage services

File locking does not work as expected with cloud storage services. If you open a file, a .lck file is created. This happens both on our local NAS file server, as well as on various cloud storage services and . lck the file, which is only 1 KB in size, is synchronized lightning fast to all connected devices.

1. For a file opened from our local NAS file server, it works correctly and another user trying to open an already opened .vwx file is notified that the file has been opened by another user and offered to open a copy.

2. For a file opened from a shared cloud storage resource, a .lck file is created, but despite this, another user can open the same .vwx file without receiving any notice that the file is already in use. This makes it impossible to use cloud storage for collaboration with VW!

Most cloud services cannot offer file locking at operating system level like a local NAS, so the lock file is probably the only option to mark the file as occupied.

I tried opening a VW file on my computer and asked my colleague to open the same file on his computer with the following results:
1. Local NAS: The file locking works. The colleague cannot open the file and is offered to open a copy. This is the expected behaviour.
2. Pcloud: File locking does not work. The colleague can open the file. When we both save our opened files, two file versions appear: One with the original name "filename.vwx" and one with the extension "filename (conflicted).vwx". This is not acceptable!
3. LucidLink: File locking does not work. The colleague can open the file. When we save, the file is replaced with the last saved version, i.e. the system does not detect that the file is open at all, even though a .lck file has been created in the folder. This is not acceptable!

For me, this problem was known for pCloud, so I decided to test LucidLink. They claim that their service has file locking! It was therefore surprising that the file locking did not work with VW. When, we tried the same test with an .odt file in LibreOffice, the file locking worked perfectly in all three cases. Then we did another test with a dwg file in Bricscad and the file was correctly locked on the local NAS server and in LucidLink. However, in pCloud both could open the same file without a note and after saving there were two differnet versions of the file created again.

Pcloud claims to handle conflicts by creating copies (conflict marked file versions) so that nothing is lost, but says nothing about file locking. LucidLink clarifies that they have file locking, but don't seem to resolve the conflict by creating conflict copies, so versions are lost and replaced with the last saved one.

It feels as if VW does not consider the .lck file at all, and the locking is done/served by the operating system in the NAS server (Asustor AS4004T) . Cloud file sync requires other lock indicators which worked with LucidLink for both LibreOffice and Bricscad, but surprisingly not for VW. LibreOffice seems to handle all cases and probably also checks mainly against the .lck file whis is fine in the case.


We want to be able to work with cloud services and have been attracted to the service offered by LucidLink, which in theory should be able to replace our local NAS (they call it cloud NAS). To get away from the limitations that a local NAS brings when work needs to be done outside the office, it is important that VW can handle work over file sharing services, which I feel is not fully possible today.

  		Lyuben Hadzhipopov

VB-192785

When "Separete Cross Objects" is selected in the section viewport properties and the "Use Attributes of Original Objects" and "Add Profile Line" options are enabled, the Pen attributes set in the attribute class are not applied to Profile Line.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2023
--------------------------
How to Reproduce
--------------------------
Steps to reproduce.
1) Create a new class from the organization and name it "testclass".
Set
Example: Fill Style Solid  Color: gray
         Pen  Style Solid  Color: pink

2) Slab Tool > Slab Tool Preferences > Slab Preferences dialog > Edit components "1"
Set
Example: Section Fill Style Hatch
         Section Pen  Stlye Solid Color: blue

3) Draw the slab with component 1 set.

4) Create a section viewport.

5) Select the section viewport and click the "Advanced Properties..." button on the shape tab of the Object Info palette to open the "Advanced Section Properties" dialog.

6) Advanced Section Properties > Attributes tab > Set "Separate Cross Sections"
Check the options "Use Attributes of Original Objects" and "Add Profile Line". 
Confirm that the "testclass" created in 1) is selected in the "Attribute Class" pull-down menu, and then click the OK button to close the dialog.

7) Update the section viewport. The Pen attributes set in the Attribute Class are not applied to Profile Line.

* Please refer to attached "13072_v2022.vwx" and "13072_v2023.vwx". 


*Remarks*
* In Vectorworks2022, the line attribute set in the attribute class is applied to Profile Line.

* Profile Line will not be applied when Vectorworks2022 files are opened and updated in Vectorworks2023.
By exporting the Vectorworks2023 file to Vectorworks2022, opening it, and updating it, it will be displayed normally.

 

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Rick Berge

VB-193652

Hello,

When using an iPhone and 'Photos to 3D' an OBJ file is created that allows users to import as a mesh with textures into Vectorworks.

If the drawing file is in millimetres, the import dialogue asks you to match the same. However if I choose millimetres then the object comes in 1000 times too small. You need to choose metres instead even though the 'model space' units as described in the dialogue should be millimetres.

Peter

VB-193529

Question - Regarding the Site Protection Server ROTATE option not being enabled with just "Reread/Restart Servers".

Some optional Site Protection Server commands are not enabled by simply running "Reread/Restart Servers".

Command not enabled: ROTATE
Steps to enable:
1) Click "Shutdown" from the menu on the left side of the Web Interface.
2) Click the "SHUT DOWN SERVER" displayed next to shut down the ISV server.
3) Click "Reread/Restart Servers" from the left menu of the Web Interface.
4) On the next screen, click "REREAD/RESTART" to start the ISV server.

On the other hand, I think most commands, such as the Exclude command, are enabled just by executing "Reread/Restart Servers".

So I have a question.
Is it by spec that the server needs to be shut down and started up like this to enable the ROTATE command? Or is it a bug?
If it is a spec, we have the following improvement requests for help documentation.

-Please add a note about commands that require such server shutdown and startup in the ISV and RLM options.
-In "Specifying server options" where options are described, please add that Reread/Restart is required for the option to take effect, and that depending on the command, the server must be shut down and started.

*This matter is being reported as we are responding to inquiries from important customers.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Kamen Kitanov

VB-193305

Referenced files not being displayed

VB-193224

Angle falloff significantly different among render modes

See the attached file and screen shot.

The light at the top has a 40° spread angle and a 10° beam angle. This should control the angle falloff of the beam. Generally, the beam angle is defined at the point where the light is 50% of the center brightness and the field angle is where the light is 90% of the center brightness. As below that is fairly imperceptible to the eye, we can assume that the edge of the beam is at the spread angle.

Both Shaded and RW show a taper from center to beam to spread, and a hard edge when spread = beam. The curve which the taper follows is different, however.

Redshift shows an abrupt step at the beam angle, and the spread angle tapers at the edges regardless of the distance from the beam. When beam and spread are the same, the field is not flat at all, and the overall brightness is significantly reduced. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-193242

2. Select Marquee and draw the full area limited by the rectangle in the file.

3. When trying to export we get a pop-up warning saying that the are is too big.

The Customer asks what is the size limitation for this export, we would also like to know. Thank you in advance!

I would suggest that this limitation could appear somewhere (or in the pop-up warning or in the Export Settings Dialog, as example). 		Josh Loy

3)Close the "Units" dialog.
4)Select the data tag and click "Settings..." of OIP.
5)Without changing anything, click the "OK" button in the "Data tag Settings" dialog.
6)Check the data tag,everything after the second decimalplace is not displayed.

*When the sample file is opened with Vectorworks 2022,regardless of the "Decimal Precison" of "Length",the second decimal place is also displayed.

It is very annoying that this functionality has been lost.

In the second movie, I attempt to align the slab object with a 3D locus point. Upon running 3D align, the slab object is sent to 2195'5 3/8" above the roof layer.

I do all my work in 3D and expect to be able to use the tools reliably. There is no work around for this lack of functionality. I need to draw my work accurately and 3D align used to be the way to ensure accurate placement of objects relative to each other.

What is supposed to happen:
Select objects to align in 3D, go to Modify/Align/Align-Distribute 3D;
Decide which axis and direction to align and press OK, the objects align in 3D as specified.

VB-192873

Object created via certain Irrigation tools requires two undo calls to undo object creation

The following tools in the Irrigation tool set require two undo calls to undo the creation of an object via the tool:

- Outlet tool
- Drip Outlet tool
- Pipe tool
- Valve tool
- Point of Connection tool
- System Component tool

In a Project Sharing environment, this can cause two object checkout dialogs to appear immediately following each other when adding an object from one of these tools to an irrigation system.  It seems like the creation of these objects should be undoable with one undo command usage, which would also prevent two object checkout dialogs in a Project Sharing environment. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-192593

Export Worksheet: export to xlsx does not correctly convert strings from Vectorworks to Excel

To replicate (see video):
1) create a worksheet
2) write *AA* in the cell {_}A1{_}, write =IF({_}A1{_}=AA;1;0) in _A2_
--> {_}A2{_}'s result will be {*}1{*}.
If _A1_ is not *AA* {_}A2{_}'s result will be {*}0{*}. **

Unfortunately these two fields won't show the same results once exported into Excel. There the formula in A2 has to be written like this: =IF(A1="AA";1;0) for it to work.

  		Rick Berge
